original: lha ma yin la sogs pa'i lus gang gis sems can rnams kyi lus sgrub nus shing /
analyzed: lha ma yin la sogs pa'i lus gang gis sems can rnams kyi lus sgrub nus shing /
translated: The bodies of the demigods and so on, by which bodies they are able to establish the bodies of sentient beings,

original: sems can gyi dge ba 'phel bar 'gyur ba de lta bu'i lus ched du bsams shing blangs te sems can gyi don mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi dge ba 'phel bar 'gyur ba de lta bu'i lus ched du bsams shing blangs te sems can gyi don mdzad pa'o //
translated: and by which bodies the virtue of sentient beings will increase, they intentionally take up such bodies and work for the welfare of sentient beings.

original: rab 'byor chos bzhi po de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa brgyad pa la gnas pas yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor chos bzhi po de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa brgyad pa la gnas pas yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Subh≈´ti, these four dharmas are to be completed by the bodhisattva mahƒÅsattva on the eighth ground.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sa brgyad pa la gnas pas chos bzhi po 'di dag kyang yongs su rdzogs par byas na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sa brgyad pa la gnas pas chos bzhi po 'di dag kyang yongs su rdzogs par byas na /
translated: Thus, having completed these four dharmas, the bodhisattva on the eighth ground

original: theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: is said to have entered the Great Vehicle.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos dgu ba la gnas pas chos bcu gnyis yongs su rdzogs par bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni byang chub sems dpa' sa dgu pa la gnas pas yongs su rdzogs par bya ba bstan pa
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos dgu ba la gnas pas chos bcu gnyis yongs su rdzogs par bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni byang chub sems dpa' sa dgu pa la gnas pas yongs su rdzogs par bya ba bstan pa
translated: This is the teaching of the perfection of the twelve dharmas by the Bodhisattva who stands on the ninth stage.

original: ste / 'di ltar smon lam mtha' yas pa yongs su gzung ba ste /
analyzed: ste / 'di ltar smon lam mtha' yas pa yongs su gzung ba ste /
translated: Thus, he should take up the infinite prayers.üîΩAs he prays, so it will be fulfilled.

original: ji lta ji ltar smon pa de lta de ltar phun sum tshogs par 'gyur ba dang zhes bya ba ni sa dgu pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpas pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par bya bas byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam rgya chen
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar smon pa de lta de ltar phun sum tshogs par 'gyur ba dang zhes bya ba ni sa dgu pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpas pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par bya bas byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam rgya chen
translated: The Bodhisattva who stands on the ninth stage, by perfecting the six perfections, makes the great Bodhisattva prayers

original: po bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: po bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: for the sake of fulfilling his own and others' aims.

original: ji ltar smon ba de bzhin du 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar smon ba de bzhin du 'grub pa'o //
translated: As he prays, so it will be accomplished.

original: lha dang klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po'i skad shes pa zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pas /
analyzed: lha dang klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po'i skad shes pa zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pas /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúhe knows the languages of gods, nƒÅgas, yak·π£as, gandharvas, asuras, garu·∏ças, ki·πÉnaras, and mahoragas‚Äù refers to the correct understanding of language.

original: lha dang / klu la sogs pa sems can thams cad kyi skad shes shing de dag gi skad du chos ston pa'o //
analyzed: lha dang / klu la sogs pa sems can thams cad kyi skad shes shing de dag gi skad du chos ston pa'o //
translated: With this understanding, he knows the languages of all sentient beings, including gods, nƒÅgas, and so forth, and he teaches the Dharma to them in their own languages.

original: yongs su rdzogs pa'i spobs pa nges bar bstan pa shes pa dang zhes bya ba ni spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa dang ldan pas /üîΩbdud @226a * //
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs pa'i spobs pa nges bar bstan pa shes pa dang zhes bya ba ni spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa dang ldan pas / bdud @226a * //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúhe knows how to teach with complete confidence‚Äù refers to the correct understanding of eloquence.

original: dang mu stegs can la sogs pa phas rgol ba rnams thul ba dang / rgyal rigs che zhing btsun pa la sogs pa'i 'khor du chos ston pa la sba mi 'gong zhing zil gyis mi non pa'i spobs ba dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: dang mu stegs can la sogs pa phas rgol ba rnams thul ba dang / rgyal rigs che zhing btsun pa la sogs pa'i 'khor du chos ston pa la sba mi 'gong zhing zil gyis mi non pa'i spobs ba dang ldan pa'o //
translated: With this understanding, he is able to defeat MƒÅra, non-Buddhists, and other opponents, and he is able to teach the Dharma to assemblies of high-ranking people such as royalty without being timid or overawed. He has the eloquence that is free of timidity and overawedness.

original: ma'i mngal du 'gro ba phun sum tshogs pa dang zhes bya ba ni sa dgu pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems can gyi don du 'khor bar skye na yang /
analyzed: ma'i mngal du 'gro ba phun sum tshogs pa dang zhes bya ba ni sa dgu pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems can gyi don du 'khor bar skye na yang /
translated: The perfect womb is that of a bodhisattva on the ninth level who, for the sake of beings, takes birth in samsara.

original: nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis ma'i mngal du mi skye bar tshe rabs thams cad du rdzus te skye ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis ma'i mngal du mi skye bar tshe rabs thams cad du rdzus te skye ba'o //
translated: The perfection of entering the mother‚Äôs womb refers to the fact that the bodhisattva who is in his ninth and last birth, although he is born in samsara for the sake of beings, is not born from a mother‚Äôs womb through the power of the passions. He is born miraculously in all his lives.

original: rigs phun sum tshogs pa dang zhes bya ba ni dam pa'i chos spyod nus pa'i snod du gyur pa'i rigs bzang por skye ba'o //
analyzed: rigs phun sum tshogs pa dang zhes bya ba ni dam pa'i chos spyod nus pa'i snod du gyur pa'i rigs bzang por skye ba'o //
translated: The perfection of family refers to the fact that he is born in a good family, a family that is a vessel for practicing the holy Dharma.

original: rgyud phun sum tshogs pa dang zhes bya ba ni rgyal rigs che zhing mtho ba dang bram ze'i rigs che zhing mtho ba'i rgyud du skye ba'o //
analyzed: rgyud phun sum tshogs pa dang zhes bya ba ni rgyal rigs che zhing mtho ba dang bram ze'i rigs che zhing mtho ba'i rgyud du skye ba'o //
translated: The perfection of lineage refers to the fact that he is born in a great and noble lineage, either a royal or a brahman lineage.

original: rus phun sum tshogs pa dang zhes bya ba ni rus dang rigs gang gi nang du sngon byang chub sems dpa' byung bar gyur pa'i rigs der skyes pa'o //
analyzed: rus phun sum tshogs pa dang zhes bya ba ni rus dang rigs gang gi nang du sngon byang chub sems dpa' byung bar gyur pa'i rigs der skyes pa'o //
translated: The perfection of clan refers to the fact that he is born in the clan and family in which former bodhisattvas have appeared.

original: 'khor phun sum tshogs pa dang zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' sems can thams cad bla na med pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed cing byang chub la bkod pas byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor dang ldan par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor phun sum tshogs pa dang zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' sems can thams cad bla na med pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed cing byang chub la bkod pas byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor dang ldan par gyur pa'o //
translated: The perfection of retinue is the possession of a retinue of bodhisattvas, because the bodhisattva has caused all sentient beings to generate the intention to achieve supreme enlightenment and has established them in enlightenment.

original: tshe phun sum tshogs pa dang zhes bya ba ni sa dgu pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni skyes ma thag tu sngon gyi bsod nams kyi mthus 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas pa rnams 'od kyi snang bas khyab cing /
analyzed: tshe phun sum tshogs pa dang zhes bya ba ni sa dgu pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni skyes ma thag tu sngon gyi bsod nams kyi mthus 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas pa rnams 'od kyi snang bas khyab cing /
translated: The perfection of life is that, as soon as the bodhisattva is born on the ninth stage, through the power of his previous merits, infinite world-realms are pervaded by the light of his glory,

original: 'jig rten gyi khams de dag rnam pa drug tu g-yo par 'gyur ba'o//
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams de dag rnam pa drug tu g-yo par 'gyur ba'o//
translated: and those world-realms tremble in six ways.

original: mngon par 'byung ba phun sum tshogs pa dang zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' de rab tu 'byung ba'i tshe /
analyzed: mngon par 'byung ba phun sum tshogs pa dang zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' de rab tu 'byung ba'i tshe /
translated: The perfection of departure is that when the bodhisattva departs from home,

original: sems can bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du ma dang lhan cig tu rab tu 'byung ste /
analyzed: sems can bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du ma dang lhan cig tu rab tu 'byung ste /
translated: he departs together with many hundred thousands of niyutas of kotis of sentient beings.

original: rab tu byung ba'i sems can de dag kyang theg pa gsum la nges par gnas par 'gyur ba'o//
analyzed: rab tu byung ba'i sems can de dag kyang theg pa gsum la nges par gnas par 'gyur ba'o//
translated: And those sentient beings who have gone forth will be established in the three vehicles.

original: byang chub kyi shing gi rgyan phun sum tshogs pa dang zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' de byang chub kyi shing drung du mngon par 'tshang rgya ba'i byang chub kyi shing gi rtsa ba ni gser gyi rgyu las byas pa /
analyzed: byang chub kyi shing gi rgyan phun sum tshogs pa dang zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' de byang chub kyi shing drung du mngon par 'tshang rgya ba'i byang chub kyi shing gi rtsa ba ni gser gyi rgyu las byas pa /
translated: The perfection of the adornments of the tree of awakening refers to the tree of awakening under which the bodhisattva attains perfect buddhahood. The roots of that tree are made of gold.

original: lhun ni bee d'urya'i rang bzhin du 'dug pa /
analyzed: lhun ni bee d'urya'i rang bzhin du 'dug pa /
translated: Its trunk is made of beryl.

original: yal ga ni rin po che sna bdun las grub @226b pa ;
analyzed: yal ga ni rin po che sna bdun las grub @226b pa ;
translated: Its branches are made of the seven precious substances.

original: me tog dang lo ma ni rin po che sna tshogs las byas pa yin la /
analyzed: me tog dang lo ma ni rin po che sna tshogs las byas pa yin la /
translated: Its flowers and leaves are made of various precious substances.

original: shing de'i dri zhim po dang 'od bzang pos ni 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas pa khyab par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: shing de'i dri zhim po dang 'od bzang pos ni 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas pa khyab par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The sweet fragrance and beautiful light of that tree pervade infinite world systems.

original: yon tan thams cad yongs su rdzogs par phun sum tshogs pa ste zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba'i yon tan thams cad dang ldan pa'o //üîΩrab 'byor chos bcu gnyis po de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos dgu pa la gnas pas yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'o zhes bya ba ni sa dgu pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpas chos bcu gnyis po de dag yongs su rdzogs
analyzed: yon tan thams cad yongs su rdzogs par phun sum tshogs pa ste zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba'i yon tan thams cad dang ldan pa'o // rab 'byor chos bcu gnyis po de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos dgu pa la gnas pas yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'o zhes bya ba ni sa dgu pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpas chos bcu gnyis po de dag yongs su rdzogs
translated: The perfection of the complete perfection of all good qualities means that the Bodhisattva is endowed with all the good qualities of bringing beings to maturity and purifying the Buddha-field.

original: par byas na theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: par byas na theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Subhuti, these twelve dharmas are to be fully completed by the Bodhisattva-mahƒÅsattva dwelling on the ninth. This teaches that if the Bodhisattva dwelling on the ninth ground fully completes these twelve dharmas, he is truly engaged in the Great Vehicle.

original: rab 'byor sa bcu pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du brjod do zhes bya ba las sa bcu pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni pha rol tu phyin pa bcu yongs su rdzogs shing de
analyzed: rab 'byor sa bcu pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du brjod do zhes bya ba las sa bcu pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni pha rol tu phyin pa bcu yongs su rdzogs shing de
translated: Subh≈´ti, a bodhisattva great being who is on the tenth level is called a tathƒÅgata.

original: bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi yon tan thams cad dang ldan la /
analyzed: bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi yon tan thams cad dang ldan la /
translated: A bodhisattva who is on the tenth level has completed the ten perfections and has all the qualities of a buddha, such as the ten powers of a tathƒÅgata, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, great compassion, the eighteen distinctive qualities of a buddha, and the gnosis of omniscience.

original: shes bya dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa bag chags yan chad spangs pas sangs rgyas dang 'dra ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du brjod do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: shes bya dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa bag chags yan chad spangs pas sangs rgyas dang 'dra ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du brjod do zhes gsungs so //
translated: He is called a tathƒÅgata because he is like a buddha, having abandoned the obscurations of the knowable and the afflictions together with their latent predispositions.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal ba dang / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang du sa bcu po re re la yongs su sbyong zhing rdzogs par bya ba dang /
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal ba dang / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang du sa bcu po re re la yongs su sbyong zhing rdzogs par bya ba dang /
translated: Having thus spoken, the venerable Subhuti said to the Lord:

original: spang bar bya ba'i chos rnams mdor smos pa de dag re re nas zhib tu dgrol ba'i phyir zhus pa'o //
analyzed: spang bar bya ba'i chos rnams mdor smos pa de dag re re nas zhib tu dgrol ba'i phyir zhus pa'o //
translated: This is the request for the detailed explanation of those dharmas which are to be purified, completed, and abandoned in each of the ten stages, which were mentioned in brief.

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lhag pa'i bsam ba la sogs pa yongs su sbyong ba @227a * //üîΩgang lags zhes bya ba ni dang por lhag pa'i bsam pa la sogs pa yongs su sbyong ba mdor bshad pa de nyid zhib tu bshad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lhag pa'i bsam ba la sogs pa yongs su sbyong ba @227a * // gang lags zhes bya ba ni dang por lhag pa'i bsam pa la sogs pa yongs su sbyong ba mdor bshad pa de nyid zhib tu bshad pa'i phyir /
translated: Lord, what is the Bodhisattva-mahasattva's purification of superior attitude, etc.?üîΩ This is the request to the Lord by Subhuti for the detailed explanation of just those purifications of superior attitude, etc. which were mentioned in brief.üîΩHow should those superior attitudes, etc. be purified?

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa la sogs pa de dag ji ltar yongs su sbyang bar bgyi zhes bcom ldan 'das la rab 'byor gyis zhus pa'o //
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa la sogs pa de dag ji ltar yongs su sbyang bar bgyi zhes bcom ldan 'das la rab 'byor gyis zhus pa'o //
translated: This is the request to the Lord by Subhuti for the detailed explanation of just those purifications of superior attitude, etc. which were mentioned in brief.

original: de la bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de la bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas dge ba'i rtsa ba mang po yang dag par sdud pa 'di ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas dge ba'i rtsa ba mang po yang dag par sdud pa 'di ni /
translated: ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, this is the gathering of the many roots of virtue by the bodhisattva great beings who have given rise to the mind endowed with the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lhag pa'i bsam pa la sogs pa yongs su sbyong pa'o zhes bya ba nas /üîΩrab 'byor de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa dang po la gnas pa'i yongs su sbyang ba bcu po zhes bya ba'i bar du ni byang chub sems dpa' sa dang po rab tu dga' ba la gnas pas yongs su sbyang bar bya ba'i
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lhag pa'i bsam pa la sogs pa yongs su sbyong pa'o zhes bya ba nas / rab 'byor de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa dang po la gnas pa'i yongs su sbyang ba bcu po zhes bya ba'i bar du ni byang chub sems dpa' sa dang po rab tu dga' ba la gnas pas yongs su sbyang bar bya ba'i
translated: Subh≈´ti, this is the purification of the superior intention and so on of the bodhisattva great beings.üîΩSubh≈´ti, these are the ten purifications for the bodhisattva great beings abiding on the first ground.‚Äù

original: chos bcu gang du mdor smos pa'i 'grel pa ste /
analyzed: chos bcu gang du mdor smos pa'i 'grel pa ste /
translated: This is the commentary on the brief indication of the ten dharmas that are to be purified by the bodhisattva abiding on the first ground, Very Joyful.

original: de dag gi don ni sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de dag gi don ni sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: The meaning of these is as explained above.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i tshul khrims yongs su dag pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i tshul khrims yongs su dag pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba nas /
translated: What is the bodhisattva-mahƒÅsattva's pure morality?

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la brtson zhing tshol ba'o zhes bya'i bar du ni /
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la brtson zhing tshol ba'o zhes bya'i bar du ni /
translated: This is the bodhisattva-mahƒÅsattva's striving and seeking in the perfections.

original: sa gnyis pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpas chos brgyad yid la bya ba gong du mdor smos pa'i 'grel pa'o //
analyzed: sa gnyis pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpas chos brgyad yid la bya ba gong du mdor smos pa'i 'grel pa'o //
translated: Here, the commentary on the eight mental engagements of the bodhisattva abiding on the second ground, which were mentioned briefly above, is as follows.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i mang du thos pas ma ngoms pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i mang du thos pas ma ngoms pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba nas /
translated: What is the bodhisattva-mahƒÅsattva's insatiable listening?üîΩ This is the bodhisattva-mahƒÅsattva's abiding in shame and embarrassment.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i ngo tsha shes shing khrel yod pa la gnas pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni byang chub sems dpa' sa gsum pa la gnas pas chos lnga la gnas par bya ba gong du mdor smos pa'i 'grel pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i ngo tsha shes shing khrel yod pa la gnas pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni byang chub sems dpa' sa gsum pa la gnas pas chos lnga la gnas par bya ba gong du mdor smos pa'i 'grel pa'o //
translated: Here, the commentary on the five dharmas in which the bodhisattva abiding on the third ground should abide, which were mentioned briefly above, is as follows.üîΩ Here, the commentary on the four dharmas in which the bodhisattva abiding on the fourth ground should abide, which were mentioned briefly above, is as follows.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dgon pa na gnas pa yongs su mi gtong ba gang zhe na zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dgon pa na gnas pa yongs su mi gtong ba gang zhe na zhes bya ba nas /
translated: What is the bodhisattva-mahƒÅsattva's not abandoning dwelling in the wilderness?

original: 'di ni byang chub @227b sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dngos po thams cad la ltos pa med pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni byang chub sems dpa' sa bzhi pa la gnas pas chos bcu yongs su blangs shing gnas par bya ba mdor smos pa'i 'grel pa'o
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub @227b sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dngos po thams cad la ltos pa med pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni byang chub sems dpa' sa bzhi pa la gnas pas chos bcu yongs su blangs shing gnas par bya ba mdor smos pa'i 'grel pa'o
translated: From here up to This is the bodhisattva-mahƒÅsattva's not relying on all things is the commentary on the brief statement about the ten dharmas that the bodhisattva abiding on the fourth ground should take up and abide in.

original: // de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i khyim pa dang brten pa yongs su spang bar bya ba gang zhe na zhes bya ba nas /

analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug nyams rangs su mi 'dor ba'o zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' sa lnga pa la gnas pas chos drug dang bco brgyad yongs su spang bar bya ba gong du mdor smos pa'i 'grel pa'o //
translated: This is the commentary on the verse that begins: ‚ÄúThe bodhisattva who is on the fifth ground should abandon six dharmas and eighteen faults,‚Äù which was stated above in brief.

analyzed: de la sa drug la chos drug yongs su rdzogs par bya ba gang zhe na zhes bya ba nas /

original: 'di ltar de ni byang chub kyi lam ma yin pas thog ma sems bskyed nas kha za yag gi sems su mi bya'i /
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni byang chub kyi lam ma yin pas thog ma sems bskyed nas kha za yag gi sems su mi bya'i /
translated: up to: ‚ÄúSince this is not the path to awakening, from the first production of the thought of awakening, one should not have a mind that is attached to food.

translated: This is the commentary on the verse that begins: ‚ÄúThe bodhisattva who is on the sixth ground should complete six dharmas and abandon six dharmas,‚Äù which was stated above in brief.

original: gzhan gyi gong du bshad ba bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi gong du bshad ba bzhin no //
translated: As explained above.

original: shes par bya ba lnga'i rgya mtsho'i pha rol tu phyin par gyur to zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyang pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par byas pa las shes par bya ba thams cad la thogs pa med pa'i ye shes brnyes par gyur te /
analyzed: shes par bya ba lnga'i rgya mtsho'i pha rol tu phyin par gyur to zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyang pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par byas pa las shes par bya ba thams cad la thogs pa med pa'i ye shes brnyes par gyur te /
translated: As for the statement, ‚ÄúHe reached the other shore of the ocean of the five objects of knowledge,‚Äù and so on, the bhagavat buddhas of the three times and the shravakas and pratyekabuddhas also attained the unobstructed wisdom of all objects of knowledge by completing the six perfections.

original: shes par bya ba'i nang na yang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus yun ring po nas sems can dang sems can ma yin pa'i dngos po rnams sngar cir gyur pa dang / phyis cing 'gyur ba dang / da ltar gyi dngos po brtag cing blta dka' ba rnams dang /
analyzed: shes par bya ba'i nang na yang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus yun ring po nas sems can dang sems can ma yin pa'i dngos po rnams sngar cir gyur pa dang / phyis cing 'gyur ba dang / da ltar gyi dngos po brtag cing blta dka' ba rnams dang /
translated: Among the objects of knowledge, they attained the wisdom that knows the past and future of all things, both sentient and nonsentient, that have existed for a long time in the past, that will exist in the future, and that are difficult to examine and see in the present.

original: don dam pa'i dbyings tshig gis brjod pa'i yul ma yin pa dang / 'dus ma byas pa'i dbyings dang / shes par bya ba'i dngos po 'di lnga zab cing brtag dka' ste /
analyzed: don dam pa'i dbyings tshig gis brjod pa'i yul ma yin pa dang / 'dus ma byas pa'i dbyings dang / shes par bya ba'i dngos po 'di lnga zab cing brtag dka' ste /
translated: The five things to be known are the ultimate realm, which is not an object expressed by words, the unconditioned realm, and these five things to be known are profound and difficult to fathom,

original: gzhan @228a * //
analyzed: gzhan @228a * //
translated: because

original: gyis mthar phyin par mi nus pa'i phyir rgya mtsho dang 'dra bas shes par bya ba lnga'i rgya mtsho zhes bya'o //

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis shes par bya ba lnga'i rgya mtsho'i mthar phyin par bshad pa yang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa la gnas pa'i tshe la mi bya'i /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis shes par bya ba lnga'i rgya mtsho'i mthar phyin par bshad pa yang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa la gnas pa'i tshe la mi bya'i /
translated: The explanation that the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas reach the end of the five things to be known is not to be taken as referring to the time when they abide on the ≈õrƒÅvaka or pratyekabuddha levels.

original: theg pa gcig tu bshad pa'i tshul gyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i tshe la bya'o //
analyzed: theg pa gcig tu bshad pa'i tshul gyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i tshe la bya'o //
translated: It is to be taken as referring to the time when they fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood by means of the way of explaining the single vehicle.

original: kha za yag gi sems su mi bya zhes bya ba ni stong pa'am don med par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: kha za yag gi sems su mi bya zhes bya ba ni stong pa'am don med par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: de la ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdag tu 'dzin par mi bya zhe na zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bdag tu 'dzin par mi bya zhe na zhes bya ba nas /
translated: How should a bodhisattva-mahƒÅsattva not grasp at self? and so on, up to How should a bodhisattva-mahƒÅsattva not grasp at sentient beings?

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang du 'dod pa'i zhing du 'gro ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang du 'dod pa'i zhing du 'gro ba gang zhe na /

original: 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor de dang de dag tu lus ston pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni byang chub sems dpa' sa bdun pa la gnas pas bdag tu 'dzin pa la sogs pa chos nyi shu mi bya ba dang / stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par bya ba la sogs pa chos nyi shu yongs su rdzogs par bya ba gong du mdor smos pa'i 'grel pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor de dang de dag tu lus ston pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni byang chub sems dpa' sa bdun pa la gnas pas bdag tu 'dzin pa la sogs pa chos nyi shu mi bya ba dang / stong pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par bya ba la sogs pa chos nyi shu yongs su rdzogs par bya ba gong du mdor smos pa'i 'grel pa'o //
translated: It is the manifestation of the body in this and that assembly. This is the commentary on the brief introduction to the twenty dharmas that a bodhisattva abiding on the seventh ground should not practice, such as grasping at self, and the twenty dharmas that he should complete, such as completing emptiness.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sems can thams cad kyi sems khong du chud pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sems can thams cad kyi sems khong du chud pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba nas /
translated: What is the bodhisattva-mahƒÅsattva's understanding of the minds of all sentient beings?

analyzed: de la ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ched du bsams shing sred pa nye bar len pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that the bodhisattva-mahƒÅsattva intentionally takes up craving?

original: 'di lta ste sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni byang chub sems dpa' sa brgyad pa la gnas pas chos bzhi po rnam gnyis yongs su rdzogs par bya ba gong du mdor smos pa'i 'grel pa'o //

translated: It is like this: for the sake of ripening sentient beings. This is the commentary on the four dharmas that were mentioned in brief above, which are to be completed in two ways by the bodhisattva dwelling on the eighth stage.

original: de la ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ji lta ji ltar smon pa de lta de ltar phun sum tshogs par 'gyur ba yin zhe na zhes bya ba nas /

translated: How is it that the bodhisattva-mahƒÅsattva becomes endowed with whatever he wishes?

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i yon tan thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa phun sum tshogs pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni byang chub sems dpa' sa dgu pa la gnas pas chos bcu gnyis @228b yongs su rdzogs par bya ba gong du mdorüîΩsmos pa'i 'grel pa'o //

translated: Up to here, it is the commentary on the above brief explanation that the bodhisattva abiding on the ninth ground should perfect twelve dharmas.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bcu pa la gnas pa de bzhin gshegs pa nyid ces bya ba gang zhe na zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bcu pa la gnas pa de bzhin gshegs pa nyid ces bya ba gang zhe na zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Therein, what is called the TathƒÅgata stage of the bodhisattva-mahƒÅsattva abiding on the tenth?üîΩUp to: Thus, Subh≈´ti, the bodhisattva-mahƒÅsattva abiding on the tenth is called the TathƒÅgata.

original: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bcu pa la gnas pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid ces bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni sa bcu pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du brjod do zhesüîΩgong du mdor smos pa'i 'grel pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bcu pa la gnas pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid ces bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni sa bcu pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du brjod do zhesüîΩgong du mdor smos pa'i 'grel pa ste /
translated: Up to here is the commentary on the above brief explanation that the bodhisattva abiding on the tenth ground is called the TathƒÅgata.

original: de dag gi don kyang gong du mdor smos pa'i skabs nyid du bshad zin to //
analyzed: de dag gi don kyang gong du mdor smos pa'i skabs nyid du bshad zin to //
translated: The meaning of those has already been explained in the section above where it was briefly mentioned.

original: rab 'byor de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sa bcu gang zhe na zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sa bcu gang zhe na zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Subh≈´ti, what are the ten bodhisattva stages of the bodhisattva great beings?üîΩSubh≈´ti, these are the ten bodhisattva stages of the bodhisattva great beings.

original: rab 'byor 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sa bcu'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni sa bcu la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du brjod do zhes gong du smos pa sa bcu la ji ltar gnas pa dangüîΩ/ ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du brjod par bya ba'i don bstan pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sa bcu'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni sa bcu la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du brjod do zhes gong du smos pa sa bcu la ji ltar gnas pa dangüîΩ/ ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du brjod par bya ba'i don bstan pa ste /
translated: The above statement that the bodhisattva abiding on the ten stages is called a tathƒÅgata teaches the meaning of how to abide on the ten stages and how to be called a tathƒÅgata.

original: byang chub sems dpa' thabs mkhas pas pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / stong pa nyid bco brgyad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs sum cu rtsa bdun la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag la spyod pa'i tshe nyan thos kyi sa dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thabs mkhas pas pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / stong pa nyid bco brgyad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs sum cu rtsa bdun la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag la spyod pa'i tshe nyan thos kyi sa dang /
translated: When the bodhisattva skilled in means practices the six perfections, the eighteen emptinesses, the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment, and so forth up to the eighteen unshared qualities of the Buddha, he surpasses the levels of the ≈õrƒÅvakas,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyis dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sa dgu dag las 'das nas byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu pa la gnas pa ni sangs rgyas kyi sa la gnas pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //üîΩde la dkar po rnam par mthong ba'i sa zhes bya ba ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa la gnas pa'i tshe drod dang rtse mo zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin thob pa na dang por rnam par byang ba'i chos dkar po rnams mthong ba'i phyir dkar po mthong
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyis dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sa dgu dag las 'das nas byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu pa la gnas pa ni sangs rgyas kyi sa la gnas pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o // de la dkar po rnam par mthong ba'i sa zhes bya ba ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa la gnas pa'i tshe drod dang rtse mo zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin thob pa na dang por rnam par byang ba'i chos dkar po rnams mthong ba'i phyir dkar po mthong
translated: pratyekabuddhas, and the nine bodhisattva levels, and abiding on the tenth bodhisattva level, he abides on the level of the Buddha.

original: ba'i sa zhes bya pa'o //
analyzed: ba'i sa zhes bya pa'o //
translated: The level called seeing virtue is so called because when abiding on the level of practice through belief, having attained the concentrations called heat and peak, one sees the virtuous phenomena of purification for the first time, and thus it is called the level of seeing virtue.

original: rigs kyi sa zhes bya ba ni bzod pa dang / 'jig rten gyi chos kyi mchog ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin thob pa'i tshe chos dang gang zag la bdag med par rtogs @229a * //
analyzed: rigs kyi sa zhes bya ba ni bzod pa dang / 'jig rten gyi chos kyi mchog ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin thob pa'i tshe chos dang gang zag la bdag med par rtogs @229a * //
translated: The level of potential‚Äù is the level of patient acceptance and the level of the supreme mundane quality, when one has attained the meditative absorption of the supreme mundane quality.üîΩ

original: pas byang chub gsum 'thob pa'i rigs dang ldan pas na rigs kyi sa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: pas byang chub gsum 'thob pa'i rigs dang ldan pas na rigs kyi sa zhes bya'o //
translated: The stage of lineage is so called because at the time of obtaining the meditative stabilization called the supreme mundane state, one has the lineage for attaining the three enlightenments by realizing the selflessness of persons and phenomena.

original: brgyad pa'i sa zhes bya ba ni dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu thob pa'i sa nas yas bgrangs na rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la 'jug pa la grangs brgyad pa la 'bab pas na rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la 'jug pa'i sa la brgyad pa zhes bya'o
analyzed: brgyad pa'i sa zhes bya ba ni dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu thob pa'i sa nas yas bgrangs na rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la 'jug pa la grangs brgyad pa la 'bab pas na rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la 'jug pa'i sa la brgyad pa zhes bya'o
translated: The stage of the eighth is so called because, counting up from the stage of attaining the result of arhat, the entry to the result of stream entry is the eighth.

original: // mthong ba'i sa zhes bya ba ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la gnas pas chos kyi de kho na nyid phyin ci ma log par rtogs shing mthong bas na mthong ba'i sa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: // mthong ba'i sa zhes bya ba ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la gnas pas chos kyi de kho na nyid phyin ci ma log par rtogs shing mthong bas na mthong ba'i sa zhes bya'o //
translated: The stage of seeing is so called because one who abides in the result of stream entry sees and realizes the reality of phenomena without error.

original: bsrabs pa'i sa zhes bya ba ni lan cig phyir 'ong bas 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'dod chags srab mor byas pas na bsrabs pa'i sa zhes bya'o //üîΩ'dod chags dang bral ba'i sa zhes bya ba ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i sa la gnas pas 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'dod chags ma lus par spangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bsrabs pa'i sa zhes bya ba ni lan cig phyir 'ong bas 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'dod chags srab mor byas pas na bsrabs pa'i sa zhes bya'o // 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sa zhes bya ba ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i sa la gnas pas 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'dod chags ma lus par spangs pa'i phyir /
translated: The stage of thinning out is so called because the once-returner has thinned out the attachment of the desire realm.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sa zhes bya'o //
translated: The stage of separation from attachment is so called because the nonreturner has completely abandoned attachment to the desire realm.üîΩThe stage of what has been done is so called because the arhat has abandoned all the afflictions of the three realms and has completed the qualities of an arhat.

original: byas pa rtogs pa'i sa zhes bya ba ni dgra bcom pa'i sa la gnas pas khams gsum gyi nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs shing dgra bcom pa'i yon tan yongs su rdzogs par byas pa rnam par grol ba mthong ba'i ye shes kyis bya ba ni byas zin
analyzed: byas pa rtogs pa'i sa zhes bya ba ni dgra bcom pa'i sa la gnas pas khams gsum gyi nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs shing dgra bcom pa'i yon tan yongs su rdzogs par byas pa rnam par grol ba mthong ba'i ye shes kyis bya ba ni byas zin
translated: The knowledge of liberation has done its work.

original: / tshangs par spyad pa ni spyad zin te /
analyzed: / tshangs par spyad pa ni spyad zin te /
translated: The practice of pure conduct has been completed.

original: 'di las srid pa gzhan myong bar mi 'gyur ro zhes rtogs par 'gyur bas na dgra bcom pa'i sa la byas pa rtogs pa'i sa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di las srid pa gzhan myong bar mi 'gyur ro zhes rtogs par 'gyur bas na dgra bcom pa'i sa la byas pa rtogs pa'i sa zhes bya'o //
translated: One understands: From this there will be no further experience of existence. Therefore, the stage of the Arhat is called the stage of understanding what has been done.

original: de ltar nyan thos kyi sa rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po la sogs pa sa dgu rnams las yongs su 'das nas sa bcu la gnas pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu pa yin no zhes bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar nyan thos kyi sa rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po la sogs pa sa dgu rnams las yongs su 'das nas sa bcu la gnas pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu pa yin no zhes bstan pa ste /
translated: Thus, having transcended the stages of the Sravakas and the first nine Bodhisattva stages, the tenth stage is the stage of the Bodhisattva.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa la gnas zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' sa bcu pa la gnas pas bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs pas na sangs rgyas dang 'dra ba'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi sa la gnas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa la gnas zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' sa bcu pa la gnas pas bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs pas na sangs rgyas dang 'dra ba'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi sa la gnas zhes bya'o //
translated: The phrase abiding in the stage of the Buddha means that the Bodhisattva abiding in the tenth stage is said to abide in the stage of the Buddha because he is like a Buddha, having completed the accumulations of merit and knowledge.

original: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs par rig par @229b bya'o zhes bya ba ni sa dang po nas sa bcu pa'i bar du byang chub sems dpa'i skyon rnams yongs su spong ba dangüîΩ/ yon tan rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed cing byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu yongs su sbyong ba de dag theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs par rig par bya'o zhes theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa'i don gong du bshad pa rnams
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs par rig par @229b bya'o zhes bya ba ni sa dang po nas sa bcu pa'i bar du byang chub sems dpa'i skyon rnams yongs su spong ba dang / yon tan rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed cing byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu yongs su sbyong ba de dag theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs par rig par bya'o zhes theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa'i don gong du bshad pa rnams
translated: Subhuti, it is thus that one should know the Bodhisattva, the great being, to have set out in the great vehicle.

original: mjug bsdus te bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mjug bsdus te bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the explanation of the meaning of ‚Äúsetting out in the great vehicle‚Äù given above, which is summarized and taught here.

original: rab 'byor khyod kyis gang yang 'di skad du theg pa de gang nas 'byung bar 'gyur zhes smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang du rab 'byor gyis theg pa de gang nas 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bcom ldan 'das la zhus pa'i tshig de nyid smos
analyzed: rab 'byor khyod kyis gang yang 'di skad du theg pa de gang nas 'byung bar 'gyur zhes smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang du rab 'byor gyis theg pa de gang nas 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bcom ldan 'das la zhus pa'i tshig de nyid smos
translated: ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, you said, ‚ÄòWhere will that vehicle come from?‚Äô‚Äù and so on.

original: nas / theg pa chen po de kun rdzob tu ni khams gsum nas byung nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gnas par 'gyur ba dang / don dam par khams gsum nas 'byung ba yang med la /
analyzed: nas / theg pa chen po de kun rdzob tu ni khams gsum nas byung nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gnas par 'gyur ba dang / don dam par khams gsum nas 'byung ba yang med la /
translated: Having stated the words that Subh≈´ti asked the BhagavƒÅn, ‚ÄúWhere will that vehicle come from?‚Äù he taught that the MahƒÅyƒÅna, conventionally, comes from the three realms and abides in omniscience, and ultimately, it does not come from the three realms,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gnas pa yang med pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gnas pa yang med pa bstan pa ste /
translated: and it does not abide in omniscience.

original: de la mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis khams gsum nas 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis khams gsum nas 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIt comes from the three realms by way of not apprehending anything.‚Äù

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po de kun rdzob tu khams gsum nas byung ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po de kun rdzob tu khams gsum nas byung ste /
translated: ‚ÄúIt abides in omniscience‚Äù means that the MahƒÅyƒÅna, conventionally, comes from the three realms and abides in omniscience.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gnas par 'gyur ba bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gnas par 'gyur ba bstan pa'o //
translated: the demonstration of abiding in the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor de ni 'di ltar theg pa chen po gang yin pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gang yin pa'i chos de gnyis ka yang ldan pa ma yin mi ldan pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas don dam par theg pa chen po dang /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ni 'di ltar theg pa chen po gang yin pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gang yin pa'i chos de gnyis ka yang ldan pa ma yin mi ldan pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas don dam par theg pa chen po dang /
translated: Subh≈´ti, it is because the Great Vehicle and the knowledge of all aspects‚Äîthose two dharmas‚Äîare neither conjoined nor disjoined, and so on.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid tha dad du dbyer med pas khams gsum nas 'byung ba dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gnas par 'gyur ba dbyer med pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid tha dad du dbyer med pas khams gsum nas 'byung ba dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gnas par 'gyur ba dbyer med pa bstan pa ste /
translated: The demonstration of the inseparability of the Great Vehicle and the knowledge of all aspects in the ultimate, and the inseparability of the emergence from the three realms and abiding in the knowledge of all aspects is shown.

original: chos de gnyis ldan pa yang ma yin mi ldan pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba'i don dam par theg pa chen po dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gcig pa dang tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid med par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: chos de gnyis ldan pa yang ma yin mi ldan pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba'i don dam par theg pa chen po dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gcig pa dang tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid med par bstan pa ste /
translated: The demonstration of the Great Vehicle and the knowledge of all aspects as neither conjoined nor disjoined in the ultimate, and as not having the character of being the same or different is shown.

original: ldan pa yang ma yin zhes bya @230a * //üîΩbas ni gcig pa'i mtshan nyid med pa bstan to //
analyzed: ldan pa yang ma yin zhes bya @230a * // bas ni gcig pa'i mtshan nyid med pa bstan to //
translated: Nor is it not endowed with them.

original: mi ldan pa yang ma yin zhes bya bas ni tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid med pa bstan to //
analyzed: mi ldan pa yang ma yin zhes bya bas ni tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid med pa bstan to //
translated: By saying ‚Äúnor is it not endowed with them,‚Äù he teaches that they do not have the defining characteristic of difference.

original: gzugs med pa bstan du med pa /
analyzed: gzugs med pa bstan du med pa /
translated: It is formless, cannot be shown,

original: thogs pa med pa ste /
analyzed: thogs pa med pa ste /
translated: and is unimpeded.üîΩThus, it is of a single defining mark, which is the absence of a defining mark.

original: 'di ltar mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig pa'o zhes bya ba ni don dam par theg pa chen po dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la tha dad du dbyer med pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig pa'o zhes bya ba ni don dam par theg pa chen po dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la tha dad du dbyer med pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa'o //
translated: This teaches the reason that the Great Vehicle and the knowledge of all aspects are ultimately not different and not divided.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor mtshan nyid med pa'i chos ni 'byung ba'am 'byung bar 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: rab 'byor mtshan nyid med pa'i chos ni 'byung ba'am 'byung bar 'gyur ba'am /
translated: Subh≈´ti, a dharma that is without a defining mark does not arise, is not in the process of arising,üîΩand has not arisen.

original: byung bar gyur pa med de zhes bya ba ni de ltar theg pa chen po dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid don dam par dngos po med de /
analyzed: byung bar gyur pa med de zhes bya ba ni de ltar theg pa chen po dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid don dam par dngos po med de /
translated: Thus, the Great Vehicle and the knowledge of all aspects are ultimately not things.

original: mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig pa'i phyir khams gsum nas da ltar byung ba yang med /
analyzed: mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig pa'i phyir khams gsum nas da ltar byung ba yang med /
translated: Because they are of the single identity that is without identity, there is no present arising from the three realms,üîΩno future arising,

original: phyis 'byung bar 'gyur ba yang med /üîΩsngon byung bar gyur pa yang med do zhes bstan pa'o //üîΩrab 'byor gang mtshan nyid med pa'i chos rnams 'byung bar 'dod pa de ni chos kyi dbyings 'byung par 'dod du zad do zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: phyis 'byung bar 'gyur ba yang med / sngon byung bar gyur pa yang med do zhes bstan pa'o // rab 'byor gang mtshan nyid med pa'i chos rnams 'byung bar 'dod pa de ni chos kyi dbyings 'byung par 'dod du zad do zhes bya ba nas /
translated: and no past arising.üîΩSubh≈´ti, whoever wishes for the arising of phenomena that are without identity is simply wishing for the arising of the realm of phenomena.üîΩSubh≈´ti, whoever wishes for the arising of phenomena that are without identity is simply wishing for the arising of the realm of cessation.

original: rab 'byor gang mtshan nyid med pa'i chos rnams 'byung bar 'dod pa de ni 'gog pa'i dbyings 'byung bar 'dod du zad do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni chos kyi dbyings stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin gyi rnam grangs su gtogs pa de bzhin nyid dang /

translated: This passage mentions the realm of phenomena, emptiness, the nature, the categories, suchness,

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' la sogs pa smos te /
translated: the perfect limit, and so on.

original: de dag la don dam par khams gsum nas 'byung ba yang med la /
analyzed: de dag la don dam par khams gsum nas 'byung ba yang med la /
translated: Ultimately, there is no arising from the three realms,üîΩno arising in the three realms,üîΩand no arising in the three realms.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gnas par 'gyur ba yang med pa de bzhin du theg pa chen po dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang dngos po med pas khams gsum nas 'byung zhing rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gnas par 'gyur ba med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gnas par 'gyur ba yang med pa de bzhin du theg pa chen po dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang dngos po med pas khams gsum nas 'byung zhing rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gnas par 'gyur ba med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Just as there is no such thing as a Great Vehicle, and just as there is no such thing as a person who goes forth from the three worlds in the Great Vehicle, and just as there is no such thing as a person who stands in the knowledge of all aspects, in the same way, since there is no such thing as the Great Vehicle, and since there is no such thing as the knowledge of all aspects, there is no going forth from the three worlds, and there is no standing in the knowledge of all aspects.üîΩSubh≈´ti, anyone who wants to go forth from the three worlds in the Great Vehicle, and who wants to stand in the knowledge of all aspects, should understand that he is wanting to go forth from the three worlds in the emptiness of form, and he should understand that he is wanting to stand in the emptiness of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rab 'byor gang mtshan nyid med pa'i chos rnams 'byung bar 'dod pa de ni gzugs stong pa nyid 'byung bar 'dod du zad do zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor gang mtshan nyid med pa'i chos rnams 'byung bar 'dod pa de ni gzugs stong pa nyid 'byung bar 'dod du zad do zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Because the emptiness of form does not go forth to the knowledge of all aspects, and does not stand in the knowledge of all aspects.üîΩBecause the emptiness of the perfection of wisdom does not go forth to the knowledge of all aspects, and does not stand in the knowledge of all aspects.üîΩBecause the emptiness of the knowledge of path aspects does not go forth to the knowledge of all aspects, and does not stand in the knowledge of all aspects.üîΩBecause the emptiness of the knowledge of all aspects does not go forth to the knowledge of all aspects, and does not stand in the knowledge of all aspects.üîΩBecause the emptiness of the knowledge of paths does not go forth to the knowledge of all aspects, and does not stand in the knowledge of all aspects.üîΩBecause the emptiness of the knowledge of all modes does not go forth to the knowledge of all aspects, and does not stand in the knowledge of all aspects.üîΩBecause the emptiness of the knowledge of all-knowledge does not go forth to the knowledge of all aspects, and does not stand in the knowledge of all aspects.üîΩBecause the emptiness of the knowledge of paths does not go forth to the knowledge of all aspects, and does not stand in the knowledge of all aspects.

analyzed: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis @230b tshor ba yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor bas stong pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni phung po lnga la sogs pa 'jig rten pa'i chos ming gis smos pa rnams de dag gi rang bzhinüîΩgyis stong pa'i gtan tshigs smos nas /
translated: Because the emptiness of the knowledge of all modes does not go forth to the knowledge of all aspects, and does not stand in the knowledge of all aspects.üîΩBecause the emptiness of the knowledge of all-knowledge does not go forth to the knowledge of all aspects, and does not stand in the knowledge of all aspects.üîΩBecause the emptiness of the knowledge of all-knowledge does not go forth to the knowledge

analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i ngo bo nyid ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa la thug
