original: rang sangs rgyas kyi 'bras bu rang byang chub dang / byang chub sems dpa'i 'bras bu lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'bras bu rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnams don dam par ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir khams gsum nas 'byung ba med cing rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gnas pa med pa de bzhin du theg pa chen po zhes
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi 'bras bu rang byang chub dang / byang chub sems dpa'i 'bras bu lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'bras bu rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnams don dam par ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir khams gsum nas 'byung ba med cing rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gnas pa med pa de bzhin du theg pa chen po zhes
translated: the result of pratyekabuddhas, which is the state of a pratyekabuddha buddha, the result of bodhisattvas, which is the knowledge of the aspects of the path, and the result of tathƒÅgatas, which is the knowledge of all aspects‚Äîsince they are ultimately empty of entityness, there is no emergence from the three realms and no abiding in the knowledge of all aspects.

original: bya ba don dam par mtshan nyid med pa'i chos de yang khams gsum nas 'byung ba med cing /
analyzed: bya ba don dam par mtshan nyid med pa'i chos de yang khams gsum nas 'byung ba med cing /
translated: That phenomenon, which is ultimately without characteristics, does not emerge from the three realms,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gnas pa med do zhes @231b bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gnas pa med do zhes @231b bstan pa'o //
translated: and does not abide in the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rab 'byor gang mtshan nyid med pa'i chos rnams 'byung bar 'dod pa de ni mi 'byung bar 'dod du zad do zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor gang mtshan nyid med pa'i chos rnams 'byung bar 'dod pa de ni mi 'byung bar 'dod du zad do zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Subh≈´ti, whoever wishes for the emergence of phenomena that are ultimately without characteristics, wishes for the emergence of what does not emerge.

original: gdags pa stong pa nyid gdags pa stong pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid stong pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni ming dang mtshan ma dang / brda dang tha snyad dang gdags pa rnams don dam par de dag gi rang bzhin gyi sa stong pa'i phyir khams gsum nas 'byung ba med cing /
analyzed: gdags pa stong pa nyid gdags pa stong pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid stong pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni ming dang mtshan ma dang / brda dang tha snyad dang gdags pa rnams don dam par de dag gi rang bzhin gyi sa stong pa'i phyir khams gsum nas 'byung ba med cing /
translated: Up to ‚ÄúThe emptiness of designation is empty of the emptiness of designation because of the emptiness of its own entity‚Äù means that ultimately names, signs, symbols, conventions, and designations are empty of their own natures, so they do not emerge from the three realms,üîΩand do not abide in the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gnas pa med pa de bzhin du theg pa chen po zhes bya ba don dam par mtshan nyid  med pa'i chos de'ang khams gsum nas 'byung ba med cing /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gnas pa med pa de bzhin du theg pa chen po zhes bya ba don dam par mtshan nyid  med pa'i chos de'ang khams gsum nas 'byung ba med cing /
translated: Just as the knowledge of all aspects is not established in the three realms, in the same way, the Great Vehicle, the ultimate Dharma without characteristics, is not established in the three realms,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gnas pa med pa bstan to //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gnas pa med pa bstan to //
translated: and is not established in the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rab 'byor gang mtshan nyid med pa'i chos rnams 'byung bar 'dod pa de ni skye ba med pa 'byung bar 'dod du zad do zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor gang mtshan nyid med pa'i chos rnams 'byung bar 'dod pa de ni skye ba med pa 'byung bar 'dod du zad do zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Subh≈´ti, whoever wishes for the arising of dharmas without characteristics is simply wishing for the arising of the non-arisen.

original: mngon par 'du bya ba med pa ni mngon par 'du bya ba med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid du gtogs pa skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang /
analyzed: mngon par 'du bya ba med pa ni mngon par 'du bya ba med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid du gtogs pa skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang /
translated: Up to: because non-conditioning is empty of the essence of non-conditioning.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa rnams don dam par de dag gi rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i phyir khams gsum nas 'byung ba med cing rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gnas pa med pa de bzhin du theg pa chen po zhes bya ba don damüîΩpar mtshan nyid med pa'i chos de yang khams gsum nas 'byung ba med cing /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa rnams don dam par de dag gi rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i phyir khams gsum nas 'byung ba med cing rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gnas pa med pa de bzhin du theg pa chen po zhes bya ba don dam par mtshan nyid med pa'i chos de yang khams gsum nas 'byung ba med cing /
translated: Because the absence of afflictions, the absence of purification, and the absence of activity are ultimately empty of their own intrinsic reality, they do not emerge from the three realms and do not stand in the knowledge of all aspects.üîΩIn the same way, the so-called Great Vehicle, that phenomenon without a defining characteristic ultimately, does not emerge from the three realms and does not stand in the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gnas pa med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gnas pa med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the teaching.

original: rab 'byor de ltar rnam grangs 'dis ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar rnam grangs 'dis ni /
translated: Subh≈´ti, through this one of many explanations,

original: 'di ltar theg pa chen po ni khams gsum nas byung nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gnas par shes par bya ste zhes bya ba ni de ltar don dam par chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i phyir chos gang yang khams gsum nas 'byungüîΩba med cing /üîΩrnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gnas pa med par rtogs pa nyid du kun rdzob tu khams gsum nas 'byung nas rnam pa thams cad @232a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar theg pa chen po ni khams gsum nas byung nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gnas par shes par bya ste zhes bya ba ni de ltar don dam par chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i phyir chos gang yang khams gsum nas 'byung ba med cing / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gnas pa med par rtogs pa nyid du kun rdzob tu khams gsum nas 'byung nas rnam pa thams cad @232a * //
translated: Thus, since all phenomena are ultimately empty of intrinsic reality, no phenomenon whatsoever emerges from the three realms.

original: mkhyen pa nyid du gnas par rig par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mkhyen pa nyid du gnas par rig par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: However, it should be understood that, in terms of the conventional, one emerges from the three realms and abides in omniscience.

original: gnas de ni bskyod du med pa'o zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi gnas de la gnas na mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnams kyis bskyod du mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas de ni bskyod du med pa'o zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi gnas de la gnas na mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnams kyis bskyod du mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That abode is unshakable, because when one abides in that abode of omniscience, the adverse factors are unable to shake it.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang khyod kyis gang 'di skad du theg pa chen po de gang du gnas par 'gyur zhes smras pa de ni theg pa chen po de gang du yang gnas par 'gyur ba med de zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gong du bcom ldan 'das
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang khyod kyis gang 'di skad du theg pa chen po de gang du gnas par 'gyur zhes smras pa de ni theg pa chen po de gang du yang gnas par 'gyur ba med de zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gong du bcom ldan 'das
translated: That Great Vehicle will not stay anywhere at all.üîΩAnd so on.

original: la rab 'byor gyis theg pa chen po de gang du gnas par 'gyur zhes zhus pa'i lan du /
analyzed: la rab 'byor gyis theg pa chen po de gang du gnas par 'gyur zhes zhus pa'i lan du /
translated: This is the answer to Subh≈´ti‚Äôs question to the Blessed One, ‚ÄúWhere will that Great Vehicle stay?‚Äù

original: don dam par theg pa chen po de gang du yang gnas par 'gyur ba med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: don dam par theg pa chen po de gang du yang gnas par 'gyur ba med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: It teaches that ultimately that Great Vehicle will not stay anywhere at all.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?üîΩBecause all phenomena are non-abiding, since they are not apprehended as abiding.

original: 'di ltar chos thams cad ni gnas mi dmigs pa'i phyir mi gnas pa ste zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po de don dam par gang du yang gnas pa med pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar chos thams cad ni gnas mi dmigs pa'i phyir mi gnas pa ste zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po de don dam par gang du yang gnas pa med pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: This teaches the reason why that Great Vehicle ultimately does not stay anywhere at all.

original: don dam par 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos thams cad dngos po yod par ma grub pas gnas mi dmigs pa'i phyir gang du yang mi gnas pa de bzhin du theg pa chen po de yang gang du yang mi gnas pa'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: don dam par 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos thams cad dngos po yod par ma grub pas gnas mi dmigs pa'i phyir gang du yang mi gnas pa de bzhin du theg pa chen po de yang gang du yang mi gnas pa'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Since ultimately all conditioned and unconditioned phenomena are not established as existent things, they do not abide anywhere, and in the same way, the Great Vehicle also does not abide anywhere.üîΩSubh≈´ti, the Great Vehicle abides in that way, by way of not apprehending anything.

original: rab 'byor de ltar theg pa chen po de ni mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas so zhes bya ba ni de ltar chos thams cad don dam par dngos po med de /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar theg pa chen po de ni mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas so zhes bya ba ni de ltar chos thams cad don dam par dngos po med de /
translated: Thus, ultimately all phenomena are not things,

original: gang du yang gnas pa med mod kyi /
analyzed: gang du yang gnas pa med mod kyi /
translated: and they do not abide anywhere.

original: kun rdzob du tha snyad tsam du gnas so zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob du tha snyad tsam du gnas so zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: However, conventionally, they are merely posited.

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: Subh≈´ti, it is like this:

original: chos kyi dbyings ni gnas pa yang ma yin mi gnas pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings ni gnas pa yang ma yin mi gnas pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The realm of phenomena does not abide and does not not abide.

original: 'gog pa'i dbyings kyi rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni 'dus ma byas pa'i chos ming gis smos pa rnams rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i phyir gnas pa dang mi gnas pa med pa de bzhin du theg pa chen po de la yangüîΩgnas pa dang mi gnas pa'i mtha' gnyis med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i dbyings kyi rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni 'dus ma byas pa'i chos ming gis smos pa rnams rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i phyir gnas pa dang mi gnas pa med pa de bzhin du theg pa chen po de la yang gnas pa dang mi gnas pa'i mtha' gnyis med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: The passage from ‚Äúbecause it is empty of the nature of the element of cessation‚Äù up to ‚Äúbecause it is empty of the nature of the element of space‚Äù teaches that just as unconditioned phenomena, which are mentioned by name, are empty of their own intrinsic reality and therefore neither abide nor do not abide,üîΩin the same way, the Great Vehicle also has neither the extreme of abiding nor the extreme of non-abiding.

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na gzugs stong pa nyid ni gnas pa yang ma yin mi gnas pa yang ma yin no @232b zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na gzugs stong pa nyid ni gnas pa yang ma yin mi gnas pa yang ma yin no @232b zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Subh≈´ti, it is like this: the emptiness of form is neither abiding nor non-abiding, up toüîΩbecause the feeling that arises from the condition of eye contact is empty of the feeling that arises from the condition of eye contact.

original: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor bas stong pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i bar du phung po lnga la sogs pa 'dus byas kyi chos rnams de dag gi rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor bas stong pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i bar du phung po lnga la sogs pa 'dus byas kyi chos rnams de dag gi rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i phyir /
translated: The passage from ‚Äúbecause the five aggregates are empty of the five aggregates‚Äù up to ‚Äúbecause the element of consciousness is empty of the element of consciousness‚Äù teaches that just as conditioned phenomena such as the five aggregates and so on are empty of their own intrinsic reality and therefore neither abide nor do not abide,

original: gnas pa'am mi gnas pa med pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: gnas pa'am mi gnas pa med pa de bzhin du /
translated: in the same way, the Great Vehicle also has neither the extreme of abiding nor the extreme of non-abiding.

original: theg pa chen po de la yang gnas pa'am mi gnas pa med pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen po de la yang gnas pa'am mi gnas pa med pa bstan pa'o //
translated: It is taught that the Great Vehicle also is not something that abides or does not abide.

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /üîΩrmi lam ni gnas pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na / rmi lam ni gnas pa yang ma yin /
translated: Subh≈´ti, it is like this:üîΩA dream is not something that abides or does not abide.

original: mi gnas pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: mi gnas pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Up to:üîΩA TathƒÅgata‚Äôs emanation is empty of a TathƒÅgata‚Äôs emanation.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pas stong pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni rmi lam la sogs pa shin tu med pa'i chos rnams la gnas pa dang mi gnas pa med pa de bzhin du theg pa chen po de la
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pas stong pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni rmi lam la sogs pa shin tu med pa'i chos rnams la gnas pa dang mi gnas pa med pa de bzhin du theg pa chen po de la
translated: Just as a dream and so on are utterly non-existent phenomena that are not something that abides or does not abide, so too the Great Vehicle

original: yang don dam par gnas pa dang mi gnas pa med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: yang don dam par gnas pa dang mi gnas pa med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: is not something that abides or does not abide ultimately.

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: Subh≈´ti, it is like this:

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni gnas pa yang ma yin mi gnas pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni gnas pa yang ma yin mi gnas pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The perfection of generosity is not something that abides or does not abide.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i bar du ni rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams de dag gi ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir gnas pa dang
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i bar du ni rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams de dag gi ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir gnas pa dang
translated: The passage from ‚Äúbecause the reality of the knowledge of all aspects is empty of the reality of the knowledge of all aspects‚Äù up to ‚Äúbecause the reality of the knowledge of all aspects is empty of the reality of the knowledge of all aspects‚Äù teaches that just as the phenomena of purification are empty of their own reality,

original: mi gnas pa med pa de bzhin du theg pa chen po de la yang don dam par gnas pa dang / mi gnas pa med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mi gnas pa med pa de bzhin du theg pa chen po de la yang don dam par gnas pa dang / mi gnas pa med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: and therefore neither abide nor do not abide, in the same way, the Great Vehicle ultimately neither abides nor does not abide.

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /üîΩming ni gnas pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na / ming ni gnas pa yang ma yin /
translated: Subh≈´ti, it is thus.

original: mi gnas pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: mi gnas pa yang ma yin no //
translated: A name neither abides nor does not abide.

original: rab 'byor de bzhin du theg pa chen po de yang gnas pa yang ma yin /üîΩmi gnas pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor de bzhin du theg pa chen po de yang gnas pa yang ma yin /üîΩmi gnas pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Subh≈´ti, the Great Vehicle neither abides nor does not abide.

original: gdags pa'i ngo bo nyid gdags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni ming dang mtshan ma la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du btags pa rnams don dam par dngos po med de /
analyzed: gdags pa'i ngo bo nyid gdags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni ming dang mtshan ma la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du btags pa rnams don dam par dngos po med de /
translated: The passage from ‚Äúbecause the reality of designation is empty of the reality of designation‚Äù up to ‚Äúbecause the reality of non-entityness is empty of the reality of non-entityness‚Äù teaches that names, signs, and so on that are designated as mundane conventions are ultimately non-entities.üîΩBecause they are empty of essence, they are neither abiding nor non-abiding.

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i phyir gnas pa dang mi gnas pa med pa de bzhin du theg pa chen po de la yang don dam par gnas pa dang mi gnas pa med pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i phyir gnas pa dang mi gnas pa med pa de bzhin du theg pa chen po de la yang don dam par gnas pa dang mi gnas pa med pa bstan pa'o //
translated: Similarly, the Great Vehicle is also neither ultimately abiding nor non-abiding.

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: Subh≈´ti, it is thus.

original: skye ba med pa ni gnas pa yang ma yin /üîΩmi gnas pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba @233a * //
analyzed: skye ba med pa ni gnas pa yang ma yin / mi gnas pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba @233a * //
translated: Non-production is neither abiding nor non-abiding.

original: nas / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: nas / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Up to ‚ÄúWhy is that?

original: rab 'byor de ni 'di ltar mngon par 'du bya ba med pa'i ngo bo nyid mngon par 'du bya ba med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ni 'di ltar mngon par 'du bya ba med pa'i ngo bo nyid mngon par 'du bya ba med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
translated: Subh≈´ti, it is because the essence of the absence of compositional activity is empty of the essence of the absence of compositional activity.‚Äù

original: chos thams cad kyi skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang ; kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa rnams don dam par de dag gi ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir gnas pa dang mi gnas pa med pa de bzhin du theg pa chen po de la yang gnas pa dang mi gnas pa med par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang ; kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa rnams don dam par de dag gi ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir gnas pa dang mi gnas pa med pa de bzhin du theg pa chen po de la yang gnas pa dang mi gnas pa med par bstan pa'o //
translated: In the same way, the Great Vehicle is also taught as neither existent nor non-existent.

original: rab 'byor rnam grangs des na /
analyzed: rab 'byor rnam grangs des na /
translated: Subh≈´ti, for these reasons,

original: theg pa de ni mi gnas par gnas pa'i tshul dang / bskyod du med pa'i tshul gyis gang du yang gnas par 'gyur ba med do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: theg pa de ni mi gnas par gnas pa'i tshul dang / bskyod du med pa'i tshul gyis gang du yang gnas par 'gyur ba med do zhes bya ba la /
translated: that vehicle does not stand anywhere by way of standing without standing or by way of being unshakable.

original: mi gnas par gnas pa'i tshul zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po don dam par dngos po med pas mi gnas la /
analyzed: mi gnas par gnas pa'i tshul zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po don dam par dngos po med pas mi gnas la /
translated: As for standing without standing, the Great Vehicle does not stand ultimately because it is not a thing.

original: kun rdzob tu rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gnas par 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gnas par 'gyur ba med do //
translated: It does not stand in the relative as omniscience.

original: bskyod du med pa'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bskyod du med pa'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúIn a manner of not moving‚Äù means

original: theg pa chen po de don dam par ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir gang du gnas pa med pa de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin las mi 'gyur bas mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnams kyis gzhan du bsgyur zhing bskyod mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: theg pa chen po de don dam par ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir gang du gnas pa med pa de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin las mi 'gyur bas mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnams kyis gzhan du bsgyur zhing bskyod mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: that since the Great Vehicle is ultimately empty of an essence, it does not stand anywhere, and since it does not move from the nature of suchness, it cannot be changed or moved elsewhere by adverse factors.

original: gang du yang gnas par 'gyur ba med do zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po de don dam par ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir gang du yang gnas pa med pa'i don mjug bsdus te bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gang du yang gnas par 'gyur ba med do zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po de don dam par ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir gang du yang gnas pa med pa'i don mjug bsdus te bstan pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt does not stand anywhere‚Äù concludes and teaches the meaning that since the Great Vehicle is ultimately empty of an essence, it does not stand anywhere.

original: rab 'byor gang yang khyod kyis 'di skad du theg pa des su zhig 'byung bar 'gyur zhes smras pa ni theg pa des su'ang 'byung bar 'gyur ba med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor gang yang khyod kyis 'di skad du theg pa des su zhig 'byung bar 'gyur zhes smras pa ni theg pa des su'ang 'byung bar 'gyur ba med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: ‚ÄúSu¬≠bh≈´ti, when you said, ‚ÄòWho will emerge through this vehicle?‚Äô it is because no one at all emerges through this vehicle.‚Äù

original: bcom ldan 'das la rab 'byor gyis theg pa chen po des su zhig 'byung bar 'gyur zhes zhus pa'i lan du /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la rab 'byor gyis theg pa chen po des su zhig 'byung bar 'gyur zhes zhus pa'i lan du /
translated: Subh≈´ti asked the Lord, ‚ÄúBy what Great Vehicle will anyone emerge?‚Äù

original: theg pa chen po nyid dang des 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa don dam par dngos po med cing dmigs su med pa'i phyir theg pa des su'ang 'byung bar 'gyur ba @233b med do zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa ste /
analyzed: theg pa chen po nyid dang des 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa don dam par dngos po med cing dmigs su med pa'i phyir theg pa des su'ang 'byung bar 'gyur ba @233b med do zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa ste /
translated: In reply, the Lord said, ‚ÄúBy the Great Vehicle itself, and the Bodhisattvas who will emerge by it, ultimately, are not entities and are not apprehended, so by that vehicle no one will emerge.‚Äù

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?üîΩ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, it is because that vehicle, and those Bodhisattvas, and the emergence, and the one who will emerge, and the time when they will emerge, are not two, nor are they three.‚Äù

original: rab 'byor de ni 'di ltar theg pa de gang yin pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba med pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ni 'di ltar theg pa de gang yin pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba med pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: This teaches the reason why there is no emergence.

original: theg pa de gang yin pa dang zhes bya ba ni theg pa gang gis 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i theg pa chen po de la bya'o //
analyzed: theg pa de gang yin pa dang zhes bya ba ni theg pa gang gis 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i theg pa chen po de la bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat vehicle‚Äù refers to the Great Vehicle by which one will emerge.

original: gang 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang zhes bya ba ni theg pa des gang 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i byang chub sems dpa' la bya'o //
analyzed: gang 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang zhes bya ba ni theg pa des gang 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i byang chub sems dpa' la bya'o //
translated: That which will arise refers to the bodhisattva who will arise by means of that vehicle.

original: gang gis 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang zhes bya ba ni chos dang gang zag la bdag med par rtogs par sgrub pa'i chos gang la gnas na 'byung bar 'gyur ba la bya'o //
analyzed: gang gis 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang zhes bya ba ni chos dang gang zag la bdag med par rtogs par sgrub pa'i chos gang la gnas na 'byung bar 'gyur ba la bya'o //
translated: That by which one will arise refers to the Dharma that is the means of establishing the realization of the no self of the person and phenomena, abiding in which one will arise.

original: gang nas 'byung bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni khams gsum la bya'o //
analyzed: gang nas 'byung bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni khams gsum la bya'o //
translated: That from which one will arise refers to the three realms.

original: chos de dag thams cad med cing mi dmigs pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / khams gsum po de dag don dam par dngos po med cing dmigs su med pa'i phyir chos gang zhig chos gang gis 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba dang sbyar te 'byung bar byed pa dang /
analyzed: chos de dag thams cad med cing mi dmigs pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / khams gsum po de dag don dam par dngos po med cing dmigs su med pa'i phyir chos gang zhig chos gang gis 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba dang sbyar te 'byung bar byed pa dang /
translated: Because all those dharmas do not exist and are not apprehended refers to the fact that since the Great Vehicle, the bodhisattva, the Dharma of practice, and the three realms are ultimately non things and not apprehended, one should connect this with the question, ‚ÄúWhat dharma will arise through what dharma?‚Äù

original: 'byung bar bya ba dang / gang nas 'byung ba'i chos de dag don dam par med cing mi dmigs pas gang yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba med do zhes don mdor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung bar bya ba dang / gang nas 'byung ba'i chos de dag don dam par med cing mi dmigs pas gang yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba med do zhes don mdor bstan pa'o //
translated: The meaning of the summary is that since those phenomena that are to be produced and from which they are produced do not exist ultimately and are not observed, nothing whatsoever is produced.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩrab 'byor de ni 'di ltar bdag shin tu rnam par dag pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mu stegs can gyis bdag tu brtags pa rnams dang / chos kyi dbyings la sogs pa 'dus ma byas pa'i chos rnams dang / phung po dang /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / rab 'byor de ni 'di ltar bdag shin tu rnam par dag pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mu stegs can gyis bdag tu brtags pa rnams dang / chos kyi dbyings la sogs pa 'dus ma byas pa'i chos rnams dang / phung po dang /
translated: Why is that?

original: khams la sogs pa nyon mongs pa'i phyogs su gtogs pa'i chos rnams dang pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa rnam par byang ba'i chos thams cad kyang dmigs su med pa'i phyir chos gang gis kyang gang yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba med do zhes bstan pa ste
analyzed: khams la sogs pa nyon mongs pa'i phyogs su gtogs pa'i chos rnams dang pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa rnam par byang ba'i chos thams cad kyang dmigs su med pa'i phyir chos gang gis kyang gang yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba med do zhes bstan pa ste
translated: Subh≈´ti, it is because the self is extremely pure, and so on. The imputed selves of the tƒ´rthikas, the unconditioned phenomena such as the dharmadhƒÅtu, and the phenomena that are included in the class of afflictions such as the aggregates and the constituents, and all the phenomena of complete purification such as the perfections, are not observed. Therefore, nothing whatsoever is produced by any phenomenon.

original: / de la bdag shin tu rnam par dag pa dang zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: / de la bdag shin tu rnam par dag pa dang zhes bya ba nas /
translated: That is taught as follows.

original: mthong ba po dmigs su med do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni mu stegs can gyis brtags pa'i @234a * //
analyzed: mthong ba po dmigs su med do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni mu stegs can gyis brtags pa'i @234a * //
translated: Up to ‚Äúthe seer is not observed‚Äù is the nonobservation of the imputed.üîΩ

original: bdag rnams yang dag par dngos po med de /
analyzed: bdag rnams yang dag par dngos po med de /
translated: Up to ‚Äúthe seer is not apprehended‚Äù indicates that the selves imputed by the tƒ´rthikas do not exist in reality.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir dmigs su med pas gang gis kyang 'byung bar 'gyur ba med cing /
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir dmigs su med pas gang gis kyang 'byung bar 'gyur ba med cing /
translated: Because they are utterly pure, they are not apprehended. Therefore, nothing arises.

original: gang yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba med pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' de yang don dam par theg pa chen po des 'byung bar 'gyur ba med do zhes bstan pa ste /
analyzed: gang yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba med pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' de yang don dam par theg pa chen po des 'byung bar 'gyur ba med do zhes bstan pa ste /
translated: And just as nothing arises, so too the bodhisattva does not arise ultimately through that Great Vehicle.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni shin tu stong pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni shin tu stong pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is taught by ‚Äúbecause they are utterly pure,‚Äù which means ‚Äúbecause they are utterly empty.‚Äù

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir chos kyi dbyings dmigs su med do zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir chos kyi dbyings dmigs su med do zhes bya ba nas /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause the realm of phenomena is utterly pure, it is not apprehended‚Äù indicates that the realm of phenomena is not apprehended because it is utterly pure.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings dmigs su med do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni stong pa nyid kyi rnam grangs su gtogs pa'i chos rnams dmigs su med pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings dmigs su med do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni stong pa nyid kyi rnam grangs su gtogs pa'i chos rnams dmigs su med pa bstan pa'o //
translated: Up to ‚Äúthe inconceivable element is not apprehended‚Äù teaches the non-apprehension of phenomena included in the synonyms of emptiness.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir phung po rnams dmigs su med do zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir phung po rnams dmigs su med do zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Up to ‚Äúthe aggregates are not apprehended because of being extremely pure‚Äù teaches the non-apprehension of phenomena included in the side of afflictions.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dmigs su med do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni nyon mongs pa'i phyogs su gtogs pa'i chos rnams dmigs su med pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dmigs su med do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni nyon mongs pa'i phyogs su gtogs pa'i chos rnams dmigs su med pa bstan pa'o //
translated: Up to ‚Äúdependent origination is not apprehended‚Äù teaches the non-apprehension of phenomena included in the side of afflictions.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dmigs su med do zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dmigs su med do zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Up to ‚Äúthe perfection of generosity is not apprehended because of being extremely pure‚Äù teaches the non-apprehension of phenomena included in purification.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dmigs su med do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams dmigs su med pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dmigs su med do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams dmigs su med pa bstan pa'o //
translated: Up to ‚Äúthe knowledge of all aspects is not apprehended because of being extremely pure‚Äù teaches the non-apprehension of phenomena included in purification.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir skye ba med pa dmigs su med do zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir skye ba med pa dmigs su med do zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Because of utter purity, non-production is not apprehended.üîΩ

original: mngon par 'du bya ba med pa dmigs su med do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni chos kyi dbyings kyi rnam grangs su gtogs pa skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa la sogs pa dmigs su med pa bstan to //üîΩshin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir sngon gyi mtha' dmigs su med do zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: mngon par 'du bya ba med pa dmigs su med do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni chos kyi dbyings kyi rnam grangs su gtogs pa skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa la sogs pa dmigs su med pa bstan to // shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir sngon gyi mtha' dmigs su med do zhes bya ba nas /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause of utter purity, non-production is not apprehended‚Äù up to ‚Äúnon-conditioning is not apprehended‚Äù teaches that the categories of the Dharma-element, such as non-production and non-cessation, etc., are not apprehended.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir 'phel ba dmigs su med do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni dus gsum dang 'ong ba dang 'gro ba dang gnas pa dang tshe 'pho ba dang / skye ba dang / 'grib pa dang / 'phel ba rnams don dam par rang bzhin stong pa nyid yin pas /
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir 'phel ba dmigs su med do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni dus gsum dang 'ong ba dang 'gro ba dang gnas pa dang tshe 'pho ba dang / skye ba dang / 'grib pa dang / 'phel ba rnams don dam par rang bzhin stong pa nyid yin pas /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause of utter purity, the prior limit is not apprehended‚Äù up to ‚Äúbecause of utter purity, increase is not apprehended‚Äù teaches that the three times, coming and going, abiding, transference of life, birth, decrease, and increase are ultimately empty of inherent existence.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir dmigs su med pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir dmigs su med pa bstan pa'o //
translated: Because of utter purity, they are not apprehended.

original: @234b gang mi dmigs pas thams cad dmigs su med pa yin zhe na zhes bya ba ni gang du smos pa'i chos rnams dmigs su med par bshad pa chos de dag gi rgyu mi dmigs pas dmigs su med dam /
analyzed: @234b gang mi dmigs pas thams cad dmigs su med pa yin zhe na zhes bya ba ni gang du smos pa'i chos rnams dmigs su med par bshad pa chos de dag gi rgyu mi dmigs pas dmigs su med dam /
translated: If it is asked by what non-apprehension are all non-apprehended,üîΩthe BhagavƒÅn himself asks, ‚ÄúBy what non-apprehension are all non-apprehended?‚Äù in order to dispel the doubts of some in the assembly who think, ‚ÄúAre phenomena explained as non-apprehended because the cause of those phenomena is not apprehended,

original: 'on te chos de dag gi rang bzhin mi dmigs pas dmigs su med snyam du 'khor gyi nang na kha cig the tshom za ba bsal ba'i phyir gang mi dmigs pas thams cad dmigs su med pa yin zhes bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis glengs pa'o //
analyzed: 'on te chos de dag gi rang bzhin mi dmigs pas dmigs su med snyam du 'khor gyi nang na kha cig the tshom za ba bsal ba'i phyir gang mi dmigs pas thams cad dmigs su med pa yin zhes bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis glengs pa'o //
translated: or are those phenomena non-apprehended because their nature is not apprehended?‚Äù

original: chos kyi dbyings mi dmigs pas chos kyi dbyings dmigs su med do zhes bya ba ni don dam par chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin dngos po med de mi dmigs pas chos kyi dbyings dmigs su med pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings mi dmigs pas chos kyi dbyings dmigs su med do zhes bya ba ni don dam par chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin dngos po med de mi dmigs pas chos kyi dbyings dmigs su med pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: The statement, ‚ÄúThe dharmadhƒÅtu is non-apprehended because the dharmadhƒÅtu is not apprehended,‚Äù teaches that ultimately the nature of the dharmadhƒÅtu is not a thing and is not apprehended, so the dharmadhƒÅtu is not apprehended.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor chos kyi dbyings dmigs su med pa ni dmigs pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: rab 'byor chos kyi dbyings dmigs su med pa ni dmigs pa yang ma yin /
translated: Subh≈´ti, the non-apprehension of the dharma-dhƒÅtu is not an apprehension,

original: mi dmigs pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa yang ma yin no //
translated: nor is it a non-apprehension.

original: zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa dang mi dmigs pa dag dngos po yod pa las brjod kyi /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa dang mi dmigs pa dag dngos po yod pa las brjod kyi /
translated: This shows that the terms ‚Äúapprehension‚Äù and ‚Äúnon-apprehension‚Äù are used in relation to existent things.

original: dngos po med pa la dmigs pa dang / mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i tha snyad gdags su med de /
analyzed: dngos po med pa la dmigs pa dang / mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i tha snyad gdags su med de /
translated: But in the case of non-existents, it is impossible to designate them as ‚Äúapprehended‚Äù or ‚Äúnot apprehended.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir chos kyi dbyings dmigs su med pa la /
analyzed: de'i phyir chos kyi dbyings dmigs su med pa la /
translated: Therefore, in the non-apprehension of the dharma-dhƒÅtu,

original: dmigs pa dang mi dmigs pa'i tha snyad gdags su med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang mi dmigs pa'i tha snyad gdags su med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: the terms ‚Äúapprehension‚Äù and ‚Äúnon-apprehension‚Äù cannot be designated.

original: chos kyi dbyings la ji ltar bshad pa de bzhin du de bzhin nyid dang yang dag pa'i mtha' la sogs pa 'grib pa dang / 'phel ba dmigs su med pa la thug gi bar du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings la ji ltar bshad pa de bzhin du de bzhin nyid dang yang dag pa'i mtha' la sogs pa 'grib pa dang / 'phel ba dmigs su med pa la thug gi bar du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Just as it is explained in relation to the dharma-dhƒÅtu, so it should be applied in the same way to suchness, the perfect end, and so forth, up to the non-apprehension of decrease and increase.

original: sa dang po mi dmigs pas sa dang po dmigs su med do zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: sa dang po mi dmigs pas sa dang po dmigs su med do zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The first ground is not apprehended, therefore the first ground is non-apprehensible.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor sa bcu pa dmigs su med pa ni dmigs pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: rab 'byor sa bcu pa dmigs su med pa ni dmigs pa yang ma yin /
translated: Subh≈´ti, the ten grounds are not apprehended, nor are they non-apprehended.

original: mi dmigs pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du ni dkar po rnam par mthong ba'i sa la sogs pa yang don dam par dngos po med pas dmigs pa dang mi dmigs pa'i tha snyad gdags su med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du ni dkar po rnam par mthong ba'i sa la sogs pa yang don dam par dngos po med pas dmigs pa dang mi dmigs pa'i tha snyad gdags su med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Up to here, it teaches that the ground of seeing white, and so on, are also ultimately not things, so they cannot be designated as apprehended or non-apprehended.

original: sa dang po ni gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang du sa dang po nas sa bcu'i par du dmigs su med do zhes bshad pa sa bcu la rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: sa dang po ni gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang du sa dang po nas sa bcu'i par du dmigs su med do zhes bshad pa sa bcu la rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: What is the first ground? and so on, explains that from the first ground up to the tenth ground are not apprehended. The ten grounds are twofold:

original: byang chub sems dpa'i @235a * //üîΩsa dang po rab tu dga' ba nas sa bcu pa chos kyi sprin gyi bar la yang sa bcu zhes bya /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i @235a * // sa dang po rab tu dga' ba nas sa bcu pa chos kyi sprin gyi bar la yang sa bcu zhes bya /
translated: the ten grounds of the bodhisattvasüîΩand the ten grounds such as the ground of seeing white.

original: dkar po rnam par mthong ba'i sa la sogs pa la sa bcu zhes bya na /
analyzed: dkar po rnam par mthong ba'i sa la sogs pa la sa bcu zhes bya na /
translated: If the ten grounds such as the ground of seeing white are called the ten grounds,

original: skabs 'dir sa bcu gang la bya snyam du 'khor gyi nang na kha cig the tshom za ba'i the tshom bsal ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis dkar po rnam par mthong ba'i sa la sogs pa ming gis brjod pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: skabs 'dir sa bcu gang la bya snyam du 'khor gyi nang na kha cig the tshom za ba'i the tshom bsal ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis dkar po rnam par mthong ba'i sa la sogs pa ming gis brjod pa bstan pa'o //
translated: In this context, it is thought that the ten stages are to be performed. In order to dispel the doubts of some in the assembly who have doubts, the Blessed One himself taught the names of the stages, such as the stage of seeing what is white.

original: de la dkar po rnam par mthong ba'i sa zhes bya ba ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa la dang po shes rab kyis rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams mthong ba'i gnas skabs la bya'o //
analyzed: de la dkar po rnam par mthong ba'i sa zhes bya ba ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa la dang po shes rab kyis rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams mthong ba'i gnas skabs la bya'o //
translated: Here, the stage of seeing what is white is the stage of practice through belief, and refers to the state of seeing the phenomena of purification through wisdom for the first time.

original: rigs kyi gnas kyi sa zhes bya ba ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa la drod dang / rtse mo dang / bzod pa dang / 'jig rten gyi chos kyi mchog la gnas pa'i tshe byang chub gsum gyi rigs dang ldan pa'i phyir rigs kyis zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi gnas kyi sa zhes bya ba ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa la drod dang / rtse mo dang / bzod pa dang / 'jig rten gyi chos kyi mchog la gnas pa'i tshe byang chub gsum gyi rigs dang ldan pa'i phyir rigs kyis zhes bya'o //
translated: The stage of the abode of the lineage is the stage of practice through belief, and refers to the time of abiding in heat, peak, patience, and the supreme mundane state, because it possesses the lineage of the three enlightenments.

original: brgyad pa'i sa zhes bya ba ni dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu thob pa'i gral dang po nas yas bgrangs na /
analyzed: brgyad pa'i sa zhes bya ba ni dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu thob pa'i gral dang po nas yas bgrangs na /
translated: The stage of the eighth is the first rank of those who have attained the fruit of arhatship.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir 'jug pa grangs brgyad la 'bab pas na brgyad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir 'jug pa grangs brgyad la 'bab pas na brgyad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the eighth because it is the eighth of the eight kinds of entry into the realization of the fruit of stream-winning.

original: mthong ba'i sa zhes bya ba ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la gnas pas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gang zag la bdag med pa'i chos mthong ba'i phyir mthong ba'i sa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i sa zhes bya ba ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la gnas pas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gang zag la bdag med pa'i chos mthong ba'i phyir mthong ba'i sa zhes bya'o //
translated: The stage of vision is so called because the stream-winner, abiding in the fruit, sees the Dharma of the non-self of the individual by means of the supramundane path.

original: bsrabs pa'i sa zhes bya ba ni lan cig phyir 'ong bas 'dod pa'i 'dod chags srab mor byas pa'i phyir lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i sa la bsrabs pa'i sa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bsrabs pa'i sa zhes bya ba ni lan cig phyir 'ong bas 'dod pa'i 'dod chags srab mor byas pa'i phyir lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i sa la bsrabs pa'i sa zhes bya'o //
translated: The stage of thinning is so called because the once-returner, by thinning out the passion of the realm of desire, is in the stage of the once-returner.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sa zhes bya ba ni phyir mi 'ong bas 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang / gnod sems spangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sa zhes bya ba ni phyir mi 'ong bas 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang / gnod sems spangs pa'i phyir /
translated: The stage of separation from passion is so called because the non-returner, by abandoning the passion and the ill-will of the realm of desire,

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i sa la 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i sa la 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sa zhes bya'o //
translated: is in the stage of the non-returner.

original: byas pa rtogs pa'i sa zhes bya ba ni dgra bcom pas bdag gis bya ba byas so //
analyzed: byas pa rtogs pa'i sa zhes bya ba ni dgra bcom pas bdag gis bya ba byas so //
translated: The stage of realizing what was to be done is the stage of the arhat, because the arhat realizes, ‚ÄúWhat was to be done is done by me.

original: 'di las srid pa gzhan med do zhes bya ba la sogs par rtogs pa'i phyir dgra bcom pa'i sa la byas pa rtogs pa'i sa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'di las srid pa gzhan med do zhes bya ba la sogs par rtogs pa'i phyir dgra bcom pa'i sa la byas pa rtogs pa'i sa zhes bya ste /
translated: There is no existence other than this.‚Äù

original: sa de dag las dkar po rnam par mthong ba'i sa ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa la gnas pa'i @235b byang chub sems dpa'i sa'o //
analyzed: sa de dag las dkar po rnam par mthong ba'i sa ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa la gnas pa'i @235b byang chub sems dpa'i sa'o //
translated: Of those stages, the stage of seeing what is white is the stage of the bodhisattva abiding in the stage of action from faith.

original: rigs kyi sa ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa la nyan thos dang / byang chub sems dpa' thun mong gi sa'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi sa ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa la nyan thos dang / byang chub sems dpa' thun mong gi sa'o //
translated: The stage of lineage is the stage common to the ≈õrƒÅvaka and bodhisattva on the stage of action from faith.

original: brgyad pa'i sa dang / mthong ba'i sa dang / bsrabs pa'i sa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sa dang / byas pa rtogs pa'i sa rnams ni nyan thos kyi sa'o //
analyzed: brgyad pa'i sa dang / mthong ba'i sa dang / bsrabs pa'i sa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sa dang / byas pa rtogs pa'i sa rnams ni nyan thos kyi sa'o //
translated: The eight stages, the stage of seeing, the stage of thinning, the stage of separation from passion, and the stage of realizing what was to be done are the stages of the ≈õrƒÅvaka.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi lung la mi rten par rang gi blos rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i don zab mo rtogs nas 'khor dang lhan cig tu gnas pa dang / bse'i rva ltar gcig pu yan gar du gnas pa la rang sangs rgyas kyi sa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi lung la mi rten par rang gi blos rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i don zab mo rtogs nas 'khor dang lhan cig tu gnas pa dang / bse'i rva ltar gcig pu yan gar du gnas pa la rang sangs rgyas kyi sa zhes bya'o //
translated: The so-called Pratyekabuddha level is so called because one abides together with a retinue after realizing the profound meaning of dependent origination with one's own mind without relying on the instructions of others, and because one abides alone like a rhinoceros.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa rab tu dga' ba la sogs pas bcu la bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa rab tu dga' ba la sogs pas bcu la bya'o //
translated: The so-called Bodhisattva level is the ten levels of the bodhisattva, such as the Joyous.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi sa kun du 'od la bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi sa kun du 'od la bya'o //
translated: The so-called Buddha level is the Buddha level of Universal Light.

original: nang stong pa nyid kyi phyir sa dang po dmigs su med do zhes bya ba nas dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid kyi phyir sa dang po dmigs su med do zhes bya ba nas dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Because of the emptiness of internal phenomena, the first level is non-apprehensible, and so on up to: because of the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities, the Buddha level is non-apprehensible.

original: sa bcu pa dmigs su med do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni dkar po rnam par mthong ba'i sa la sogs pa sa bcu po de dag re re yang stong pa nyid bco brgyad dang sbyar te /
analyzed: sa bcu pa dmigs su med do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni dkar po rnam par mthong ba'i sa la sogs pa sa bcu po de dag re re yang stong pa nyid bco brgyad dang sbyar te /
translated: The passage from ‚ÄúThe tenth ground is not apprehended‚Äù up to ‚ÄúThe tenth ground is not apprehended‚Äù teaches that each of the ten grounds, such as the ground of seeing bright virtue, is associated with the eighteen emptinesses.

original: de ltar stong pa'i phyir sa de dag dmigs su med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar stong pa'i phyir sa de dag dmigs su med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Because they are empty in that way, those grounds are not apprehended.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir sa dang po dmigs su med pa ni dmigs pa yang ma yin /üîΩmi dmigs pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba nas /üîΩshin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir sa bcu pa dmigs su med pa ni dmigs pa yang ma yin /üîΩmi dmigs pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir sa dang po dmigs su med pa ni dmigs pa yang ma yin / mi dmigs pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba nas / shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir sa bcu pa dmigs su med pa ni dmigs pa yang ma yin / mi dmigs pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
translated: Subh≈´ti, the first ground is not apprehended, is not non-apprehended, because of utter purity.

original: sa bcu po de dag de ltar stong ste /
analyzed: sa bcu po de dag de ltar stong ste /
translated: The passage from ‚ÄúThe first ground is not apprehended, is not non-apprehended, because of utter purity‚Äù up to ‚ÄúThe tenth ground is not apprehended, is not non-apprehended, because of utter purity‚Äù teaches that those ten grounds are empty in that way.

original: dmigs su med pas ni /
analyzed: dmigs su med pas ni /
translated: Because they are not apprehended,

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir dmigs pa dang / mi dmigs pa'i mtha' gnyis dang bral ba bstan pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir dmigs pa dang / mi dmigs pa'i mtha' gnyis dang bral ba bstan pa'o //
translated: they are free from the two extremes of apprehension and non-apprehension.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa nye bar bzung na nang stong pa nyid kyi phyir sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dmigs su med do zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa nye bar bzung na nang stong pa nyid kyi phyir sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dmigs su med do zhes bya ba nas /
translated: If one takes the utterly pure as the basis, then the maturation of sentient beings is not apprehended, because of the emptiness of internal phenomena.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa nye bar bzung na dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi phyir mig lnga dmigs su med do zhes bya ba'i bar @236a * //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa nye bar bzung na dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi phyir mig lnga dmigs su med do zhes bya ba'i bar @236a * //
translated: If one takes the utterly pure as the basis, then the five eyes are not apprehended, because of the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities.

original: du ni sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyan lnga yang don dam par dngos po med de /
analyzed: du ni sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyan lnga yang don dam par dngos po med de /
translated: The maturation of sentient beings, the purification of the buddhafield, and the five eyes of the TathƒÅgata are ultimately non-entities.

original: shin tu rnam par dag cing stong ba nyid bco brgyad dang sbyar na dmigs su med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag cing stong ba nyid bco brgyad dang sbyar na dmigs su med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: If one takes the utterly pure as the basis, and applies it to the eighteen emptinesses, it is taught that they are not apprehended.

original: rab 'byor de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
translated: Subh≈´ti, in that way, bodhisattva mahƒÅsattvas practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis theg pa chen pos rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni theg pa des su zhig 'byung bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis theg pa chen pos rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni theg pa des su zhig 'byung bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: One will stand in the knowledge of all modes by means of the Great Vehicle, in such a way that one does not apprehend any dharma.

original: rab 'byor gyis zhus pa'i lan mjug bsdus na sa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis zhus pa'i lan mjug bsdus na sa bstan pa ste /
translated: The reply to Subhuti's question is summed up in the teaching on the stages.

original: gong du bshad pa'i rim pa ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de khams gsum nas byung ste /
analyzed: gong du bshad pa'i rim pa ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de khams gsum nas byung ste /
translated: The Bodhisattva who courses in the perfection of wisdom as explained above, will emerge from the three worlds,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //üîΩshes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'bum pa rgya cher bshad pa las /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o // shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'bum pa rgya cher bshad pa las /
translated: and will stand in the knowledge of all modes.

original: le'u bcu gcig pa'o /
analyzed: le'u bcu gcig pa'o /
translated: The eleventh chapter of the commentary on the perfection of wisdom in one hundred thousand lines.

original: // / de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: // / de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Subhuti said to the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das theg pa chen po theg pa chen po zhes bgyi ba ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das theg pa chen po theg pa chen po zhes bgyi ba ni /
translated: The Great Vehicle, the Great Vehicle, Lord, is so called

original: lha dang mi dang / lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten zil gyis mnan te 'byung bar 'gyur ba de'i slad du theg pa chen po zhes bgyi'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni theg pa de gang nas kyang 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don sngar bshad paüîΩlas gleng nas theg pa chen po'i nges pa'i tshig dang / theg pa chen po'i chos gang yin pa zhib tu bshad pa ste /
analyzed: lha dang mi dang / lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten zil gyis mnan te 'byung bar 'gyur ba de'i slad du theg pa chen po zhes bgyi'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni theg pa de gang nas kyang 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don sngar bshad pa las gleng nas theg pa chen po'i nges pa'i tshig dang / theg pa chen po'i chos gang yin pa zhib tu bshad pa ste /
translated: The phrase because it surpasses the world with its gods, humans, and asuras and then emerges explains the etymology of the word MahƒÅyƒÅna and the meaning of the term MahƒÅyƒÅna Dharma in response to the question, Where does this vehicle come from? and so forth.

original: de la lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten zil gyis mnan te 'byung bar 'gyur bas de'i slad du theg pa chen po zhes bgyi'o zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po zhes bya ba'i nges pa'i tshig bshad pa ste /
analyzed: de la lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten zil gyis mnan te 'byung bar 'gyur bas de'i slad du theg pa chen po zhes bgyi'o zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po zhes bya ba'i nges pa'i tshig bshad pa ste /
translated: The phrase because it surpasses the world with its gods, humans, and asuras and then emerges explains the etymology of the word MahƒÅyƒÅna.

original: rgya gar gyi skad ya na zhes bya ba theg pa la yang bya /
analyzed: rgya gar gyi skad ya na zhes bya ba theg pa la yang bya /
translated: The Sanskrit word yƒÅna means vehicle,

original: 'byung ba la yang bya /
analyzed: 'byung ba la yang bya /
translated: emergence,

original: 'gro ba la yang bya ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba la yang bya ste /
translated: and going.

original: skabs 'dir lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin du bcas @236b pa'i 'jig rten thams cad zil gyis mnan te 'byung bas /
analyzed: skabs 'dir lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin du bcas @236b pa'i 'jig rten thams cad zil gyis mnan te 'byung bas /
translated: Here, it is called the Great Vehicle because it appears, having surpassed all the worlds of gods, humans, and demigods.

original: 'byung ba che ba'i phyir theg pa chen po zhes bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba che ba'i phyir theg pa chen po zhes bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: It is called the Great Vehicle because it is great in origin.üîΩBlessed One, that Great Vehicle is equal to space.

original: bcom ldan 'das theg pa chen po de ni nam mkha' dang mnyam pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nam mkha'i dpes theg pa de che ba yin par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das theg pa chen po de ni nam mkha' dang mnyam pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nam mkha'i dpes theg pa de che ba yin par bstan pa ste /
translated: This shows that the vehicle is great by the example of space.

original: skabs 'byed pa che ba dang / 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba dang / gnas pa med pa dang / dus gsum med pas che ba nyid bstan pa'o //
analyzed: skabs 'byed pa che ba dang / 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba dang / gnas pa med pa dang / dus gsum med pas che ba nyid bstan pa'o //
translated: It shows greatness by the greatness of opportunity, by going and coming, by not abiding, and by the absence of the three times.

original: de la ji ltar nam mkha' sems can grangs dang tshad ma mchis pa'i go 'byed pa de bzhin du theg pa chen po 'di yang sems can grangs dang tshad ma mchis pa'i go 'byed pas /
analyzed: de la ji ltar nam mkha' sems can grangs dang tshad ma mchis pa'i go 'byed pa de bzhin du theg pa chen po 'di yang sems can grangs dang tshad ma mchis pa'i go 'byed pas /
translated: Just as space provides opportunity for countless, innumerable sentient beings, so too this Great Vehicle provides opportunity for countless, innumerable sentient beings.

original: bcom ldan 'das rnam grangs des na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnam grangs des na /
translated: Blessed One, for this reason,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi theg pa chen po ste zhes bya ba ni skabs 'byed pa che ba bstan pa ste /üîΩji ltar nam mkha' la sems can thams cad ji ltar 'dod pa'i spyod lam thams cad kyis gnas kyang dog pa med pa'i go skabs 'byed pa che ba de de bzhin du theg pa chen po 'di la yang sems can thams cad skad cig gcig la cig car
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi theg pa chen po ste zhes bya ba ni skabs 'byed pa che ba bstan pa ste / ji ltar nam mkha' la sems can thams cad ji ltar 'dod pa'i spyod lam thams cad kyis gnas kyang dog pa med pa'i go skabs 'byed pa che ba de de bzhin du theg pa chen po 'di la yang sems can thams cad skad cig gcig la cig car
translated: The Great Vehicle of the bodhisattva-mahƒÅsattvas.

original: zhugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang dog pa med pa'i phyir theg pa chen po zhes bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: zhugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang dog pa med pa'i phyir theg pa chen po zhes bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Just as in space, all sentient beings can abide in all the conduct they desire without any restriction, and space is said to be ‚Äúvast‚Äù because it provides that opportunity, in the same way, in this Great Vehicle, all sentient beings can enter simultaneously in a single instant, and omniscience is not restricted, so it is called the Great Vehicle.üîΩIn that Great Vehicle, is there going and coming,

original: theg pa chen po de la 'gro ba dang 'ong ba zhes bgyi ba'am /
analyzed: theg pa chen po de la 'gro ba dang 'ong ba zhes bgyi ba'am /
translated: It is called the Great Vehicle because it goes and comes.

original: gnas pa yang ma mchis zhes bya ba dang / sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / dbus zhes bgyi ba yang ma mchis so zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba dang / gnas pa med pa dang / dus gsum med pa'i mdo bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gnas pa yang ma mchis zhes bya ba dang / sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / dbus zhes bgyi ba yang ma mchis so zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba dang / gnas pa med pa dang / dus gsum med pa'i mdo bstan pa'o //
translated: This teaches the s≈´tra on the absence of coming, going, and abiding, and the absence of the three times.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: Blessed One, it is like this:

original: nam mkha' la 'gro ba'am 'ong ba zhes bgyi ba yang ma mchis la /üîΩgnas pa yang ma mchis pa de bzhin du theg pa chen po 'di la yang 'gro ba mi dmigs 'byung ba mi dmigs gnas pa mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ni ji ltar nam mkha' la 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba dang / gnas pa med pa de bzhin du theg pa chen po la yang 'gro ba @237a * //
analyzed: nam mkha' la 'gro ba'am 'ong ba zhes bgyi ba yang ma mchis la / gnas pa yang ma mchis pa de bzhin du theg pa chen po 'di la yang 'gro ba mi dmigs 'byung ba mi dmigs gnas pa mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ni ji ltar nam mkha' la 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba dang / gnas pa med pa de bzhin du theg pa chen po la yang 'gro ba @237a * //
translated: There is no coming or going in space,üîΩand there is no abiding. In the same way, in this Great Vehicle, going is not observed, coming is not observed, and abiding is not observed.

original: dang 'ong ba mi dmigs so zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dang 'ong ba mi dmigs so zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: This teaches that just as there is no coming, going, or abiding in space, in the same way, in the Great Vehicle, coming and going are not observed.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste /
translated: Blessed One, it is like this:

original: dper na nam mkha' ni dus gsum mnyam pa nyid kyi slad du zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' ni dus gsum mnyam pa nyid kyi slad du zhes bya ba nas /
translated: For example, space is so called because of the sameness of the three times.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste theg pa chen po 'di ni dus gsum mnyam pa nyid kyi theg pa'am /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste theg pa chen po 'di ni dus gsum mnyam pa nyid kyi theg pa'am /
translated: Bhagavan, this vehicle, the Great Vehicle, is the vehicle of the sameness of the three times.üîΩFor that reason, it is called the Great Vehicle, the Great Vehicle.

original: de'i slad du theg pa chen po theg pa chen po zhes bgyi'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni dus gsum dmigs su med pa'i phyir theg pa chen po yin par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de'i slad du theg pa chen po theg pa chen po zhes bgyi'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni dus gsum dmigs su med pa'i phyir theg pa chen po yin par bstan pa'o //
translated: This passage teaches that the Great Vehicle is so called because the three times are not observed.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavan replied:

original: rab 'byor de de bzhin no //üîΩde de bzhin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor de de bzhin no // de de bzhin te /
translated: Subh≈´ti, it is so!üîΩIt is so!

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is just as you have said.üîΩSubh≈´ti, the six perfections are the Great Vehicle of bodhisattva mahƒÅsattvas.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rab 'byor gyis theg pa chen po de nam mkha' dang mnyam par bshad pa de bden te /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rab 'byor gyis theg pa chen po de nam mkha' dang mnyam par bshad pa de bden te /
translated: And so on.

original: de bzhin no zhes bstod pa dang / 'khor gyi nang nas kha cig theg pa chen po de gang yin snyam du the tshom za ba bsal ba'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di dag la sogs pa theg pa chen po yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin no zhes bstod pa dang / 'khor gyi nang nas kha cig theg pa chen po de gang yin snyam du the tshom za ba bsal ba'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di dag la sogs pa theg pa chen po yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Thus it is is the praise. In order to remove the doubt of some in the assembly who wonder What is this Great Vehicle? it is taught that these six perfections and so on are the Great Vehicle.

original: de la pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang ; stong pa nyid rnams dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i bar gyi chos de rnams kyi mtshan nyid ni sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de la pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang ; stong pa nyid rnams dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i bar gyi chos de rnams kyi mtshan nyid ni sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: Therein, the characteristics of those dharmas, from the perfections up to the unshared qualities of the Buddha such as the powers, are as explained above.

original: rab 'byor gang yang khyod kyis 'di skad du theg pa de ni lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten zil gyis mnan te /
analyzed: rab 'byor gang yang khyod kyis 'di skad du theg pa de ni lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten zil gyis mnan te /

original: 'dod pa'i khams de rnam par brtags pa dang / rgyu dang rkyen gyis bskyed pa /

original: mi rtag cing mi brtan pa /

original: 'gyur ba'i chos can yin te /
analyzed: 'gyur ba'i chos can yin te /

original: spang bar 'os pa'i phyir theg pa chen po des lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten zil gyis mnan te 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //

translated: Because it is suitable to be abandoned, the MahƒÅyƒÅna surpasses and goes beyond the world with its gods, humans, and asuras.

translated: Just as it was explained in the desire realm, so it should be applied to the form realm, the formless realm, the five aggregates, the twelve sense spheres, the six consciousnesses, the six contacts, the six feelings that arise from the condition of contact,

original: rab 'byor gal te lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten dngos po yod pa zhig yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bcud kyi 'jig rten rnams dngos po med par rtogs pas theg pa de 'byung bar 'gyur ba bstan pa'o //

translated: If the world with its gods, humans, and asuras were existent things, and so on, it is taught that the vehicle would appear because of realizing that the world of beings is nonexistent.

original: rab 'byor gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems dang po bskyed phyin chad snying po byang chub tu 'dug gi bar du zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po nas sa bcu'i bar du ni /

translated: If the bodhisattva mahƒÅsattva were to think, From the first production of the thought of awakening until sitting at the site of awakening, and so on, it is said that from the first bodhisattva ground up to the tenth ground, the bodhisattva mahƒÅsattva should not abide in the notion that form is empty and so on.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa re re la yang sems bskyed pa'i khyad par re re 'byung ba ji snyed yod pa de dag thams cad dngos po med par rtogs pa'i phyir theg pa chen po de lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten zil
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa re re la yang sems bskyed pa'i khyad par re re 'byung ba ji snyed yod pa de dag thams cad dngos po med par rtogs pa'i phyir theg pa chen po de lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten zil

translated: This shows the going beyond.üîΩIf the diamond-like knowledge of the Bodhisattva-¬≠MahƒÅsattva were something existent, etc.

translated: All the afflictions that are connected with latent tendencies are understood to be non-entities refers to the knowable, and the latent tendencies of the afflictive obscurations are called connected with latent tendencies because they are the cause for the subsequent arising of afflictions.

translated: The Buddha's speech is understood in the realms of the world systems of the ten directions, as many as the sand grains in the Ganges River.

analyzed: ldan pa 'byung ste /
translated: The Tathagata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One's speech endowed with sixty aspects is taught in the Tathagata's Secret Sutra as follows: Santimati, moreover, the Tathagata's speech arises endowed with sixty aspects.üîΩIt is gentle,

original: mnyen pa dang / 'jam pa dang / yid du 'ong ba dang / yid du 'thad pa dang / dag pa dang / dri ma med pa dang / gsal gsal ba dang / snyan cing 'jebs pa dag dang / mnyan par 'os pa dang / mi tshugs pa dang /
analyzed: mnyen pa dang / 'jam pa dang / yid du 'ong ba dang / yid du 'thad pa dang / dag pa dang / dri ma med pa dang / gsal gsal ba dang / snyan cing 'jebs pa dag dang / mnyan par 'os pa dang / mi tshugs pa dang /
translated: smooth, pleasing, agreeable, pure, stainless, clear, melodious, worthy of listening to, unassailable,

original: snyan pa dang / dul ba dang / mi rtsub pa dang / mi brlang ba dang / rab tu dul ba dang / rnar snyan pa dang / lus sim par byed pa dang / sems tshim par byed pa dang / snying dga' bar byed pa dang /

translated: It is pleasant, disciplined, not harsh, not rude, very disciplined, pleasing to the ear, refreshing to the body, satisfying to the mind, gladdening the heart,

original: dga' ba dang bde ba bskyed pa dang / yongs su gdung ba med pa dang / kun shes par bya ba dang / rnam par rig par bya ba dang / rnam par byang ba dang / dga' bar byed pa dang / mngon par dga' bar byed pa dang /

translated: generating joy and happiness, free from torment, understandable, intelligible, pure, delightful, and delightful to the mind.
