original: 'khor kun tu grags pa dang / rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa zhes bya ba gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'khor kun tu grags pa dang / rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa zhes bya ba gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is renowned in all circles and endowed with the best of all aspects.

original: de la mnyen pa ni khams dang ; dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad nye bar ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la mnyen pa ni khams dang ; dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad nye bar ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Among these, it is gentle because it reveals all the elements and roots of virtue.

original: 'jam pa ni tshe 'di nyid la bde ba la reg par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jam pa ni tshe 'di nyid la bde ba la reg par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is soft because it brings about the experience of bliss in this very life.

original: yid du 'ong ba ni don bzang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid du 'ong ba ni don bzang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is pleasing because it has a good meaning.

original: yid du 'thad pa ni tshig 'bru bzang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid du 'thad pa ni tshig 'bru bzang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is agreeable because it has good phrasing.

original: dag pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa bla na med pa'i rjes las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dag pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa bla na med pa'i rjes las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is pure because it arises after the supramundane, unsurpassed [path].

original: dri ma med pa ni nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal ba dang / bag chags thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dri ma med pa ni nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal ba dang / bag chags thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is stainless because it is free from all the latent tendencies and propensities of the afflictions.

original: gsal gsal ba ni tshig dang yi ge grags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal gsal ba ni tshig dang yi ge grags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is clear because the words and syllables are renowned.

original: snyan cing 'jebs pa ni mu stegs can thams cad kyi log pa'i blo  gros dang / lta ba 'jig pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snyan cing 'jebs pa ni mu stegs can thams cad kyi log pa'i blo  gros dang / lta ba 'jig pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is pleasing because it has the quality of destroying the false understanding and views of all the tƒ´rthikas.

original: mnyan par 'os pa ni bsgrubs pas nges par 'byin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mnyan par 'os pa ni bsgrubs pas nges par 'byin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is worth listening to because it is certain to liberate those who practice it.

original: mi tshugs pa ni phas kyi rgol ba thams cad kyis bar mi chod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi tshugs pa ni phas kyi rgol ba thams cad kyis bar mi chod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is invincible because it cannot be interrupted by any opponents.

original: snyan pas ni dga' bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snyan pas ni dga' bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is pleasing because it brings joy.

original: dul  ba ni 'dod chags kyi gnyen por 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dul  ba ni 'dod chags kyi gnyen por 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is gentle because it is the antidote to desire.

original: mi rtsub pa ni bslab pa bcas pa thabs sla ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi rtsub pa ni bslab pa bcas pa thabs sla ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not harsh because the precepts are easy to follow.

original: mi brlang ba ni de las 'das pa dag yang dag par 'byung ba ston par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi brlang ba ni de las 'das pa dag yang dag par 'byung ba ston par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not offensive because it teaches the way to overcome transgressions.

original: rab tu dul ba ni theg pa gsum gyis 'dul ba ston pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: rab tu dul ba ni theg pa gsum gyis 'dul ba ston pa'i phyir ro//
translated: It is well disciplined because it teaches the training in the three vehicles.

original: rnar snyan pa ni g-yeng ba'i gnyen por gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnar snyan pa ni g-yeng ba'i gnyen por gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is pleasant to the ear because it is the antidote to distraction.

original: lus sim par byed pa ni ting nge 'dzin thob par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus sim par byed pa ni ting nge 'dzin thob par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It refreshes the body, because it causes one to attain concentration.

original: sems tshim par byed pa ni lhag mthong gis mchog tu dga' ba thob par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems tshim par byed pa ni lhag mthong gis mchog tu dga' ba thob par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It refreshes the mind, because it causes one to attain the supreme joy of insight.

original: snying dga' bar byed pa ni the tshom @240a * //üîΩgcod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snying dga' bar byed pa ni the tshom @240a * // gcod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It gladdens the heart, because it eliminates doubt.

original: dga' ba dang bde ba bskyed pa ni log par nges pa sal  ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dga' ba dang bde ba bskyed pa ni log par nges pa sal  ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It generates joy and well-being, because it eliminates wrong decisions.

original: yongs su gdung ba med pa ni bsgrub pa la 'gyod pa med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩkun shes par bya ba ni thos pa las byung ba'i shes pa phun sum tshogs pa'i gzhir gyur pa'i phyir ro //üîΩrnam par rig par bya ba ni bsam pa las byung ba'i shes pa phun sum tshogs pa'i gzhir gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su gdung ba med pa ni bsgrub pa la 'gyod pa med pa'i phyir ro // kun shes par bya ba ni thos pa las byung ba'i shes pa phun sum tshogs pa'i gzhir gyur pa'i phyir ro // rnam par rig par bya ba ni bsam pa las byung ba'i shes pa phun sum tshogs pa'i gzhir gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is free from distress, because there is no regret about practice.üîΩIt is understandable, because it is the basis for the perfection of knowledge born of hearing.üîΩIt is intelligible, because it is the basis for the perfection of knowledge born of reflection.

original: rnam par gsal ba ni slob dpon gyis chos kyi dpe mkhyud med pa las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par gsal ba ni slob dpon gyis chos kyi dpe mkhyud med pa las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is clear, because it is the basis for the perfection of knowledge born of meditation.

original: dga' bar byed pa ni bdag gi don rjes su thob pa rnams dga' bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dga' bar byed pa ni bdag gi don rjes su thob pa rnams dga' bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is delightful because it delights those who have attained their own goal.

original: mngon par dga' bar byed pa ni bdag gi don ma thob pa rnams re bar byed pa'i phyir ro //üîΩkun shes par byed pa ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i chos yang dag par ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par dga' bar byed pa ni bdag gi don ma thob pa rnams re bar byed pa'i phyir ro // kun shes par byed pa ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i chos yang dag par ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is inspiring because it inspires those who have not attained their own goal.üîΩIt is informative because it teaches the inconceivable Dharma.

original: rnam par rig par byed pa ni bsam du yod pa'i chos yang dag par ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rig par byed pa ni bsam du yod pa'i chos yang dag par ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is communicative because it teaches the conceivable Dharma.

original: rigs pa ni tshad ma dang mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs pa ni tshad ma dang mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is reasonable because it does not contradict valid cognition.

original: 'brel pa ni ci rigs par 'dul ba la ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa ni ci rigs par 'dul ba la ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is relevant because it teaches in accordance with the disciple.

original: zlos pa'i skyon med pa ni don med pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩseng ge'i sgra'i shugs ni mu stegs can gyi tshogs thams cad skrag par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zlos pa'i skyon med pa ni don med pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro // seng ge'i sgra'i shugs ni mu stegs can gyi tshogs thams cad skrag par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is without the fault of repetition because it is not meaningless.üîΩIt has the force of a lion‚Äôs roar because it frightens the hosts of adversaries.

original: glang po che'i sgra skad ni sgra gsang mtho ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: glang po che'i sgra skad ni sgra gsang mtho ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It has the sound of an elephant‚Äôs roar because it is sonorous.

original: 'brug sgra'i sgra dbyangs ni zab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brug sgra'i sgra dbyangs ni zab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The sound of the dragon's roar is deep.

original: klu'i dbang po'i sgra ni gzung bar 'os pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: klu'i dbang po'i sgra ni gzung bar 'os pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The sound of the lord of the nagas is worthy of being grasped.

original: dri za'i glu'i dbyangs ni snyan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dri za'i glu'i dbyangs ni snyan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The sound of the gandharva's song is pleasant.

original: bya ka la ping ka'i sgra dbyangs bsgrags pa ni myur du 'gyur ba'i ngang tshul can gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: bya ka la ping ka'i sgra dbyangs bsgrags pa ni myur du 'gyur ba'i ngang tshul can gyi phyir ro //
translated: The sound of the kalavi·πÖka bird is of a nature that quickly changes.

original: tshangs pa'i sgra dbyangs bsgrags pa ni rgyang ring du grags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i sgra dbyangs bsgrags pa ni rgyang ring du grags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The sound of Brahma's voice is heard from afar.

original: shang shang te'u'i sgra dbyangs su grags pa ni grub pa thams cad thob par 'gyur ba'i ltas bzang po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shang shang te'u'i sgra dbyangs su grags pa ni grub pa thams cad thob par 'gyur ba'i ltas bzang po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The sound of the ≈õa·πÖkha is an auspicious sign of attaining all accomplishments.

original: lha'i dbang po'i sgra dbyangs ltar snyan pa ni 'gal bar bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lha'i dbang po'i sgra dbyangs ltar snyan pa ni 'gal bar bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The sound of the lord of the gods is pleasant, as it is not to be opposed.

original: rnga'i sgra ni bdud phyir rgol ba thams cad pham par bya ba la thog mar 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnga'i sgra ni bdud phyir rgol ba thams cad pham par bya ba la thog mar 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The sound of the drum is foremost in defeating all mƒÅra adversaries.

original: ma khengs pa ni bstod pas khengs par mi @240b 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma khengs pa ni bstod pas khengs par mi @240b 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Not arrogant means not becoming arrogant through praise.

original: mi dma' ba ni smad pas zhum par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi dma' ba ni smad pas zhum par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not low, because it is not discouraged by contempt.

original: sgra thams cad kyi rjes su zhugs pa ni rnam par bsgrub pa thams cad dang / sgra'i mtshan nyid rnam pa thams cad kyi rjes su zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra thams cad kyi rjes su zhugs pa ni rnam par bsgrub pa thams cad dang / sgra'i mtshan nyid rnam pa thams cad kyi rjes su zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is in accord with all sounds, because it is in accord with all the accomplishments of speech and all the characteristics of sounds.

original: tshig zur chag med pa ni brjed bzhin du mi smra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshig zur chag med pa ni brjed bzhin du mi smra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not corrupt, because it is not spoken with forgetfulness.

original: ma tshang ba med pa ni 'dul ba'i bya ba la dus thams cad du sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma tshang ba med pa ni 'dul ba'i bya ba la dus thams cad du sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not incomplete, because it is applied at all times to the activities of the Vinaya.

original: ma zhum pa ni rnyed pa dang bkur sti la mi brten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma zhum pa ni rnyed pa dang bkur sti la mi brten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not faint, because it is not dependent on gain and honor.

original: mi zhan pa ni 'jigs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi zhan pa ni 'jigs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not weak, because it is fearless.

original: rab tu dga' ba ni thos na rab tu dga' bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba ni thos na rab tu dga' bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is delightful, because it is delightful to hear.

original: khyab pa ni rig pa'i gnas thams cad la mkhas pa'i rjes su zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyab pa ni rig pa'i gnas thams cad la mkhas pa'i rjes su zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is pervasive, because it is in accord with the expertise in all the branches of learning.

original: byang chub pa ni sems can rnams kyi don mtha' dag sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub pa ni sems can rnams kyi don mtha' dag sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is enlightened, because it accomplishes all the aims of living beings.

original: rgyun chags pa ni rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyun chags pa ni rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is continuous, because it is uninterrupted.

original: 'bel ba ni rnam pa sna tshogs su 'bel ba'i phyir ro //üîΩsgra thams cad rdzogs par byed pa ni sgra gcig las sgra'i rnam par rig pa du ma 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bel ba ni rnam pa sna tshogs su 'bel ba'i phyir ro // sgra thams cad rdzogs par byed pa ni sgra gcig las sgra'i rnam par rig pa du ma 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is varied, because it is varied in its aspects.üîΩIt satisfies all desires, because many ideas of speech arise from one sound.

original: dbang po thams cad tshim par byed pa ni tshig gcig gis don du ma rig par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po thams cad tshim par byed pa ni tshig gcig gis don du ma rig par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It satisfies all faculties, because many meanings are understood from one word.

original: ma smad pa ni dam bcas pa bzhin du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma smad pa ni dam bcas pa bzhin du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is irreproachable, because it is in accordance with what has been promised.

original: mi 'gyur ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus na de bzhin du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi 'gyur ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus na de bzhin du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is unchanging, because it is not otherwise in the future.

original: ma brtags pa ni rtab rtab por mi smra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma brtags pa ni rtab rtab por mi smra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not frivolous, because it is not hasty.

original: 'khor kun tu grags pa de ni 'khor nye ring la mtshungs par grags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khor kun tu grags pa de ni 'khor nye ring la mtshungs par grags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is renowned in all circles, because it is renowned equally in all circles, near and far.

original: rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa ni 'jig rten pa dang / 'khor las 'das pa'i don dang dpe'i chos thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa ni 'jig rten pa dang / 'khor las 'das pa'i don dang dpe'i chos thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is endowed with the most sublime of all aspects because it is endowed with the most sublime of all mundane and supramundane qualities, both those that are related to the subject and those that are related to the object.

original: rab 'byor gal te de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi 'khor lo dngos po yod pa zhig yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba don dam par dngos
analyzed: rab 'byor gal te de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi 'khor lo dngos po yod pa zhig yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba don dam par dngos
translated: If the wheel of the Dharma that is turned by the tathagatas, arhats, and completely perfect buddhas were a thing, then it would be necessary to admit that the wheel of the Dharma would be turned by all those who are proponents of the view that things exist, such as ascetics, brahmins, gods,

original: po med par rtogs pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: po med par rtogs pa bstan pa ste /
translated: demigods, and Brahma.

original: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dngos po zhig yod na ni dge sbyong dang / bram ze dang / lha dang / @241a * //üîΩbdud dang / tshangs pa la sogs pa chos thams cad kyi dngos po yod par lta ba rnams kyis kyang chos kyi 'khor lo bskor nus pa'i rigs na /
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dngos po zhig yod na ni dge sbyong dang / bram ze dang / lha dang / @241a * //üîΩbdud dang / tshangs pa la sogs pa chos thams cad kyi dngos po yod par lta ba rnams kyis kyang chos kyi 'khor lo bskor nus pa'i rigs na /
translated: However, the wheel of the Dharma is not turned by any of them.

original: dngos po yod par lta ba rnams kyis bskor ma nus pa las na /
analyzed: dngos po yod par lta ba rnams kyis bskor ma nus pa las na /
translated: Since those who view things as existent are unable to turn the wheel of Dharma,

original: de bzhin gshegs pas don dam par chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dngos po med par thugs su chud nas kun rdzob tu sgyu ma lta bu'i tshul gyis sus kyang bskor ma nus pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor to zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas don dam par chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dngos po med par thugs su chud nas kun rdzob tu sgyu ma lta bu'i tshul gyis sus kyang bskor ma nus pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor to zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: the TathƒÅgata, having realized that ultimately the wheel of Dharma is not an existent, turned the wheel of Dharma conventionally, in the manner of an illusion, which no one else was able to turn.üîΩSubh≈´ti, if those sentient beings for whose sake the TathƒÅgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One turned the wheel of Dharma were existent things, etc.

original: rab 'byor gal te de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis gang gi don du chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i sems can de dag dngos po yod pa zhig yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sems can gang gi
analyzed: rab 'byor gal te de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis gang gi don du chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i sems can de dag dngos po yod pa zhig yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sems can gang gi
translated: This is saying that the sentient beings for whose sake the wheel of Dharma was turned are not existent things.

original: phyir chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar bya ba'i sems can de dag don dam par dngos po med par rtogs pas theg pa chen po des lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten zil gyis mnan te 'byung bar 'gyur ba bstan pa ste /
analyzed: phyir chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar bya ba'i sems can de dag don dam par dngos po med par rtogs pas theg pa chen po des lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten zil gyis mnan te 'byung bar 'gyur ba bstan pa ste /
translated: The beings for whom the wheel of Dharma is turned are ultimately realized to be nonthings. Therefore, the Mahayana will appear, outshining the world with its gods, humans and asuras.

original: sems can de dag dngos po yod pa zhig yin na ni sems can gyi dngos po las nams kyang mi 'gyur bas sems can de dag phung po ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'dra yang mi rung ba zhig na
analyzed: sems can de dag dngos po yod pa zhig yin na ni sems can gyi dngos po las nams kyang mi 'gyur bas sems can de dag phung po ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'dra yang mi rung ba zhig na
translated: If those beings were existent things, they would never change from the nature of sentient beings, and it would be impossible for those beings to pass into complete nirvana in the expanse of nirvana without any remainder of the aggregates.

original: sems can de dag don dam par dngos po med la kun rdzob tu 'khrul pa'i dbang gis sgyu ma tsam du snang ba'i phyir sems can de dag chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba des phung po'i lhag ma ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs
analyzed: sems can de dag don dam par dngos po med la kun rdzob tu 'khrul pa'i dbang gis sgyu ma tsam du snang ba'i phyir sems can de dag chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba des phung po'i lhag ma ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs
translated: However, those beings are ultimately nonthings, and they appear as mere illusions through the power of confusion on the relative level. Therefore, those beings can pass into complete nirvana in the expanse of nirvana without any remainder of the aggregates through the turning of the wheel of Dharma.

original: su mya ngan las 'das par gyur to zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: su mya ngan las 'das par gyur to zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: The word passed into nirvƒÅ·πáa is taught.

original: de ltar chos de dag dngos po med par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar chos de dag dngos po med par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of realizing those phenomena to be non-existent.

original: theg pa chen po des lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten zil gyis mnan cing 'byung bar gyur to zhes bya ba'i tshig ni gong ma rnams la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen po des lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten zil gyis mnan cing 'byung bar gyur to zhes bya ba'i tshig ni gong ma rnams la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: It is said, That Great Vehicle, having surpassed the world with its gods, humans, and asuras, will go forth, and this phrase should be applied to the previous [statements] as well.

original: rab 'byor gang yang khyod kyis 'di skad du theg pa de ni nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'o zhes smras pa ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor gang yang khyod kyis 'di skad du theg pa de ni nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'o zhes smras pa ni /
translated: Subh≈´ti, you said, That vehicle is equal to space, and...

original: de de @241b bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gong du rab 'byor gyis theg pa chen po nam mkha' dang mnyam mo zhes smras pa'i don bcom ldan 'das kyis spros nas bshad pa ste /
analyzed: de de @241b bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gong du rab 'byor gyis theg pa chen po nam mkha' dang mnyam mo zhes smras pa'i don bcom ldan 'das kyis spros nas bshad pa ste /
translated: The passage beginning with It is just so is the Blessed One's elaborate explanation of the meaning of Subh≈´ti's statement, The Great Vehicle is equal to space.

original: kun brtags pa'i dngos po rnams ni rnam pa nyi shu rtsa bzhir rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i dngos po rnams ni rnam pa nyi shu rtsa bzhir rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: The imputed things are established in twenty-four ways.

original: theg pa chen po 'di la de lta bu'i rnam par gzhag pa med pa'i phyir nam mkha' dang mnyam par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen po 'di la de lta bu'i rnam par gzhag pa med pa'i phyir nam mkha' dang mnyam par rig par bya'o //
translated: Because such a system does not exist in this Great Vehicle, it should be understood as being equal to space.

original: de la rnam pa nyi shu rtsa bzhi ni phyogs rnam par gzhag pa dang / dbyibs rnam par gzhag pa dang / kha dog rnam par gzhag pa dang / dus gsum rnam par gzhag pa dang / 'phel ba grib rnam par gzhag pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang /
analyzed: de la rnam pa nyi shu rtsa bzhi ni phyogs rnam par gzhag pa dang / dbyibs rnam par gzhag pa dang / kha dog rnam par gzhag pa dang / dus gsum rnam par gzhag pa dang / 'phel ba grib rnam par gzhag pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang /
translated: In this regard, the twenty-four are: the system of direction, the system of shape, the system of color, the system of the three times, the system of increase and decrease, the system of defilement and purification,

original: rnam par byang ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / skye ba dang 'gag pa la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / mthong ba dang thos pa la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa dang /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / skye ba dang 'gag pa la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / mthong ba dang thos pa la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa dang /
translated: the system of origination and cessation, etc., the system of virtue, nonvirtue, etc., the system of seeing, hearing, etc.,

translated: the presentation of what is to be known and what is not to be known, the presentation of karmic maturation and so on, the presentation of what is included in the three realms, the presentation of being endowed with attachment and so on,

original: sems dang po bskyed pa la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / dkar po rnam par mthong ba'i sa la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / rgyun tu zhugs pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa dang /
analyzed: sems dang po bskyed pa la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / dkar po rnam par mthong ba'i sa la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / rgyun tu zhugs pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa dang /
translated: the presentation of the first generation of the mind of enlightenment and so on, the presentation of the stage of seeing white and so on, the presentation of the result of stream enterer and so on, the presentation of the ≈õrƒÅvaka and pratyekabuddha levels and so on,

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / stong pa dang mi stong pa la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / zhi ba dang ma zhi ba la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa dang /
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / stong pa dang mi stong pa la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / zhi ba dang ma zhi ba la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa dang /
translated: the establishment of peace, non-peace, etc.üîΩthe establishment of light and darkness

original: snang ba dang mun par rnam par gzhag pa dang / dmigs su yod pa dang dmigs su med pa rnam par gzhag pa @242a * //
analyzed: snang ba dang mun par rnam par gzhag pa dang / dmigs su yod pa dang dmigs su med pa rnam par gzhag pa @242a * //
translated: the establishment of the apprehensible and the inapprehensible

analyzed: pa dang / brjod du yod pa dang / brjod du med pa rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: the establishment of the expressible and the inexpressible.

original: de la rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: de la rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: In this regard, Subh≈´ti, it is like this:

original: nam mkha' la ni shar phyogs dmigs su med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nam mkha' la phyogs rnam par gzhag pa med pa'i dpes theg pa chen po de nam mkha' dang mnyam pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' la ni shar phyogs dmigs su med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nam mkha' la phyogs rnam par gzhag pa med pa'i dpes theg pa chen po de nam mkha' dang mnyam pa bstan pa'o //
translated: The eastern direction is not apprehended in space, etc. This shows that the Great Vehicle is equal to space by the example of the non-establishment of directions in space.

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /

analyzed: nam mkha' ni ring po ma yin thung ngu ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dbyibs rnam par gzhag pa med pa bstan pa'o //
translated: Space is not long, not short, etc. This shows that there is no establishment of shape.

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /üîΩnam mkha' ni sngon po ma yin ser po ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni kha dog rnam par gzhag pa med pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na / nam mkha' ni sngon po ma yin ser po ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni kha dog rnam par gzhag pa med pa bstan pa'o //

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /üîΩnam mkha' la ni 'das pa ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dus gsum rnam par gzhag pa med pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na / nam mkha' la ni 'das pa ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dus gsum rnam par gzhag pa med pa bstan pa'o //

original: 'bri ba ni rgyun 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: 'bri ba ni rgyun 'chad pa'o //
translated: Subhuti: It is thus that a Bodhisattva, who courses in perfect wisdom, should train in the cognition of the nonexistence of own-being.

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: Subhuti: It is thus that a Bodhisattva, who courses in perfect wisdom, should train in the cognition of the nonexistence of own

original: nam mkha' la kun nas nyon mongs pa med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba rnam par gzhag pa med pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' la kun nas nyon mongs pa med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba rnam par gzhag pa med pa bstan pa'o //
translated: This shows the non-establishment of defilement and purification.

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: Subhuti, it is like this:üîΩIn the sky there is no arising, etc.

original: nam mkha' la skye ba med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni skye ba dang 'gag pa la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa med pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: nam mkha' la skye ba med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni skye ba dang 'gag pa la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa med pa bstan pa ste /
translated: This shows the non-establishment of arising, cessation, etc.

original: 'gag pa ni skad cig re re la 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: 'gag pa ni skad cig re re la 'jig pa'o //
translated: Cessation is destruction moment by moment.

original: mtha' thug pa med pa ni rgyun chad de mi snang ba la bya'o //
analyzed: mtha' thug pa med pa ni rgyun chad de mi snang ba la bya'o //
translated: The non-extinction of the end is to be taken as the interruption and non-appearance of the continuum.

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste /
translated: Subhuti, it is like this:üîΩIn the sky there is no virtue, etc.

original: dper na / nam mkha' ni dge ba ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa med pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dper na / nam mkha' ni dge ba ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa med pa bstan pa'o //
translated: This shows the non-establishment of virtue, non-virtue, etc.

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: Subhuti, it is like this:

original: nam mkha' ni mthong ba ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: nam mkha' ni mthong ba ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: In the sky there is no seeing, etc.

original: mthong ba dang thos pa la @242b sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa med pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba dang thos pa la @242b sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa med pa bstan pa'o //
translated: The teaching on the non-establishment of seeing, hearing, etc.

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste /
translated: Subh≈´ti, it is like this:

original: dper na / nam mkha' ni shes par bya ba ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni shes par bya ba dang / shes par mi bya ba la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa med pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: dper na / nam mkha' ni shes par bya ba ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni shes par bya ba dang / shes par mi bya ba la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa med pa bstan pa ste /
translated: The teaching on the non-establishment of the knowable, the unknowable, etc. is from Space is not to be known and so on.

original: de la shes par bya ba yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa'i yul ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la shes par bya ba yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa'i yul ma yin pa'o //
translated: There, not to be known means not being an object of the five sense consciousnesses.

original: rnam par shes par mi bya ba yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i yul ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes par mi bya ba yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i yul ma yin pa'o //
translated: Not to be made conscious means not being an object of mental consciousness.

original: yongs su shes par bya ba yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ltar yongs su shes par bya ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su shes par bya ba yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ltar yongs su shes par bya ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: Not to be fully known means not to be fully known like the truth of suffering.

original: mngon du bya ba yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa'i bden pa ltar mngon sum du bya ba yang ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: mngon du bya ba yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa'i bden pa ltar mngon sum du bya ba yang ma yin pa'o //
translated: Not to be actualized means not to be actualized like the truth of cessation.

original: spang ba ma yin zhes bya ba ni kun 'byung ba'i bden pa ltar spang bar bya ba yang ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: spang ba ma yin zhes bya ba ni kun 'byung ba'i bden pa ltar spang bar bya ba yang ma yin pa'o //
translated: Not to be abandoned means that it is not to be abandoned like the truth of origination.

original: bsgom pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni lam gyi bden pa ltar bsgom par bya ba yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bsgom pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni lam gyi bden pa ltar bsgom par bya ba yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Nor is it to be realized means that it is not to be realized like the truth of the path.

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: Subhuti, it is like this:

original: nam mkha' ni rnam par smin pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rnam par smin pa la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa med pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: nam mkha' ni rnam par smin pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rnam par smin pa la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa med pa bstan pa ste /
translated: The statement that space is not subject to ripening, etc. teaches the non-establishment of ripening, etc.

original: rnam par smin pa ni 'bras bur gyur pa la bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa ni 'bras bur gyur pa la bya'o //
translated: Ripening should be understood as the result.

original: rnam par smin pa'i chos can ni gdod 'bras bur 'gyur ba la bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i chos can ni gdod 'bras bur 'gyur ba la bya'o //
translated: The subject of ripening is that which becomes the result.

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: Subhuti, it is like this:

original: nam mkha' ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi khongs su chud pa ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni khams gsum gyi khongs su chud pa rnam par gzhag pa med pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi khongs su chud pa ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni khams gsum gyi khongs su chud pa rnam par gzhag pa med pa bstan pa'o //
translated: The statement that space is not included in the desire realm, etc. teaches the non-establishment of inclusion in the three realms.

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: Subh≈´ti, it is like this:

original: nam mkha' ni 'dod chags dang ldan pa ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'dod chags dang ldan pa la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa med pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' ni 'dod chags dang ldan pa ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'dod chags dang ldan pa la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa med pa bstan pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSpace is not associated with passion‚Äù and so on teaches the non-establishment of association with passion and so on.

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: Subh≈´ti, it is like this:

original: nam mkha' la ni sems dang po bskyed pa med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sems dang po bskyed pa la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa med pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' la ni sems dang po bskyed pa med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sems dang po bskyed pa la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa med pa bstan pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn space, there is no first production of the thought‚Äù and so on teaches the non-establishment of the first production of the thought and so on.

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /üîΩnam mkha' la ni dkar po rnam par mthong ba'i @243a * //
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na / nam mkha' la ni dkar po rnam par mthong ba'i @243a * //
translated: Subh≈´ti, it is like this:

original: sa med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dkar po rnam par mthong ba'i sa la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa med pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sa med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dkar po rnam par mthong ba'i sa la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa med pa bstan pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn space, there is no ground of seeing what is white‚Äù and so on teaches the non-establishment of the ground of seeing what is white and so on.

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: Subh≈´ti, it is like this:

original: nam mkha' la ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa med pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' la ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa med pa bstan pa'o //

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: Subhuti, it is like this:üîΩIn space there is no level of the ≈õrƒÅvakas, etc.

original: nam mkha' la ni nyan thos kyi sa med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa med pa bstan pa'o //

translated: This shows that the levels of the ≈õrƒÅvakas, pratyekabuddhas, etc., are not established.

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: Subhuti, it is like this:üîΩSpace is not endowed with form, etc.

original: nam mkha' ni gzugs dang ldan pa ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gzugs dang gzugs med pa la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa med pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' ni gzugs dang ldan pa ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gzugs dang gzugs med pa la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa med pa bstan pa'o //
translated: This shows that form, formlessness, etc., are not established.

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: Subhuti, it is like this:üîΩSpace is not permanent, not impermanent, etc.

original: nam mkha' ni rtag pa ma yin mi rtag pa ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa med pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' ni rtag pa ma yin mi rtag pa ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa med pa bstan pa'o //
translated: This shows that permanence, impermanence, etc., are not established.

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: Subh≈´ti, it is like this:

original: nam mkha' ni stong pa ma yin mi stong pa ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni stong pa dang mi stong pa la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa med pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' ni stong pa ma yin mi stong pa ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni stong pa dang mi stong pa la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa med pa bstan pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSpace is not empty and not non-empty‚Äù and so forth teaches the non-establishment of emptiness and non-emptiness, and so on.

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: Subh≈´ti, it is like this:

original: nam mkha' ni zhi ba ma yin ma zhi ba ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni zhi ba dang ma zhi ba la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa med pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' ni zhi ba ma yin ma zhi ba ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni zhi ba dang ma zhi ba la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa med pa bstan pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSpace is not peace and not not peace‚Äù and so forth teaches the non-establishment of peace and not peace, and so on.

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: Subh≈´ti, it is like this:üîΩ‚ÄúSpace is not light and not dark‚Äù and so forth teaches the non-establishment of light and dark.üîΩSubh≈´ti, it is like this:

original: nam mkha' ni snang ba ma yin mun pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snang ba dang mun pa rnam par gzhag pa med pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' ni snang ba ma yin mun pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snang ba dang mun pa rnam par gzhag pa med pa bstan pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSpace is not existent and not non-existent‚Äù and so forth teaches the non-establishment of existence and non-existence.

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: Subh≈´ti, it is like this:

original: nam mkha' ni dmigs su yod pa ma yin /
analyzed: nam mkha' ni dmigs su yod pa ma yin /
translated: ‚ÄúSpace is not apprehended and not not apprehended‚Äù and so forth teaches the non-establishment of apprehension and non-apprehension.

original: dmigs su med pa ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dmigs su yod pa dang / dmigs su med pa rnam par gzhag pa med pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs su med pa ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dmigs su yod pa dang / dmigs su med pa rnam par gzhag pa med pa bstan pa'o //
translated: The passage beginning not non-apprehensible teaches the non-establishment of the apprehensible and the non-apprehensible.

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: Subh≈´ti, it is like this:

original: nam mkha' ni brjod du yod pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: nam mkha' ni brjod du yod pa yang ma yin /
translated: Space is not expressible,

original: brjod du med pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni brjod du yod pa dang / brjod du med pa rnam par gzhag pa @243b med pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: brjod du med pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni brjod du yod pa dang / brjod du med pa rnam par gzhag pa @243b med pa bstan pa'o //
translated: nor is it inexpressible. The passage beginning with Subh≈´ti, it is like this teaches the non-establishment of the expressible and the inexpressible.

original: rab 'byor rnam grangs des kyang theg pa de ni nam mkha' dang mnyam pa ste /üîΩ'di ltar theg pa chen po'o zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa'i dngos po rnams la rnam par gzhag pa nyi shu rtsa bzhi yod pa de lta bur nam mkha' la rnam par gzhag pa med pa'i dpes theg pa chen po de nam mkha' dang mnyam par bshad
analyzed: rab 'byor rnam grangs des kyang theg pa de ni nam mkha' dang mnyam pa ste / 'di ltar theg pa chen po'o zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa'i dngos po rnams la rnam par gzhag pa nyi shu rtsa bzhi yod pa de lta bur nam mkha' la rnam par gzhag pa med pa'i dpes theg pa chen po de nam mkha' dang mnyam par bshad
translated: Subh≈´ti, by this one of many explanations, that vehicle is equal to space,

original: pa'i don mjug bsdus te bstan pa'o //
analyzed: pa'i don mjug bsdus te bstan pa'o //
translated: and thus it is the Great Vehicle. This passage concludes the teaching by summarizing the meaning of the explanation that the Great Vehicle is equal to space by the example of the non-establishment of space in the twenty-four ways in which imagined things are established.

original: rab 'byor gang yang khyod kyis 'di skad du /
analyzed: rab 'byor gang yang khyod kyis 'di skad du /
translated: The Lord: So it is, Subhuti, so it is.üîΩJust as space gives room for all beings, so also this vehicle gives room for infinite, innumerable beings.üîΩSubhuti: Just as space is not something that can be shown, 'Here it is,' so also this vehicle cannot be shown, 'Here it is.'üîΩThe Lord: So it is, Subhuti, so it is.üîΩJust as space cannot be shown, 'Here it is,' so also this vehicle cannot be shown, 'Here it is.'

original: ji ltar nam mkha' sems can tshang med grangs med pa'i go 'byed pa de bzhin du theg pa de yang sems can tshad med grangs med pa'i go 'byed do zhes smras pa ni /
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' sems can tshang med grangs med pa'i go 'byed pa de bzhin du theg pa de yang sems can tshad med grangs med pa'i go 'byed do zhes smras pa ni /
translated: Subhuti: Just as space is not included in either the internal or the external, so also this vehicle is not included in either the internal or the external.

original: de de bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gong du rab 'byor gyis nam mkha' las dpe blangs te /
analyzed: de de bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gong du rab 'byor gyis nam mkha' las dpe blangs te /
translated: The Lord: So it is, Subhuti, so it is.üîΩJust as space is not included in either the internal or the external, so also this vehicle is not included in either the internal or the external.üîΩSubhuti: Just as space is neither fettered nor liberated, for space is without thought, so also this vehicle is neither fettered nor liberated, for it is without thought.üîΩThe Lord: So it is, Subhuti, so it is.

original: go skabs 'byed pa che ba'i phyir theg pa chen po'o zhes bgyi'o zhes bshad pa'i don bcom ldan 'das kyis mdor smos pa /
analyzed: go skabs 'byed pa che ba'i phyir theg pa chen po'o zhes bgyi'o zhes bshad pa'i don bcom ldan 'das kyis mdor smos pa /
translated: Just as space is neither fettered nor liberated, for space is without thought, so also this vehicle is neither fettered nor liberated, for it is without thought.üîΩSubhuti: Just as space is neither defiled nor purified, so also this vehicle is neither defiled nor purified.üîΩThe Lord: So it is, Subhuti, so it is.üîΩJust as space is neither defiled nor purified, so also this vehicle is neither defiled nor purified.

original: de bden no zhes bstod nas theg pa chen po de sems can tshad med grangs med pa'i go 'byed pa'i don 'gres nyi shu rtsa gnyis kyis zhib tu bshad pa ste /
analyzed: de bden no zhes bstod nas theg pa chen po de sems can tshad med grangs med pa'i go 'byed pa'i don 'gres nyi shu rtsa gnyis kyis zhib tu bshad pa ste /
translated: Subhuti: Just as space is neither contracted nor expanded, so also this vehicle is neither contracted nor expanded.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: The Lord: So it is, Subhuti, so it is.üîΩJust as space is neither contracted nor expanded, so also this vehicle is neither contracted nor expanded.üîΩSubhuti: Just as space is not past, future, or present, so also this vehicle is not

original: rab 'byor sems can med pa'i phyir nam mkha' med par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go 'byed pa che ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rab 'byor sems can med pa'i phyir nam mkha' med par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go 'byed pa che ba'i phyir /
translated: Subhuti, space is to be known as non-existent because of the non-existence of beings.

original: theg pa chen po'o zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste //
analyzed: theg pa chen po'o zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste //
translated: This teaches the reason why it is called the Great Vehicle, because it is the great liberator.

original: 'jig rten pas phyin ci log tu brtags pa ltar sems can dang / nam mkha' dang / theg pa chen po rnams dngos po yod na ni gcig gi go gcig gis chod pas de ltar gro skabs chen po 'byed par yang mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'jig rten pas phyin ci log tu brtags pa ltar sems can dang / nam mkha' dang / theg pa chen po rnams dngos po yod na ni gcig gi go gcig gis chod pas de ltar gro skabs chen po 'byed par yang mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: If beings, space, and the Great Vehicle were existent things, then one would obstruct the other, and thus there would be no great liberation.

original: de dag thams cad dngos po med cing mi dmigs pas gcig la gcig thogs pa med de /
analyzed: de dag thams cad dngos po med cing mi dmigs pas gcig la gcig thogs pa med de /
translated: But since all of them are non-existent and inapprehensible, they do not obstruct one another.

original: go skabs chen po 'byed pa'i phyir theg pa chen po yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: go skabs chen po 'byed pa'i phyir theg pa chen po yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Because it is the great liberator, it is the Great Vehicle.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: rab 'byor de ni 'di ltar sems can gang yin pa dang / nam mkha' gang yin pa dang / theg pa chen po gang yin pa de dag thams cad kyang dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sems can dang / nam mkha' dang / theg @244a * //
translated: This is the explanation of the reason why sentient beings, space,

analyzed: pa chen po rnams med pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: and the Great Vehicle do not exist.

analyzed: de gsum char yang don dam par dmigs su med pa'i phyir dngos po yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Because those three are ultimately non-apprehensible, they are explained as not being existent things.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩrab 'byor sems can tshad med pa'i phyir nam mkha' tshad med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / rab 'byor sems can tshad med pa'i phyir nam mkha' tshad med par rig par bya'o //
translated: Why is that?üîΩSubh≈´ti, space should be known as immeasurable because sentient beings are immeasurable.

original: nam mkha' tshad med pa'i phyir theg pa chen po tshad med par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: nam mkha' tshad med pa'i phyir theg pa chen po tshad med par rig par bya ste /
translated: The Great Vehicle should be known as immeasurable because space is immeasurable.

original: rab 'byor rnam grangs 'dis kyang theg pa chen po de sems can tshad med grangs med pa'i go 'byed do zhes bya ba ni sems can dang nam mkha' dang / theg pa chen po de dag dmigs su med pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor rnam grangs 'dis kyang theg pa chen po de sems can tshad med grangs med pa'i go 'byed do zhes bya ba ni sems can dang nam mkha' dang / theg pa chen po de dag dmigs su med pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: This shows the reason why sentient beings, space, and the Great Vehicle cannot be apprehended.

analyzed: dngos po zhig yod na ni tshad 'di tsam mo zhes tshad gzung du yang rung na /
translated: If they were things, it would be possible to apprehend their measure, saying,

analyzed: de dag dngos po med pa'i phyir tshad med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: They are immeasurable because they are not things.

translated: Why is it so?üîΩSubhuti, it is because sentient beings, space, and the Great Vehicle, all of them, cannot be apprehended.

analyzed: theg pa chen po tshad med pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: This shows the reason why sentient beings, space, and the Great Vehicle are immeasurable.

analyzed: de dag 'di ltar dmigs su med pa'i phyir tshad bzung du med do zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: rab 'byor sems can dpag tu med pa'i phyir nam mkha' dpag tu med par rig par bya'o //

analyzed: nam mkha' dpag tu med pa'i phyir theg pa chen po dpag tu med par rig par bya ste /
translated: The Great Vehicle should be known as immeasurable because space is immeasurable.üîΩSubh≈´ti, by this approach as well, that Great Vehicle provides space for immeasurable, incalculable sentient beings.

translated: The reason that sentient beings, space, and the Great Vehicle are not apprehended is taught by the immeasurable.

analyzed: dngos po zhig dmigs su yod na ni 'di tsam mo zhes dpag tu yang rung na /

analyzed: dngos por dmigs su med pa'i phyir dpag tu med do zhes bstan pa'o //

analyzed: mi 'grangs pa dang / mi dpogs pa dang / chos thams cad med pa'i gtan tshigs kyis bsnan te /

analyzed: mi 'grangs pa ni grangs gcig gnyis la sogs par bgrang du med pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: mi dpogs pa ni rjes su dpag pa'i tshad mas thog tu mi phebs pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang sems can med pa'i phyir de bzhin nyid med par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Moreover, Subh≈´ti, you should know that suchness does not exist because sentient beings do not exist, up to

analyzed: chos thams cad gang yin pa de dag thams cad kyang dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni chos kyi dbyings kyi skabs su de bzhin nyid smos pa'i 'gres te gsum pa'o //
translated: because all those dharmas are also non-apprehensible. This is the third permutation, mentioning suchness in the context of the dharma-dhƒÅtu.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang bdag med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang bdag med pa'i phyir /
translated: Furthermore, Subh≈´ti, you should know that because there is no self,

original: sems can med par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba nas /üîΩchos thams cad gang yin pa de dag thams cad kyang dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni de bzhin nyid kyi skabs su mu stegs can gyis btags pa'i bdag nyid rnams dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' smos nas /
analyzed: sems can med par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba nas / chos thams cad gang yin pa de dag thams cad kyang dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni de bzhin nyid kyi skabs su mu stegs can gyis btags pa'i bdag nyid rnams dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' smos nas /
translated: there are no sentient beings.üîΩUp to: because all those phenomena are also unobservable.üîΩThis is the fourth permutation, which teaches that the selves imputed by tƒ´rthikas in the context of suchness and the limits of reality

original: de dag dngos po med par bstan pa'i 'gres bzhi pa'o //üîΩrab 'byor gzhan yang bdag med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag dngos po med par bstan pa'i 'gres bzhi pa'o // rab 'byor gzhan yang bdag med pa'i phyir /
translated: do not exist.üîΩFurthermore, Subh≈´ti, you should know that because there is no self,

original: sems can med par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni yang @245a * //
analyzed: sems can med par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni yang @245a * //
translated: there are no sentient beings.

original: dag pa'i mtha'i skabs su bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings dang / phung po lngas pa snan  te de dag dmigs su med pa bstan pa'i 'gres te lnga pa'o //
analyzed: dag pa'i mtha'i skabs su bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings dang / phung po lngas pa snan  te de dag dmigs su med pa bstan pa'i 'gres te lnga pa'o //
translated: This is the fifth permutation, which teaches that the inconceivable expanse and the five aggregates in the context of the limits of realityüîΩare unobservable.

original: de bzhin du nang gi skye mched drug dang sbyar ba'i 'gres ni drug pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du nang gi skye mched drug dang sbyar ba'i 'gres ni drug pa'o //
translated: The permutation that applies to the six inner sense bases is the sixth.

original: phyi'i skye mched drug dang sbyar ba'i 'gres ni bdun pa'o //
analyzed: phyi'i skye mched drug dang sbyar ba'i 'gres ni bdun pa'o //
translated: The seventh is the one that is applied to the six external sense bases.

original: rnam par shes pa drug dang sbyar ba'i 'gres ni brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa drug dang sbyar ba'i 'gres ni brgyad pa'o //
translated: The eighth is the one that is applied to the six consciousnesses.

original: 'dus te reg pa drug dang sbyar ba'i 'gres ni dgu pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus te reg pa drug dang sbyar ba'i 'gres ni dgu pa'o //
translated: The ninth is the one that is applied to the six contacts.

original: reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba drug dang sbyar ba'i 'gres ni bcu pa'o //
analyzed: reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba drug dang sbyar ba'i 'gres ni bcu pa'o //
translated: The tenth is the one that is applied to the six feelings that arise from contact.

original: sa'i khams la sogs pa khams drug dang sbyar pa'i 'gres ni bcu gcig pa'o //
analyzed: sa'i khams la sogs pa khams drug dang sbyar pa'i 'gres ni bcu gcig pa'o //
translated: The eleventh is the one that is applied to the six elements, beginning with the earth element.

original: ma rig pa la sogs pa rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i yan lag rnams dang sbyar ba'i 'gres ni bcu gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa la sogs pa rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i yan lag rnams dang sbyar ba'i 'gres ni bcu gnyis pa'o //
translated: The twelfth is the one that is applied to the members of dependent origination, beginning with ignorance.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang sbyar ba'i 'gres ni bcu gsum pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang sbyar ba'i 'gres ni bcu gsum pa'o //
translated: The thirteenth is the one that is applied to the six perfections.

original: stong pa nyid bco brgyad dang sbyar ba'i 'gres ni bcu bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid bco brgyad dang sbyar ba'i 'gres ni bcu bzhi pa'o //
translated: The fourteenth is the one that is applied to the eighteen kinds of emptiness.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs sum cu rtsa bdun dang sbyar ba'i 'gres ni bco lnga pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs sum cu rtsa bdun dang sbyar ba'i 'gres ni bco lnga pa'o //
translated: The fifteenth is the one that is applied to the thirty-seven factors of awakening.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi nas gzungs kyi sgo rnams kyi bar gyi chos rnams dang sbyar ba'i 'gres ni bcu drug pa ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi nas gzungs kyi sgo rnams kyi bar gyi chos rnams dang sbyar ba'i 'gres ni bcu drug pa ste /
translated: The sixteenth permutation is that of the dharmas from the four noble truths up to the dhƒÅra·πáƒ´ gateways.

original: chos de rnams ris gcig tu smos pa ni nyan thos dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams thun mong gi chos yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos de rnams ris gcig tu smos pa ni nyan thos dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams thun mong gi chos yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: These dharmas are mentioned in one group because they are the common dharmas of the hearers and bodhisattvas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad rnams dang sbyar ba'i 'gres ni bcu bdun pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad rnams dang sbyar ba'i 'gres ni bcu bdun pa'o //
translated: The seventeenth permutation is that of the ten powers of the tathƒÅgatas, the four forms of fearlessness, the four forms of correct knowledge, great compassion, and the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas.

original: rigs kyi sa dang brgyad pa'i sa dang / mthong ba'i sa dang / bsrabs pa'i sa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sa dang / byas pa rtogs pa'i sa rnams dang sbyar ba'i 'gres ni bco brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi sa dang brgyad pa'i sa dang / mthong ba'i sa dang / bsrabs pa'i sa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sa dang / byas pa rtogs pa'i sa rnams dang sbyar ba'i 'gres ni bco brgyad pa'o //
translated: The eighteenth permutation is that of the stages of the spiritual family, the eighth stage, the stage of seeing, the stage of thinning, the stage of freedom from desire, and the stage of realizing what has been done.

original: rgyun tu zhugs pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu bzhi dang sbyar ba'i 'gres ni bcu dgu pa'o //
analyzed: rgyun tu zhugs pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu bzhi dang sbyar ba'i 'gres ni bcu dgu pa'o //
translated: The nineteenth permutation is the one that applies to the four fruits of stream-enterer and so on.

original: rang sangs rgyas dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dang sbyar pa'i 'gres ni nyi shu pa'o //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dang sbyar pa'i 'gres ni nyi shu pa'o //
translated: The twentieth permutation is the one that applies to the pratyekabuddha and the perfect buddha.

original: theg pa gsum @245b dang ; rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang sbyar pa'i 'gres ni nyi shu gcig ba'o //
analyzed: theg pa gsum @245b dang ; rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang sbyar pa'i 'gres ni nyi shu gcig ba'o //
translated: The twenty-first permutation is the one that applies to the three vehicles and to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings kyi dpe bstan pa'i 'gres ni nyi shu gnyis pa ste //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings kyi dpe bstan pa'i 'gres ni nyi shu gnyis pa ste //
translated: The twenty-second permutation is the one that applies to the example of the realm of nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: de ltar chos de dag thams cad don dam par dngos po yod par ma grub ste /
analyzed: de ltar chos de dag thams cad don dam par dngos po yod par ma grub ste /
translated: Thus, all of these phenomena are not ultimately established as existent things,

original: dmigs su med pas nam mkha' dang 'dra ba'i phyir theg pa chen po de sems can tshad med grangs med dpag tu med pa'i go skabs 'byed pa che ba'i phyir theg pa chen po'o zhes bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs su med pas nam mkha' dang 'dra ba'i phyir theg pa chen po de sems can tshad med grangs med dpag tu med pa'i go skabs 'byed pa che ba'i phyir theg pa chen po'o zhes bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: because they are like space, since they are not apprehended. Therefore, because that Great Vehicle provides an opportunity for immeasurable, innumerable, and limitless sentient beings, it is called the Great Vehicle.‚Äù

original: rab 'byor gang yang khyod kyis 'di skad du theg pa chen po de la 'ong ba'am 'gro ba zhes bya ba'ang med /
analyzed: rab 'byor gang yang khyod kyis 'di skad du theg pa chen po de la 'ong ba'am 'gro ba zhes bya ba'ang med /
translated: Subh≈´ti, you said, ‚ÄúIn that Great Vehicle, there is no coming or going,üîΩand there is no staying.‚Äù Subh≈´ti, it is just as you have said.

original: gnas pa zhes bya ba'ang med do zhes smras pa ni rab 'byor de de bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang du rab 'byor gyis theg pa de la 'ong ba dang / 'gro ba med pa'i phyir theg pa chen po zhes bya'o zhes bshad pa'i don bcom ldan 'das kyis mdor smos nas /
analyzed: gnas pa zhes bya ba'ang med do zhes smras pa ni rab 'byor de de bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang du rab 'byor gyis theg pa de la 'ong ba dang / 'gro ba med pa'i phyir theg pa chen po zhes bya'o zhes bshad pa'i don bcom ldan 'das kyis mdor smos nas /
translated: The Blessed One briefly mentioned the meaning of what Subh≈´ti had explained, namely, ‚ÄúThat vehicle is called the Great Vehicle because that vehicle has no coming or going.‚Äù

original: de bden no zhes bstod de /
analyzed: de bden no zhes bstod de /
translated: He praised him, saying, ‚ÄúThat is true.‚Äù

original: theg pa chen po de la 'ong ba'ang med de /
analyzed: theg pa chen po de la 'ong ba'ang med de /
translated: In that Great Vehicle, there is no coming,üîΩand there is no going and no staying.

original: 'gro ba med cing gnas pa med pa'i don zhib tu bshad pa ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba med cing gnas pa med pa'i don zhib tu bshad pa ste /
translated: The meaning of that is explained in detail.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor chos thams cad ni g-yo ba med pa ste /üîΩde dag gang nas kyang 'ong ba med do //
analyzed: rab 'byor chos thams cad ni g-yo ba med pa ste / de dag gang nas kyang 'ong ba med do //
translated: Subh≈´ti, all phenomena are motionless.üîΩThey do not come from anywhere.

original: gang du yang 'gro ba med do //
analyzed: gang du yang 'gro ba med do //
translated: They do not go anywhere.

original: gang yang gnas par 'gyur ba med do zhes bya ba nas theg pa chen po de la 'ong ba dang 'gro ba med pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: gang yang gnas par 'gyur ba med do zhes bya ba nas theg pa chen po de la 'ong ba dang 'gro ba med pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: The reason why there is no coming or going in the Mahayana is taught from there is no coming or going of any dharma up to there is no abiding anywhere.

original: don dam par chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i phyir de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin la g-yo ba med de gzhan du mi 'gyur pas 'ong pa dang 'gro ba dang / gnas pa med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: don dam par chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i phyir de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin la g-yo ba med de gzhan du mi 'gyur pas 'ong pa dang 'gro ba dang / gnas pa med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Ultimately, all phenomena are non-existent, so there is no movement in the nature of suchness, no transformation, and therefore no coming, going, or abiding. This is the teaching.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor de ni 'di ltar gzugs ni gang nas kyang 'ong ba med do //
analyzed: rab 'byor de ni 'di ltar gzugs ni gang nas kyang 'ong ba med do //
translated: Subhuti, it is because form does not come from anywhere,

original: gong du yang 'gro pa med do //
analyzed: gong du yang 'gro pa med do //
translated: it does not go anywhere,üîΩand it does not abide anywhere.

original: gang yang gnas par 'gyur ba med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gong du chos thams cad g-yo ba med pa ste /
analyzed: gang yang gnas par 'gyur ba med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gong du chos thams cad g-yo ba med pa ste /
translated: This explains that all phenomena are without movement, without coming or going.

original: 'ong ba dang 'gro ba med par bshad pa ni chos thams cad gang yin pa ming gis smos te bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'ong ba dang 'gro ba med par bshad pa ni chos thams cad gang yin pa ming gis smos te bstan pa'o //
translated: The explanation of all phenomena being just names is taught from what are all phenomena? up to they are spoken of and taught by names.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor gzugs kyi rang bzhi ni gang nas kyang 'ong ba med ces bya ba la @246a * //üîΩsogs pa na don dam par gzugs dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin stong pa nyid ni gang nas kyang 'ong ba med gang du yang 'gro ba med /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzugs kyi rang bzhi ni gang nas kyang 'ong ba med ces bya ba la @246a * // sogs pa na don dam par gzugs dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin stong pa nyid ni gang nas kyang 'ong ba med gang du yang 'gro ba med /
translated: The nature of form, etc. is not something that comes from anywhere, etc.

original: gang yang gnas par 'gyur ba med do zhes bstan pa ste /
analyzed: gang yang gnas par 'gyur ba med do zhes bstan pa ste /
translated: This teaches that ultimately the emptiness of the nature of non-entityness of form, etc. does not come from anywhere, does not go to anywhere, and does not even abide anywhere.

original: gzugs kyi rang bzhin dang / de bzhin nyid dang / ngo bo nyid dang / mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni stong pa nyid kyi rnam grangs su zad do //
analyzed: gzugs kyi rang bzhin dang / de bzhin nyid dang / ngo bo nyid dang / mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni stong pa nyid kyi rnam grangs su zad do //
translated: The nature of form, suchness, the reality-limit, and the dharma-element are synonyms for emptiness.

original: gzugs la ji lta ba de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa 'jig rten pa'i chos rnams dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa 'dus ma byas pa la thug gi bar du 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs la ji lta ba de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa 'jig rten pa'i chos rnams dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa 'dus ma byas pa la thug gi bar du 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Just as with form, so it is with feeling, etc., and with the mundane dharmas, and with the supramundane dharmas up to the uncompounded, such as the six perfections.

original: rab 'byor gang yang khyod kyis 'di skad du theg pa de la sngon gyi mtha' 'ang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: rab 'byor gang yang khyod kyis 'di skad du theg pa de la sngon gyi mtha' 'ang mi dmigs so //
translated: Subh≈´ti, you said, ‚ÄúThat vehicle is not apprehended in the past,

original: phyi ma'i mtha' 'ang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha' 'ang mi dmigs so //
translated: it is not apprehended in the future,üîΩand it is not apprehended in the present.‚Äù

original: dbus kyang mi dmigs te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gong du rab 'byor gyis theg pa de dus gsum las 'das pa'i phyir theg pa chen po zhes bya'o zhes bshad pa'i don bcom ldan 'das kyis mdor smos te de bzhin bden no zhes bstod nas theg
analyzed: dbus kyang mi dmigs te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gong du rab 'byor gyis theg pa de dus gsum las 'das pa'i phyir theg pa chen po zhes bya'o zhes bshad pa'i don bcom ldan 'das kyis mdor smos te de bzhin bden no zhes bstod nas theg
translated: The Blessed One briefly mentioned the meaning of what Subh≈´ti had previously explained, namely, ‚ÄúThat vehicle is called the Great Vehicle because it transcends the three times,‚Äù and praised him, saying, ‚ÄúSo it is, Subh≈´ti.‚Äù

original: pa de dus gsum las 'das shing dus gsum mnyam pa nyid kyi don zhib tu bshad pa'o //
analyzed: pa de dus gsum las 'das shing dus gsum mnyam pa nyid kyi don zhib tu bshad pa'o //
translated: He then explained in detail the meaning of the equality of the three times, which is that vehicle‚Äôs transcendence of the three times.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?üîΩSubh≈´ti, it is because the past time is empty of the past time.

original: rab 'byor de ni 'di ltar 'das pa'i dus kyang 'das pa'i dus kyis stong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dus gsum mnyam pa nyid dmigs su med pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ni 'di ltar 'das pa'i dus kyang 'das pa'i dus kyis stong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dus gsum mnyam pa nyid dmigs su med pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: This teaches the reason why the equality of the three times is unobservable.

original: don dam pa 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba zhes bya ba de dag rang bzhin gyis stong pa dang / dus gsum mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba yang tha snyad du btags pa tsam du zad kyi don dam par mnyam pa nyid kyi rang bzhin med pa dang /
analyzed: don dam pa 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba zhes bya ba de dag rang bzhin gyis stong pa dang / dus gsum mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba yang tha snyad du btags pa tsam du zad kyi don dam par mnyam pa nyid kyi rang bzhin med pa dang /
translated: The past, future, and present are empty of intrinsic nature, and the so-called equality of the three times is also just a conventional designation. Ultimately, there is no nature of equality.

original: theg pa chen po dang theg pa chen po la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang don dam par dngos po med pa'i phyir dus gsum zhes grangs gcig gnyis la sogs par bgrang zhing tha dad du dbyer med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen po dang theg pa chen po la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang don dam par dngos po med pa'i phyir dus gsum zhes grangs gcig gnyis la sogs par bgrang zhing tha dad du dbyer med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: The Great Vehicle and the bodhisattvas who abide in the Great Vehicle are ultimately non-entities. Therefore, the three times cannot be counted as one, two, or any number, and they cannot be differentiated as distinct.

original: de bas na 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi mnyam pa nyid kyi theg pa ste /
analyzed: de bas na 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi mnyam pa nyid kyi theg pa ste /
translated: Therefore, this is the vehicle of equality for the bodhisattva great beings.

original: de la mnyam pa dang @246b mi mnyam pa mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ni mnyam pa dang mi mnyam pa ces tha dad du mi 'byed pa nyid mnyam pa nyid kyi theg pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //üîΩde la 'dod chags dang / 'dod chags dang bral bar yang mi dmigs so zhes bya ba nas /üîΩ'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa yang mi dmigs so zhes bya ba'i bar du ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyi ming smos nas /
analyzed: de la mnyam pa dang @246b mi mnyam pa mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ni mnyam pa dang mi mnyam pa ces tha dad du mi 'byed pa nyid mnyam pa nyid kyi theg pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o // de la 'dod chags dang / 'dod chags dang bral bar yang mi dmigs so zhes bya ba nas / 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa yang mi dmigs so zhes bya ba'i bar du ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyi ming smos nas /
translated: In the passage there is no apprehension of sameness or difference, it is taught that the very non-differentiation of sameness and difference is the vehicle of sameness.

original: de dag yod pa dang med pa'i mtha' gnyis tha dad du mi dmigs pa nyid mnyam pa nyid yin par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de dag yod pa dang med pa'i mtha' gnyis tha dad du mi dmigs pa nyid mnyam pa nyid yin par bstan pa'o //
translated: In the passage there is no apprehension of either attachment or non-attachment, up to there is no apprehension of either cyclic existence or nirvana, it is taught that the vehicle of sameness is the very non-apprehension of the extremes of existence and non-existence of phenomena such as attachment, by mentioning the names of phenomena such as attachment.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar de'i rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i chos ming gis smos pa de dag gi rang bzhin don dam par dmigs su med pas de'i phyir de dag la yod pa dang / med pa'i mtha' gnyis tha dad du dbyer med de mnyam pa nyid du zhes bstan pa'o//
analyzed: 'di ltar de'i rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i chos ming gis smos pa de dag gi rang bzhin don dam par dmigs su med pas de'i phyir de dag la yod pa dang / med pa'i mtha' gnyis tha dad du dbyer med de mnyam pa nyid du zhes bstan pa'o//
translated: This teaches that the nature of those phenomena such as attachment that are mentioned by name is ultimately unobservable. Therefore, existence and nonexistence, the two extremes, are undifferentiated in them, they are the same.

original: rab 'byor 'das pa'i gzugs ni 'das pa'i gzugs kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: rab 'byor 'das pa'i gzugs ni 'das pa'i gzugs kyis stong ngo //
translated: Subh≈´ti, past form is empty of past form.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: stong pa nyid las 'das pa'i gzugs dmigs su med do //
analyzed: stong pa nyid las 'das pa'i gzugs dmigs su med do //
translated: Form that transcends emptiness is not observed.

original: stong pa nyid kyang stong pa nyid kyis stong pas dmigs su med na /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang stong pa nyid kyis stong pas dmigs su med na /
translated: Since emptiness is empty of emptiness and is not observed,üîΩwhat need is there to say that form that transcends emptiness is observed?

original: stong pa nyid las 'das pa'i gzugs dmigs par 'gyur ba lta ci zhig smos zhes bya ba ni don dam par 'das pa'i gzugs kyi rang bzhin stong pa dang / stong pa nyid ces bya ba yang tha snyad du brjod pa tsam du zad kyi /

analyzed: gnyis su byar med do zhes bya ba nas /
translated: and cannot be made dual.

original: rab 'byor rnam grangs des na theg pa chen po bstan pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rab 'byor rnam grangs des na theg pa chen po bstan pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: ... By this approach, Subh≈´ti, the teaching of the Great Vehicle is the teaching of the perfection of wisdom.üîΩThe teaching of the perfection of wisdom is the teaching of the Great Vehicle.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pas theg pa chen po bstan par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni chos de dag thams cad mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pas theg pa chen po bstan par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni chos de dag thams cad mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: This is the teaching of the reason that all those phenomena are of one single characteristic, which is the absence of a characteristic.üîΩNot dual means that the Great Vehicle and the perfection of wisdom, up to the eighteen distinct qualities of the Buddha,

original: gnyis su med de zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la thug gi bar gyi @249a * //
analyzed: gnyis su med de zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la thug gi bar gyi @249a * //
translated: are not dual, and cannot be made dual.

original: chos de dag thams cad don dam par stong pa nyid du ro gcig pa'i phyir gnyis su med ces bya'o //
analyzed: chos de dag thams cad don dam par stong pa nyid du ro gcig pa'i phyir gnyis su med ces bya'o //
translated: All these dharmas are said to be non-dual because they are of one taste in emptiness in the ultimate.

original: gnyis su byar med ces bya ba ni de ltar stong pa nyid du ro gcig pas /
analyzed: gnyis su byar med ces bya ba ni de ltar stong pa nyid du ro gcig pas /
translated: Non-dual means that, being of one taste in emptiness in that way,

original: tha dad du dbyer mi nus so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tha dad du dbyer mi nus so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: they cannot be divided into separate things.

original: de bas na theg pa chen po bstan pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan par 'gyur /
analyzed: de bas na theg pa chen po bstan pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan par 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, by teaching the Great Vehicle, the perfection of wisdom is taught.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pas theg pa chen po bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pas theg pa chen po bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: By teaching the perfection of wisdom, the Great Vehicle is taught.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang mthun par theg pa chen po ston to zhes gang du smos pa dang sbyar ro//
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang mthun par theg pa chen po ston to zhes gang du smos pa dang sbyar ro//
translated: It is connected with the statement that the Great Vehicle is taught in accordance with the perfection of wisdom.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Subh≈´ti said to the Blessed One:
