analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' ni sngon gyi mthar mi dmigs so //
translated: Blessed One, in this way, the bodhisattva is not apprehended at the prior limit.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni phyi ma'i mthar mi dmigs so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni phyi ma'i mthar mi dmigs so //
translated: The bodhisattva is not apprehended in the future.üîΩThe bodhisattva is not apprehended in the middle.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni dbus su mi dmigs te zhes bya ba ni gang la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don gdams shing rjes su bstan par bya ba'i byang chub sems dpa' yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ma dmigs na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni dbus su mi dmigs te zhes bya ba ni gang la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don gdams shing rjes su bstan par bya ba'i byang chub sems dpa' yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ma dmigs na /
translated: Since the bodhisattva who is to be instructed and advised in the meaning of the perfection of wisdom is not seen, not apprehended,

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang zhig shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gdams shing rjes su bstan par bgyi zhes 'og nas 'byung ba'i don gleng bslang ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' dus gsum du mi dmigs pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang zhig shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gdams shing rjes su bstan par bgyi zhes 'og nas 'byung ba'i don gleng bslang ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' dus gsum du mi dmigs pa bstan pa'o //
translated: then, in order to raise the topic of the meaning that will be stated below, namely, ‚ÄúWhat bodhisattva should be instructed and advised in the perfection of wisdom?‚Äù it is taught that the bodhisattva is not apprehended in the three times.

original: gzugs kun du mtha' yas pa'i slad du byang chub sems dpa' kun tu mtha' yas par rig par bgyi'o zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gzugs kun du mtha' yas pa'i slad du byang chub sems dpa' kun tu mtha' yas par rig par bgyi'o zhes bya ba nas /
translated: ‚ÄúThe bodhisattva should be known as infinite because form is infinite.‚Äù

original: rnam par shes pa kun tu mtha' yas pa'i slad du byang chub sems dpa' kun tu mtha' yas par bgyi ste zhes bya ba'i bar du ni byang chub sems dpa' dus gsum du mi dmigs pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa kun tu mtha' yas pa'i slad du byang chub sems dpa' kun tu mtha' yas par bgyi ste zhes bya ba'i bar du ni byang chub sems dpa' dus gsum du mi dmigs pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: The passage from ‚Äúbecause consciousness is infinite‚Äù up to ‚Äúa bodhisattva is infinite‚Äù teaches the reason why a bodhisattva is not apprehended in the three times.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga rnams don dam par rang bzhin gyis stong pas dus gsum gyi mtha' gzung du med de /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga rnams don dam par rang bzhin gyis stong pas dus gsum gyi mtha' gzung du med de /
translated: Because the five aggregates of form and so on are ultimately empty of intrinsic existence, the limit of the three times cannot be apprehended.

original: mtha' yas pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' la yang dus gsum dmigs su med de /
analyzed: mtha' yas pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' la yang dus gsum dmigs su med de /
translated: Because of their infinity, a bodhisattva is also not apprehended in the three times.

original: mtha' yas par rig par bya'o @249b zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mtha' yas par rig par bya'o @249b zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: It should be understood that he is infinite.

original: gzugs byang chub sems dpa' zhes bgyi ba de lta bu yang ma mchis mi dmigs so zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gzugs byang chub sems dpa' zhes bgyi ba de lta bu yang ma mchis mi dmigs so zhes bya ba nas /
translated: ‚ÄúForm is a bodhisattva‚Äù does not exist and is not apprehended.

original: rnam par shes pa byang chub sems dpa' zhes bgyi ba de lta bu yang ma mchis mi dmigs te zhes bya ba'i bar du ni de ltar gzugs kun tu mtha' yas pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' kun tu mtha' yas par rig par bya na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa byang chub sems dpa' zhes bgyi ba de lta bu yang ma mchis mi dmigs te zhes bya ba'i bar du ni de ltar gzugs kun tu mtha' yas pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' kun tu mtha' yas par rig par bya na /
translated: The passage from ‚ÄúConsciousness is not the bodhisattva‚Äù up to ‚Äúis not apprehended‚Äù is the explanation that if the bodhisattva is known to be infinite because form is infinite,

original: 'o na ni gzugs la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' yin par 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa bsal ba'i phyir gzugs byang chub sems dpa' zhes bgyi ba de lta bu yang ma mchis mi dmigs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa'o ;üîΩ/ bcom ldan 'das de ltar bdag gis byang chub sems dpa' thams cad rnam pa thams cad du thams cad yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gong du bshad pa'i rim pa de lta bur byang chub sems dpa' yong ye
analyzed: 'o na ni gzugs la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' yin par 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa bsal ba'i phyir gzugs byang chub sems dpa' zhes bgyi ba de lta bu yang ma mchis mi dmigs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa'o ; / bcom ldan 'das de ltar bdag gis byang chub sems dpa' thams cad rnam pa thams cad du thams cad yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gong du bshad pa'i rim pa de lta bur byang chub sems dpa' yong ye
translated: then it would follow that form and so on are the bodhisattva.

original: rnam pa thams cad du ma mthong ma dmigs na /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du ma mthong ma dmigs na /
translated: The passage from ‚ÄúBhagavan, thus I do not see any bodhisattva at all in any way‚Äù explains that if the bodhisattva is not seen or apprehended in the way explained above,üîΩthen the bodhisattva does not exist.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang zhig shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gdams shing bstan par bgyi zhes bya ba 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang zhig shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gdams shing bstan par bgyi zhes bya ba 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase the bodhisattva who is instructed and taught the perfection of wisdom is to be applied to the following.

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' zhes bgyi ba 'di ni ming tsam du bas te zhes bya ba nas /üîΩmngon par ma grub pa mngon par ma grub pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gdags su mchis sam zhes bya ba'i bar du ni byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba kun rdzob tu ming dang tha snyad tsam du brjod du zad kyi don dam
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' zhes bgyi ba 'di ni ming tsam du bas te zhes bya ba nas / mngon par ma grub pa mngon par ma grub pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gdags su mchis sam zhes bya ba'i bar du ni byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba kun rdzob tu ming dang tha snyad tsam du brjod du zad kyi don dam
translated: The Blessed One said, Blessed One, this 'bodhisattva' is merely a name.

original: par dngos po yod par ma grub pa'i dpe mu stegs can gyis brtags pa'i dpag tu med pa las blangs te bstan pa'o //
analyzed: par dngos po yod par ma grub pa'i dpe mu stegs can gyis brtags pa'i dpag tu med pa las blangs te bstan pa'o //
translated: From ... up to 'non-establishment' cannot be designated in the non-established perfection of wisdom indicates that the so-called 'bodhisattva' is merely a conventional name and expression, but in ultimate reality, it is taught that there is no established entity, taking examples from the limitless imputations of the tƒ´rthikas.

original: gal te de ltar bstan pa'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sems mi 'jum yongs su mi 'jum /
analyzed: gal te de ltar bstan pa'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sems mi 'jum yongs su mi 'jum /
translated: If, when taught in this way, the mind of the bodhisattva-mahƒÅsattva does not become discouraged, does not become cowed, does not become regretful, and does not turn back, thinking 'I will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,' then, Subh≈´ti, that bodhisattva-mahƒÅsattva should be known as 'not separated from the perfection of wisdom,' as 'practicing the perfection of wisdom,' as 'residing in the perfection of wisdom,' as 'not lacking in the perfection of wisdom,' as 'not lacking in skillful means,' as 'not lacking in the spiritual friend,' as 'not lacking in the bodhisattva-vehicle,' and as 'not lacking in the perfection of wisdom.'

original: 'gyod par mi 'gyur zhing yid mi 'jigs mi dngang skrag par mi 'gyur na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do zhes bya ba ni de ltar dmigs su med pa'i chos zab mo bstan pa'i
analyzed: 'gyod par mi 'gyur zhing yid mi 'jigs mi dngang skrag par mi 'gyur na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do zhes bya ba ni de ltar dmigs su med pa'i chos zab mo bstan pa'i
translated: If a bodhisattva great being does not regret it, and does not fear, does not tremble, and is not terrified, then that bodhisattva great being practices the perfection of wisdom.üîΩThis is the teaching on the praise of the acceptance of the profound,

original: tshe sems zhum zhing skrag par ma gyur na /
analyzed: tshe sems zhum zhing skrag par ma gyur na /
translated: when the mind does not become timid or frightened at the time of teaching the profound Dharma that is not an object of observation.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yang dag par spyod @250a * //üîΩpar chud do zhes zab mo la bzod pa'i rjes su bsngags pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yang dag par spyod @250a * // par chud do zhes zab mo la bzod pa'i rjes su bsngags pa bstan pa'o //
translated: One should understand that he practices the perfection of wisdom

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bus tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bus tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Then, the venerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´¬≠putra said to the venerable Su¬≠bh≈´ti, Venerable Su¬≠bh≈´ti, why is it so?

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ci'i phyir na de skad du /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ci'i phyir na de skad du /
translated: Why is it so?

original: gal te de ltar bstan pa'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sems mi 'jum /
analyzed: gal te de ltar bstan pa'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sems mi 'jum /
translated: If, at the time of such teachings, the mind of a bodhisattva great being does not become timid,

original: yongs su mi 'jum /
analyzed: yongs su mi 'jum /
translated: does not become cowed,

original: 'gyod par mi 'gyur zhing yid mi 'jigs mi dngang skrag par mi 'gyur na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do zhes smra zhes bya ba'i bar du ni chos thams cad dus gsum du mi
analyzed: 'gyod par mi 'gyur zhing yid mi 'jigs mi dngang skrag par mi 'gyur na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do zhes smra zhes bya ba'i bar du ni chos thams cad dus gsum du mi
translated: If, when this is said, the mind of the bodhisattva great being does not get cowed, does not get discouraged, does not get depressed, does not get frightened, does not tremble, does not doubt, does not hesitate, then that bodhisattva great being practices the perfection of wisdom.

original: dmigs pa'i don 'og nas zhib tu bshad pa'i skabs dbye ba'i phyir gong du rab 'byor gyis byang chub sems dpa' dus gsum du dmigs su med pa la sogs pa bshad pa'i tshig de dag nyid sh'a ri'i bus bzlas te /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i don 'og nas zhib tu bshad pa'i skabs dbye ba'i phyir gong du rab 'byor gyis byang chub sems dpa' dus gsum du dmigs su med pa la sogs pa bshad pa'i tshig de dag nyid sh'a ri'i bus bzlas te /
translated: The meaning of the non-apprehension of all phenomena in the three times is explained in detail below. In order to open up that section, ≈öƒÅriputra repeats the words that Subh≈´ti previously explained about how the bodhisattva is not apprehended in the three times, and so on.

original: rab 'byor khyod ci'i phyir de skad zer zhes dris pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor khyod ci'i phyir de skad zer zhes dris pa'o //
translated: He asks, ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, why do you say that?‚Äù

original: de skad ces smras pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de skad ces smras pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: When this was said, the venerable Subh≈´ti said to the venerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra:

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu sems can med pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sngon gyi mthar mi dmigs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni byang chub sems dpa' dus gsum du dmigs su med pa'i don rab 'byor gyis zhib tu bshad pa steüîΩ/ sems can med pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sngon gyi mthar mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ni mu stegs can gyis brtags pa'i bdag sems can  zhes bya ba la sogs pa de dag yang dag par yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu sems can med pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sngon gyi mthar mi dmigs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni byang chub sems dpa' dus gsum du dmigs su med pa'i don rab 'byor gyis zhib tu bshad pa ste / sems can med pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sngon gyi mthar mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ni mu stegs can gyis brtags pa'i bdag sems can  zhes bya ba la sogs pa de dag yang dag par yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The passage beginning ‚ÄúVenerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra, the bodhisattva is not apprehended in the past because sentient beings do not exist‚Äù is Subh≈´ti‚Äôs detailed explanation of the meaning of the bodhisattva not being apprehended in the three times.üîΩThe passage ‚ÄúThe bodhisattva is not apprehended in the past because sentient beings do not exist‚Äù means that the self called sentient beings imputed by tƒ´rthikas do not exist in reality.

original: de dag 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / de ltar gyi dus gsum char na dmigs su med pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang don dam par dus gsum du dmigs su med do zhes bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de dag 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / de ltar gyi dus gsum char na dmigs su med pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang don dam par dus gsum du dmigs su med do zhes bstan pa ste /
translated: Just as they are not apprehended in the three times‚Äîthe past, the future, and the present‚Äîin the same way, the bodhisattva also is not apprehended in the three times in ultimate reality.

original: sems can stong pa dang / sems can dben pa dang / sems can rang bzhin med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mu stegs can gyis brtags pa'i bdag yang dag par yod pa ma yin pa'i rnam grangs bstan pa'o//
analyzed: sems can stong pa dang / sems can dben pa dang / sems can rang bzhin med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mu stegs can gyis brtags pa'i bdag yang dag par yod pa ma yin pa'i rnam grangs bstan pa'o//
translated: ‚ÄúBecause sentient beings are empty, because sentient beings are isolated, because sentient beings are essenceless‚Äù is the teaching of synonyms for the non-ultimate existence of the self imagined by the tƒ´rthikas.

original: @250b tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: @250b tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Venerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra, why is that?

original: sems can med pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sems can dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / dus gsum kun kyang stong pa nyid du ro gcig pas tha mi dad pa'i phyir gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: sems can med pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sems can dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / dus gsum kun kyang stong pa nyid du ro gcig pas tha mi dad pa'i phyir gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause sentient beings do not exist‚Äù and so forth teaches the reason that the three times are not different because sentient beings, bodhisattvas, and the three times are all of one taste in emptiness, and thus are not dual and cannot be made dual.

original: des ni gang zag la bdag med pa bshad pa'i sgo nas byang chub sems dpa' dus gsum du dmigs su med pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: des ni gang zag la bdag med pa bshad pa'i sgo nas byang chub sems dpa' dus gsum du dmigs su med pa bstan pa'o //
translated: This explains that the bodhisattva is not observed in the three times from the perspective of the selflessness of persons.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gzugs med pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sngon gyi mtha' mi dmigs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni chos la bdag med pa bshad pa'i sgo nas byang chub sems dpa' dus gsum du dmigs su med pa bstan
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gzugs med pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sngon gyi mtha' mi dmigs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni chos la bdag med pa bshad pa'i sgo nas byang chub sems dpa' dus gsum du dmigs su med pa bstan
translated: The passage beginning ‚ÄúVenerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´¬≠putra, because form is non-existent, the bodhisattva is not apprehended in the past‚Äù explains that the bodhisattva is not apprehended in the three times by way of explaining the selflessness of phenomena.

original: pa ste / tshig gi don bshad pa ni gong ma dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: pa ste / tshig gi don bshad pa ni gong ma dang 'dra'o //
translated: The meaning of the words is explained as above.

analyzed: gzugs la ji lta ba de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa 'jig rten pa'i chos rnams dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa thams cad mkhyen pa la thug gi bar du 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos thams cad dus gsum du dmigs su med pa bshad pa la byang chub sems dpa' dus gsum du dmigs su med pa bstan pa'o //
translated: Just as with form, so it is with feeling and so on, with the mundane phenomena, and with all the supramundane phenomena from the six perfections up to omniscience. The explanation that all of these are not apprehended in the three times is the explanation that the bodhisattva is not apprehended in the three times.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gang yang 'di skad du /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gang yang 'di skad du /
translated: Venerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´¬≠putra, you asked

analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: gzugs kun du mtha' yas pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' kun du mtha' yas par rig par bya'o zhes zer ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas gong du sh'a ri'i bus rab 'byor la khyod ci'i phyir gzugs kun du mtha' yas pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'
analyzed: gzugs kun du mtha' yas pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' kun du mtha' yas par rig par bya'o zhes zer ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas gong du sh'a ri'i bus rab 'byor la khyod ci'i phyir gzugs kun du mtha' yas pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'
translated: is Subh≈´ti‚Äôs reply to ≈öƒÅriputra‚Äôs question, ‚ÄúWhy do you say that bodhisattvas are infinite because form is infinite?‚Äù

original: kun du mtha' yas par rig par bya zhes zer zhes dris pa'i tshig rab 'byor gyis bzlas nas gzugs la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la thug gi bar du 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos thams cad nam mkha'i dpes kun du mtha' yas pa'i don zhib tu bshad pa ste /üîΩji ltar nam mkha' de dngos po yod pa ma yin zhing rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i phyir de la sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / @251a * //
analyzed: kun du mtha' yas par rig par bya zhes zer zhes dris pa'i tshig rab 'byor gyis bzlas nas gzugs la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la thug gi bar du 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos thams cad nam mkha'i dpes kun du mtha' yas pa'i don zhib tu bshad pa ste / ji ltar nam mkha' de dngos po yod pa ma yin zhing rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i phyir de la sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / @251a * //
translated: He explains in detail that all mundane and supramundane phenomena, from form up to the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas, are infinite in the sense that they are like space.

original: dbus med de /
analyzed: dbus med de /
translated: He says that space is not a thing and that because it is empty by nature, it has no beginning, end, or middle.

original: kun du mtha' yas pa de bzhin du phung po lnga la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi chos rnams dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar du 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos thams cad kyang rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
analyzed: kun du mtha' yas pa de bzhin du phung po lnga la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi chos rnams dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar du 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos thams cad kyang rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
translated: In the same way, the five aggregates and so on, the mundane dharmas, and all the supramundane dharmas up to the eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddhas, are empty of a basic nature.

original: nam mkha' dang 'dra ba de dag la sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / dbus dmigs su med pa'i phyir kun du mtha' yas so //
analyzed: nam mkha' dang 'dra ba de dag la sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / dbus dmigs su med pa'i phyir kun du mtha' yas so //
translated: Like space, they are boundless because their beginning, end, and middle cannot be apprehended.

original: byang chub sems dpa' yang de lta bur stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir kun du mtha' yas par rig par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yang de lta bur stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir kun du mtha' yas par rig par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: The bodhisattva should be known as boundless in the same way, because he is the nature of emptiness.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gang yang 'di skad du /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gang yang 'di skad du /
translated: The Lord: What do you think, Subhuti, is the Suchness of form, etc.

original: ci'i phyir na gzugs byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba de lta bu yang med cing mi dmigs na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gong du sh'a ri'i bus rab 'byor la khyod ci'i phyir gzugs byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba de lta bu yang med
analyzed: ci'i phyir na gzugs byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba de lta bu yang med cing mi dmigs na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gong du sh'a ri'i bus rab 'byor la khyod ci'i phyir gzugs byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba de lta bu yang med
translated: Why? Because that which is called ‚Äúform, bodhisattva‚Äù does not exist and is not observed.

original: cing mi dmigs zhes zer zhes dris pa'i tshig rab 'byor gyis bzlas nas gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad byang chub sems dpa' ma yin pa'i gtan tshigs zhib tu bshad pa ste /
analyzed: cing mi dmigs zhes zer zhes dris pa'i tshig rab 'byor gyis bzlas nas gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad byang chub sems dpa' ma yin pa'i gtan tshigs zhib tu bshad pa ste /
translated: The above passage is a detailed explanation of the reason why form and so on are not the bodhisattva, in response to the question ≈öƒÅriputra asked Subh≈´ti earlier: ‚ÄúWhy do you say, ‚ÄòThat which is called ‚Äúform, bodhisattva‚Äù does not exist and is not observed‚Äô?

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gzugs ni gzugs kyis stong ste /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gzugs ni gzugs kyis stong ste /
translated: Venerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra, form is empty of form.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩstong pa nyid la gzugs med byang chub sems dpa' med do zhes bya ba ni don dam par gzugs rang bzhin gyis stong pas de ltar stong pa la gzugs zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / stong pa nyid la gzugs med byang chub sems dpa' med do zhes bya ba ni don dam par gzugs rang bzhin gyis stong pas de ltar stong pa la gzugs zhes bya ba'am /
translated: Why is that?üîΩBecause in emptiness there is no form, and there is no bodhisattva.

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba med de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba med de /
translated: This means that ultimately form is empty of its own nature. Thus, in emptiness, there is no such thing as ‚Äúform‚Äù or ‚Äúbodhisattva.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir gzugs byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba de lta bu yang med cing mi dmigs so zhes bdag gis smras so zhes bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzugs byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba de lta bu yang med cing mi dmigs so zhes bdag gis smras so zhes bshad pa'o //
translated: Therefore, I say that the bodhisattva is not and is not apprehended in form.

original: gzugs la ji ltar bshad pa de bzhin de tshor ba nas de bzhin gshegs pa la thug gi bar du 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos thams cad la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs la ji ltar bshad pa de bzhin de tshor ba nas de bzhin gshegs pa la thug gi bar du 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos thams cad la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Just as it is explained with regard to form, so it is to be applied to all dharmas, mundane and supramundane, from feeling up to the Tathagata.

original: tshe dang ldan pa shar dva ti'i bu gang yang 'di skad du bdag gis /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa shar dva ti'i bu gang yang 'di skad du bdag gis /
translated: Venerable Subhuti, when you say,üîΩ‚ÄúI do not apprehend anywhere any bodhisattva whatsoever,

original: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad du thams cad rnam pa thams cad thams cad mi dmigs na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad du thams cad rnam pa thams cad thams cad mi dmigs na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: in all respects,‚Äù etc.,

original: gong du sh'a ri'i bus rab 'byor la khyod ci'i phyir /
analyzed: gong du sh'a ri'i bus rab 'byor la khyod ci'i phyir /
translated: above, Shariputra said to Subhuti, ‚ÄúWhy is it,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa thams cad du mi dmigs na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa thams cad du mi dmigs na /
translated: when you do not apprehend a bodhisattva in all respects,

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang zhig shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang zhig la gdams shing rjes su bstan par bya zhes zer zhes rab 'byor la dris pa'i tshig @251b rab 'byor gyis bzlas nas de'i don rab 'byor gyis zhib tu bshad pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang zhig shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang zhig la gdams shing rjes su bstan par bya zhes zer zhes rab 'byor la dris pa'i tshig @251b rab 'byor gyis bzlas nas de'i don rab 'byor gyis zhib tu bshad pa ste /
translated: Subhuti repeats the question and explains its meaning in detail.

original: gzugs ni gzugs la med cing mi dmigs so //
analyzed: gzugs ni gzugs la med cing mi dmigs so //
translated: Form is not in form, it is not found there.

original: gzugs ni tshor ba la med cing mi dmigs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa thams cad du med cing mi dmigs pas gdams shing rjes su bstan pa med pa'i gtan tshigs zhib tu bshad pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs ni tshor ba la med cing mi dmigs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa thams cad du med cing mi dmigs pas gdams shing rjes su bstan pa med pa'i gtan tshigs zhib tu bshad pa ste /
translated: Form is not in feeling, it is not found there and so on, is the detailed explanation of the reason why the Bodhisattva should not be instructed and admonished by way of the non-existence and non-apprehension of all aspects.

original: gzugs la sogs pa 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang / de bzhin gshegs pa la thug gi bar du chos de dag thams cad don dam par bdag gi dngos por yang med la /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang / de bzhin gshegs pa la thug gi bar du chos de dag thams cad don dam par bdag gi dngos por yang med la /
translated: Form and so on, the mundane and supramundane dharmas up to the Tathagata, all those dharmas ultimately do not have their own nature.

original: gzhan gyi dngos por yang med pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa thams cad du med cing mi dmigs pas byang chub sems dpa' gang yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang la yang gdams shing rjes su bstan du med do zhes bshad pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dngos por yang med pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa thams cad du med cing mi dmigs pas byang chub sems dpa' gang yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang la yang gdams shing rjes su bstan du med do zhes bshad pa'o //
translated: Because it does not exist as a thing of its own, nor as a thing of another, the bodhisattva is not at all, and is not in any way, found or apprehended. Therefore, no bodhisattva at all is instructed in, or admonished about, any perfection of wisdom.

original: de la gzugs ni gzugs la med cing mi dmigs so zhes bya bas ni bdag gi dngos por med pa bstan to //
analyzed: de la gzugs ni gzugs la med cing mi dmigs so zhes bya bas ni bdag gi dngos por med pa bstan to //
translated: Here, ‚Äúform is not found in form‚Äù shows that it does not exist as a thing of its own.

original: gzugs ni tshor ba la med cing mi dmigs so zhes bya bas ni gzhan gyi dngos por yang med pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs ni tshor ba la med cing mi dmigs so zhes bya bas ni gzhan gyi dngos por yang med pa bstan pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúForm is not found in feeling‚Äù shows that it does not exist as a thing of another.

original: de bzhin du chos thams cad la yang bdag gi dngos por med pa dang / gzhan gyi dngos por med ci rigs su sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du chos thams cad la yang bdag gi dngos por med pa dang / gzhan gyi dngos por med ci rigs su sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: In the same way, all dharmas should be connected with the absence of a thing of their own and the absence of a thing of another, as appropriate.

original: tshe dang ldan pa shar dva ti'i bu gang yang 'di skad du /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa shar dva ti'i bu gang yang 'di skad du /
translated: Venerable Subh≈´ti, you said,

original: ci'i phyir na 'di lta ste /
analyzed: ci'i phyir na 'di lta ste /
translated: ‚ÄúWhy is it that this perfection of wisdom is so deep?‚Äù

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba 'di ni ming tsam yin zhes zer ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gong du sh'a ri'i bus rab 'byor la khyod ci'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba 'di ni ming tsam yin no zhes zer zhes drisüîΩpa'i tshig rab 'byor gyis bzlas te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba 'di ni ming tsam yin zhes zer ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gong du sh'a ri'i bus rab 'byor la khyod ci'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba 'di ni ming tsam yin no zhes zer zhes dris pa'i tshig rab 'byor gyis bzlas te /
translated: The phrase this 'bodhisattva' is a mere name is a repetition of the words asked by Shariputra to Subhuti above, Why do you say that this 'bodhisattva' is a mere name?

original: de'i don zhib tu bshad pa ste /
analyzed: de'i don zhib tu bshad pa ste /
translated: The meaning of that is explained in detail.

original: tshe dang ldan pa shar dva ti'i bu 'di lta ste /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa shar dva ti'i bu 'di lta ste /
translated: The passage beginning Venerable Shariputra, it is like this

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba 'di ni glo bur du ming du btags pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba 'di ni glo bur du ming du btags pa ste /
translated: is a repetition of the words asked by Shariputra to Subhuti above, Why do you say that this 'bodhisattva' is a mere name?

original: de'i phyir na 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir na 'di lta ste /
translated: The passage beginning Venerable Shariputra, it is like thisüîΩis a repetition of the words asked by Shariputra to Subhuti above, Why do you say that this 'bodhisattva' is a mere name?üîΩThe passage beginning Venerable Shariputra, it is like this

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba 'di ming tsam zhes bya ba ni don dam par byang chub sems @252a * //üîΩdpa' zhes bya ba ni dngos po yod par ma grub ste /

translated: is a repetition of the words asked by Shariputra to Subhuti above, Why do you say that this 'bodhisattva' is a mere name?üîΩThe passage beginning Venerable Shariputra, it is like thisüîΩis a repetition of the words asked by Shariputra to Subhuti above, Why do you say that this 'bodhisattva' is a mere name?üîΩThe passage beginning Venerable Shariputra, it is like thisüîΩis a repetition of the words asked by Shariputra to Subhuti above, Why do you say that this 'bodhisattva' is a mere name?üîΩThe passage beginning Venerable Shariputra, it is like thisüîΩis a repetition of the words asked by Shariputra to Subhuti above, Why do you say that this 'bodhisattva' is a mere name?üîΩThe passage beginning Venerable Shariputra, it is like thisüîΩis a repetition of the words asked by Shariputra to Subhuti above, Why do you say that this 'bodhisattva' is a mere name?üîΩThe passage beginning Venerable Shariputra, it is like this

original: de ltar dngos po med pa las byang chub sems dpa' zhes ming du brjod pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar dngos po med pa las byang chub sems dpa' zhes ming du brjod pa ni /
translated: is a repetition of the words asked by Shariputra to Subhuti above, Why do you say that this 'bodhisattva' is a mere name?üîΩThe passage beginning Venerable Shariputra

original: kun rdzob tu glo bur du tha snyad btags par zad de /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu glo bur du tha snyad btags par zad de /
translated: It is merely a conventional designation that is adventitious.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' yang dag par med na /
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' yang dag par med na /
translated: Thus, if a bodhisattva is not really existent,

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang zhig shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gdams shing rjes su bstan par bya zhes gang du smos pa'i don dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang zhig shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gdams shing rjes su bstan par bya zhes gang du smos pa'i don dang sbyar ro //
translated: then with respect to what should one give instructions and follow-up teachings on the perfection of wisdom?‚Äù

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu 'di lta ste /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu 'di lta ste /
translated: Venerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´¬≠putra, it is like this:

original: gzugs zhes bya ba dang / tshor ba zhes bya ba dang / 'du shes zhes bya ba dang / 'du byed ces bya ba dang / rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba ni glo bur du ming du btags pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba 'ba' zhig don dam par med pa las glo bur du ming du btags par ma zad kyi /
analyzed: gzugs zhes bya ba dang / tshor ba zhes bya ba dang / 'du shes zhes bya ba dang / 'du byed ces bya ba dang / rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba ni glo bur du ming du btags pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba 'ba' zhig don dam par med pa las glo bur du ming du btags par ma zad kyi /
translated: ‚ÄúForm,‚Äù ‚Äúfeeling,‚Äù ‚Äúperception,‚Äù ‚Äúvolitional factors,‚Äù and ‚Äúconsciousness‚Äù are adventitious designations.

original: phung po lnga la sogs pa chos thams cad kyang don dam par yong pa ma yin pa las glo bur du ming du btags par zad do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: phung po lnga la sogs pa chos thams cad kyang don dam par yong pa ma yin pa las glo bur du ming du btags par zad do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: All phenomena, such as the five aggregates, are ultimately not things, but are merely names that are adventitiously imputed.

original: 'di ltar ming ni gang nas kyang ma 'ong gang du yang mi 'gro gang na yang mi gnas so zhes bya ba ni phung po lnga rnams yang dag par yod pa ma yin pa las glo bur du ming du btags pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar ming ni gang nas kyang ma 'ong gang du yang mi 'gro gang na yang mi gnas so zhes bya ba ni phung po lnga rnams yang dag par yod pa ma yin pa las glo bur du ming du btags pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: Thus, a name does not come from anywhere, does not go anywhere, and does not abide anywhere. This teaches the reason that the five aggregates are not really existent, but are merely adventitiously imputed as names.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po de dag don dam par dngos po med pas skye pa'i tshe yang gang nas kyang mi 'ong //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po de dag don dam par dngos po med pas skye pa'i tshe yang gang nas kyang mi 'ong //
translated: Since those aggregates such as form are ultimately unreal things, when they arise, they do not come from anywhere.

original: 'gag pa'i tshe yang gang du yang mi 'gro //
analyzed: 'gag pa'i tshe yang gang du yang mi 'gro //
translated: When they cease, they do not go anywhere.

original: skad cig ma'i rang bzhin yin pas gang na yang mi gnas so zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: skad cig ma'i rang bzhin yin pas gang na yang mi gnas so zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Since they have the nature of moments, they do not abide anywhere. This is the teaching.

original: ming tsam zhes bya ba gang yin pa de ni gzugs ma yin /üîΩde ni tshor ba ma yin /
analyzed: ming tsam zhes bya ba gang yin pa de ni gzugs ma yin / de ni tshor ba ma yin /
translated: That which is called ‚Äúmere name‚Äù is not form.üîΩIt is not feeling.

original: de ni 'du shes ma yin /
analyzed: de ni 'du shes ma yin /
translated: It is not discrimination.

original: de ni 'du byed ma yin /
analyzed: de ni 'du byed ma yin /
translated: It is not compositional factors.

original: de ni rnam par shes pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni yang dag par yod pa ma yin pa las glo bur du ming tsam du btags pa de ni yang dag par phung po lnga'i rang bzhin ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de ni rnam par shes pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni yang dag par yod pa ma yin pa las glo bur du ming tsam du btags pa de ni yang dag par phung po lnga'i rang bzhin ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: That is not consciousness. This teaches that what is imputed as a mere name with respect to what is not really existent is not the nature of the five aggregates.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar ming ni ming gi rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar ming ni ming gi rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
translated: Because a name is empty of the intrinsic nature of a name.

original: stong pa gang yin pa de ni ming ma yin te zhes bya ba ni glo bur du btags pa'i ming de @252b phung po lnga'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: stong pa gang yin pa de ni ming ma yin te zhes bya ba ni glo bur du btags pa'i ming de @252b phung po lnga'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: That which is empty is not a name. This teaches the reason why the name that is imputed adventitiously is not the nature of the five aggregates.

original: ming de rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i phyir phung po lnga'i rang bzhin ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ming de rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i phyir phung po lnga'i rang bzhin ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that because that name is empty of intrinsic nature, it is not the nature of the five aggregates.

original: phung po lnga la ji ltar bshad pa de bzhin du phyi nang gi skye mched bcu gnyis dang / rnam par shes pa drug dang / 'dus te reg pa drug dang / reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba drug dang / sa'i khams la sogs pa khams drug dang /
analyzed: phung po lnga la ji ltar bshad pa de bzhin du phyi nang gi skye mched bcu gnyis dang / rnam par shes pa drug dang / 'dus te reg pa drug dang / reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba drug dang / sa'i khams la sogs pa khams drug dang /
translated: Just as it is with the five aggregates, so it is with the twelve internal and external sense spheres, the six consciousnesses, the six contacts, the six feelings that arise from contact, the six elements such as earth,

original: ma rig pa la sogs pa rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bcu gnyis la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa la sogs pa rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bcu gnyis la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: and the twelve factors of dependent origination beginning with ignorance.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang 'di lta ste /
translated: Venerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra, moreover, it is like this:

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni ming tsam ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni ming tsam ste /
translated: The perfection of generosity is merely a name.üîΩIn the name, the perfection of generosity does not exist, and the perfection of generosity does not exist in the name.

original: ming la yang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la yang ming de med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du rnam par byang ba'i chos thams cad kyang don dam

translated: Therefore, suffering arises from seeing what does not exist as if it did,

original: gang phyin ci log tu mthong ba las byung ba de yang dag par yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir chos thams cad ni sdug bsngal ba'o zhes bya bas chos @254b thams cad dngos po med par bstan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gang phyin ci log tu mthong ba las byung ba de yang dag par yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir chos thams cad ni sdug bsngal ba'o zhes bya bas chos @254b thams cad dngos po med par bstan par rig par bya'o //
translated: and since that which arises from mistaken seeing does not exist in reality, it should be understood that the statement ‚Äúall things are suffering‚Äù teaches that all things are unreal.

original: gang dang yang bral bas ma yin no zhes bya ba ni bde ba la sogs pa'i dngos po yod pa gang dang yang bral bas sdug bsngal bar gyur pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gang dang yang bral bas ma yin no zhes bya ba ni bde ba la sogs pa'i dngos po yod pa gang dang yang bral bas sdug bsngal bar gyur pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not due to being separated from anything at all. This means that suffering does not come from being separated from any existent thing such as pleasure.

original: dngos po med pa las phyin ci log tu mthong ba las sdug bsngal bar gyur to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dngos po med pa las phyin ci log tu mthong ba las sdug bsngal bar gyur to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It comes from seeing what is nonexistent as existent.

original: 'dir yang gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar du 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos thams cad la yang don gcig tu sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar du 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos thams cad la yang don gcig tu sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Here, one should apply the same meaning to all mundane and supramundane dharmas, from the five aggregates such as form up to the eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu 'di ltar sdug bsngal gang yin pa de ni dngos po med pa dang zad pa ste zhes bya ba ni de ltar chos thams cad dngos po med pa las phyin ci log tu mthong ste /

translated: Because, Venerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra, that suffering is nonexistent and exhausted. This means that one sees what is nonexistent as existent, and

original: yod par brtags pa las sdug bsngal bar gyur pa de ni don dam par dngos po yod pa ma yin pas dngos po med pa dang zad pa'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: yod par brtags pa las sdug bsngal bar gyur pa de ni don dam par dngos po yod pa ma yin pas dngos po med pa dang zad pa'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: The suffering that comes from the imputation of existence is ultimately the non-existence of entities, and the exhaustion of entities.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang chos thams cad ni bdag med pa ste /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang chos thams cad ni bdag med pa ste /
translated: Venerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra, moreover, all phenomena are selfless,üîΩnot due to being free from anything.

original: gang dang yang bral bas ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bdag med pa'i sgo nas thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: gang dang yang bral bas ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bdag med pa'i sgo nas thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par bstan pa ste /
translated: This and so forth teaches that everything is the nature of non-entityness from the perspective of selflessness.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar du bdag med pa zhes bya ba ni de dag gi rang bzhin med de /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar du bdag med pa zhes bya ba ni de dag gi rang bzhin med de /
translated: The five aggregates beginning with form up to the eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha are said to be selfless, meaning they lack intrinsic nature.

original: stong pa la bdag med pa zhes bya'i mu stegs can gyis brtags pa'i bdag dang bral bas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: stong pa la bdag med pa zhes bya'i mu stegs can gyis brtags pa'i bdag dang bral bas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that emptiness is called ‚Äúselfless,‚Äù but it is not due to being free from the self imputed by tƒ´rthikas.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang chos thams cad ni tshig zhi ba ste gang dang yang bral bas ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni zhi ba'i sgo nas chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par bstan
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang chos thams cad ni tshig zhi ba ste gang dang yang bral bas ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni zhi ba'i sgo nas chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par bstan
translated: This and the rest teaches that all phenomena are the nature of non-entityness from the perspective of peace.

original: pa ste / gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar gyi chos de dag thams cad don dam par ngo bo nyid med cing gzod ma nas zhi ba'i phyir zhi ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: pa ste / gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar gyi chos de dag thams cad don dam par ngo bo nyid med cing gzod ma nas zhi ba'i phyir zhi ba zhes bya'o //
translated: All phenomena, from the five aggregates beginning with form up to the eighteen distinct qualities of the Buddha, are said to be ‚Äúpeaceful‚Äù because ultimately they are without entityness and primordially peaceful.

original: dngos po yod pa las mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang bral nas zhi bar gyur pa ni @255a * //
analyzed: dngos po yod pa las mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang bral nas zhi bar gyur pa ni @255a * //
translated: It is not the case that they become peaceful by being free from the opposite of existence.

original: ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the teaching.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang chos thams cad ni stong pa ste gang dang yang bral bas ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang chos thams cad ni stong pa ste gang dang yang bral bas ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
translated: Venerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra, furthermore, all phenomena are empty, but not in the sense of being devoid of anything.

original: smon pa med pa bstan pa'i sgo nas chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: smon pa med pa bstan pa'i sgo nas chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par bstan pa ste /
translated: This and so forth teaches that all phenomena are the nature of non-entityness by way of teaching the doors of liberation of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar gyi chos de dag thams cad don dam par rang bzhin yod par ma grub pa stong pa dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar gyi chos de dag thams cad don dam par rang bzhin yod par ma grub pa stong pa dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa yin gyi /
translated: All phenomena, from the five aggregates beginning with form up to the eighteen distinctive qualities of the buddhas, are ultimately empty, signless, and wishless, in the sense that they are not established as having any nature.

original: dngos po gzhan dang bral bas stong pa dang / mtshan ma dang bral bas mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa dang bral bas smon pa med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po gzhan dang bral bas stong pa dang / mtshan ma dang bral bas mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa dang bral bas smon pa med pa ma yin te /
translated: They are not empty, signless, and wishless in the sense of being devoid of other entities, being devoid of signs, and being devoid of wishes.

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa dang / rang bzhin gyis mtshan ma med pa dang / rang bzhin gyis smon pa med pa'i phyir chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa dang / rang bzhin gyis mtshan ma med pa dang / rang bzhin gyis smon pa med pa'i phyir chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Because they are empty of inherent nature, without inherent signs, and without inherent aspirations, all phenomena are the non-entityness of entities.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang chos thams cad ni dge ba ste /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang chos thams cad ni dge ba ste /

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang chos thams cad ni rtag pa ma yin 'jig pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rtag pa ma yin pa dang / 'jig pa ma yin pa'i sgo nas chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par bstan pa ste /

translated: ‚ÄúVenerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra, moreover, all phenomena are neither permanent nor annihilated‚Äù and so on teaches that all phenomena are essentially devoid of entityness in terms of being neither permanent nor annihilated.

original: kun brtags pa'i chos 'di dag thams cad yod pa zhig yin na ni rtag pa'i rang bzhin te /üîΩther zug tu gnas pa zhig gam /
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i chos 'di dag thams cad yod pa zhig yin na ni rtag pa'i rang bzhin te / ther zug tu gnas pa zhig gam /
translated: If all these imputed phenomena existed, they would have the nature of permanence.üîΩThey would be something that endures forever.

original: mi rtag pa'i rang bzhin te 'jig pa'i chos can zhig yin grang na /
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i rang bzhin te 'jig pa'i chos can zhig yin grang na /
translated: Or they would have the nature of impermanence, something that is subject to destruction.

original: don dam par chos 'di dag thams cad dngos po yod par ma grub pas rtag pa dang 'jig pa'i rang bzhin ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: don dam par chos 'di dag thams cad dngos po yod par ma grub pas rtag pa dang 'jig pa'i rang bzhin ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: However, since ultimately all these phenomena are not established as existent things, they are taught to be neither permanent nor subject to destruction.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de'i rang bzhin ni de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni gzugs rtag pa ma yin 'jig pa ma yin pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin ni de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni gzugs rtag pa ma yin 'jig pa ma yin pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúTheir nature is just like that‚Äù teaches the reason that form is neither permanent nor subject to destruction.

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i phyir gzugs rtag pa ma yin 'jig pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o ;
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i phyir gzugs rtag pa ma yin 'jig pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o ;
translated: Because of emptiness of intrinsic nature, form is not permanent and not impermanent.

original: / de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa zag pa med pa'i chos la thug gi bar du thams cad la sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: / de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa zag pa med pa'i chos la thug gi bar du thams cad la sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, it should be applied to all, from feeling to the uncontaminated dharmas.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gang yang 'di skad du ci'i phyir gzugs mngon par ma grub ces bya ba la sogs pa ni gong du sh'a ri'i bus rab 'byor la gzugs @256b la sogs pa'i chos rnams ci'i phyir mngon par ma grub ces zer
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gang yang 'di skad du ci'i phyir gzugs mngon par ma grub ces bya ba la sogs pa ni gong du sh'a ri'i bus rab 'byor la gzugs @256b la sogs pa'i chos rnams ci'i phyir mngon par ma grub ces zer
translated: Venerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra, as for what was said, ‚ÄúWhy is form not established?‚Äù and so on, above ≈öƒÅriputra asked Subh≈´ti, ‚ÄúWhy do you say that dharmas such as form are not established?‚Äù

original: zhes dris pa'i tshig rab 'byor gyis bzlas nas /
analyzed: zhes dris pa'i tshig rab 'byor gyis bzlas nas /
translated: Subh≈´ti repeated the question.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga rnams mngon par 'du ma byas pa'i phyir mngon par ma grub po zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga rnams mngon par 'du ma byas pa'i phyir mngon par ma grub po zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: He taught, ‚ÄúThe five aggregates beginning with form are not established because they are not produced.‚Äù

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar gzugs la mngon par 'du byed pa med ces bya ba la sogs pa ni chos rnams mngon par 'du ma byas pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs la mngon par 'du byed pa med ces bya ba la sogs pa ni chos rnams mngon par 'du ma byas pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: Thus, ‚Äúform is not produced‚Äù and so on teaches the reason why phenomena are not produced.

original: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pas mngon par 'du byed pa po med pa'i phyir mngon par 'dus ma byas pa'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pas mngon par 'du byed pa po med pa'i phyir mngon par 'dus ma byas pa'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Since all phenomena are empty by nature, there is no producer, and so they are taught to be unproduced.

original: gzugs la ji lta ba bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la thug gi bar du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs la ji lta ba bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la thug gi bar du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: As with form, this should be applied up to the eighteen distinct qualities of the Buddha.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu rnam grangs des na gzugs mngon par ma grub bo //üîΩtshor ba mngon par ma grub bo //üîΩ'du shes mngon par ma grub bo //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu rnam grangs des na gzugs mngon par ma grub bo // tshor ba mngon par ma grub bo // 'du shes mngon par ma grub bo //
translated: Venerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra, for this reason, form is not produced.üîΩFeeling is not produced.üîΩPerception is not produced.

original: 'du byed mngon par ma grub bo //
analyzed: 'du byed mngon par ma grub bo //
translated: Formation is not produced.

original: rnam par shes pa mngon par ma grub bo zhes bya ba ni de ltar chos thams cad mngon par 'du byed pa'i byed pa po med pa'i phyir mngon par ma grub pa'i don rab 'byor gyis mjug bsdus te bstan pa'o //üîΩtshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gang yang 'di skad du ci'i phyir tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gang mngon par ma grub pa de gzugs ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gong du sh'a ri'i bus rab 'byor la ci'i phyir gang mngon
analyzed: rnam par shes pa mngon par ma grub bo zhes bya ba ni de ltar chos thams cad mngon par 'du byed pa'i byed pa po med pa'i phyir mngon par ma grub pa'i don rab 'byor gyis mjug bsdus te bstan pa'o // tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gang yang 'di skad du ci'i phyir tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gang mngon par ma grub pa de gzugs ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gong du sh'a ri'i bus rab 'byor la ci'i phyir gang mngon
translated: ‚ÄúConsciousness is not established‚Äù is the meaning of ‚Äúnot arisen,‚Äù and Subh≈´ti concludes the teaching by saying that it is because all phenomena are devoid of an agent who brings them about.

original: par ma grub pa de gzugs ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa dris pa'i tshig rab 'byor gyis bzlas nas /
analyzed: par ma grub pa de gzugs ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa dris pa'i tshig rab 'byor gyis bzlas nas /
translated: ‚ÄúVenerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra, why is it that the Venerable Subh≈´ti says that what is not arisen is not form?‚Äù and so on. This is a repetition of the question ≈öƒÅriputra asked Subh≈´ti above, ‚ÄúWhy is it that what is not arisen is not form?‚Äù and so on.

original: de'i lan du gzugs la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar gyi chos rnams rang bzhin gyis stong pas skye ba dang 'jig pa med cing gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba yang med de /
analyzed: de'i lan du gzugs la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar gyi chos rnams rang bzhin gyis stong pas skye ba dang 'jig pa med cing gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba yang med de /
translated: In response, since forms and so on, up to the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas are empty of inherent nature, they are without arising and ceasing and do not transform from abiding into something else.

original: de'i phyir gang mngon par ma grub pa de gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang mngon par ma grub pa de gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is taught that that which is not manifestly produced is not the nature of forms and so on.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu rnam grangs des na /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu rnam grangs des na /
translated: Venerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra, for this reason

original: gang mngon bar 'dus ma byas pa de gzugs ma yin no zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gang mngon bar 'dus ma byas pa de gzugs ma yin no zhes bya ba nas /
translated: that which is not manifestly produced is not form,

original: gang mngon par 'dus ma byas pa de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma yin no @257a * //
analyzed: gang mngon par 'dus ma byas pa de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma yin no @257a * //
translated: up to that which is not manifestly produced is not omniscience.

original: zhes bya ba'i bar du ni de ltar chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pas skye pa dang 'jig pa med pa'i phyir mngon par 'dus ma byas pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i bar du ni de ltar chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pas skye pa dang 'jig pa med pa'i phyir mngon par 'dus ma byas pa ste /
translated: Thus, since all phenomena are empty of inherent nature, they are not manifestly produced because they are without arising and ceasing.

original: de ltar mngon par 'dus ma byas shing mngon par ma grub pa de gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyi chos de dag gang gi rang bzhin yang ma yin no zhes mngon par ma grub pa'i
analyzed: de ltar mngon par 'dus ma byas shing mngon par ma grub pa de gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyi chos de dag gang gi rang bzhin yang ma yin no zhes mngon par ma grub pa'i
translated: Thus, that which is uncompounded and not established is not the intrinsic nature of any of those phenomena from the five aggregates beginning with form up to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: don mjug bsdus te bstan pa'o //
analyzed: don mjug bsdus te bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the summary of the meaning of ‚Äúnot established.‚Äù

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gang yang 'di skad du ci'i phyir na /üîΩmngon par ma grub pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ji ltar gdams shing rjes su bstan par bya zhes smras zhes zer ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gong du rab 'byor gyis mngon par ma grub pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gang yang 'di skad du ci'i phyir na / mngon par ma grub pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ji ltar gdams shing rjes su bstan par bya zhes smras zhes zer ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gong du rab 'byor gyis mngon par ma grub pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de
translated: Venerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´¬≠putra, when you asked, ‚ÄúWhy is it thatüîΩthe unestablished should be instructed and taught the perfection of wisdom?‚ÄùüîΩThis is what you said.üîΩPreviously, Subh≈´ti said, ‚ÄúThe bodhisattva who is unestablished

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par ma grub pa la ji ltar gdams shing rjes su bstan par bya zhes smras pa la /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par ma grub pa la ji ltar gdams shing rjes su bstan par bya zhes smras pa la /
translated: should be instructed and taught the unestablished perfection of wisdom.‚Äù

original: sh'a ri'i bus khyod ci'i phyir de skad zer zhes rab 'byor la dris pa'i lan /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bus khyod ci'i phyir de skad zer zhes rab 'byor la dris pa'i lan /
translated: ≈öƒÅriputra asked Subh≈´ti, Why do you say that?

original: sh'a ri'i bu la rab 'byor gyis smras pa ste /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu la rab 'byor gyis smras pa ste /
translated: Subh≈´ti replied to ≈öƒÅriputra, saying,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu 'di ltar mngon par ma grub pa gang yin pa de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu 'di ltar mngon par ma grub pa gang yin pa de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: Venerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra, in that way, that which is not accomplished is the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa de ni mngon par ma grub pa ste /üîΩde ltar mngon par ma grub pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'i chos de gnyis ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gdams shing rjes su bstan par bya ba'i byang chub sems dpa' dang /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa de ni mngon par ma grub pa ste / de ltar mngon par ma grub pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'i chos de gnyis ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gdams shing rjes su bstan par bya ba'i byang chub sems dpa' dang /
translated: That which is the perfection of wisdom is not accomplished.üîΩIn that way, those two dharmas called 'not accomplished' and 'perfection of wisdom' are not two, are not divided, are not broken apart, and are not cut apart.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gnyi ga yang don dam par dngos por med de /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gnyi ga yang don dam par dngos por med de /
translated: Both the bodhisattva who is to be instructed and advised in the perfection of wisdom and the perfection of wisdom itself are ultimately unreal.

original: mngon par ma grub par rang bzhin gcig pas tha dad du dbyer med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par ma grub par rang bzhin gcig pas tha dad du dbyer med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Since they are of the same nature in being unestablished, they are inseparable as different.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu rnam grangs nges na 'di skad du mngon par ma grub pa de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ji ltar gdams shing rjes su bstan par bya zhes smras so zhes bya ba ni gong du smos pa'i
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu rnam grangs nges na 'di skad du mngon par ma grub pa de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ji ltar gdams shing rjes su bstan par bya zhes smras so zhes bya ba ni gong du smos pa'i
translated: Venerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra, in that case, it is said, how should one instruct and teach the perfection of wisdom to that which is unestablished?

original: tshul gyis na byang chub sems dpa' dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gnyis ka yang don dam par mngon @257b par ma grub ste /
analyzed: tshul gyis na byang chub sems dpa' dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gnyis ka yang don dam par mngon @257b par ma grub ste /
translated: In the manner stated above, both the bodhisattva and the perfection of wisdom are ultimately unestablished.

original: stong pa nyid du ro gcig cing tha dad du dbyer med pa la ji ltar gdams shing rjes su bstan par bya zhes smras so zhes don mjug bsdus te bstan pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid du ro gcig cing tha dad du dbyer med pa la ji ltar gdams shing rjes su bstan par bya zhes smras so zhes don mjug bsdus te bstan pa'o //
translated: Since they are of the same nature in emptiness, inseparable as different, it is said, how should one instruct and teach? This is the summary explanation.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha dva ti'i bu gang yang 'di skad du /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha dva ti'i bu gang yang 'di skad du /
translated: Venerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra, someone might say,

original: ci'i phyir na mngon par ma grub pa ma gtogs par gang byang chub tu spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de lta bu mi dmigs so zhes zer na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gong du /
analyzed: ci'i phyir na mngon par ma grub pa ma gtogs par gang byang chub tu spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de lta bu mi dmigs so zhes zer na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gong du /
translated: Why? Because, except for the unproduced, one does not apprehend that kind of bodhisattva who would practice for enlightenment.

original: sh'a ri'i bus rab 'byor la khyod ci'i phyir mngon par ma grub pa ma gtogs par gang byang chub tu spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de lta bu mi dmigs so zhes zer zhes dris pa'i tshig de nyid rab 'byor gyis bzlas nas de'i don zhib tu bstan
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bus rab 'byor la khyod ci'i phyir mngon par ma grub pa ma gtogs par gang byang chub tu spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de lta bu mi dmigs so zhes zer zhes dris pa'i tshig de nyid rab 'byor gyis bzlas nas de'i don zhib tu bstan
translated: This is the repetition of the question asked by ≈öƒÅriputra to Subh≈´ti above, ‚ÄúWhy do you say, ‚Äòexcept for the unproduced, one does not apprehend that kind of bodhisattva who would practice for enlightenment‚Äô?‚Äù and it is the detailed explanation of its meaning.

original: pa ste / don dam par mngon par ma grub pa zhes bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba tha dad du dbyer med de stong pa nyid du ro gcig par bstan pa'o//
analyzed: pa ste / don dam par mngon par ma grub pa zhes bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba tha dad du dbyer med de stong pa nyid du ro gcig par bstan pa'o//
translated: It teaches that ultimately the so-called unproduced and the so-called bodhisattva are undifferentiated, being of one taste in emptiness.

original: ji ltar mngon par 'grub pa dang byang chub sems dpa' gnyis don dam par stong pa nyid du ro gcig pas tha dad du dbyer med de /
analyzed: ji ltar mngon par 'grub pa dang byang chub sems dpa' gnyis don dam par stong pa nyid du ro gcig pas tha dad du dbyer med de /
translated: Just as the produced and the bodhisattva are undifferentiated in ultimate emptiness, being of one taste,

original: gnyis su byar med pa de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa phung po lnga nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du sbyar bar bya'o //üîΩtshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gang yang 'di skad du ci'i phyir na /
analyzed: gnyis su byar med pa de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa phung po lnga nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du sbyar bar bya'o // tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gang yang 'di skad du ci'i phyir na /
translated: In the same way, one should apply this to the five aggregates beginning with form up to the knowledge of all modes.

original: de ltar bstan pa'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gal te mi 'jigs mi dngang skrag par mi 'gyur na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod ces smras zhes zer  ba ni zhes byaüîΩba la sogs pa ni gong du /
analyzed: de ltar bstan pa'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gal te mi 'jigs mi dngang skrag par mi 'gyur na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod ces smras zhes zer  ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gong du /
translated: Venerable ≈öƒÅriputra, you have asked, ‚ÄúWhy is it said that when a bodhisattva great being is taught in this way, if he does not tremble, is not frightened or terrified, then a bodhisattva great being is practicing the perfection of wisdom?‚Äù

original: sh'a ri'i bus rab 'byor la khyod ci'i phyir /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bus rab 'byor la khyod ci'i phyir /
translated: In the above, ≈öƒÅriputra said to Subh≈´ti, ‚ÄúWhy is it that

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don zab mo de ltar bstan pa'i tshe /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don zab mo de ltar bstan pa'i tshe /
translated: when the profound meaning of the perfection of wisdom is taught in this way,

original: gal te mi 'jigs mi dngang skrag par mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te mi 'jigs mi dngang skrag par mi 'gyur na /
translated: if you do not tremble, are not frightened or terrified,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do  zhes smras zhes dris pa'i tshig rab 'byor gyis bzlas nas /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do  zhes smras zhes dris pa'i tshig rab 'byor gyis bzlas nas /
translated: Having repeated the question, Subhuti, you said, 'he practices the perfection of wisdom.'

original: de'i don zhib tu bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de'i don zhib tu bstan pa ste /
translated: What is the meaning of that?

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos thams cad byed pa med par yang dag par rjes su mthong la /üîΩchos thams @258a * //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos thams cad byed pa med par yang dag par rjes su mthong la / chos thams @258a * //
translated: The detailed explanation is: Thus, Venerable Subhuti, the Bodhisattva-mahƒÅsattva sees all phenomena as devoid of activity,üîΩand sees all phenomena as like a dream.

original: cad rmi lam dang 'dra bar yang dag par rjes su mthong zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni don dam par chos thams cad skye ba dang 'jig par byed pa'i rgyu gang yang med par rtogs nas /
analyzed: cad rmi lam dang 'dra bar yang dag par rjes su mthong zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni don dam par chos thams cad skye ba dang 'jig par byed pa'i rgyu gang yang med par rtogs nas /
translated: And so on. Having realized that ultimately there is no cause whatsoever that produces or destroys all phenomena,

original: rmi lam dang / sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / sgra brnyan dang / mig yor dang / sprul pa dang 'dra bar yang dag par rjes su mthong bas de'i phyir skye ba dang / 'jig pa med pa'i chos zab mo thos nas 'jigs shing skrag par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rmi lam dang / sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / sgra brnyan dang / mig yor dang / sprul pa dang 'dra bar yang dag par rjes su mthong bas de'i phyir skye ba dang / 'jig pa med pa'i chos zab mo thos nas 'jigs shing skrag par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Because they see them as like a dream, like an illusion, like a mirage, like an echo, like an apparition, like a reflection of the moon in water, and like a magical creation, therefore, when they hear the profound teaching of nonproduction and nonstopping, they are not afraid, not terrified, not fearful.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then venerable Subh≈´ti said to the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na /
translated: ‚ÄúLord, when bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

analyzed: chos de dag la yongs su rtog pa'i tshe 'di ni gzugs zhes bgyi bar gzugs la mi dmigs shing mi len mi gnas te mngon par zhen par mi bgyid la /
translated: do not apprehend form, do not take it up, do not settle down on it, and do not get definitively settled on it as ‚Äòthis is form,‚Äô

original: 'dogs par mi bgyid do zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gong du chos thams cad tha dad du dbyer med cing stong pa nyid du ro gcig par rtogs pa'i 'bras bu gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad la ma chags par gyur pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: 'dogs par mi bgyid do zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gong du chos thams cad tha dad du dbyer med cing stong pa nyid du ro gcig par rtogs pa'i 'bras bu gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad la ma chags par gyur pa bstan pa ste /
translated: The passage beginning I will not designate and so on teaches the result of the realization that all phenomena are undifferentiated and of the same taste in emptiness, namely, nonattachment to all phenomena such as form.

analyzed: chos de dag la 'di ltar yongs su rtog pa'i tshe zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos gong du smos pa de dag la stong pa nyid du ro gcig par yongs su rtog pa'i tshe zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: When one thoroughly investigates those phenomena in this way means when one thoroughly investigates those mundane and supramundane phenomena mentioned above as being of the same taste in emptiness.

original: 'di ni gzugs zhes bgyi bar gzugs la mi dmigs shing zhes bya ba ni 'du shes kyis mtshan mar mi 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gzugs zhes bgyi bar gzugs la mi dmigs shing zhes bya ba ni 'du shes kyis mtshan mar mi 'dzin pa'o //
translated: As for the passage beginning I will not apprehend form as form, one does not apprehend it as a sign through discriminations.

original: mi len zhes bya ba ni yid kyis dngos por mi rtog pa'o //
analyzed: mi len zhes bya ba ni yid kyis dngos por mi rtog pa'o //
translated: One does not grasp it means one does not conceive it as a thing with the intellect.

original: mi gnas te zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyis stong par rtogs nas de la mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: mi gnas te zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyis stong par rtogs nas de la mi gnas pa'o //
translated: One does not abide in it means that, having realized it to be empty with wisdom, one does not abide in it.

original: mngon par zhen par mi bgyid la zhes bya ba ni lta bas mngon par zhen par mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par zhen par mi bgyid la zhes bya ba ni lta bas mngon par zhen par mi byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúDo not settle down on it‚Äù means do not settle down on it through views.

original: 'dogs par mi bgyid do zhes bya ba ni tshig gis ming dang brngar  btags shing gzhan la mi ston to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dogs par mi bgyid do zhes bya ba ni tshig gis ming dang brngar  btags shing gzhan la mi ston to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúDo not designate it‚Äù means do not designate it with words, do not give it a name, and do not teach it to others.

original: de bzhin du tshor pa la sogs pa 'jig rten pa'i chos rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la thug gi par du spyar  bar bya'o //üîΩbcom ldan 'das gzhan yang byang @258b chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe 'di ni ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo zhes bgyi bar ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad la mi dmigs shing /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor pa la sogs pa 'jig rten pa'i chos rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la thug gi par du spyar  bar bya'o // bcom ldan 'das gzhan yang byang @258b chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe 'di ni ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo zhes bgyi bar ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad la mi dmigs shing /
translated: In the same way, the mundane dharmas such as feeling, up to the eighteen dharmas exclusive to a Buddha should be applied.

original: mi len mi gnas te mngon par zhen par mi bgyid la /
analyzed: mi len mi gnas te mngon par zhen par mi bgyid la /
translated: Moreover, Blessed One, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom, they do not settle down on, do not take up, do not stand in, and do not settle down on all the dhƒÅra·πáƒ´ gateways and meditative stabilization gateways, thinking, ‚ÄúThis is a dhƒÅra·πáƒ´ gateway‚Äù or ‚ÄúThis is a meditative stabilization gateway.‚Äù

original: 'dogs par mi bgyid do zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo dang / gzungs kyi sgor gyur pa'i yi ge aa la sogs pa yi ge'i 'bru rnams la yang mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing mngon par zhen par mi 'gyur ba bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'dogs par mi bgyid do zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo dang / gzungs kyi sgor gyur pa'i yi ge aa la sogs pa yi ge'i 'bru rnams la yang mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing mngon par zhen par mi 'gyur ba bstan pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúI will not designate‚Äù shows that he does not apprehend even the syllables of the letters such as A, which are the door of meditative stabilization and the door of dhƒÅra·πáƒ´, and does not become attached to them.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?
