analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Because when bodhisattva mahƒÅsattvas practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: gzugs yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de ltar gong du smos pa'i rim pas 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos thams cad la mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing mngon par ma chags pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de ltar gong du smos pa'i rim pas 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos thams cad la mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing mngon par ma chags pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: ‚Äúthey do not see form‚Äù and so on shows the reason why they do not apprehend and are not attached to all mundane and supramundane phenomena in the order mentioned above.

original: gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi par du chos de dag don dam par dngos po yod par ma grub bas dngos por yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ba'i phyir de dag la mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing mngon par ma
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi par du chos de dag don dam par dngos po yod par ma grub bas dngos por yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ba'i phyir de dag la mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing mngon par ma
translated: Because they do not see those phenomena, from form up to omniscience, as real things that exist ultimately, they do not apprehend them as signs and do not

original: chags so zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: chags so zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: become attached to them.

original: bcom ldan 'das de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Blessed One, why is that?

original: de ni 'di ltar gzugs kyi ma skyes pa gang lags pa de gzugs ma lags te /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar gzugs kyi ma skyes pa gang lags pa de gzugs ma lags te /
translated: Because the non-arising of form is not form.

original: de ltar na gzugs dang ma skyes pa de gnyis su ma mchis te /
analyzed: de ltar na gzugs dang ma skyes pa de gnyis su ma mchis te /
translated: Thus, form and non-arising are not two,üîΩand cannot be made two.

original: gnyis su bgyir ma mchis so zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gong du chos thams cad yang dag par rjes su ma mthong pas bshad pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis su bgyir ma mchis so zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gong du chos thams cad yang dag par rjes su ma mthong pas bshad pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: This and so forth explains the reason for not seeing any phenomena as real, as explained above.

original: don dam par gzugs ma skyes pa yin pas ma skyes pa la gzugs kyi rang bzhin med ba'i phyir yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ngo zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: don dam par gzugs ma skyes pa yin pas ma skyes pa la gzugs kyi rang bzhin med ba'i phyir yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ngo zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Since ultimately form is unarisen, and the nature of the unarisen is non-existent, therefore, it is said that ‚ÄúI do not see the perfect.‚Äù

original: de ltar na gzugs dang ma skyes pa de gnyis su ma mchis te /
analyzed: de ltar na gzugs dang ma skyes pa de gnyis su ma mchis te /
translated: Thus, form and non-arising are not two,üîΩand cannot be made two.

original: gnyis su bgyir ma mchis so zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang ma skyes pa gnyis don dam par dngos po med @259a * //
analyzed: gnyis su bgyir ma mchis so zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang ma skyes pa gnyis don dam par dngos po med @259a * //
translated: This means that form and non-arising are of one taste in ultimate non-entityness,

analyzed: par ro gcig pa'i phyir tha dad du dbyer med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: and therefore are not divisible into different things.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: bcom ldan 'das de ni 'di ltar ma skyes pa ni gcig ma lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ni 'di ltar ma skyes pa ni gcig ma lags /
translated: BhagavƒÅn, it is like this: non-arising is not one,

original: gnyis ma lags /
analyzed: gnyis ma lags /
translated: not two,

original: mang  ba ma lags /
analyzed: mang  ba ma lags /
translated: not many,üîΩand not different.

original: tha dad pa ma lags te zhes bya ba ni ma skyes pa zhes bya ba don dam par dngos po med pa la bya ste /
analyzed: tha dad pa ma lags te zhes bya ba ni ma skyes pa zhes bya ba don dam par dngos po med pa la bya ste /
translated: This means that what is called ‚Äúnon-arising‚Äù is ultimate non-entityness.

original: dngos po med pa la ni grangs kyis bgrang ba'am /
analyzed: dngos po med pa la ni grangs kyis bgrang ba'am /
translated: In non-entityness, there is no enumeration or

original: tha dad du dbyer med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: tha dad du dbyer med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: divisibility into different things.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: gzugs kyi ma skyes pa gang lags pa de gzugs ma lags so zhes bya ba ni ma skyes pa la gzugs kyi rang bzhin med pa'i phyir don mjug bsdus te bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi ma skyes pa gang lags pa de gzugs ma lags so zhes bya ba ni ma skyes pa la gzugs kyi rang bzhin med pa'i phyir don mjug bsdus te bstan pa'o //
translated: That non-arising of form is not form. This is the summary of the meaning taught: because the nature of form does not exist in non-arising.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du 'jig  rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos thams cad la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du 'jig  rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos thams cad la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Similarly, this should be applied to all mundane and supramundane dharmas, from feeling up to omniscience.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: BhagavƒÅn,

original: gzugs kyi 'grib pa gang lags pa de ni gzugs ma lags te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad don dam par dngos po yod pa ma yin pa las phyin ci log tu yod par brtags pa ni phyis gzhan du 'gyur
analyzed: gzugs kyi 'grib pa gang lags pa de ni gzugs ma lags te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad don dam par dngos po yod pa ma yin pa las phyin ci log tu yod par brtags pa ni phyis gzhan du 'gyur
translated: That decrease of form is not form. This and so on is said because all dharmas such as form and so on are imagined to exist in the opposite way from not being ultimately existent things. Later, they will change and deteriorate,

original: zhing nyams par 'gyur ba'i phyir 'grib pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhing nyams par 'gyur ba'i phyir 'grib pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: so they are called decrease.

original: de ltar yang dag par ma yin pa las kun brtags pa'i gzugs 'grib pa'i rang bzhin can de don dam par gzugs yang dag pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar yang dag par ma yin pa las kun brtags pa'i gzugs 'grib pa'i rang bzhin can de don dam par gzugs yang dag pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Thus, form that is imagined from what is not real has the nature of a shadow. That form is not real ultimately.

original: de ltar na gzugs dang 'grib pa de gnyis su ma mchis te /
analyzed: de ltar na gzugs dang 'grib pa de gnyis su ma mchis te /
translated: Thus, form and its shadow are not two.

original: gnyis su bgyir ma mchis so zhes bya ba ni don dam par de gnyis stong pa nyid du ro gcig pas tha dad du dbyer med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gnyis su bgyir ma mchis so zhes bya ba ni don dam par de gnyis stong pa nyid du ro gcig pas tha dad du dbyer med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: They are not divided into two. This means that ultimately they are the same in emptiness, and so they cannot be divided into different things.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bcom ldan 'das de ni 'di ltar 'grib pa ni gcig ma lags gnyis ma lags zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gnyis su med pa'i gtan tshigs bshad pa ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ni 'di ltar 'grib pa ni gcig ma lags gnyis ma lags zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gnyis su med pa'i gtan tshigs bshad pa ste /
translated: Blessed One, it is because a shadow is not one, not two, and so on. This explains the reason why there is no duality.

original: gzugs kyi dngos po med pa las phyin ci log ni yod par rtag pa 'grib pa'i rang bzhin can de ni don dam par dngos po yod pa ma yin pas gcig dang du ma la sogs par tha dad du dbyer med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi dngos po med pa las phyin ci log ni yod par rtag pa 'grib pa'i rang bzhin can de ni don dam par dngos po yod pa ma yin pas gcig dang du ma la sogs par tha dad du dbyer med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: The error in regard to the non-existence of the entity of form is the belief in existence, which has the nature of a diminution of permanence. Since that does not exist as an entity in the ultimate, it cannot be differentiated as one or many, etc.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba @259b la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos thams cad la sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba @259b la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos thams cad la sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should apply this to all dharmas, mundane and supramundane, from feeling, etc. up to the knowledge of all modes.üîΩThe Blessed One said: Subhuti, form is not one thing and illusion another, for illusion itself is form, and form itself is illusion.

original: bcom ldan 'das gang yang gzugs zhes bgyi ba 'di ni gnyis su ma mchis shing nyams pa ma mchis pa'i chos kyi grangs su bgyis pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzugs kyi phung po nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang yang gzugs zhes bgyi ba 'di ni gnyis su ma mchis shing nyams pa ma mchis pa'i chos kyi grangs su bgyis pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzugs kyi phung po nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du
translated: The Blessed One said: Subhuti, form is not one thing and emptiness another, for emptiness itself is form, and form itself is emptiness.

original: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos ming gis smos pa rnams kun rdzob tu gzugs so tshor ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs par gdams shing brjod pa tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos ming gis smos pa rnams kun rdzob tu gzugs so tshor ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs par gdams shing brjod pa tsam du zad kyi /
translated: The mundane and supramundane dharmas mentioned by name are merely instructed and expressed as form, feeling, etc., in the conventional sense.

original: don dam par ni de dag thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du ro gcig cing de bzhin nyid las nyams par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir gnyis su ma mchis shing nyams pa ma mchis pa'i chos kyi grangs su bgyis pa'o zhes /
analyzed: don dam par ni de dag thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du ro gcig cing de bzhin nyid las nyams par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir gnyis su ma mchis shing nyams pa ma mchis pa'i chos kyi grangs su bgyis pa'o zhes /
translated: In the ultimate sense, all of them are of one taste in the nature of non-entityness, and are not subject to degeneration from suchness, so they are counted as dharmas that are non-dual and not subject to degeneration.

original: bcom ldan 'das la rab 'byor gyis gsol pa ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la rab 'byor gyis gsol pa ste /
translated: This is what Subh≈´ti said to the Blessed One.

analyzed: grangs su bgyis pa'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis su med cing nyams pa med pa'i rang bzhin nam gnyis su med pa'i rang ris su gtogs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase counted as means that they belong to the category of the nature of non-duality and non-degeneration, or the nature of non-duality.

analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'bum pa rgya cher bshad pa las /
translated: In the Extensive Commentary on the Perfection of Wisdom in One Hundred Thousand Lines,

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod  pa na /
translated: ‚ÄúBlessed One, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

analyzed: chos de la 'di ltar yongs su rtog pa de'i tshe 'di ni gzugs zhes bgyi bar gzugs la mi dmigs shing mi len mi gnas te mngon par zhen par mi bgyid la /
translated: When thoroughly investigating that phenomenon, at that time, one does not apprehend form as 'this is form,' does not accept it, does not dwell on it, does not become fixated on it,

original: rang sangs rgyas ni rnam pa gnyis te /

analyzed: khyod kyis de skad du bshad pa'i don bdag gis 'jal te /
translated: He says, I understand the meaning of what you have explained thus.

original: de ltar chos thams cad ma skyes pa'i rang bzhin du ro gcig cing tha mi dad na /
analyzed: de ltar chos thams cad ma skyes pa'i rang bzhin du ro gcig cing tha mi dad na /
translated: If all phenomena are of one taste in being of the nature of non-arising and are not different,

original: chos gcig rtogs pas thams cad rtogs par 'gyur bas nyan thos la sogs pas rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu thob zin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tshig 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: chos gcig rtogs pas thams cad rtogs par 'gyur bas nyan thos la sogs pas rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu thob zin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tshig 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: then by realizing one phenomenon, all would be realized, and thus the sravakas and so forth would have already attained the fruits of stream enterer and so forth. This is to be connected with the passage that occurs below.

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa pa rnams kyis kyang rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid thob zin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa pa rnams kyis kyang rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid thob zin par 'gyur ro //
translated: The followers of the ≈örƒÅvakayƒÅna would have already attained the fruit of entering the stream, the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth, the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth, and arhatship.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa rnams kyis kyang rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub thob zin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa rnams kyis kyang rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub thob zin par 'gyur ro //
translated: The followers of the Pratyeka¬≠buddha¬≠yƒÅna would have already attained the awakening of a pratyekabuddha.üîΩThe bodhisattva mahƒÅsattvas would have already attained the knowledge of all aspects.‚Äù

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos kyang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob zin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni de ltar gong du bshad pa'i rim pas chos thams cad stong pa nyid du ro gcig ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos kyang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob zin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni de ltar gong du bshad pa'i rim pas chos thams cad stong pa nyid du ro gcig ste /
translated: In this way, all phenomena are of one taste in emptiness, as explained above.

original: tha mi dad na gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams dang / rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu rnams dang / rang byang chub dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnams stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du ro gcig ste /
analyzed: tha mi dad na gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams dang / rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu rnams dang / rang byang chub dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnams stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du ro gcig ste /
translated: If they are not different, then the results of stream enterer, once-returner, non-returner, and arhat, and also the state of a pratyekabuddha and the knowledge of all aspects, are the same taste in the nature of emptiness.

original: tha mi dad gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams mthong zhing rtogs pa nyid kyis rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu rnams kyang rtogs shing thob par 'gyur ba'i rigs na /
analyzed: tha mi dad gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams mthong zhing rtogs pa nyid kyis rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu rnams kyang rtogs shing thob par 'gyur ba'i rigs na /
translated: If it is reasonable that by seeing and realizing phenomena such as form, etc., the results of stream enterer, etc., are also realized and attained,

original: ci'i phyir de ltar mi 'gyur zhes sh'a ri'i bus rab 'byor la dris pa'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir de ltar mi 'gyur zhes sh'a ri'i bus rab 'byor la dris pa'o //
translated: why is that not so?

original: 'gro ba lnga rnams kyang tha mi dad par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni de ltar chos thams cad stong pa'i rang bzhin du ro gcig ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba lnga rnams kyang tha mi dad par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni de ltar chos thams cad stong pa'i rang bzhin du ro gcig ste /
translated: Up to ‚Äúthe five types of beings would not be different,‚Äù all phenomena are the same taste in the nature of emptiness.

original: tha mi dad na lha dang / mi dang dud 'gro dang yi dags dang / sems can dmyal ba'i 'gro ba 'di dag yang tha dad du dbyer med par 'gyur ro zhes smras pa'o //
analyzed: tha mi dad na lha dang / mi dang dud 'gro dang yi dags dang / sems can dmyal ba'i 'gro ba 'di dag yang tha dad du dbyer med par 'gyur ro zhes smras pa'o //
translated: If they are not different, then these transmigrations of gods, humans, animals, hungry ghosts, and hell beings would not be differentiated.üîΩThe bodhisattva great beings would have already attained the five types of awakening.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos kyang byang chub lnga thob zin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu bzhi dang / rang byang chub dang byang chub lnga po 'di rnams kyang bla na med pa'i byang chub dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos kyang byang chub lnga thob zin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu bzhi dang / rang byang chub dang byang chub lnga po 'di rnams kyang bla na med pa'i byang chub dang /
translated: The five types of awakening‚Äîthe four fruits of stream enterer and so on, and solitary realizers‚Äô awakening‚Äîwould be the same as unsurpassed awakening.

original: rang bzhin tha mi dad pas byang chub sems dpas byang chub lnga po de dag ma bsgoms ma bsgrubs par yang thob zin par @264a * //
analyzed: rang bzhin tha mi dad pas byang chub sems dpas byang chub lnga po de dag ma bsgoms ma bsgrubs par yang thob zin par @264a * //
translated: Since they are not different by nature, the bodhisattvas would have already attained those five types of awakening without having cultivated or accomplished them.

original: 'gyur ro zhes smras pa'o //
analyzed: 'gyur ro zhes smras pa'o //
translated: This is what you have said.

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gal te chos thams cad ma skyes pa yin na /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gal te chos thams cad ma skyes pa yin na /
translated: Venerable Subh≈´ti, if all phenomena are unarisen,

original: ci'i phyir na rgyun du zhugs pas ni kun du sbyor ba gsum spang pa'i phyir lam bsgoms zhes bya ba ni de ltar chos thams cad stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du gcig ste tha mi dad na nyan thos rgyun du zhugs pas kun du sbyor ba gsum
analyzed: ci'i phyir na rgyun du zhugs pas ni kun du sbyor ba gsum spang pa'i phyir lam bsgoms zhes bya ba ni de ltar chos thams cad stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du gcig ste tha mi dad na nyan thos rgyun du zhugs pas kun du sbyor ba gsum
translated: Why? Because the stream enterer cultivates the path in order to abandon the three fetters.

original: spang pa'i phyir 'phags pa'i lam bsgom du yang ci zhig yod ces smras pa ste /
analyzed: spang pa'i phyir 'phags pa'i lam bsgom du yang ci zhig yod ces smras pa ste /
translated: If all phenomena are the same in being empty, without distinction, then what is the point of the noble path that the stream enterer cultivates in order to abandon the three fetters?

original: kun du sbyor ba gsum ni 'jigs tshogs la lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom dang gsum mo //
analyzed: kun du sbyor ba gsum ni 'jigs tshogs la lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom dang gsum mo //
translated: The three fetters are the afflicted view of the self, holding a view to be paramount, and doubt.

original: de la 'jig tshogs la lta ba ni bdag tu lta ba ste /
analyzed: de la 'jig tshogs la lta ba ni bdag tu lta ba ste /
translated: The afflicted view of the self is the view of the self.

original: bdag tu lta ba la chags na gang zag la bdag med pa'i chos rnam par thar pa mi 'dod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba la chags na gang zag la bdag med pa'i chos rnam par thar pa mi 'dod par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one is attached to the view of the self, one will not aspire to the Dharma of the selflessness of persons, which is the door to liberation.

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin na tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs tsam gyis chog par 'dzin te /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin na tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs tsam gyis chog par 'dzin te /
translated: If one holds a view to be paramount, one will be satisfied with mere ethical discipline and ritual.

original: 'phags pa'i lam mi sgom par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam mi sgom par 'gyur ro //
translated: One does not cultivate the noble path.

original: the tshom gyis ni 'phags pa'i lam la yid gnyis za bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: the tshom gyis ni 'phags pa'i lam la yid gnyis za bar 'gyur te /
translated: One is doubtful about the noble path.

original: chos 'di gsum 'phags pa'i lam gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin la /
analyzed: chos 'di gsum 'phags pa'i lam gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin la /
translated: These three dharmas are adverse to the noble path.

original: 'khor ba rnams su skye bar sbyor ba rgyu yin pa'i phyir kun du sbyor ba zhes bya'o //üîΩlan cig phyir 'ong bas ni 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug srab pa'i phyir lam bsgom zhes bya ba ni de ltar chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin du tha mi dad na nyan thos lan cig phyir 'ong bas 'dod chags dang /
analyzed: 'khor ba rnams su skye bar sbyor ba rgyu yin pa'i phyir kun du sbyor ba zhes bya'o // lan cig phyir 'ong bas ni 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug srab pa'i phyir lam bsgom zhes bya ba ni de ltar chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin du tha mi dad na nyan thos lan cig phyir 'ong bas 'dod chags dang /
translated: They are called fetters because they are the cause of the connection with birth in the realms of sa·πÉsƒÅra.üîΩThe once-returner cultivates the path because of the weakness of attachment, aversion, and delusion.

original: zhe sdang dang / gti mug srab mor bya ba'i phyir 'phags pa'i lam sgom du yang ci zhig yod /
analyzed: zhe sdang dang / gti mug srab mor bya ba'i phyir 'phags pa'i lam sgom du yang ci zhig yod /
translated: Thus, if all dharmas are not different in being the nature of non-entityness, what noble path is there for the ≈õrƒÅvaka once-returner to cultivate in order to weaken attachment, aversion, and delusion?

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams mthong ba nyid kyis 'phags pa'i lam bsgoms zin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams mthong ba nyid kyis 'phags pa'i lam bsgoms zin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that because of seeing dharmas such as form, the noble path has already been cultivated.

original: phyir mi 'ong bas ni don dam pa ma yin pa'i cha can gyi kun du sbyor ba lnga spang ba'i phyir lam bsgoms zhes bya ba ni de ltar chos thams cad skye ba med cing stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du tha mi dad na /üîΩdam pa ma yin pa'i cha can gyi kun du sbyor ba lnga spang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong bas ni don dam pa ma yin pa'i cha can gyi kun du sbyor ba lnga spang ba'i phyir lam bsgoms zhes bya ba ni de ltar chos thams cad skye ba med cing stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du tha mi dad na / dam pa ma yin pa'i cha can gyi kun du sbyor ba lnga spang ba'i phyir /
translated: The nonreturner cultivates the path in order to abandon the five fetters that are not of the nature of the ultimate.üîΩThe nonreturner cultivates the path in order to abandon the five fetters that are not of the nature of the ultimate.

original: 'phags pa'i lam bsgom mi dgos so zhes smras pa ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam bsgom mi dgos so zhes smras pa ste /
translated: It is not necessary to cultivate the noble path in order to abandon the five fetters that are not of the nature of the ultimate.

original: dam pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams la bya ste /
analyzed: dam pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams la bya ste /
translated: What is called ‚Äúnot of the nature of the ultimate‚Äù refers to the desire realm,

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams gong ma gnyis pas ngan cing dman pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams gong ma gnyis pas ngan cing dman pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the two higher realms of form and formlessness are superior and inferior to it.

original: dam pa ma yin pa'i cha can gyi kun tu sbyor ba lnga zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams su gtogs pa'i @264b nyon mongs pa lnga la bya ste /
analyzed: dam pa ma yin pa'i cha can gyi kun tu sbyor ba lnga zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams su gtogs pa'i @264b nyon mongs pa lnga la bya ste /
translated: The five fetters that are not of the nature of the ultimate refer to the five afflictions belonging to the desire realm.

original: kun du sbyor ba lnga ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang / gnod sems dang lnga'o //
analyzed: kun du sbyor ba lnga ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang / gnod sems dang lnga'o //
translated: the desire for desire-realm objects, and malice.

original: kun du sbyor ba'i don ni sngar bshad pa bzhin no //üîΩdgra bcom pas ni bla ma'i cha can gyi kun du sbyor ba rnams spang ba'i phyir lam bsgoms zhes bya ba ni de ltar chos thams cad skye ba med cing stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin ni tha mi dad na 'phags pa dgra bcom pas gzugs dang /
analyzed: kun du sbyor ba'i don ni sngar bshad pa bzhin no // dgra bcom pas ni bla ma'i cha can gyi kun du sbyor ba rnams spang ba'i phyir lam bsgoms zhes bya ba ni de ltar chos thams cad skye ba med cing stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin ni tha mi dad na 'phags pa dgra bcom pas gzugs dang /
translated: The meaning of fetter is as explained above.üîΩThe arhat cultivates the path in order to abandon the fetters associated with the higher realms.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams kyi nyon mongs pa rnams spang ba'i phyir 'phags pa'i lam bsgom du yang ci zhig yod ces smras pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams kyi nyon mongs pa rnams spang ba'i phyir 'phags pa'i lam bsgom du yang ci zhig yod ces smras pa ste /
translated: Since all phenomena are unborn and the nature of emptiness is undifferentiated, what noble arhat would cultivate the noble path in order to abandon the afflictions of the form and formless realms?

original: bla ma'i cha can gyi kun du sbyor ba zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams kyi nyon mongs pa lnga la bya ste /
analyzed: bla ma'i cha can gyi kun du sbyor ba zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams kyi nyon mongs pa lnga la bya ste /
translated: The fetters associated with the higher realms refer to the five afflictions of the form and formless realms.

original: de dag kyang gzugs kyi khams kyi 'dod chags dang / gzugs med pa'i khams kyi 'dod chags dang / rgod pa dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa rnams te kun du sbyor ba'i don ni sngar bshad pa bzhin no //üîΩrang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la zhugs pas ni rang byang chub kyi don du lam bsgoms zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rang sangs rgyas kyis rang byang chub kyi 'bras bu thob par bya ba'i phyir lam bsgom pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems can gyi don du dka' ba spyad pa dang /
analyzed: de dag kyang gzugs kyi khams kyi 'dod chags dang / gzugs med pa'i khams kyi 'dod chags dang / rgod pa dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa rnams te kun du sbyor ba'i don ni sngar bshad pa bzhin no // rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la zhugs pas ni rang byang chub kyi don du lam bsgoms zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rang sangs rgyas kyis rang byang chub kyi 'bras bu thob par bya ba'i phyir lam bsgom pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems can gyi don du dka' ba spyad pa dang /
translated: These are the attachment to the form realm, the attachment to the formless realm, agitation, pride, and ignorance. The meaning of fetter is as explained above.üîΩThose who have entered the vehicle of the solitary realizers cultivate the path for the sake of the awakening of a solitary realizers, and so on. The solitary realizers cultivate the path in order to attain the fruit of a solitary realizers‚Äô awakening. The bodhisattvas undergo hardships for the sake of sentient beings.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas bla na med pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs pas sangs rgyas par bya ba dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor du yang ci zhig yod ces smras pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas bla na med pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs pas sangs rgyas par bya ba dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor du yang ci zhig yod ces smras pa'o //
translated: The Thus-Gone One has fully awakened to unsurpassed awakening and become a buddha, and so on.

original: de skad ces smras pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis /
analyzed: de skad ces smras pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis /
translated: When this was said, the venerable Subh≈´ti

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so zhes bya ba nas /
translated: To the venerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra,  and so on, up to

original: ma skyes pa la rang sangs rgyas yod par mi 'dod do //
analyzed: ma skyes pa la rang sangs rgyas yod par mi 'dod do //
translated: I do not accept that a pratyekabuddha exists in the unborn.üîΩ I do not accept that pratyekabuddhahood exists.

original: rang byang chub yod par mi 'dod do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni nyan thos rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs par gdags shing rnam par gzhag pa ni kun rdzob kyi tha snyad tsam du gdags par zad kyi don dam par de dag yod par mi 'dod doüîΩzhes bstan pa ste /
analyzed: rang byang chub yod par mi 'dod do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni nyan thos rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs par gdags shing rnam par gzhag pa ni kun rdzob kyi tha snyad tsam du gdags par zad kyi don dam par de dag yod par mi 'dod do zhes bstan pa ste /
translated: It is taught that the designations and presentations of the stream-enterers and so on of the Hearers are merely conventional designations and terminologies. It is taught that ultimately they are not accepted as existing.üîΩIt is taught that attainment and realization are also not accepted as ultimately existing.

original: 'thob pa dang khong du chud pa zhes bya ba la 'thob pa ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa 'thob par bya ba la bya'o //
analyzed: 'thob pa dang khong du chud pa zhes bya ba la 'thob pa ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa 'thob par bya ba la bya'o //
translated: Attainment refers to the attainment of the fruits of stream-entry and so on.

original: khong du chud pa ni 'phags pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin rtogs pa la bya ste /
analyzed: khong du chud pa ni 'phags pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin rtogs pa la bya ste /
translated: Realization refers to the realization of the nature of the noble path.

original: don dam par 'thob pa dang / khong du chud pa de dag kyang yod par mi 'dod do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: don dam par 'thob pa dang / khong du chud pa de dag kyang yod par mi 'dod do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: It is taught that ultimately, those attainments and realizations are not accepted as existing.

original: tshe dang ldan @265a * //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan @265a * //
translated: To the venerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra,  and so on, up to

original: pa sha ra dva ti'i bu bdag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dka' ba spyad pa spyod pa yod par mi 'dod do zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pas dka' ba spyad pa'i dngos po yod
analyzed: pa sha ra dva ti'i bu bdag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dka' ba spyad pa spyod pa yod par mi 'dod do zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pas dka' ba spyad pa'i dngos po yod
translated: ‚ÄúO PƒÅ·π£a·πá·∏ça, I do not assert that bodhisattva mahƒÅsattvas practice austerities.‚ÄùüîΩüîΩThis is because the bodhisattva who has attained acceptance of the fact that phenomena are not produced does not have the thing called ‚Äúausterities.‚Äù

original: par mi lta ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: par mi lta ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The passage, O son of the conqueror, I do not accept that the bodhisattva-mahƒÅsattva practices austerities, is because the bodhisattva who has attained acceptance of the non-arising of dharmas does not view the existence of austerities.

original: don de nyid gsal bar bstan pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yang dka' ba spyod pa'i 'du shes kyis mi spyod do zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad de /
analyzed: don de nyid gsal bar bstan pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yang dka' ba spyod pa'i 'du shes kyis mi spyod do zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad de /
translated: To clarify that meaning, it is explained, The bodhisattva-mahƒÅsattva does not practice with the notion of austerities, and so on.

original: don dam par dka' ba spyad pa'i dngos po yod par mi lta ba dang / kun rdzob tu yang snying rje chen pos sems can thams cad la pha ma la sogs pa'i 'du shes bskyed pas dka' ba'i 'du shes mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: don dam par dka' ba spyad pa'i dngos po yod par mi lta ba dang / kun rdzob tu yang snying rje chen pos sems can thams cad la pha ma la sogs pa'i 'du shes bskyed pas dka' ba'i 'du shes mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: It teaches that ultimately, because he does not view the existence of austerities, and conventionally, because he generates the notion of all sentient beings as his parents and so on through great compassion, the notion of austerity does not arise.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni 'di ltar sems bskyed de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni 'di ltar sems bskyed de /
translated: The bodhisattva-mahƒÅsattva generates the following thought:

original: de ltar bdag bdag ces bya ba yang de ni thams cad rnam pa thams cad du med cing mi dmigs pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: de ltar bdag bdag ces bya ba yang de ni thams cad rnam pa thams cad du med cing mi dmigs pa de bzhin du /
translated: Thus, the so-called self is totally and utterly nonexistent and unobservable.üîΩIn the same way, one should develop the perception that all outer and inner phenomena are like that.üîΩAnd even though one develops that perception, one should not develop the perception of difficulty.

original: phyi nang gi chos rnams la yang 'du shes bskyed de de ltar 'du shes bskyed kyang dka' pa'i 'du shes mi skyed do zhes bya ba ni don dam par chos thams cad dmigs su med par rtogs pas dka' ba'i 'du shes mi skye ba'i thabs bstan pa ste
analyzed: phyi nang gi chos rnams la yang 'du shes bskyed de de ltar 'du shes bskyed kyang dka' pa'i 'du shes mi skyed do zhes bya ba ni don dam par chos thams cad dmigs su med par rtogs pas dka' ba'i 'du shes mi skye ba'i thabs bstan pa ste
translated: This teaches the method for not developing the perception of difficulty by realizing that ultimately all phenomena are unobservable.

original: / mu stegs can gyis bdag tu brtags pa rnams gang zag la bdag med par rtogs pa'i tshe bdag tu brtags pa de dag thams cad rnam pa thams cad du yong ye med pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: / mu stegs can gyis bdag tu brtags pa rnams gang zag la bdag med par rtogs pa'i tshe bdag tu brtags pa de dag thams cad rnam pa thams cad du yong ye med pa de bzhin du /
translated: When the self imputed by the tƒ´rthikas is realized to be the absence of self in the person, all those imputations of self are totally and utterly nonexistent.

original: chos la bdag med par rtogs pa'i tshe yang phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa phyi nang gi chos rnams kyang rnam pa thams cad du med cing mi dmigs par shes par byas la dka' ba'i 'du shes kyang mi skyed do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: chos la bdag med par rtogs pa'i tshe yang phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa phyi nang gi chos rnams kyang rnam pa thams cad du med cing mi dmigs par shes par byas la dka' ba'i 'du shes kyang mi skyed do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: When one realizes the selflessness of phenomena, one should also understand that all outer and inner phenomena, such as the aggregates, elements, and sense spheres, do not exist at all and are not apprehended, and one should not generate the idea of difficulty.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩ'di ltar de ni chos gang yang mi lan mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dka' ba'i 'du shes mi skye ba'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / 'di ltar de ni chos gang yang mi lan mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dka' ba'i 'du shes mi skye ba'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: Why is that?üîΩBecause one does not apprehend any phenomenon at all. This teaches the reason why one does not generate the idea of difficulty.

original: don dam par dka' ba'i 'du shes skye bar 'gyur ba'i chos gang yang mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: don dam par dka' ba'i 'du shes skye bar 'gyur ba'i chos gang yang mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Because one does not apprehend any phenomenon at all, one does not apprehend any phenomenon as a sign of the generation of the idea of difficulty.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu bdag ni ma skyes pa la de bzhin gshegs pa yod par mi 'dod do //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu bdag ni ma skyes pa la de bzhin gshegs pa yod par mi 'dod do //
translated: Venerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra, I do not assert that the TathƒÅgata exists in non-arising.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyang yod par mi 'dod do zhes bya ba ni don dam par chos thams cad ma skyes pa /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyang yod par mi 'dod do zhes bya ba ni don dam par chos thams cad ma skyes pa /
translated: The phrase they do not assert that even unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment exists indicates that ultimately they do not assert that any thing exists, because all phenomena are unarisen,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyang ma skyes pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir dngos po @265b yod par mi 'dod do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyang ma skyes pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir dngos po @265b yod par mi 'dod do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: and the TathƒÅgata and unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment have the nature of being unarisen.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba ltar na /üîΩma skyes pa'i chos kyis 'thob pa'am 'thob par bya ba med do zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis chos thams cad thog ma nas ma skyes pa'o zhes bshad pa dang sbyar na don dam par ma skyes pa'i chos kyis rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'i
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba ltar na / ma skyes pa'i chos kyis 'thob pa'am 'thob par bya ba med do zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis chos thams cad thog ma nas ma skyes pa'o zhes bshad pa dang sbyar na don dam par ma skyes pa'i chos kyis rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'i
translated: The phrase just as the TathƒÅgata turns the wheel of the dharma indicates thatüîΩthere is no attainment or knower of an unarisen dharma in the sense that ultimately, because all phenomena are primordially unarisen,

original: 'bras bu thob par byed pa'ang ma skyes la /
analyzed: 'bras bu thob par byed pa'ang ma skyes la /
translated: there is no attainment of the results of stream enterer and so on by an unarisen dharma.

original: thob par bya ba'i 'bras bu de rnams kyang ma skyes pa'i phyir 'thob pa'am 'thob par bya ba med do zhes bya bstan pa'o //
analyzed: thob par bya ba'i 'bras bu de rnams kyang ma skyes pa'i phyir 'thob pa'am 'thob par bya ba med do zhes bya bstan pa'o //
translated: And those results to be obtained are not obtained or to be obtained because they are not produced.üîΩThe elder Subh≈´ti, do you assert that the obtained and the to-be-obtained are produced things?üîΩOr do you assert that the obtained and the to-be-obtained are unproduced things?üîΩOr do you assert that the obtained and the to-be-obtained are unproduced things?üîΩOr do you assert that the obtained and the to-be-obtained are unproduced things?

analyzed: smras pa tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor khyod chos skyes pas 'thob pa dang / 'thob par bya ba 'dod dam zhes bya ba'i rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'i gang zag rnams dngos po yod pas rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin thob bar 'dod dam zhes sh'a ri'i bus rab 'byor la dris pa'o
translated: Or do you assert that the obtained and the to-be-obtained are unproduced things?üîΩOr do you assert that the obtained and the to-be-obtained are unproduced things?üîΩOr do you assert that the obtained and the to-be-obtained are unproduced things?üîΩOr do you assert that the obtained and the to-be-obtained are unproduced things?üîΩOr do you assert that the obtained and the to-be-obtained are unproduced things?üîΩOr do you assert that the obtained and the to-be-obtained are unproduced things?üîΩOr do you assert that the obtained and the to-be-obtained are unproduced things?üîΩOr do you assert that the obtained and the to-be-obtained are unproduced things?üîΩOr do you assert that the obtained and the to-be-obtained are unproduced things?üîΩOr do you assert that the obtained and the to-be-obtained are unproduced things?üîΩOr do you assert that the obtained and the to-be-obtained are unproduced things?üîΩOr do you assert that the obtained and the to-be-obtained are unproduced things?üîΩOr do you assert that the obtained and the to-be-obtained are unproduced things?üîΩOr do you assert that the obtained and the to-be-obtained are unproduced things?üîΩOr do you assert that the obtained and the to-be-obtained are unproduced things?üîΩOr do you assert that the obtained and the to-be-obtained are unproduced things?

original: // 'on tam ma skyes pa'i chos kyis 'thob bar 'dod ces bya ba ni rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'i gang zag dngos po med pa zhig gis rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa dngos po yod pa rnams 'thob par 'dod ces dris pa ste /
analyzed: // 'on tam ma skyes pa'i chos kyis 'thob bar 'dod ces bya ba ni rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'i gang zag dngos po med pa zhig gis rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa dngos po yod pa rnams 'thob par 'dod ces dris pa ste /
translated: Or do you assert that the obtained and the to-be-obtained are unproduced things?üîΩOr do you assert that the obtained and the to-be-obtained are unproduced things?

original: dngos po yod pas dngos po med pa 'thob pa dang / dngos po med pas dngos po yod pa 'thob pa gnyi ga la yang mi rigs par mthong nas gal bzung ste dris pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po yod pas dngos po med pa 'thob pa dang / dngos po med pas dngos po yod pa 'thob pa gnyi ga la yang mi rigs par mthong nas gal bzung ste dris pa'o //
translated: Seeing that it is not tenable that either a non-existent thing is attained through an existent thing or an existent thing is attained through a non-existent thing, he takes up a position and questions him.

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subh≈´ti said,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu bdag ni de ltar mi 'dod do //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu bdag ni de ltar mi 'dod do //
translated: Venerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra, I do not assert that.üîΩI do not assert that a non-arisen thing is attained.

original: ma skyes pa'i chos kyis kyang 'thob par mi 'dod do zhes bya ba ni dngos po yod pas dngos po med pa 'thob pa dang / dngos po med pas dngos po yod pa 'thob pa gnyi ga yang mi rigs pas de ltar mi 'dod do zhes smras pa'o //
analyzed: ma skyes pa'i chos kyis kyang 'thob par mi 'dod do zhes bya ba ni dngos po yod pas dngos po med pa 'thob pa dang / dngos po med pas dngos po yod pa 'thob pa gnyi ga yang mi rigs pas de ltar mi 'dod do zhes smras pa'o //
translated: This is saying that since it is not tenable that either a non-existent thing is attained through an existent thing or an existent thing is attained through a non-existent thing, he says, ‚ÄúI do not assert that.‚Äù

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor 'o na thob pa med pa /
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor 'o na thob pa med pa /
translated: He said, ‚ÄúVenerable Subh≈´ti, then is there no attainment,

original: mngon par rtogs pa med dam zhes bya ba ni de ltar rnam pa gnyi gar mi 'dod na rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'i gang zag rnams kyis rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa 'thob pa dang / lam sgom zhing mngon par rtogs pa yang med dam zhes dris pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa med dam zhes bya ba ni de ltar rnam pa gnyi gar mi 'dod na rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'i gang zag rnams kyis rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa 'thob pa dang / lam sgom zhing mngon par rtogs pa yang med dam zhes dris pa'o //
translated: The question Is there no realization? means, if one does not accept either of the two aspects, then there is no attainment of the fruit of stream-entry, etc. by the person who is a stream-enterer, etc., and there is no realization of the path by cultivating it.

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subh≈´ti said:

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu 'thob pa yang yod mngon par rtogs pa yang yod pa de de gnyis kyis ni /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu 'thob pa yang yod mngon par rtogs pa yang yod pa de de gnyis kyis ni /
translated: Venerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra, there is attainment and there is realization, but not by those two.

original: ma yin gyi zhes bya ba ni 'thob pa dang mngon par rtogs pa dag nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa spong ba tsam la 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du btags pa tsam du yod par @266a * //
analyzed: ma yin gyi zhes bya ba ni 'thob pa dang mngon par rtogs pa dag nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa spong ba tsam la 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du btags pa tsam du yod par @266a * //
translated: This shows that attainment and realization exist as mere designations in conventional terms, as the mere abandonment of the afflictive and cognitive obstructions,

original: 'dod kyi / dngos po yod pas med pa 'thob pa dang / dngos po med pas yod pa 'thob pa gnyis kyi tshul gyis ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod kyi / dngos po yod pas med pa 'thob pa dang / dngos po med pas yod pa 'thob pa gnyis kyi tshul gyis ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: but not in the manner of attaining non-existence through existence or attaining existence through non-existence.

original: don de nyid gsal bar bshad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don de nyid gsal bar bshad pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to clarify that meaning,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu 'thob pa'ang mngon par rtogs pa ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyis gdags pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan te /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu 'thob pa'ang mngon par rtogs pa ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyis gdags pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan te /
translated: the passage beginning with ‚ÄúVenerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra, attainment and clear realization are also designated by worldly convention‚Äù is taught.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i gang zag la sogs pa 'thob par byed pa rnams dang rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa 'thob par bya ba rnams ni kun rdzob tu btags pa tsam du zad kyi don dam par yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i gang zag la sogs pa 'thob par byed pa rnams dang rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa 'thob par bya ba rnams ni kun rdzob tu btags pa tsam du zad kyi don dam par yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: The passage teaches that those who attain the person who is a stream enterer and so on and the attainments such as the fruit of stream entry are mere conventional designations and do not exist ultimately.

original: smras pa tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor thob pa dang / mngon par rtogs par bya ba 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du yod pa de bzhin du 'gro ba lnga dag kyang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du tha dad du yod kyi /
analyzed: smras pa tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor thob pa dang / mngon par rtogs par bya ba 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du yod pa de bzhin du 'gro ba lnga dag kyang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du tha dad du yod kyi /
translated: ≈öƒÅriputra said, ‚ÄúVenerable Subh≈´ti, just as attainment and clear realization exist as worldly conventions, so the five types of beings also exist as different things in worldly conventions.

original: don dam par ma yin nam zhes bya ba ni gong du 'gro ba lnga rnams kyang tha mi dad par 'gyur ro zhes brgal ba'i don zhib tu bshad pa'i gleng bslang ba'i phyir /üîΩji ltar thob pa dang mngon par rtogs pa 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du yod kyi /
analyzed: don dam par ma yin nam zhes bya ba ni gong du 'gro ba lnga rnams kyang tha mi dad par 'gyur ro zhes brgal ba'i don zhib tu bshad pa'i gleng bslang ba'i phyir / ji ltar thob pa dang mngon par rtogs pa 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du yod kyi /
translated: The phrase ultimately, is for the purpose of explaining in detail the point of the objection raised above, namely, that the five destinies would not be different.

original: don dam par med par de bzhin du 'gro ba lnga yang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du tha dad kyi don dam par tha mi dad dam zhes dris pa'o //
analyzed: don dam par med par de bzhin du 'gro ba lnga yang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du tha dad kyi don dam par tha mi dad dam zhes dris pa'o //
translated: The question is: Just as attainment and clear realization exist conventionally, but not ultimately, in the same way, are the five destinies also different conventionally, but not ultimately?

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu de de bzhin te /
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu de de bzhin te /
translated: The reply is: Venerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra, it is so!üîΩ Just as attainment and clear realization exist conventionally, but not ultimately, in the same way, the five destinies are also different conventionally, but not ultimately.

original: ji ltar thob pa dang / mngon par rtogs pa 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du yod pa de bzhin du 'gro ba lnga dag kyang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du tha dad kyi don dam par ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni don dam par de dag thams cad ma skyes pa'i rang
analyzed: ji ltar thob pa dang / mngon par rtogs pa 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du yod pa de bzhin du 'gro ba lnga dag kyang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du tha dad kyi don dam par ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni don dam par de dag thams cad ma skyes pa'i rang
translated: This means that ultimately all of these are not produced, and therefore they are not different.

original: bzhin du ro gcig pas tha dad du dbyer med pa las kun rdzob tu sems can rnams drang zhing bkri ba'i phyir ming dang mtshan mar bzung zhing tha snyad du btags pa tsam du zad do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bzhin du ro gcig pas tha dad du dbyer med pa las kun rdzob tu sems can rnams drang zhing bkri ba'i phyir ming dang mtshan mar bzung zhing tha snyad du btags pa tsam du zad do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: In the same way, because of being of one taste, they are not different and cannot be divided. For the sake of guiding and leading sentient beings on the conventional level, they are merely designated with names and characteristics and are mere conventional designations.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu don dam par ni las kyang med /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu don dam par ni las kyang med /
translated: Venerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra, ultimately there is no karma,

original: las kyi rnam par smin pa yang med skye ba yang med /
analyzed: las kyi rnam par smin pa yang med skye ba yang med /
translated: there is no ripening of karma, there is no birth,

original: 'gag pa yang med /
analyzed: 'gag pa yang med /
translated: there is no cessation,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa 'ang med /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa 'ang med /
translated: there is no affliction,üîΩand there is no purification.

original: rnam par byang ba'ang med do zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba lnga rnams don dam par tha mi dad pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'ang med do zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba lnga rnams don dam par tha mi dad pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: This teaches the reason why, ultimately, the five types of beings are not different.

original: 'gro ba lnga zhes bya ba ni las legs par spyad pa dang / nyes par spyad pa'i rnam par smin pa las lha dang / mi dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dags dang / sems can dmyal ba dang lngar tha dad du dbye zhing gdags @266b pa tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: 'gro ba lnga zhes bya ba ni las legs par spyad pa dang / nyes par spyad pa'i rnam par smin pa las lha dang / mi dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dags dang / sems can dmyal ba dang lngar tha dad du dbye zhing gdags @266b pa tsam du zad kyi /
translated: The so-called five destinies are merely differentiated and designated as five: gods, humans, animals, hungry ghosts, and hell beings, due to the maturation of good and bad karma.

original: don dam par ni las dang las kyi rnam par smin pa la sogs pa med pas na 'gro ba lnga tha dad du dbyer med do zhes bstan pa'o //üîΩsmras pa tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ma skyes pa'i chos skye bar 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: don dam par ni las dang las kyi rnam par smin pa la sogs pa med pas na 'gro ba lnga tha dad du dbyer med do zhes bstan pa'o // smras pa tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ma skyes pa'i chos skye bar 'gyur ba'am /
translated: But ultimately, since karma, the maturation of karma, and so on do not exist, the five destinies cannot be differentiated.üîΩ≈öƒÅriputra said, ‚ÄúVenerable Subh≈´ti, do unarisen phenomena arise,üîΩor do arisen phenomena arise?‚Äù

original: 'on tam skyes pa'i chos skye bar 'gyur ram zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams ma skyes pa las kyang mi skye ba dang / skyes pa las mi skye ba'i gtan tshigs zhib tu 'chad du gzhug pa'i phyir sh'a ri'i bus rab 'byor la dris pa ste /
analyzed: 'on tam skyes pa'i chos skye bar 'gyur ram zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams ma skyes pa las kyang mi skye ba dang / skyes pa las mi skye ba'i gtan tshigs zhib tu 'chad du gzhug pa'i phyir sh'a ri'i bus rab 'byor la dris pa ste /
translated: ≈öƒÅriputra asked Subh≈´ti to explain in detail the reasons why mundane and supramundane phenomena do not arise from the unarisen and do not arise from the arisen.

original: ma skyes pa'i chos ni dngos po med pa ste /
analyzed: ma skyes pa'i chos ni dngos po med pa ste /
translated: An unarisen phenomenon is a non-entity,

original: ri bong gi rva dang 'dra bas skye bar 'gyur ba'i mi rigs pa dang / skyes pa'i chos ni dngos po yod par gyur zin pas gdod skye mi dgos pa'i phyir de skad dris pa'o //
analyzed: ri bong gi rva dang 'dra bas skye bar 'gyur ba'i mi rigs pa dang / skyes pa'i chos ni dngos po yod par gyur zin pas gdod skye mi dgos pa'i phyir de skad dris pa'o //
translated: like the horn of a rabbit. Therefore, it is not reasonable that it should arise. And a arisen phenomenon is already an existent entity, so it does not need to arise again.

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subh≈´ti said,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu bdag ni ma skyes pa'i chos kyang skye bar mi 'dod /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu bdag ni ma skyes pa'i chos kyang skye bar mi 'dod /
translated: Venerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra, I do not assert that an unarisen phenomenon arises,üîΩnor do I assert that an arisen phenomenon arises.

original: skyes pa'i chos kyang skye bar mi 'dod do zhes bya ba ni don dam par skyes pa dang ma skyes pa gnyi ga rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i phyir gnyi ga yang skye bar mi 'dod do zhes mdor smras pa'o //
analyzed: skyes pa'i chos kyang skye bar mi 'dod do zhes bya ba ni don dam par skyes pa dang ma skyes pa gnyi ga rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i phyir gnyi ga yang skye bar mi 'dod do zhes mdor smras pa'o //
translated: This is a brief statement: ultimately, neither an arisen nor an unarisen phenomenon is asserted to arise because both are empty of inherent nature.

original: smras pa tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ma skyes pa'i chos skye bar mi 'dod pa gang yin zhes bya ba ni ma skyes pa'i chos zhes bya ba gang yin pa ming gis smos te 'chad du gzhug pa'i skabs dbye ba'i phyir sh'a ri'i bus rab 'byor la
analyzed: smras pa tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ma skyes pa'i chos skye bar mi 'dod pa gang yin zhes bya ba ni ma skyes pa'i chos zhes bya ba gang yin pa ming gis smos te 'chad du gzhug pa'i skabs dbye ba'i phyir sh'a ri'i bus rab 'byor la
translated: ≈öƒÅriputra asked Subh≈´ti, Venerable Subh≈´ti, what is it that you do not assert is the arising of an unarisen phenomenon?

translated: The passage from ‚ÄúVenerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´¬≠putra, I do not assert that the origination of the knowledge of all aspects‚Äù up to ‚ÄúI do not assert that the origination of the knowledge of all aspects is essentially empty‚Äù is the answer to the question, ‚ÄúWhat is it that you do not assert to be originated?‚ÄùüîΩIt teaches that all the worldly phenomena, such as the five aggregates, and all the supramundane phenomena, such as the six perfections, up to the knowledge of all aspects,

analyzed: de'i 'og tu skye ba zhes bya ba dang / mi skye ba zhes bya ba'i chos nyid kyang skye ba med par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: then, after that, in order to show that the reality called arising and the reality called non-arising are also non-arisen,

analyzed: smras pa tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor skye ba skye'am /
translated: it is said: ‚ÄúVenerable Subh≈´ti, does arising arise,

analyzed: 'on tam mi skye ba skye zhes bya ba sh'a ri'i bus rab 'byor la dris pa'o //
translated: or does non-arising arise?‚Äù This is ≈öƒÅriputra‚Äôs question to Subh≈´ti.

original: smras pa tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu skye ba yang mi skye /
analyzed: smras pa tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu skye ba yang mi skye /

original: mi skye ba yang mi skye'o zhes bya ba ni skye ba dang mi skye ba zhes bya ba de dag kun rdzob tu tha snyad tsam du brjod du zad kyi /

analyzed: don dam par de gnyi ga yang dngos po yod par ma grub pas mi skye'o zhes bstan pa'o //

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu 'di ltar skye ba gang yin pa dang / skye ba med pa gang yin pa'i chos de gnyi ga yang ldan pa yang ma yin / mi ldan pa yang ma yin /
translated: Venerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra, it is because both the phenomena of arising and non-arising are neither conjoined nor disjoined.

original: gzugs med pa bltar med pa /
analyzed: gzugs med pa bltar med pa /
translated: They are formless, invisible,

original: thogs pa med pa ste /
analyzed: thogs pa med pa ste /
translated: and non-resistant.üîΩThey are of a single mark, which is to say, the mark of no mark.

original: 'di ltar mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig pa dag go zhes bya ba ni skye ba dang mi skye ba zhes bya ba'i chos de dag don dam par dngos po yod par ma grub cing mi skye ba'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /üîΩldan pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni sems las byung ba'i dngos po bltar yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig pa dag go zhes bya ba ni skye ba dang mi skye ba zhes bya ba'i chos de dag don dam par dngos po yod par ma grub cing mi skye ba'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste / ldan pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni sems las byung ba'i dngos po bltar yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: This teaches the reason for non-arising, namely, that those phenomena called ‚Äúarising‚Äù and ‚Äúnon-arising‚Äù are not ultimately established as existent things.üîΩ‚ÄúThey are neither conjoined‚Äù teaches that the things that are mental factors are not visible.

original: mi ldan pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni sems dang @267b mi ldan pa'i 'du byed kyi dngos po bltar yod pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //

translated: ‚ÄúNor disjoined‚Äù means that the things that are compositional factors not associated with the mind are also not visible.

original: gzugs med pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi phung po ltar dngos po yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //

translated: ‚ÄúInvisible‚Äù means that it cannot be shown to have the nature of color and shape.

translated: ‚ÄúImperturbable‚Äù means that it does not exist as a thing that is perturbed, as do the eye faculty and so on.

original: 'di ltar mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig pa dag go zhes bya ba ni de ltar ldan pa dang mi ldan pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa gang gi mtshan nyid kyang ma yin zhing don dam par stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du mtshan nyid gcig go zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di ltar mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig pa dag go zhes bya ba ni de ltar ldan pa dang mi ldan pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa gang gi mtshan nyid kyang ma yin zhing don dam par stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du mtshan nyid gcig go zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving a single defining characteristic, and that is no defining characteristic,‚Äù means that it is not the defining characteristic of anything, such as form, etc., and that it has a single defining characteristic in being the nature of ultimate emptiness.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu rnam grangs des na skye ba yang mi skye /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu rnam grangs des na skye ba yang mi skye /
translated: Venerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra, for this reason, arising does not give rise to arising.

original: mi skye ba yang mi skye'o zhes bya ba ni rab 'byor gyis god du bshad pa'i don mjug bsdus nas bstan pa mi skye ba'i gtan tshigs de lta bu yin pa'i phyir skye ba zhes bya ba dang / mi skye ba zhes bya ba'i chos de dag la don dam par skye ba med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mi skye ba yang mi skye'o zhes bya ba ni rab 'byor gyis god du bshad pa'i don mjug bsdus nas bstan pa mi skye ba'i gtan tshigs de lta bu yin pa'i phyir skye ba zhes bya ba dang / mi skye ba zhes bya ba'i chos de dag la don dam par skye ba med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNon-arising does not arise‚Äù is the conclusion of the meaning explained by Subh≈´ti, and it is taught as the reason for non-arising. Therefore, in those phenomena called ‚Äúarising‚Äù and ‚Äúnon-arising,‚Äù ultimately there is no arising.

original: sha ra dva ti'i bus smras pa /
analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bus smras pa /
translated: ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra said:üîΩ‚ÄúVenerable Subh≈´ti, you speak of non-arisen phenomena and non-arisen phenomena. Do you have confidence in that?‚Äù

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ma skyes pa'i chos ma skyes pa'i chos zhes bya ba brjod pa khyod kyis spobs sam zhes bya ba ni de ltar skye ba dang mi skye ba zhes bya ba'i chos de dag don dam par dngos po med de /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ma skyes pa'i chos ma skyes pa'i chos zhes bya ba brjod pa khyod kyis spobs sam zhes bya ba ni de ltar skye ba dang mi skye ba zhes bya ba'i chos de dag don dam par dngos po med de /
translated: Thus, those phenomena called ‚Äúarising‚Äù and ‚Äúnon-arising‚Äù ultimately have no substance.

analyzed: mi skye ba yin na ma skyes zhes bya ba'i tshig gis brjod du yang ci yod ces dris pa'o //

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor chos ma skyes pa rnams kyi skye ba med pa yang brjod du spobs par 'gyur ram zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos skye ba med pa'i chos can rnams kyang don dam par dngos po med de skye ba med pa
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor chos ma skyes pa rnams kyi skye ba med pa yang brjod du spobs par 'gyur ram zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos skye ba med pa'i chos can rnams kyang don dam par dngos po med de skye ba med pa
translated: The question Venerable Subh≈´ti, will you be able to express the non-arising of unarisen phenomena? is asking, Even phenomena such as form that are characterized by non-arising are ultimately non-existent, being non-arisen.

original: yin na / de ltar dngos po med pa la skye ba med do zhes brjod du yang rung ngam zhes dris pa'o //
analyzed: yin na / de ltar dngos po med pa la skye ba med do zhes brjod du yang rung ngam zhes dris pa'o //
translated: Is it appropriate to say, 'The non-existent does not arise'?

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /üîΩtshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu ma skyes pa'i chos ma skyes pa'i chos zhes bya ba brjod par khyod kyis spobs sam zhes zer ba ni tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu ma skyes pa'i chos /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu ma skyes pa'i chos ma skyes pa'i chos zhes bya ba brjod par khyod kyis spobs sam zhes zer ba ni tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu ma skyes pa'i chos /
translated: Subh≈´ti said:üîΩVenerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra, do you have the confidence to express 'an unarisen phenomenon' and 'an unarisen phenomenon'?

original: ma skyes pa'i chos zhes bya ba brjod pa la bdag gis spobs pa med do zhes bya ba ni sh'a ri'i bus dris pa gong ma'i lan btab pa ste /
analyzed: ma skyes pa'i chos zhes bya ba brjod pa la bdag gis spobs pa med do zhes bya ba ni sh'a ri'i bus dris pa gong ma'i lan btab pa ste /
translated: Venerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra, I do not have the confidence to express 'an unarisen phenomenon' and 'an unarisen phenomenon.' This is Subh≈´ti's answer to ≈öƒÅriputra's previous question.

original: skye ba dang mi skye ba zhes bya ba'i chos don dam par dngos po med pa de dag mi skye'o //üîΩzhes @268a * //
analyzed: skye ba dang mi skye ba zhes bya ba'i chos don dam par dngos po med pa de dag mi skye'o // zhes @268a * //
translated: Those phenomena called ‚Äúarising‚Äù and ‚Äúnon-arising‚Äù are ultimately non-entities, and they do not arise.

original: bdag gis brjod pa ni kun rdzob tu tshig gis don bstan pa'i phyir brjod pa tsam du zad kyi don dam par brjod pa spobs pa med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gis brjod pa ni kun rdzob tu tshig gis don bstan pa'i phyir brjod pa tsam du zad kyi don dam par brjod pa spobs pa med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: The meaning of this is that I have no confidence in speaking ultimately, but I do speak conventionally in order to teach the meaning with words.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu chos ma skyes pa rnams kyi skye ba med pa yang bdag gis ni brjod par spobs pa med de zhes bya ba ni ni sh'a ri'i bus dris pa /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu chos ma skyes pa rnams kyi skye ba med pa yang bdag gis ni brjod par spobs pa med de zhes bya ba ni ni sh'a ri'i bus dris pa /
translated: Venerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra, I also have no confidence in speaking about the non-arising of phenomena that have not arisen.

original: 'og ma'i lan btab pa ste /
analyzed: 'og ma'i lan btab pa ste /
translated: This is the answer to the question below.

original: gzugs la sogs pa skye ba med pa'i chos can rnams skye ba med do zhes brjod pa yang kun rdzob tu tshig gis don bstan pa'i phyir brjod pa tsam du zad kyi don dam par ni brjod par spobs pa med do zhes bya ba'i don to /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa skye ba med pa'i chos can rnams skye ba med do zhes brjod pa yang kun rdzob tu tshig gis don bstan pa'i phyir brjod pa tsam du zad kyi don dam par ni brjod par spobs pa med do zhes bya ba'i don to /
translated: The meaning is that even the statement ‚ÄúForms and so on, which have the quality of non-arising, do not arise‚Äù is merely a conventional expression in order to teach the meaning with words. Ultimately, I have no confidence in speaking.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu 'di ltar ma skyes pa'i chos gang yin pa dang / skye ba med pa gang yin pa dang / spobs pa gang yin pa dang / brjod pa gang yin pa dang / mi skye ba'i chos de dag thams cad kyang ldan pa yang ma yin /üîΩmi ldan pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu 'di ltar ma skyes pa'i chos gang yin pa dang / skye ba med pa gang yin pa dang / spobs pa gang yin pa dang / brjod pa gang yin pa dang / mi skye ba'i chos de dag thams cad kyang ldan pa yang ma yin / mi ldan pa yang ma yin /
translated: Venerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra, it is like this: that which is a non-arisen phenomenon, that which is non-arising, that which is eloquence, that which is expression, and all those phenomena that are non-arisen are neither conjoined nor disjoined.

original: gzugs med pa bltar med pa thogs pa med pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs med pa bltar med pa thogs pa med pa ste /
translated: They are not material; they cannot be seen; they have no obstruction.üîΩThey are all of one mark‚Äîthat is, no mark.

original: 'di ltar mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig pa dag go zhes bya ba ni ma skyes pa'i chos zhes bya bar brjod par spobs pa med pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig pa dag go zhes bya ba ni ma skyes pa'i chos zhes bya bar brjod par spobs pa med pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: This is the explanation of the reason for the absence of eloquence in the expression ‚Äúnon-arisen phenomena.‚Äù

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos ma skyes pa zhes bya ba dang / skye ba med pa zhes bya ba'i chos nyid dang / spobs pa med pa brjod pa gang yin pa de dag thams cad kyang kun rdzob tu tha snyad tsam du btags par zad kyi /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos ma skyes pa zhes bya ba dang / skye ba med pa zhes bya ba'i chos nyid dang / spobs pa med pa brjod pa gang yin pa de dag thams cad kyang kun rdzob tu tha snyad tsam du btags par zad kyi /
translated: All those phenomena that are called ‚Äúnon-arisen phenomena,‚Äù ‚Äúnon-arising,‚Äù ‚Äúthe true nature of non-arising,‚Äù ‚Äúthe absence of eloquence,‚Äù and ‚Äúexpression‚Äù are merely designated as conventional terms.

translated: The phenomena called ‚Äúspeaking,‚Äù ‚Äúeloquence,‚Äù ‚Äúbirth,‚Äù and ‚Äúnon-birth,‚Äù and those phenomena beginning with form that one begins and speaks with eloquence, are neither endowed nor not endowed.

original: thogs pa med pa yin par 'jal na /
analyzed: thogs pa med pa yin par 'jal na /

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /

translated: ‚ÄúVenerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra, it is so.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu de ni 'di ltar gzugs skye ba med do tshor ba skye ba med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni brjod pa dang spobs pa la sogs pa 'di dag 'ba' zhig don dam par skye ba med par ma
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu de ni 'di ltar gzugs skye ba med do tshor ba skye ba med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni brjod pa dang spobs pa la sogs pa 'di dag 'ba' zhig don dam par skye ba med par ma

original: zad kyi / gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos thams cad kyang skye ba med do zhes bstan pa'o //

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

translated: Why is that?üîΩBecause whatever the elder Subh≈´ti is asked about, he has no hesitation.‚Äù

analyzed: chos thams cad skye ba med pa la sogs pa'i don gang dang gang dris pa de dag gi lan thags thogs med par thebs pas /

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subh≈´ti said,

analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu de ni bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos chos thams cad la gnas pa med pa dag gi chos nyid de /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos chos thams cad la gnas pa med pa dag gi chos nyid de zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa nyan thos dgra bcom pa bcom ldan 'das kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong par rtogs pas chos de dag
translated: ‚ÄúVenerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra, that is the reality of the Blessed One‚Äôs hearers who do not abide in any phenomena‚Äù indicates that the reality of the noble hearers, the arhats, is that, through the Buddha‚Äôs blessing, they realize that all phenomena are empty by nature.

original: gang la yang mi gnas shing /

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos thams cad don dam par rang bzhin gyis stong pas phyi nang gang la yang mi gnas pa'i phyir 'phags pa nyan thos de dag kyang chos thams cad la gnas pa med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Because all mundane and supramundane phenomena are ultimately empty of intrinsic reality, the noble ≈õrƒÅvakas do not abide in any phenomenon, whether internal or external.

translated: ≈öƒÅriputra asks Subh≈´ti, ‚ÄúVenerable Subh≈´ti, how is it that all are non-abiding?‚Äù in order to have him explain in detail the reason why all phenomena, such as form, are non-abiding.

analyzed: de ni nang na yang mi gnas /

analyzed: phyi rol na yang mi gnas /
