analyzed: gnyis ka med par yang mi gnas so zhes bya ba ni don dam par gzugs kyi rang bzhin med pas nang gi dbang po rnams la yang mi gnas /
translated: This teaches that since ultimately form has no inherent nature, it does not exist internally in the internal sense faculties,

original: phyi rol gyi yul sa rnams la yang mi gnas /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi yul sa rnams la yang mi gnas /
translated: it does not exist externally in the external objects,

original: phyi nang gnyis la ma gtogs pa'i dngos po gzhan yang med pas de la yang mi gnas so zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: phyi nang gnyis la ma gtogs pa'i dngos po gzhan yang med pas de la yang mi gnas so zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: and it does not exist in anything other than the internal and external, since it is not included in both.

original: gzugs la ji lta ba bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs la ji lta ba bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: As with form, this should be applied to all the aspects of feeling and so on up to omniscience.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu rnam grangs des na chos thams cad ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir mi gnas pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos thams cad don dam par rang bzhin gyis stong pa
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu rnam grangs des na chos thams cad ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir mi gnas pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos thams cad don dam par rang bzhin gyis stong pa
translated: Venerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra, for this reason, all phenomena are non-abiding because of the emptiness of inherent nature.

original: nyid kyi phyir phyi nang gang la yang mi gnas so zhes gong du bshad pa'i don mjug bsdus te bstan pa'o //
analyzed: nyid kyi phyir phyi nang gang la yang mi gnas so zhes gong du bshad pa'i don mjug bsdus te bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the summary and teaching of the meaning explained above, that all mundane and supramundane phenomena, ultimately, do not abide anywhere, externally or internally, because of the emptiness of inherent nature.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pas de ltar gzugs @269b yongs su sbyang bar bya'o zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pas de ltar gzugs @269b yongs su sbyang bar bya'o zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Venerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra, bodhisattva mahƒÅsattvas practicing the six perfections should thus purify form...

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su sbyang bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni de ltar 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos thams cad phyi nang gang la yang mi gnas par rtogs pa nyid gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad yongs suüîΩdag pa'i rang bzhin du rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su sbyang bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni de ltar 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos thams cad phyi nang gang la yang mi gnas par rtogs pa nyid gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad yongs su dag pa'i rang bzhin du rtogs pa yin te /
translated: Up to ‚Äúthe knowledge of all aspects should be purified‚Äù means that just the realization that all mundane and supramundane phenomena do not abide anywhere, whether externally or internally, is the realization that all phenomena such as form and so on are by nature completely pure.

original: de de ltar gong du bshad pa'i tshul gyis gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du yongs su sbyang bar bya'o zhes bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de de ltar gong du bshad pa'i tshul gyis gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du yongs su sbyang bar bya'o zhes bstan pa ste /
translated: Thus, as explained above, one should purify form and so on up to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de ltar yongs su dag par rtogs par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar yongs su dag par rtogs par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This teaches that one should realize them to be completely pure in that way.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bus /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bus /
translated: Then the venerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: said to the venerable Su¬≠bh≈´ti as follows:

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa'i tshe /üîΩbyang chub kyi lam yongs su sbyong ba yin zhes bya ba ni de ltar chos thams cad gnas pa med pa'i don bstan nas byang chub kyi lam yongs su sbyang ba'i thabs bstan pa'i phyir ji ltar byang chub kyi lam yongs su sbyong ba yin zhes sh'a ri'i
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa'i tshe / byang chub kyi lam yongs su sbyong ba yin zhes bya ba ni de ltar chos thams cad gnas pa med pa'i don bstan nas byang chub kyi lam yongs su sbyang ba'i thabs bstan pa'i phyir ji ltar byang chub kyi lam yongs su sbyong ba yin zhes sh'a ri'i
translated: The Lord: Here, Subhuti, the Bodhisattva, the great being, who courses in the perfection of giving, does not settle down in the perfection of giving, and so on up to: who courses in the perfection of wisdom does not settle down in the perfection of wisdom.üîΩ And why? Because the perfection of giving, etc. to: the perfection of wisdom are empty of own-being.üîΩ Subhuti : How, O Lord, does the Bodhisattva, the great being, who courses in perfect wisdom, purify the way to enlightenment?üîΩ

original: bus rab 'byor la dris pa'o //
analyzed: bus rab 'byor la dris pa'o //
translated: The Lord: So it is, Subhuti, so it is.üîΩ And why? Because the perfection of wisdom is the genetrix and the guide of the five perfections.

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhuti: How, O Lord, does the perfection of wisdom bring about the five perfections?üîΩThe Lord: Here the perfection of wisdom purifies the perfection of giving in such a way that the Bodhisattva, the great being, gives gifts without taking anything as a basis.üîΩShe purifies the perfection of morality in such a way that the Bodhisattva, the great being, guards morality without taking anything as a basis.üîΩShe purifies the perfection of patience in such a way that the Bodhisattva, the great being, is patient and forbearing without taking anything as a basis.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni 'jig rten pa yang yod /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni 'jig rten pa yang yod /
translated: She purifies the perfection of vigour in such a way that the Bodhisattva, the great being, exerts vigour without taking anything as a basis.üîΩShe purifies the perfection of meditation in such a way that the Bodhisattva, the great being, becomes one who is concentrated without taking anything as a basis.üîΩShe purifies the perfection of wisdom in such a way that the Bodhisattva, the great being, becomes one who has entered on the certainty of a Bodhisattva without taking anything as a basis.üîΩShe purifies the four applications of mindfulness in such a way that the Bodhisattva, the great being, becomes one who has entered on the certainty of a Bodhisattva without taking anything as a basis.üîΩShe purifies the four right efforts, the four bases of magic power, the five dominants, the five powers, the seven limbs of enlightenment, the holy eightfold path in such a way that the Bodhisattva, the great being, becomes one who has entered on the certainty of a Bodhisattva without taking anything as a basis.üîΩShe purifies the three knowledges in such a way that the Bodhisattva, the great being, becomes one who has entered on the certainty of a Bodhisattva without taking anything as a basis.üîΩShe purifies the four grounds of self-confidence, the four analytical knowledges, the four kinds of unhindered knowledge, the great friendliness, the great compassion, the eighteen special dharmas of a Buddha, the ten powers of a Tathagata,

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa yang yod ces bya ba la sogs pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug 'khor gsum yongs su ma dag par spyod pa dang / 'khor gsum yongs su dag par spyod pa'i bye brag zhib tu phye ste bstan nas gang 'khor gsum yongs su ma dag par sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa drug spyod pa ni 'jig rten pas byang chub kyi lam yongs su sbyong ba ma yin
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa yang yod ces bya ba la sogs pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug 'khor gsum yongs su ma dag par spyod pa dang / 'khor gsum yongs su dag par spyod pa'i bye brag zhib tu phye ste bstan nas gang 'khor gsum yongs su ma dag par sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa drug spyod pa ni 'jig rten pas byang chub kyi lam yongs su sbyong ba ma yin
translated: The statement there is also a supramundane one and so on, having taught in detail the distinction between the practice of the six perfections with the three spheres impure and the practice with the three spheres pure, teaches that those who practice the six perfections such as generosity with the three spheres impure do not thoroughly purify the path to enlightenment.

original: gyi / 'khor gsum yongs su dag par pha rol tu phyin pa drug spyod pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa yin pas byang chub kyi lam yongs su sbyong ba yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gyi / 'khor gsum yongs su dag par pha rol tu phyin pa drug spyod pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa yin pas byang chub kyi lam yongs su sbyong ba yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: However, those who practice the six perfections with the three spheres pure are supramundane and therefore thoroughly purify the path to enlightenment.

original: smras pa tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor 'jig rten pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni gang /
analyzed: smras pa tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor 'jig rten pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni gang /
translated: It was said: Venerable Subh≈´ti, what is the mundane perfection of generosity?

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa ni gang zhes bya ba ni gong du rab 'byor gyis pha rol tu phyin pa drug 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa yang yod do zhes mdor smos pa /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa ni gang zhes bya ba ni gong du rab 'byor gyis pha rol tu phyin pa drug 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa yang yod do zhes mdor smos pa /
translated: Previously, Subh≈´ti had briefly stated, There are also mundane and supramundane six perfections.

original: sh'a ri'i bus 'jig rten pa ni gang /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bus 'jig rten pa ni gang /
translated: ≈öƒÅriputra asked, What is mundane?

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa ni gang zhes @270a * //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa ni gang zhes @270a * //
translated: What is supramundane?

original: bye brag tu phye ste dris pa'o //
analyzed: bye brag tu phye ste dris pa'o //
translated: He asked this in order to make a distinction.

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subh≈´ti said,üîΩVenerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra, here bodhisattva mahƒÅsattvas, while giving, become givers.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa byed cing sbyin bdag tu gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rab 'byor gyis 'jig rten gyi sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bshad pa ste
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa byed cing sbyin bdag tu gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rab 'byor gyis 'jig rten gyi sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bshad pa ste
translated: This explains Subh≈´ti's explanation of the mundane perfection of giving.

original: / dge sbyong dang / bram ze dang / phongs pa dang / ltogs pa dang / 'dron  pa dang / slong ba zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa'i gnas len pa po'i dmigs bstan pa'o //
analyzed: / dge sbyong dang / bram ze dang / phongs pa dang / ltogs pa dang / 'dron  pa dang / slong ba zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa'i gnas len pa po'i dmigs bstan pa'o //
translated: As for ascetics, brahmins, the poor, the hungry, travelers, and beggars, this teaches the objects of giving.

original: zas 'dod pa la ni zas /
analyzed: zas 'dod pa la ni zas /
translated: To those who desire food, give food.

original: skom 'dod pa la ni skom zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni zang zing gi sbyin pa'i rdzas bstan pa'o //
analyzed: skom 'dod pa la ni skom zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni zang zing gi sbyin pa'i rdzas bstan pa'o //
translated: For those who desire drink, drink, and so on, indicate the substance of material giving.

original: zang zing gi sbyin pa la yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: zang zing gi sbyin pa la yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Material giving also has three types:

original: sbyin pa tha mal pa dang / sbyin pa chen po dang / dka' ba'i sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa tha mal pa dang / sbyin pa chen po dang / dka' ba'i sbyin pa'o //
translated: ordinary giving, great giving, and difficult giving.

original: de la sbyin pa tha mal pa ni /
analyzed: de la sbyin pa tha mal pa ni /
translated: Among them, ordinary giving is

original: zas 'dod pa la ni zas /
analyzed: zas 'dod pa la ni zas /
translated: for those who desire food, giving food,

original: skom 'dod pa la ni skom zhes bya ba ni mi'i yo byad gzhan ci yang rung ba'i bar du yongs su gtong ste zhes bya ba'i bar gyis bstan te /
analyzed: skom 'dod pa la ni skom zhes bya ba ni mi'i yo byad gzhan ci yang rung ba'i bar du yongs su gtong ste zhes bya ba'i bar gyis bstan te /
translated: for those who desire drink, giving drink, and so on, up to giving away any other human necessities.

original: theg pa zhes bya ba ni bzhon pa la bya'o //
analyzed: theg pa zhes bya ba ni bzhon pa la bya'o //
translated: The term vehicle refers to a conveyance.

original: sbyin pa chen po ni /
analyzed: sbyin pa chen po ni /
translated: Great giving is

original: bu pho 'dod pa la ni bu pho yongs su gtong /üîΩbu mo 'dod pa la ni bu mo yongs su gtong /
analyzed: bu pho 'dod pa la ni bu pho yongs su gtong / bu mo 'dod pa la ni bu mo yongs su gtong /
translated: giving away one's son for those who desire a son,üîΩgiving away one's daughter for those who desire a daughter,

original: chung ma 'dod pa la ni chung ma yongs su gtong /
analyzed: chung ma 'dod pa la ni chung ma yongs su gtong /
translated: giving away one's wife for those who desire a wife,

original: rgyal srid 'dod pa la ni rgyal srid yongs su gtong zhes bya bas bstan to //
analyzed: rgyal srid 'dod pa la ni rgyal srid yongs su gtong zhes bya bas bstan to //
translated: and giving away one's kingdom for those who desire a kingdom.

original: dka' ba'i sbyin pa ni /
analyzed: dka' ba'i sbyin pa ni /
translated: Difficult giving is

original: mgo 'dod pa la ni mgo yongs su gtong /
analyzed: mgo 'dod pa la ni mgo yongs su gtong /
translated: For one who wants a head, he gives his head.

original: mig 'dod pa la ni mig yongs su gtong /üîΩyan lag dang nying lag 'dod pa la ni yan lag dang nying lag yongs su gtong /
analyzed: mig 'dod pa la ni mig yongs su gtong / yan lag dang nying lag 'dod pa la ni yan lag dang nying lag yongs su gtong /
translated: For one who wants eyes, he gives his eyes.üîΩFor one who wants limbs and fingers, he gives limbs and fingers.

original: sha dang khrag dang rkang 'dod pa la ni sha dang khrag dang rkang yongs su gtong zhes bya bas bstan to //
analyzed: sha dang khrag dang rkang 'dod pa la ni sha dang khrag dang rkang yongs su gtong zhes bya bas bstan to //
translated: For one who wants flesh, blood, and marrow, he gives flesh, blood, and marrow.

original: de yang gnas shing yongs su gtong ba zhes bya ba ni 'khor gsum yongs su ma dag cing dmigs pa dang bcas par sbyin pa yongs su gtong zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de yang gnas shing yongs su gtong ba zhes bya ba ni 'khor gsum yongs su ma dag cing dmigs pa dang bcas par sbyin pa yongs su gtong zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Moreover, giving while standing means giving with the three spheres impure and with reference to the object.

original: de 'di snyam du bdag ni yongs su gtong ba'o //
analyzed: de 'di snyam du bdag ni yongs su gtong ba'o //
translated: He thinks, I am the giver,

original: 'di ni len pa'o zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: 'di ni len pa'o zhes bya ba nas /
translated: he is the recipient, and this is the gift.

original: 'di ni 'jig rten pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni 'khor gsum yongs su ma dag cing dmigs pa can gyi sems kyis sbyin pa yongs su gtong ba bstan to /
analyzed: 'di ni 'jig rten pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni 'khor gsum yongs su ma dag cing dmigs pa can gyi sems kyis sbyin pa yongs su gtong ba bstan to /
translated: Up to here it has been shown that he gives with a mind that is not purified of the three spheres and that is referential.

original: de ci'i phyir 'jig rten pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir 'jig rten pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it called the mundane perfection of generosity?

original: de ni 'di ltar 'jig rten las mi g-yo /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar 'jig rten las mi g-yo /
translated: Because it does not transcend the world,üîΩit does not rise above it, and it does not go beyond it.üîΩTherefore it is called the mundane perfection of generosity.

original: mi 'phags mi 'da' @270b bas de'i phyir 'jig rten gyi sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni de ltar 'khor gsum yongs su ma dag cing dmigs pa can gyi sems kyis sbyin pa yongs su gtong ba'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyinüîΩpar 'gyur ba'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: mi 'phags mi 'da' @270b bas de'i phyir 'jig rten gyi sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni de ltar 'khor gsum yongs su ma dag cing dmigs pa can gyi sems kyis sbyin pa yongs su gtong ba'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin par 'gyur ba'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: This shows the reason why the perfection of generosity is not a perfection for one who gives gifts with a mind that is not completely pure with respect to the three spheres and that possesses the view of objects.

original: 'jig rten las mi g-yo zhes bya ba ni bdag tu 'du shes pa la chags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten las mi g-yo zhes bya ba ni bdag tu 'du shes pa la chags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It does not transcend the world means that it is attached to the notion of self.

original: mi 'phags zhes bya ba ni gzhan du 'du shes pa la chags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi 'phags zhes bya ba ni gzhan du 'du shes pa la chags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It does not rise above it means that it is attached to the notion of other.

original: mi 'da' bas zhes bya ba ni sbyin par 'du shes pa la chags pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mi 'da' bas zhes bya ba ni sbyin par 'du shes pa la chags pa'i phyir te /
translated: It does not go beyond it means that it is attached to the notion of giving.

original: de ltar 'khor gsum yongs su ma dag cing dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i sems kyis sbyin pa byas pa ni 'jig rten las mi 'da' ste /
analyzed: de ltar 'khor gsum yongs su ma dag cing dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i sems kyis sbyin pa byas pa ni 'jig rten las mi 'da' ste /
translated: Thus, generosity that is performed with a mind that is not completely pure with regard to the three spheres and that possesses a mental object does not transcend the mundane.

original: 'khor ba'i longs spyod kyi rgyur 'gyur ba'i phyir 'jig rten pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'i /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i longs spyod kyi rgyur 'gyur ba'i phyir 'jig rten pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'i /
translated: Because it becomes the cause of the enjoyments of cyclic existence, it is called the mundane perfection of generosity.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin par mi chud pas byang chub kyi lam yongs su sbyong ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to//
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin par mi chud pas byang chub kyi lam yongs su sbyong ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to//
translated: It is not included in the supramundane perfection of generosity. Thus, it does not purify the path to enlightenment. This is the meaning.

original: sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas shing bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas shing bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called a perfection because it is shared with all sentient beings and is dedicated to unsurpassed, true, and complete enlightenment.

original: dmigs pa dang bcas shing 'khor gsum yongs su ma dag pa'i phyir 'jig rten las 'das par ma chud do //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bcas shing 'khor gsum yongs su ma dag pa'i phyir 'jig rten las 'das par ma chud do //
translated: It is not included in the supramundane because it possesses a mental object and is not completely pure with regard to the three spheres.

original: de la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the supramundane perfection of generosity?üîΩThus, it is the complete purity of the three spheres.

original: 'di ltar 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bye brag tu phye ste bstan pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bye brag tu phye ste bstan pa ste /
translated: Thus, the supramundane perfection of generosity is distinguished and taught.

original: sbyin pa de sems can thams cad la yongs su gtong ste zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sbyin pa de sems can thams cad la yongs su gtong ste zhes bya ba ni /
translated: That generosity is given to all sentient beings.

original: 'khor gsum yongs su dag par sbyin pa byas pa'i bsod nams kyang kun rdzob tu sems can thams cad yongs su bsngo'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'khor gsum yongs su dag par sbyin pa byas pa'i bsod nams kyang kun rdzob tu sems can thams cad yongs su bsngo'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the merit of generosity, which is the complete purity of the three spheres, is also conventionally dedicated to all sentient beings.

original: de ci'i phyir 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it called the supramundane perfection of generosity?

original: de ni 'di ltar 'jig rten las g-yo zhing 'phags la 'das pas /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar 'jig rten las g-yo zhing 'phags la 'das pas /
translated: It is thus: since it moves, rises above, and transcends the world,

original: de'i phyir 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni bdag mi dmigs pa'i phyir 'jig rten las g-yo'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni bdag mi dmigs pa'i phyir 'jig rten las g-yo'o //
translated: It is supramundane because it transcends the world, and it is transcendent because it transcends the world.

original: gzhan mi dmigs pa'i phyir 'jig rten las 'phags so //
analyzed: gzhan mi dmigs pa'i phyir 'jig rten las 'phags so //
translated: It is supramundane because it transcends the world, and it is transcendent because it transcends the world.

original: sbyin pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir 'jig rten las 'da'o //üîΩde bzhin du tshul khrims kyi pha rol @271a * //
analyzed: sbyin pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir 'jig rten las 'da'o // de bzhin du tshul khrims kyi pha rol @271a * //
translated: It is supramundane because it transcends the world, and it is transcendent because it transcends the world.

translated: It is supramundane because it transcends the world, and it is transcendent because it transcends the world.üîΩIt is supramundane because it transcends the world, and it is transcendent because it transcends the world.üîΩIt is supramundane because it transcends the world, and it is transcendent because it transcends the world.üîΩIt is supramundane because it transcends the world, and it is transcendent because it transcends the world.üîΩIt is supramundane because it transcends the world, and it is transcendent because it transcends the world.üîΩIt is supramundane because it transcends the world, and it is transcendent because it transcends the world.üîΩIt is supramundane because it transcends the world, and it is transcendent because it transcends the world.üîΩIt is supramundane because it transcends the world, and it is transcendent because it transcends the world.üîΩIt is supramundane because it transcends the world, and it is transcendent because it transcends the world.üîΩIt is supramundane because it transcends the world, and it is transcendent because it transcends the world.üîΩIt is supramundane because it transcends the world, and it is transcendent because it transcends the world.üîΩIt is supramundane because it transcends the world, and it is transcendent because it transcends the world.üîΩIt is supramundane because it transcends the world, and it is transcendent because it transcends the world.üîΩIt is supramundane because it transcends the world, and it is transcendent because it transcends the world.üîΩIt is supramundane because it transcends the world, and it is transcendent because it transcends the world.

original: byang chub kyi lam yongs su sbyong ba yin no zhes bya ba ni ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: byang chub kyi lam yongs su sbyong ba yin no zhes bya ba ni ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: It is supramundane because it transcends the world, and it is

original: byang chub kyi lam yongs su sbyong ba yin zhes sh'a ri'i bus rab 'byor la dris pa'i don mjug bsdus nas bstan pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi lam yongs su sbyong ba yin zhes sh'a ri'i bus rab 'byor la dris pa'i don mjug bsdus nas bstan pa ste /
translated: This is the meaning of the question ≈öƒÅriputra asked Subh≈´ti, which is summarized and taught.

original: de ltar gong du bshad pa'i rim pas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug spyod pa ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par 'gyur ba'i rgyu yongs su dag par byed pa yin pa'i phyir byang chub kyi lam
analyzed: de ltar gong du bshad pa'i rim pas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug spyod pa ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par 'gyur ba'i rgyu yongs su dag par byed pa yin pa'i phyir byang chub kyi lam
translated: Thus, by the above-explained stages, practicing the six supramundane perfections is the cause for attaining unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, because it purifies the cause.

original: yongs su sbyong ba yin no zhes bstan pa'o //üîΩ'jig rten pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug rnams ni dngos po kho nar byang chub kyi lam yongs su sbyong bar mi chud kyang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba'i phyir byang chub kyi lam yongs su sbyong ba nyid nas brgyud
analyzed: yongs su sbyong ba yin no zhes bstan pa'o // 'jig rten pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug rnams ni dngos po kho nar byang chub kyi lam yongs su sbyong bar mi chud kyang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba'i phyir byang chub kyi lam yongs su sbyong ba nyid nas brgyud
translated: Therefore, it is taught that it is the complete training in the path to enlightenment.

original: pa'i rgyu yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: pa'i rgyu yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Although the six mundane perfections are not included in the complete training in the path to enlightenment as actual things, since they become the cause of the supramundane perfections, they should be known as the indirect cause of the complete training in the path to enlightenment.

original: smras pa tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub kyi lam gang yin zhes bya ba ni gong du pha rol tu phyin pa drug la 'khor gsum yongs su dag par spyod pa byang chub kyi lam yongs su sbyong ba
analyzed: smras pa tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub kyi lam gang yin zhes bya ba ni gong du pha rol tu phyin pa drug la 'khor gsum yongs su dag par spyod pa byang chub kyi lam yongs su sbyong ba
translated: This is the explanation that the practice of the six perfections with the three spheres completely purified is the training in the bodhisattva path.

original: yin no zhes bshad pa pha rol tu phyin pa drug po de dag byang chub kyi lam sbyong ba yin na /
analyzed: yin no zhes bshad pa pha rol tu phyin pa drug po de dag byang chub kyi lam sbyong ba yin na /
translated: If those six perfections are the training in the bodhisattva path,

original: byang chub kyi lam nyid gud na yod dam snyam du sems pa'i the tshom bsal ba'i phyir sh'a ri'i bus rab 'byor la dris pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi lam nyid gud na yod dam snyam du sems pa'i the tshom bsal ba'i phyir sh'a ri'i bus rab 'byor la dris pa'o //
translated: then ≈öƒÅriputra asked Subh≈´ti to clear away the doubt that thinks, Is the bodhisattva path itself somewhere else?

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subh≈´ti said,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub kyi lam mo zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub kyi lam mo zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Venerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra, the perfection of generosity is the bodhisattva great beings' bodhisattva path.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub kyi lam mo zhes bya ba'i bar du ni byang chub kyi lam zhes bya ba gzhan ma yin gyi /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub kyi lam mo zhes bya ba'i bar du ni byang chub kyi lam zhes bya ba gzhan ma yin gyi /
translated: Up to here, it is not that there is a separate so-called ‚Äúpath to enlightenment.‚Äù

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la thug gi bar du rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams 'khor gsum yongs su dag par byed pa nyid bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'thob par
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la thug gi bar du rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams 'khor gsum yongs su dag par byed pa nyid bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'thob par
translated: The factors of purification, from the six perfections up to the eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha, are the cause for attaining unsurpassed perfect complete enlightenment, by purifying the three spheres.

original: 'gyur ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir byang chub kyi lam zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'gyur ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir byang chub kyi lam zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they are called the ‚Äúpath to enlightenment.‚Äù

original: de @271b las gud na byang chub kyi lam med de /
analyzed: de @271b las gud na byang chub kyi lam med de /
translated: Apart from those, there is no other path to enlightenment.

original: 'di dag nyid byang chub kyi lam yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag nyid byang chub kyi lam yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: It is taught that these alone are the path to enlightenment.

original: smras pa tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor legs so legs so de la pha rol tu phyin pa gang gi mthu yin zhes bya ba ni de ltar rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams 'khor gsum yongs su dag par spyod pa nyid byang chub kyi lam du 'gyur bar
analyzed: smras pa tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor legs so legs so de la pha rol tu phyin pa gang gi mthu yin zhes bya ba ni de ltar rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams 'khor gsum yongs su dag par spyod pa nyid byang chub kyi lam du 'gyur bar
translated: The reply Venerable Subh≈´ti, excellent, excellent is praising the explanation that the phenomena of purification, practiced with the three spheres completely pure, are the path to enlightenment.

original: bshad pa legs so zhes bstod nas /
analyzed: bshad pa legs so zhes bstod nas /
translated: Having praised it as excellent,

original: de ltar 'gyur ba pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi nang na gang gi mthu yin zhes sh'a ri'i bus rab 'byor la dris pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'gyur ba pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi nang na gang gi mthu yin zhes sh'a ri'i bus rab 'byor la dris pa'o //
translated: ≈öƒÅriputra asks Subh≈´ti, In that case, which of the six perfections is the power?

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subh≈´ti said:

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´-putra,üîΩthat is the power of the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mthu ste zhes bya ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi nang na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mig dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mthu ste zhes bya ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi nang na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mig dang 'dra ste /
translated: Among the six perfections, the perfection of wisdom is like the eyes,

original: gtso bo yin pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan na 'khor gsum yongs su dag par 'gyur ba'i phyir byang chub kyi lam yongs su sbyong ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mthu yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gtso bo yin pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan na 'khor gsum yongs su dag par 'gyur ba'i phyir byang chub kyi lam yongs su sbyong ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mthu yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Since it is the most important, the power of the perfection of wisdom is the purification of the path to enlightenment, because when one has the perfection of wisdom, the three spheres are completely purified.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu de ni 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni nyan thos kyi chos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi chos dang / byang chub sems dpa'i chos dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos dang / dge ba'i chos thams cad skye'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi nang na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gtso bo yin zhing de'i mthu yin pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu de ni 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni nyan thos kyi chos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi chos dang / byang chub sems dpa'i chos dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos dang / dge ba'i chos thams cad skye'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi nang na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gtso bo yin zhing de'i mthu yin pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: Venerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra, it is like this: the perfection of wisdom gives rise to the dharmas of the hearers, the dharmas of the solitary realizers, the dharmas of the bodhisattvas, the dharmas of the buddhas, and all virtuous dharmas. This and so forth teaches the reason why the perfection of wisdom is the most important among the perfections and is their power.

original: skyed pa'o zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i chos theg pa gsum du gtogs pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: skyed pa'o zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i chos theg pa gsum du gtogs pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúIt produces‚Äù means it is the cause for perfecting all the virtuous qualities included in the three vehicles.

original: yongs su sdud cing yang dag par sdud pa'o zhes bya ba ni theg pa gsum du gtogs pa'i dge ba'i chos thams cad shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su zin cing yongs su khyab pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yongs su sdud cing yang dag par sdud pa'o zhes bya ba ni theg pa gsum du gtogs pa'i dge ba'i chos thams cad shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su zin cing yongs su khyab pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúIt gathers and truly gathers‚Äù means that all the virtuous qualities included in the three vehicles are embraced and pervaded by the perfection of wisdom.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la spyad de /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la spyad de /
translated: Venerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra, the previous tathƒÅgatas, arhats, perfectly awakened buddhas also practiced this perfection of wisdom,

analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par sangs rgyas so zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: and fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.‚Äù

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya ba'i rgyu'i gtso bo yin par @272a * //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya ba'i rgyu'i gtso bo yin par @272a * //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the principal cause for the transcendent conquerors of the three times to attain manifest, complete enlightenment in unsurpassable perfect buddhahood.

original: bstan pa'o // tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gal te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bshad pa'i tshe /
analyzed: bstan pa'o // tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gal te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bshad pa'i tshe /
translated: Venerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra, if, when the perfection of wisdom is being taught,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nem nur 'am rmongs par mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nem nur 'am rmongs par mi 'gyur na /
translated: a bodhisattva great being does not doubt or become confused,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni 'di ltar sems can thams cad bskyab pa dang / sems can thams cad yongs su mi gtong ba'i phyir de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis rnam par spyod pa 'dis rnam par spyod par shes par bya'o zhes bya ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams 'khor gsum yongs su
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni 'di ltar sems can thams cad bskyab pa dang / sems can thams cad yongs su mi gtong ba'i phyir de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis rnam par spyod pa 'dis rnam par spyod par shes par bya'o zhes bya ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams 'khor gsum yongs su
translated: The venerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´¬≠putra should know that this bodhisattva great being, who is practicing this practice without apprehending anything, is so because he protects all sentient beings and does not abandon all sentient beings.

original: dag par spyad na byang chub kyi lam yongs su sbyong ba yin par bshad pa'i chos zab mo de bshad pa'i tshe dad cing yid ches pas nem nur med pa dang / shes rab rno bas rmongs par ma gyur na byang chub sems dpa' de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la rnam par spyod par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: dag par spyad na byang chub kyi lam yongs su sbyong ba yin par bshad pa'i chos zab mo de bshad pa'i tshe dad cing yid ches pas nem nur med pa dang / shes rab rno bas rmongs par ma gyur na byang chub sems dpa' de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la rnam par spyod par shes par bya ste /
translated: This explains that if one practices the phenomena of purification, such as the six perfections, with the three spheres completely pure, one will train in the path to enlightenment. When that profound Dharma is explained, if one has faith and confidence, is without doubt, and is not confused due to having sharp wisdom, one should know that this bodhisattva is practicing this profound perfection of wisdom.

original: kun rdzob tu yang sems can thams cad bskyab pa dang / sems can thams cad yongs su mi gtong bar nus par shes par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩbyang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni 'di lta ste /üîΩsnying rje chen po yid la bya ba'i yid la bya ba de dang ma bral bar shes par bya'o zhes bya ba ni de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don zab mo la rnam par spyod cing sems can thams cad bskyab pa dang sems can
analyzed: kun rdzob tu yang sems can thams cad bskyab pa dang / sems can thams cad yongs su mi gtong bar nus par shes par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to // byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni 'di lta ste / snying rje chen po yid la bya ba'i yid la bya ba de dang ma bral bar shes par bya'o zhes bya ba ni de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don zab mo la rnam par spyod cing sems can thams cad bskyab pa dang sems can
translated: It should be understood that he is able to protect all sentient beings and not abandon all sentient beings even conventionally.üîΩThat bodhisattva mahƒÅsattva should be known as never separated from that mental activity, namely, the mental activity of great compassion.

original: thams cad yongs su mi gtong ba de ni byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje chen po yid la byed pa dang ldan par shes par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad yongs su mi gtong ba de ni byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje chen po yid la byed pa dang ldan par shes par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Thus, it is taught that one who practices in that way with the profound meaning of the perfection of wisdom, protecting all sentient beings and not abandoning all sentient beings, should be known as possessing the mental activity of great compassion of a bodhisattva.

original: smras pa tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor rnam par spyod pas rnam par spyod cing 'di lta ste /
analyzed: smras pa tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor rnam par spyod pas rnam par spyod cing 'di lta ste /
translated: Subh≈´ti said, ‚ÄúVenerable ≈öƒÅriputra, a bodhisattva great being who practices while practicing like this‚Äî

original: snying rje chen po yid la bya ba'i yid la bya ba de dang ma bral bas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen por 'dod na /
analyzed: snying rje chen po yid la bya ba'i yid la bya ba de dang ma bral bas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen por 'dod na /
translated: If you want to be a bodhisattva great being, you should not be separated from the mental activity of great compassion.

analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor de ltar na ni sems can thams cad kyang byang chub sems dpar 'gyur ro //
translated: Venerable Subh≈´ti, if that is so, then all sentient beings would be bodhisattvas.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?üîΩVenerable Subh≈´ti, all sentient beings are not separated from mental activity.

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor sems can thams cad kyang yid la bya ba dang ma bral lo zhes bya ba ni snying rje chen po yid la bya ba dang ma bral ba rab 'byor gyis bstod pa la sh'a ri'i bus don dam pa las bsams nas brgal
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor sems can thams cad kyang yid la bya ba dang ma bral lo zhes bya ba ni snying rje chen po yid la bya ba dang ma bral ba rab 'byor gyis bstod pa la sh'a ri'i bus don dam pa las bsams nas brgal
translated: This is the praise of not being separated from the mental activity of great compassion by Subh≈´ti. ≈öƒÅriputra, thinking of the ultimate, challenges him:

original: ba ste / yid la byed pa ni rnam par rtog pa ste /
analyzed: ba ste / yid la byed pa ni rnam par rtog pa ste /
translated: Mental activity is conceptualization.

original: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas na chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag par rtogs par mi nus pas de la byang chub sems dpa' zhes mi bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas na chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag par rtogs par mi nus pas de la byang chub sems dpa' zhes mi bya'o //
translated: If there is conceptualization, one cannot realize the pure realm of phenomena. Therefore, one should not be called a bodhisattva.

original: de ste yid @272b la byed pa dang ma bral zhing rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa yang byang chub sems dpar 'dod na ni sems can thams cad yid la byed pa dang ma bral zhing /
analyzed: de ste yid @272b la byed pa dang ma bral zhing rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa yang byang chub sems dpar 'dod na ni sems can thams cad yid la byed pa dang ma bral zhing /
translated: If you assert that one who is not free from mental activity and who has conceptual thoughts is a bodhisattva, then all sentient beings would be bodhisattvas.üîΩ

original: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pas byang chub sems dpar 'gyur ba'i rigs na /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pas byang chub sems dpar 'gyur ba'i rigs na /
translated: If you assert that one who is not free from mental activity and who has conceptualization is a bodhisattva, then it would be logical that all sentient beings, who are not free from mental activity and who have conceptualization, would be bodhisattvas.

original: de ltar 'gyur ba yang mi srid pas yid la bya ba dang ma bral ba la de skad bstod pa'i mi rigs so zhes brgal ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'gyur ba yang mi srid pas yid la bya ba dang ma bral ba la de skad bstod pa'i mi rigs so zhes brgal ba'o //
translated: But that is impossible, so it is not logical to praise one who is not free from mental activity in that way.

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subh≈´ti said,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu legs so legs so //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu legs so legs so //
translated: ‚ÄúVenerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra, excellent, excellent!

original: dri'o dri'o snyam pa'i don de nyid /
analyzed: dri'o dri'o snyam pa'i don de nyid /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äòask‚Äô and ‚Äòask‚Äô is this:

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bus yang dag pa'i tshig brjod pas yongs su bzung ngo zhes bya ba ni sh'a ri'i bus brgal ba'i don dmigs su phebs te dris zhing brgal bar 'os pa'i don thog tu phebs shing legs pa dris so zhes bstod pa'o
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bus yang dag pa'i tshig brjod pas yongs su bzung ngo zhes bya ba ni sh'a ri'i bus brgal ba'i don dmigs su phebs te dris zhing brgal bar 'os pa'i don thog tu phebs shing legs pa dris so zhes bstod pa'o
translated: This praises ≈öƒÅriputra, saying that the meaning of his objection was well taken, that his question and objection were appropriate and well-asked.

original: // de ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩde ni 'di ltar tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu sems can med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa med par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni don dam par sems can dngos po yod par ma grub pas sems can de dag la snying rje chen
analyzed: // de ci'i phyir zhe na / de ni 'di ltar tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu sems can med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa med par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni don dam par sems can dngos po yod par ma grub pas sems can de dag la snying rje chen
translated: Why is that?üîΩBecause, Venerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra, you should know that mental activity does not exist because sentient beings do not exist.

original: po 'byung ba'i yid la bya ba yang don dam par med pa las yid la byed pa 'byung ba mi rigs pas gal bzung ste dris pa dmigs su phebs te legs so zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: po 'byung ba'i yid la bya ba yang don dam par med pa las yid la byed pa 'byung ba mi rigs pas gal bzung ste dris pa dmigs su phebs te legs so zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: This means that since ultimately sentient beings are not established as existent things, the mental activity that gives rise to great compassion for those sentient beings also ultimately does not exist. Since it is unreasonable for mental activity to arise from what does not exist, the meaning of the objection was well taken.

original: sems can dngos po med pa dang / sems can rang bzhin med pa dang / sems can stong pa nyid dang / sems can dben pa zhes bya ba yang med pa'i don gyi rnam grangs su zad do //
analyzed: sems can dngos po med pa dang / sems can rang bzhin med pa dang / sems can stong pa nyid dang / sems can dben pa zhes bya ba yang med pa'i don gyi rnam grangs su zad do //

original: sems can mngon par 'tshang mi rgya ba'i phyir yid la byed pa mngon par 'tshang mi rgya bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can mngon par 'tshang mi rgya ba'i phyir yid la byed pa mngon par 'tshang mi rgya bar rig par bya'o //
translated: One should know that mental activity does not become fully enlightened because sentient beings do not become fully enlightened.

original: zhes bya ba ni de ltar sems can med pas don dam par sems can de dag mngon par 'tshang rgya ba yang med cing /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de ltar sems can med pas don dam par sems can de dag mngon par 'tshang rgya ba yang med cing /
translated: This means that since sentient beings do not exist in this way, ultimately those sentient beings do not become fully enlightened,

translated: and since mental activity also does not exist ultimately, ultimately that mental activity does not become fully enlightened.

original: sems can med pa dang / sems can dngos po med pa dang / sems can rang bzhin med pa dang / sems can stong pa nyid dang / sems can dben pa dang / sems can mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya ba zhes bya ba de dag gis ni gang zag la bdag med par bstan pa'o //üîΩtshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gzugs @273a * //

translated: ‚ÄúNo sentient beings,‚Äù ‚Äúsentient beings are unreal,‚Äù ‚Äúsentient beings are essenceless,‚Äù ‚Äúsentient beings are empty,‚Äù ‚Äúsentient beings are isolated,‚Äù and ‚Äúsentient beings do not fully awaken to unsurpassed, complete enlightenment.‚ÄùüîΩVenerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra, because form is non-existent, attention should be understood to be non-existent.üîΩVenerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra, because feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are non-existent, attention should be understood to be non-existent.üîΩVenerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra, because the eyes are non-existent, attention should be understood to be non-existent.

original: med pa'i phyir yid la bya ba med par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: med pa'i phyir yid la bya ba med par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Venerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra, because the ears, nose, tongue, body, and thinking mind are non-existent, attention should be understood to be non-existent.üîΩVenerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra, because a form is non-existent, attention should be understood to be non-existent.üîΩVenerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra, because a sound, a smell, a taste, a feeling, and a dharma are non-existent, attention should be understood to be non-existent.üîΩVenerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra, because the sensory element of the eyes is non-existent, attention should be understood to be non-existent.üîΩVenerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra, because the sensory element of sights, the sensory element of eye consciousness, and the sensory element of eye contact are non-existent, attention should be understood to be non-existent.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu rnam grangs des na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di lta ste /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu rnam grangs des na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di lta ste /
translated: Venerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra, because the sensory element of the ears, the sensory element of sounds, the sensory element of ear consciousness, and the sensory element of ear contact are non-existent, attention should be understood to be non-existent.üîΩVenerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra, because the sensory element of the nose, the sensory element of smells, the sensory element of nose consciousness, and the sensory element of nose contact are non-existent, attention should be understood to be non-existent.üîΩVenerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra, because the sensory element of the tongue, the sensory element of tastes, the sensory element of tongue consciousness, and the sensory element of tongue contact are non-existent, attention should be understood to be non-existent.üîΩVenerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra, because the sensory element of the body, the sensory element of tangibles, the sensory element

translated: The passage up to ‚Äúshould be understood as never being separate from the attention of great compassion‚Äù explains that the attention of great compassion is the attention of the bodhisattva.üîΩ

original: bla na med pa'i byang chub la thug gi bar du 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos thams cad kyang med pa dang / dngos po med pa dang / rang bzhin med pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / dben pa dang / mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya ba'i don gong ma bzhin du sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: bla na med pa'i byang chub la thug gi bar du 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos thams cad kyang med pa dang / dngos po med pa dang / rang bzhin med pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / dben pa dang / mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya ba'i don gong ma bzhin du sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: The passage from ‚Äúone should know that one is never separate from the mental state of great compassion‚Äù up to ‚Äúone should know that one is never separate from the mental state of the knowledge of all aspects‚Äù explains that all mundane phenomena such as form and so on, and all supramundane phenomena such as the six perfections up to omniscience and unsurpassed enlightenment are nonexistent, are not things, are essenceless, are emptiness, are void, and do not fully awaken.

original: de ni chos la bdag med pa'i don bstan te /
analyzed: de ni chos la bdag med pa'i don bstan te /
translated: This is the explanation of the meaning of the selflessness of phenomena.

original: de ltar don dam par gang zag dang chos gnyi ga la bdag med par rtogs pa nyid kyi mthu dang byin gyi rlabs kyis yid la byed pa med cing rnam par mi rtog par lhun gyis grub pa nyid du sems can thams cad bskyab pa dang /
analyzed: de ltar don dam par gang zag dang chos gnyi ga la bdag med par rtogs pa nyid kyi mthu dang byin gyi rlabs kyis yid la byed pa med cing rnam par mi rtog par lhun gyis grub pa nyid du sems can thams cad bskyab pa dang /
translated: Thus, through the power and blessing of realizing that ultimately both the individual and phenomena are devoid of self, without any mental activity and in a state of nonconceptuality, they spontaneously protect all sentient beings.

original: sems can thams cad yongs su mi gtong bar gyur pa nyid snying rje chen po yid la byed pa dang ma bral bar rig par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad yongs su mi gtong bar gyur pa nyid snying rje chen po yid la byed pa dang ma bral bar rig par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Thus, it should be understood that by the power and blessing of the realization of the selflessness of both persons and phenomena in the ultimate, one is never separated from the mental attentions of great compassion, which is spontaneous and nonconceptual without mental activity, and which protects all sentient beings and never abandons any sentient being.üîΩThen, the Lord's approval of Subhuti's statement Subhuti, it is so!

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la legs so zhes bya ba gnang ba ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don zab mo de lta bu rab 'byor gyis sh'a ri'i bu la bshad pa'i
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la legs so zhes bya ba gnang ba ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don zab mo de lta bu rab 'byor gyis sh'a ri'i bu la bshad pa'i
translated: Subhuti, it is as you have said and so forth, shows that Subhuti's explanation to ≈öƒÅriputra of the profound meaning of the perfection of wisdom

original: don 'khor rnams the tshom med par 'dzin du gzhug pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i mthu dang byin gyi rlabs kyis khyod kyis de ltar bshad pa legs kyis gzhan gyis kyang de ltar bstan cing bslab par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: don 'khor rnams the tshom med par 'dzin du gzhug pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i mthu dang byin gyi rlabs kyis khyod kyis de ltar bshad pa legs kyis gzhan gyis kyang de ltar bstan cing bslab par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: In order to make the retinue understand the meaning without doubt, it is taught: ‚ÄúIt is good that you have explained it thus through the power and blessing of the Tathagata. Others also should teach and train in that way.‚Äù

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i le'u 'di tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis smras pa'i tshe /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i le'u 'di tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis smras pa'i tshe /
translated: When this chapter of the perfection of wisdom was spoken by the venerable Subhuti,

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di rnam pa drug tu g-yos te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa phyin ci ma log par bshad pa'i rtags su mthu dang cho 'phrul bstan pa'o //
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di rnam pa drug tu g-yos te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa phyin ci ma log par bshad pa'i rtags su mthu dang cho 'phrul bstan pa'o //
translated: this great trichiliocosm shook in six ways, and so forth. This shows the power and miracle of explaining the perfection of wisdom without error.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe 'dzum pa mdzad do zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams tshad @273b med grangs med pa dag na yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams byang chub sems dpa' rnams la shes rab kyi pha rolüîΩtu phyin pa 'di nyid ston pa mdzad do zhes bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe 'dzum pa mdzad do zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams tshad @273b med grangs med pa dag na yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams byang chub sems dpa' rnams la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid ston pa mdzad do zhes bstan pa ste /
translated: Then, the BhagavƒÅn smiled, and so forth, teaches that in the countless, limitless world systems of the ten directions, the BhagavƒÅn buddhas also teach this very perfection of wisdom to the bodhisattvas.

original: de skad bstan pa dang 'khor rnams shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la dad pa bskyed cing rjes su yi rang du gzhug pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de skad bstan pa dang 'khor rnams shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la dad pa bskyed cing rjes su yi rang du gzhug pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that and to cause the retinue to generate faith in this very perfection of wisdom and rejoice in it,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa 'di bshad pa'i tshe lha dang mi'i skye dgu bye ba khrag khrig phrag bcu gnyis mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa skyes so zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bshad
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa 'di bshad pa'i tshe lha dang mi'i skye dgu bye ba khrag khrig phrag bcu gnyis mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa skyes so zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bshad
translated: when this teaching of the perfection of wisdom was explained, 12 trillion living beings of the gods and humans generated the acceptance that phenomena are unborn and so forth.

original: pa'i don med pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: pa'i don med pa ma yin zhing /
translated: This teaches that the meaning of the explanation of the perfection of wisdom is not meaningless.

original: 'bras bu chen po dang bcas pa yin par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu chen po dang bcas pa yin par bstan pa ste /
translated: This is the teaching on the great result.

original: de yan chad kyis ni 'bring du bshad pas 'dul ba'i gdul bya rnams kyi don du /
analyzed: de yan chad kyis ni 'bring du bshad pas 'dul ba'i gdul bya rnams kyi don du /
translated: Up to this point, the explanation of the middle has been taught for the sake of those disciples who are disciplined by the middle explanation.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don 'bring du bshad pa bstan zin to //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don 'bring du bshad pa bstan zin to //
translated: Thus, the explanation of the meaning of the perfection of wisdom in the middle has been completed.

original: shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'bum pa rgya cher bshad pa las /
analyzed: shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'bum pa rgya cher bshad pa las /
translated: In the Extensive Explanation of the Perfection of Wisdom in One Hundred Thousand Lines,

original: las kyi le'u ste bcu bzhi pa'o /
analyzed: las kyi le'u ste bcu bzhi pa'o /
translated: this is the fourteenth chapter: The Chapter on Action.

original: // /'di man chad ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di rgyas par bshad pa 'byung ste /üîΩrgyas par bshad pa de yang 'dul pa'i 'gro ba yongs su ma smin pa rnams kyi the tshom skyes pa bsal bas yongs su smin par byas nas yongs su smin pa rnams de kho na nyid kyi don rtogs par bya ba'i phyir kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i
analyzed: // /'di man chad ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di rgyas par bshad pa 'byung ste / rgyas par bshad pa de yang 'dul pa'i 'gro ba yongs su ma smin pa rnams kyi the tshom skyes pa bsal bas yongs su smin par byas nas yongs su smin pa rnams de kho na nyid kyi don rtogs par bya ba'i phyir kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i
translated: From here on, the extensive explanation of this perfection of wisdom will occur.

original: tshul rnam pa gnyis kyis bstan to //
analyzed: tshul rnam pa gnyis kyis bstan to //
translated: This extensive explanation is taught in two ways: the conventional and the ultimate, in order to eliminate the doubts that arise in those beings who are not yet fully ripened through discipline, and to cause them to ripen, and to cause those who are fully ripened to realize the meaning of suchness.

original: de nas stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di na rgyal po chen po ji snyed yod pa de dag thams cad kyang lha bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du ma dang lhan cig 'khor de nyid 'dus par gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa
analyzed: de nas stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di na rgyal po chen po ji snyed yod pa de dag thams cad kyang lha bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du ma dang lhan cig 'khor de nyid 'dus par gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa
translated: Then, all the great kings that there are in this billion-world-galactic universe, together with many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of kotis of devas, were also present in that assembly.

original: ni rgyal po chen po bzhi dang / sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha la sogs pa 'dod pa'i khams dang / gzugs kyi khams kyi lha'i gtso bo rnams chos 'chad pa'i 'khor de nyid na 'khod par bstan /
analyzed: ni rgyal po chen po bzhi dang / sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha la sogs pa 'dod pa'i khams dang / gzugs kyi khams kyi lha'i gtso bo rnams chos 'chad pa'i 'khor de nyid na 'khod par bstan /
translated: This shows that the Four Great Kings, the devas of the Thirty-three, and so on, the chief devas of the world system of desire and the world system of form, were present in that assembly listening to the Dharma.

original: lha de dag 'khor de na 'khod par bstan pa yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rgyas par bshad pa 'di 'jig rten pa'i lha yongs su ma smin pa rnams yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir brtsams pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lha de dag 'khor de na 'khod par bstan pa yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rgyas par bshad pa 'di 'jig rten pa'i lha yongs su ma smin pa rnams yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir brtsams pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The teaching that those devas were present in that assembly is because this extensive explanation of the perfection of wisdom was composed in order to bring to maturity the worldly devas who were not yet mature.

original: rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams kyi las kyi rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'i lus kyi 'od gang yin pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de bzhin gshegs @274a * //
analyzed: rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams kyi las kyi rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'i lus kyi 'od gang yin pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de bzhin gshegs @274a * //
translated: The light of the body born from the maturation of karma of the gods of the Caturmaharajika realm and so on.üîΩ

original: pa'i sku'i yon tan dang mthu bstan pa ste /
analyzed: pa'i sku'i yon tan dang mthu bstan pa ste /
translated: The light of the body born from the maturation of the karma of the gods of the Caturmaharajika realm and so on teaches the qualities and powers of the Tathagata's body.üîΩThe gods of the desire realm and the form realm are naturally of good body and clear light, and are arrogant.

original: de yang 'dod pa'i khams dang / gzugs kyi khams kyi lha rnams rang bzhin gyis lus bzang zhing 'od gsal ba snyems pa rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'od kyis zil gyis mnan nas de dag nga rgyal bcag ste /
analyzed: de yang 'dod pa'i khams dang / gzugs kyi khams kyi lha rnams rang bzhin gyis lus bzang zhing 'od gsal ba snyems pa rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'od kyis zil gyis mnan nas de dag nga rgyal bcag ste /
translated: The Tathagata's natural light outshines them, and having broken their pride,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la chos gus par nyan du gzhug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la chos gus par nyan du gzhug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: he causes them to listen to the Dharma with respect for the Tathagata.

original: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis /
analyzed: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis /
translated: Then, the lord of the gods, Sakra,

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rgya cher bshad pa gleng bslang ba'i phyir brgya byin gyis smras pa'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rgya cher bshad pa gleng bslang ba'i phyir brgya byin gyis smras pa'o //
translated: To the venerable Subhuti, he said the following, and so on. This is what Shakra said in order to introduce the extensive explanation of the perfection of wisdom.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ni ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par bya zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpas chos thams cad la mi gnas pa'i tshul gyis gnas par bya ba 'og nas zhib tu bshad pa dris
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ni ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par bya zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpas chos thams cad la mi gnas pa'i tshul gyis gnas par bya ba 'og nas zhib tu bshad pa dris
translated: How should a Bodhisattva, a great being, stand in the perfection of wisdom? This is the question about how a Bodhisattva should stand in all dharmas by way of non-standing, which will be explained in detail below.

original: pa'o // byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phin pa ni gang yin zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi tshul gyis 'jug pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i tshul gyis 'jug pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'og nas zhib tu bshad pa dris pa'o //
analyzed: pa'o // byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phin pa ni gang yin zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi tshul gyis 'jug pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i tshul gyis 'jug pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'og nas zhib tu bshad pa dris pa'o //
translated: What is the perfection of wisdom of a Bodhisattva, a great being? This is the question about the perfection of wisdom that engages by way of the method of the Hearers and Solitary Realizers, and the perfection of wisdom that engages by way of the method of the Bodhisattvas, which will be explained in detail below.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ni ji ltar bslab par bya zhes bya ba ni don dam par chos gang la yang bslab tu med pa'i tshul gyis bslab par bya ba 'og nas zhib tu bshad pa dris
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ni ji ltar bslab par bya zhes bya ba ni don dam par chos gang la yang bslab tu med pa'i tshul gyis bslab par bya ba 'og nas zhib tu bshad pa dris
translated: This is the question, which is asked in the manner of training in the ultimate, in which there is nothing to train in at all, as will be explained in detail below.üîΩWhen this was said, the venerable Subh≈´ti said to ≈öakra, lord of the gods:

original: pa'o // de skad ces smras pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis lha'i dbang po brgya byin la 'di skad ces smras so zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa dang / ji ltar gnas par bya ba dang /
analyzed: pa'o // de skad ces smras pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis lha'i dbang po brgya byin la 'di skad ces smras so zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa dang / ji ltar gnas par bya ba dang /
translated: This and so forth is the perfection of wisdom, how it should be dwelled in,

original: ji ltar bslab par bya ba dang / lha'i bu gang dag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems ma bskyed pa de dag gis kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed par bya ba rnams sangs rgyas kyi mthu dang /
analyzed: ji ltar bslab par bya ba dang / lha'i bu gang dag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems ma bskyed pa de dag gis kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed par bya ba rnams sangs rgyas kyi mthu dang /
translated: how it should be trained in, and those sons of gods who have not given rise to the mind of unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening should give rise to the mind of unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis bstan par byas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis bstan par byas /
translated: through the Buddha‚Äôs blessing,

original: legs par nyon la yid la gyis shig ces bya ba'i tshig gong ma dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: legs par nyon la yid la gyis shig ces bya ba'i tshig gong ma dang sbyar ro //
translated: listen well and keep it in mind.

original: gang yang dag pa skyon @274b med par zhugs par gyur pa de dag ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i mthu med de zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa nyan thos rgyun du zhugs pa yan chad la yang dag par
analyzed: gang yang dag pa skyon @274b med par zhugs par gyur pa de dag ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i mthu med de zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa nyan thos rgyun du zhugs pa yan chad la yang dag par
translated: Those who have entered the faultless state are not able to generate the mind for unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: skyon med par zhugs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: skyon med par zhugs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Those who are Stream Enterers and so on are called ‚Äúthose who have entered the faultless state.‚Äù

original: de ltar theg pa chung ngu la sems nges par gyur pa de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' ltar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed mi nus so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar theg pa chung ngu la sems nges par gyur pa de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' ltar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed mi nus so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Those whose minds have turned to the Lesser Vehicle in that way are not able to generate the mind for unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment like the bodhisattvas.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de dag gis 'khor ba'i rgyud kyi mtshams bcad pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba ni nyan thos rnams bla na med pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed mi nus pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de dag gis 'khor ba'i rgyud kyi mtshams bcad pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba ni nyan thos rnams bla na med pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed mi nus pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: This teaches the reason why sravakas are unable to generate the intention to achieve unsurpassable enlightenment.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni sems can gyi don du 'khor ba mi spong bar 'dul ba'i dbang gis 'khor bar skye zhing 'khor ba na gnas te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni sems can gyi don du 'khor ba mi spong bar 'dul ba'i dbang gis 'khor bar skye zhing 'khor ba na gnas te /
translated: Bodhisattvas do not abandon samsara for the sake of sentient beings and, by the power of their training, they take birth in samsara and abide there.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rlabs chen po rnams yun ring du spyad de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rlabs chen po rnams yun ring du spyad de /
translated: They practice the vast waves of bodhisattva activity for a long time

original: bla na med pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya bar byed kyi /
analyzed: bla na med pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya bar byed kyi /
translated: and then they attain manifest, complete enlightenment in unsurpassable enlightenment.

original: nyan thos rnams ni 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal gyis skrag nas 'khor ba spangs te /
analyzed: nyan thos rnams ni 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal gyis skrag nas 'khor ba spangs te /
translated: Sravakas, on the other hand, are terrified by the sufferings of samsara and abandon samsara.

original: myur du zhi ba phyogs gcig pa'i mya ngan las 'da' ba la 'khor ba'i rgyud kyi mtshams bcad pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: myur du zhi ba phyogs gcig pa'i mya ngan las 'da' ba la 'khor ba'i rgyud kyi mtshams bcad pa zhes bya ste /
translated: They quickly attain nirvana, which is a one sided peace. This is called severing the continuum of samsara.

original: de'i phyir bla na med pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i mthu med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir bla na med pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i mthu med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Therefore, they do not have the power to generate the thought of unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: 'on kyang gal te de dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed na /
analyzed: 'on kyang gal te de dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed na /
translated: But if they generate the thought of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment,üîΩI rejoice in that.

original: de dag la yang rjes su yi rang ngo zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa nyan thos rnams la yang bla na med pa'i byang chub tu 'grub par 'gyur ba'i skal ba yod pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de dag la yang rjes su yi rang ngo zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa nyan thos rnams la yang bla na med pa'i byang chub tu 'grub par 'gyur ba'i skal ba yod pa bstan pa ste /
translated: This shows that even the noble ≈õrƒÅvakas have the fortune to accomplish unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: nyan thos zhi ba phyogs gcig pa la gnas pa las skal pa dang sbyar nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'od kyis bskul nas bla na med pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed cing byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la 'jug pa dag kyang yod de /
analyzed: nyan thos zhi ba phyogs gcig pa la gnas pa las skal pa dang sbyar nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'od kyis bskul nas bla na med pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed cing byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la 'jug pa dag kyang yod de /
translated: There are those who, from abiding in the ≈õrƒÅvakas' one-sided peace, are inspired by the light of the TathƒÅgatas and generate the thought of unsurpassed enlightenment, and engage in the conduct of bodhisattvas.

original: de dag la yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bstan to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dag la yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bstan to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of this perfection of wisdom was taught to them as well.

original: khyad par du 'phags pa'i chos rnams las khyad par du 'phags pa'i chos rnams thob par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: khyad par du 'phags pa'i chos rnams las khyad par du 'phags pa'i chos rnams thob par 'gyur bas /
translated: and they will attain the qualities that are superior to the superior qualities.üîΩTherefore, I will not create obstacles for their virtuous activities.

original: de dag gi dge ba'i phyogs la bdag ni bar chad mi byed do zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa nyan thos rnams 'jig rten pa phal dang / mu stegs can rnams las @275a * //üîΩkhyad par du 'phags pa yin la /
analyzed: de dag gi dge ba'i phyogs la bdag ni bar chad mi byed do zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa nyan thos rnams 'jig rten pa phal dang / mu stegs can rnams las @275a * // khyad par du 'phags pa yin la /
translated: In this way, the noble ≈õrƒÅvakas are superior to ordinary worldly people and to tƒ´rthikas.

original: nyan thos las kyang byang chub sems dpa'i khyad par du 'phags pa yin te /
analyzed: nyan thos las kyang byang chub sems dpa'i khyad par du 'phags pa yin te /
translated: And the bodhisattvas are superior to the ≈õrƒÅvakas.

original: de ltar nyan thos las byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la 'jug pa srid pas de dag la yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bstan par bya'i//
analyzed: de ltar nyan thos las byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la 'jug pa srid pas de dag la yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bstan par bya'i//
translated: Thus, since it is possible for bodhisattvas to enter the bodhisattva way from the ≈õrƒÅvaka way, this perfection of wisdom should be taught to them as well.

original: nyan thos rnams bkol te gzhag par ni mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nyan thos rnams bkol te gzhag par ni mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one should not abandon the ≈õrƒÅvakas and leave them aside.

original: koo shi ka de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: koo shi ka de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang zhe na /
translated: Kau≈õika, what is the perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattva mahƒÅsattva?

original: koo shi ka 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gzugs ni mi rtag pa yid la bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /üîΩgong du brgya byin gyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gang yin zhes dris pa'i lan du rab 'byor gyis nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa'i tshul gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la
analyzed: koo shi ka 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gzugs ni mi rtag pa yid la bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni / gong du brgya byin gyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gang yin zhes dris pa'i lan du rab 'byor gyis nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa'i tshul gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la
