translated: Kau≈õika, here, a bodhisattva mahƒÅsattva, with a thought endowed with the knowledge of all aspects, should attend to form as impermanent, and so on.

original: 'jug pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: 'jug pa bstan pa ste /
translated: Above, ≈öatakratu asked, ‚ÄúWhat is the perfection of wisdom of a bodhisattva mahƒÅsattva?‚Äù In reply, Subh≈´ti explained the entry into the perfection of wisdom by way of the levels of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams la mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba la sogs par yid la byas na thams cad shes pa nyid kyi phyogs su gtogs pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams la mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba la sogs par yid la byas na thams cad shes pa nyid kyi phyogs su gtogs pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin
translated: When one attends to form, etc., as impermanent, suffering, etc., with the generation of the thought endowed with the knowledge of all modes, it is the perfection of wisdom belonging to the side of the knowledge of all modes.

original: pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the teaching.

original: de la gzugs ni mi rtag par yid la bya'o zhes bya ba ni ma byung ba las byung ba dang / byung nas kyang med par 'gyur ba'i phyir mi rtag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la gzugs ni mi rtag par yid la bya'o zhes bya ba ni ma byung ba las byung ba dang / byung nas kyang med par 'gyur ba'i phyir mi rtag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therein, one should attend to form as impermanent, because it is impermanent in the sense of arising from what was not and then ceasing to be after having come into being.

original: gzugs ni sdug bsngal bar yid la bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnod pa sna tshogs dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs ni sdug bsngal bar yid la bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnod pa sna tshogs dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One should attend to form as suffering, because it is associated with various kinds of harm.

original: gzugs ni bdag med par yid la bya'o zhes bya ba ni mu stegs can gyis brtags pa'i bdag gi mtshan nyid dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs ni bdag med par yid la bya'o zhes bya ba ni mu stegs can gyis brtags pa'i bdag gi mtshan nyid dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One should attend to form as without self, because it is not endowed with the characteristics of a self imagined by the heterodox.

original: gzugs ni zhi bar yid la bya'o zhes bya ba ni don dam par sdug bsngal thams cad zhi ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs ni zhi bar yid la bya'o zhes bya ba ni don dam par sdug bsngal thams cad zhi ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Form should be seen as peace, because ultimately it is the pacification of all suffering.

original: gzugs ni dben par yid la bya'o zhes bya ba ni don dam par nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs ni dben par yid la bya'o zhes bya ba ni don dam par nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Form should be seen as void, because ultimately it is free from the afflictions.

original: gzugs ni nang du yid la bya'o zhes bya ba ni rkyen du mas gso dgos pa dang / lus dang yid kyi sdug bsngal 'byung ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir nad du @275b yid la bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs ni nang du yid la bya'o zhes bya ba ni rkyen du mas gso dgos pa dang / lus dang yid kyi sdug bsngal 'byung ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir nad du @275b yid la bya'o //
translated: Form should be seen as an inner phenomenon, because it is the cause of the suffering of body and mind, which must be cured by many conditions.

original: gzugs ni shu bar yid la bya'o zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi gnod pa dang ldan pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i rnag khrag zag pa'i phyir shu ba dang 'dra bas shu bar yid la bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs ni shu bar yid la bya'o zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi gnod pa dang ldan pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i rnag khrag zag pa'i phyir shu ba dang 'dra bas shu bar yid la bya'o //
translated: Form should be seen as a boil, because it is like a boil, since it is associated with the harm of suffering and is the oozing of the pus and blood of the afflictions.

original: gzugs ni zug rngur yid la bya'o zhes bya ba ni phyi nang gi gnod pas zug par byed cing bcos bka' ba'i phyir zug rngu dang 'dra bas zug rngur yid la bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs ni zug rngur yid la bya'o zhes bya ba ni phyi nang gi gnod pas zug par byed cing bcos bka' ba'i phyir zug rngu dang 'dra bas zug rngur yid la bya'o //
translated: Form should be seen as a thorn, because it is like a thorn, since it is pierced by inner and outer harms and is difficult to remove.

original: gzugs ni sdig par yid la bya'o zhes bya ba ni smad par bya ba dang / ma rung bar 'gyur ba'i phyir sdig pa dang 'dra bas sdig par yid la bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs ni sdig par yid la bya'o zhes bya ba ni smad par bya ba dang / ma rung bar 'gyur ba'i phyir sdig pa dang 'dra bas sdig par yid la bya'o //
translated: Form should be taken to mind as a misfortune, because it is the cause of contempt and misfortune, it is like a misfortune.

original: gzugs na ni bar yid la bya'o zhes bya ba ni yun ring po'i gnod pa dang ldan pa'i phyir nad rnying na ba dang 'dra bas na bar yid la bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs na ni bar yid la bya'o zhes bya ba ni yun ring po'i gnod pa dang ldan pa'i phyir nad rnying na ba dang 'dra bas na bar yid la bya'o //
translated: Form should be taken to mind as an illness, because it is the cause of long-lasting harm, it is like an old, chronic illness.

original: gzugs ni dgrar yid la bya'o zhes bya ba ni mi bde ba dang gnod pa sna tshogs 'byung ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dgra dang 'dra bas dgrar yid la bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs ni dgrar yid la bya'o zhes bya ba ni mi bde ba dang gnod pa sna tshogs 'byung ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dgra dang 'dra bas dgrar yid la bya'o //
translated: Form should be taken to mind as an enemy, because it is the cause of various kinds of misfortune and harm, it is like an enemy.

original: gzugs ni 'jig pa'i chos can du yid la bya'o zhes bya ba ni nad dang / rgas pa dang / 'chi ba rnams kyis rab tu 'jig pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir 'jig pa'i chos can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs ni 'jig pa'i chos can du yid la bya'o zhes bya ba ni nad dang / rgas pa dang / 'chi ba rnams kyis rab tu 'jig pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir 'jig pa'i chos can zhes bya'o //
translated: Form should be taken to mind as subject to destruction, because it is by nature subject to destruction by sickness, aging, and death.

original: gzugs ni mi brtan par yid la bya'o zhes bya ba ni skye ba dang rgas pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs dang / gzhan du 'gyur zhing mal gcig na mi gnas pa'i phyir mi brtan pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs ni mi brtan par yid la bya'o zhes bya ba ni skye ba dang rgas pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs dang / gzhan du 'gyur zhing mal gcig na mi gnas pa'i phyir mi brtan pa'o //
translated: Form should be seen as impermanent, because it is impermanent in the sense of being subject to birth, decay, etc., and does not remain in the same state.

original: gzugs ni 'jig par yid la bya'o zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngang gis 'jig pa dang / 'jig par byed pa'i rkyen rnams kyis 'jig pa'i phyir 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs ni 'jig par yid la bya'o zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngang gis 'jig pa dang / 'jig par byed pa'i rkyen rnams kyis 'jig pa'i phyir 'jig pa'o //
translated: Form should be seen as perishable, because it perishes by its very nature and because it perishes through the conditions that cause its destruction.

original: gzugs ni 'jigs par yid la bya'o zhes bya ba ni phyi'i dgra dang nang gi nad la sogs pa'i 'jigs pa kun gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs ni 'jigs par yid la bya'o zhes bya ba ni phyi'i dgra dang nang gi nad la sogs pa'i 'jigs pa kun gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Form should be seen as a danger, because it is the cause of all dangers, such as external enemies and internal diseases.

original: gzugs ni 'go ba'i nad du yid la bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnod pa rnam pa mang po dang 'dre ba dang / 'go ba'i nad dang 'dra ba'i phyir 'go ba'i nad do //
analyzed: gzugs ni 'go ba'i nad du yid la bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnod pa rnam pa mang po dang 'dre ba dang / 'go ba'i nad dang 'dra ba'i phyir 'go ba'i nad do //
translated: Form should be seen as a disease, because it is associated with many kinds of harm and is like a disease.

original: gzugs ni stong pa nyid du yid la bya'o zhes bya ba ni nang gi byed pa po med pa'i phyir stong pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs ni stong pa nyid du yid la bya'o zhes bya ba ni nang gi byed pa po med pa'i phyir stong pa'o //
translated: Form should be seen as empty, because it is empty of an internal creator.

original: gzugs ni bdag gi ba med par yid la bya'o zhes bya ba ni tshor ba la sogs pa'i chos rnams la bdag gi bar 'dzin pa'i lta ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs ni bdag gi ba med par yid la bya'o zhes bya ba ni tshor ba la sogs pa'i chos rnams la bdag gi bar 'dzin pa'i lta ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Form should be taken to mind as not being one‚Äôs own. This is because there is no view that grasps feelings, etc., as one‚Äôs own.

original: gzugs ni yid brtan du mi rung bar yid la bya'o zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa ma yin pa las kun brtags pa yin te /
analyzed: gzugs ni yid brtan du mi rung bar yid la bya'o zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa ma yin pa las kun brtags pa yin te /
translated: Form should be taken to mind as not being a support. This is because it is imagined to be something that is not real.

original: 'gyur zhing mi brtan pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgzugs ni gnod par yid la bya'o zhes bya ba ni lus dang sems la mi bde @276a * //
analyzed: 'gyur zhing mi brtan pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir ro // gzugs ni gnod par yid la bya'o zhes bya ba ni lus dang sems la mi bde @276a * //
translated: Form should be taken to mind as changeable and inconstant, because it is a phenomenon that changes and is not constant.üîΩForm should be taken to mind as a danger, because it is the cause of various kinds of physical and mental suffering and harm.üîΩForm should be taken to mind as a disease, because it is the cause of the disease of the afflictions.

original: ba dang / gnod pa sna tshogs 'byung ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir gnod par yid la bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: ba dang / gnod pa sna tshogs 'byung ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir gnod par yid la bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Form should be taken to mind as a tumor, because it is the cause of the tumor of the afflictions.üîΩForm should be taken to mind as a dart, because it is the cause of the dart of the afflictions.üîΩForm should be taken to mind as a misfortune, because it is the cause of the misfortune of the afflictions.üîΩForm should be taken to mind as impermanent, by way of the thought of awakening that is endowed with the knowledge of all aspects, and so on up to:

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas da mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis tshor ba ni mi rtag par yid la bya'o zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas da mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis tshor ba ni mi rtag par yid la bya'o zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Form should be taken to mind as empty, by way of the thought of awakening that is endowed with the knowledge of all aspects, and so on up to:üîΩForm should be taken to mind as selfless, by way of the thought of awakening that is endowed with the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rga shi ni gnod par yid la bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du yang mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i don de bzhin du sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: rga shi ni gnod par yid la bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du yang mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i don de bzhin du sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: In this way, the meaning of impermanence and so forth should be applied.

original: de dag gis ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'i tshul gyis thams cad shes pa nyid kyi phyogs su gtogs pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan to //
analyzed: de dag gis ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'i tshul gyis thams cad shes pa nyid kyi phyogs su gtogs pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan to //
translated: By these, the perfection of wisdom belonging to the category of the knowledge of all aspects through the vehicle of the hearers and solitary realizers is taught.

original: koo shi ka gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni byang chub
analyzed: koo shi ka gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni byang chub
translated: Moreover, Kau≈õika, the bodhisattva mahƒÅsattva, with the generation of the mind endowed with omniscience, practices the perfection of generosity by way of non-apprehension.

original: sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid kyi phyogs su gtogs pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid kyi phyogs su gtogs pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa ste /
translated: This and so forth teaches the perfection of wisdom belonging to the category of the knowledge of the aspects of the path of the bodhisattvas' practice.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do zhes bya ba nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni kun rdzob
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do zhes bya ba nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni kun rdzob
translated: The phrase ‚Äúby generating the mind that is set on complete knowing, they practice the perfection of generosity without apprehending anything‚Äù up to ‚Äúthey practice the perfection of wisdom‚Äù is the conventional

original: tu bdag dang / sems can thams cad rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par gyur cig ces bya ba'i sems bskyed pas pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod la /
analyzed: tu bdag dang / sems can thams cad rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par gyur cig ces bya ba'i sems bskyed pas pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod la /
translated: aspect. It teaches that by generating the mind that thinks, ‚ÄúMay I and all sentient beings attain complete knowing,‚Äù they practice the six perfections.

original: don dam par de yang mi dmigs par spyod pa ni lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid kyi phyogs su gtogs pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: don dam par de yang mi dmigs par spyod pa ni lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid kyi phyogs su gtogs pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthey practice without apprehending anything‚Äù is the ultimate aspect. It teaches that the perfection of wisdom that is included in the aspect of the path is the practice of the perfection of wisdom without apprehending anything.

original: koo shi ka gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi sgom mo zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: koo shi ka gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi sgom mo zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Furthermore, Kau≈õika, the bodhisattva mahƒÅsattva, with the generation of the thought endowed with the knowledge of all aspects, cultivates the four establishments of mindfulness by way of non-apprehension,üîΩup to cultivates the eighteen distinct qualities of the Buddha by way of non-apprehension.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad sgom mo zhes bya ba'i bar du ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi la sogs pa rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams sgom pa'i tshe kun rdzob tu bdag dang sems can thams cad rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad sgom mo zhes bya ba'i bar du ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi la sogs pa rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams sgom pa'i tshe kun rdzob tu bdag dang sems can thams cad rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa
translated: When cultivating the factors of purification such as the four establishments of mindfulness, etc., with the generation of the thought of dedication, ‚ÄúMay I and all sentient beings attain the knowledge of all aspects

original: nyid thob par gyur cig ces yongs su bsngo ba'i sems bskyed pa dang ldan pas sgom zhing don dam par de'ang mi dmigs par sgom pa nyid @276b lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid kyi phyogs su gtogs pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin no
analyzed: nyid thob par gyur cig ces yongs su bsngo ba'i sems bskyed pa dang ldan pas sgom zhing don dam par de'ang mi dmigs par sgom pa nyid @276b lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid kyi phyogs su gtogs pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin no
translated: in all aspects,‚Äù cultivating while endowed with that, and also cultivating by way of non-apprehension of that ultimately, is the perfection of wisdom belonging to the aspect of the path.

original: zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: This is what is taught.

original: koo shi ka gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: koo shi ka gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: ‚ÄúMoreover, Kau≈õika, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: 'di ltar so so yang dag par slob ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid kyi phyogs su gtogs pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa'i rang bzhin la yang dag par rtog cing
analyzed: 'di ltar so so yang dag par slob ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid kyi phyogs su gtogs pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa'i rang bzhin la yang dag par rtog cing
translated: they train like this‚Ä¶‚Äù and so on. This teaches the perfection of wisdom that is included in the aspect of the knowledge of the path, the correct realization of the nature of the individual and phenomena that are the emptiness of self,

original: slob pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: slob pa bstan pa ste /
translated: and the training in that.

original: 'di ltar chos rnams mngon par brlan par byed pa dang / yongs su brlan par byed pa dang / yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / yongs su rgyas par byed pa dang / yongs su dpyod par byed pa de dag ni chos kho nar zad de /
analyzed: 'di ltar chos rnams mngon par brlan par byed pa dang / yongs su brlan par byed pa dang / yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / yongs su rgyas par byed pa dang / yongs su dpyod par byed pa de dag ni chos kho nar zad de /
translated: ‚ÄúIt is like this: those who moisten, fully moisten, fully perfect, fully expand, and fully analyze phenomena are nothing but phenomena.‚Äù

original: de la bdag gam bdag gi med do zhes bya ba ni gang zag la bdag med pa brtag pa'i sgo nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de la bdag gam bdag gi med do zhes bya ba ni gang zag la bdag med pa brtag pa'i sgo nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa ste /
translated: The statement there is no self or anything pertaining to a self is the teaching of the perfection of wisdom by way of the investigation of the selflessness of persons.

original: byang chub sems dpa' byang chub tu sems bskyed nas byams pa dang / snying rje'i dbang gis sems can 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gis gdungs pa rnams kyi sems kyi rgyud byams pa dang / snying rje la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can du byas te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' byang chub tu sems bskyed nas byams pa dang / snying rje'i dbang gis sems can 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gis gdungs pa rnams kyi sems kyi rgyud byams pa dang / snying rje la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can du byas te /
translated: After a bodhisattva has generated the thought of enlightenment, through the power of love and compassion, he makes the mental continuum of sentient beings, who are tormented by attachment, hostility, and benightedness, have the nature of love, compassion, etc.

original: dul zhing zhi ba'i sems su byed ba ni byang chub kyi sems dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / yongs su bsngo ba'i sems kyi chos nyid tsam du zad kyi mu stegs can gyis yongs su brtags pa'i byed pa po bdag la sogs pa gang yang med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dul zhing zhi ba'i sems su byed ba ni byang chub kyi sems dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / yongs su bsngo ba'i sems kyi chos nyid tsam du zad kyi mu stegs can gyis yongs su brtags pa'i byed pa po bdag la sogs pa gang yang med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: He makes their minds peaceful and subdued. This is the mere reality of the thought of enlightenment, the root of virtue, and the thought of dedication. It is taught that there is no self whatsoever, such as the self imagined by the heterodox, which is an agent.

original: chos rnams mngon par brlan par byed pa zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams kyi sems kyi rgyud 'dod chags la sogs pas gdungs shing khengs pa rnams byang chub kyi sems dang dge ba'i rtsa ba dang yongs su bsngo ba'i sems kyis byams pa dang /
analyzed: chos rnams mngon par brlan par byed pa zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams kyi sems kyi rgyud 'dod chags la sogs pas gdungs shing khengs pa rnams byang chub kyi sems dang dge ba'i rtsa ba dang yongs su bsngo ba'i sems kyis byams pa dang /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúto moisten phenomena‚Äù means that the mind-streams of sentient beings, which are tormented and inflated by desire and so forth, are moistened and subdued by the mind of enlightenment, by the roots of virtue, and by the mind of dedication.

original: snying rje la sogs pas mngon par brlan cing dul bar byas nas dang po sbyin pa la sogs pa bsdu ba rnam pa bzhi la 'jug pa'i sems bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: snying rje la sogs pas mngon par brlan cing dul bar byas nas dang po sbyin pa la sogs pa bsdu ba rnam pa bzhi la 'jug pa'i sems bskyed pa'o //
translated: Having generated the mind that engages in the four means of gathering students, such as generosity, one should first generate the mind of enlightenment.

original: yongs su brlan par byed pa zhes bya ba ni de ltar sems bskyed nas sbyin pa la sogs pa dngos su byed du 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su brlan par byed pa zhes bya ba ni de ltar sems bskyed nas sbyin pa la sogs pa dngos su byed du 'jug pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúto moisten completely‚Äù means that, having generated the mind in this way, one should engage in the actual practice of generosity and so forth.

original: yongs su rdzogs par byed pa zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa la sogs pa de dag 'khor gsum yongs su dag cing mthar phyin par byed pa'o //üîΩyongs @277a * //
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs par byed pa zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa la sogs pa de dag 'khor gsum yongs su dag cing mthar phyin par byed pa'o //üîΩyongs @277a * //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúto perfect completely‚Äù means that one should bring these practices of generosity and so forth to completion, purifying them of the three spheres.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúto purify completely‚Äù means that one should purify these practices of generosity and so forth of the three spheres.

original: su rgyas par byed pa zhes bya ba ni yongs su bsngo ba'i sems kyis bdag dang sems can thams cad bla na med pa'i byang chub tu 'grub par yongs su bsngo zhing khyab par byed pa'o //üîΩyongs su dpyod par byed pa zhes bya ba ni de ltar sbyin pa la sogs pa byed pa'i sngon rol lam /
analyzed: su rgyas par byed pa zhes bya ba ni yongs su bsngo ba'i sems kyis bdag dang sems can thams cad bla na med pa'i byang chub tu 'grub par yongs su bsngo zhing khyab par byed pa'o // yongs su dpyod par byed pa zhes bya ba ni de ltar sbyin pa la sogs pa byed pa'i sngon rol lam /
translated: The phrase pervading with refers to the dedication of the thought of complete enlightenment, which dedicates oneself and all sentient beings to the attainment of supreme enlightenment.

original: byas zin pa'i 'og tu shes rab kyis sbyin pa byed pa dang / sbyin pa'i rdzas dang / len pa po rnams mi dmigs par dpyod pa'o //
analyzed: byas zin pa'i 'og tu shes rab kyis sbyin pa byed pa dang / sbyin pa'i rdzas dang / len pa po rnams mi dmigs par dpyod pa'o //
translated: The phrase examining refers to the examination with wisdom of the act of giving, the gift, and the recipient, either before or after the act of giving.üîΩThe phrase they are only phenomena means that there is no self or mine in them. The phrase they are only mental functions means that the self and the world are only mind.

original: de dag ni chos kho nar zad de de la bdag gam bdag gi med do zhes bya ba ni de ltar mngon par brlan par byed pa la sogs pa ni byang chub kyi sems la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyis byas par zad kyi bdag la sogs pa'i byed
analyzed: de dag ni chos kho nar zad de de la bdag gam bdag gi med do zhes bya ba ni de ltar mngon par brlan par byed pa la sogs pa ni byang chub kyi sems la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyis byas par zad kyi bdag la sogs pa'i byed
translated: The phrase they are only names means that the self and the world are only names. The phrase they are only conventions means that the self and the world are only conventions.üîΩThe phrase they are only designations means that the self and the world are only designations. The phrase they are only thoughts means that the self and the world are only thoughts.

original: pa po gang gis kyang byas pa med do zhes gang zag la bdag med pa'i don mjug bsdus te bstan pa'o //
analyzed: pa po gang gis kyang byas pa med do zhes gang zag la bdag med pa'i don mjug bsdus te bstan pa'o //
translated: Thus, he concludes and teaches the meaning of the selflessness of persons.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i yongs su bsngo ba'i sems gang yin pa de yang byang chub kyi sems dang 'grogs pa ma yin /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i yongs su bsngo ba'i sems gang yin pa de yang byang chub kyi sems dang 'grogs pa ma yin /
translated: Because the thought of the bodhisattva great being‚Äôs dedication is not accompanied by the thought of awakening,üîΩand the thought of awakening is not accompanied by the thought of dedication.

original: byang chub kyi sems gang yin pa de yang yongs su bsngo ba'i sems dang 'grogs pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni chos la bdag med par rtogs pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems gang yin pa de yang yongs su bsngo ba'i sems dang 'grogs pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni chos la bdag med par rtogs pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa ste /
translated: This teaches the perfection of wisdom that is the realization of the selflessness of phenomena.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i byang chub kyi sems dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su bsngo ba'i sems kyis sems can rnams kyi sems kyi rgyud mngon par brlan pa la sogs pa byed pa'i byang chub kyi sems dang / yongs su bsngo ba'i sems de gnyi ga yang don dam pa'i dngos po med pas gcig la gcig gnas pa'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i byang chub kyi sems dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su bsngo ba'i sems kyis sems can rnams kyi sems kyi rgyud mngon par brlan pa la sogs pa byed pa'i byang chub kyi sems dang / yongs su bsngo ba'i sems de gnyi ga yang don dam pa'i dngos po med pas gcig la gcig gnas pa'am /
translated: Both of those minds of enlightenment and dedication are not established in each other because they are ultimately unreal things.

original: phan tshun 'phrad cing 'grogs pa med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: phan tshun 'phrad cing 'grogs pa med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: They do not mutually meet and accompany each other.

original: koo shi ka yongs su bsngo ba'i sems gang yin pa de ni byang chub kyi sems la med cing mi dmigs /
analyzed: koo shi ka yongs su bsngo ba'i sems gang yin pa de ni byang chub kyi sems la med cing mi dmigs /
translated: Kau≈õika, the mind of dedication is not in the mind of enlightenment and is not apprehended.üîΩThe mind of enlightenment is not in the mind of dedication and is not apprehended.

original: byang chub kyi sems gang yin pa de ni yongs su bsngo ba'i sems la med cing mi dmigs te zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi sems dang / yongs su bsngo ba'i sems gnyis phan tshun du mi 'phrad cing mi 'grogs pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems gang yin pa de ni yongs su bsngo ba'i sems la med cing mi dmigs te zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi sems dang / yongs su bsngo ba'i sems gnyis phan tshun du mi 'phrad cing mi 'grogs pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: This shows the reason why the mind of enlightenment and the mind of dedication do not mutually meet and accompany each other.

original: don dam par de gnyis ka'i dngos po med cing mi dmigs pa'i phyir gcig la gcig rten cing 'grogs pa yang med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: don dam par de gnyis ka'i dngos po med cing mi dmigs pa'i phyir gcig la gcig rten cing 'grogs pa yang med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because ultimately both of them are non-existent and non-apprehensible, therefore there is no mutual dependence and association.

original: koo shi ka gang de ltar chos thams cad la yang rab tu @277b rtog la /üîΩchos gang la yang rnam par rgyu ba med pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob tu gang zag dang chos la bdag med par rtog kyang don dam par chos gang la
analyzed: koo shi ka gang de ltar chos thams cad la yang rab tu @277b rtog la / chos gang la yang rnam par rgyu ba med pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob tu gang zag dang chos la bdag med par rtog kyang don dam par chos gang la
translated: Kau≈õika, this is the perfection of wisdom of bodhisattva-mahƒÅsattvas, who thus thoroughly investigate all phenomena,üîΩbut do not engage in any phenomenon whatsoever.

original: yang mtshan mar me 'dzin cing chags pa med pa de nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: yang mtshan mar me 'dzin cing chags pa med pa de nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: This teaches that although conventionally one thoroughly investigates the selflessness of persons and phenomena, ultimately not apprehending and not grasping at any phenomenon as a sign is itself the perfection of wisdom.

original: de skad ces smras pa dang / lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis gnas brtan rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de skad ces smras pa dang / lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis gnas brtan rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: When this was said, ≈öatakratu, head of the gods, said to the elder Subh≈´ti:

original: btsun pa rab 'byor ji ltar na yongs su bsngo ba'i sems byang chub kyi sems dang 'grogs pa ma yin /
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor ji ltar na yongs su bsngo ba'i sems byang chub kyi sems dang 'grogs pa ma yin /
translated: Venerable Subh≈´ti, how is the thought of dedication not accompanied by the thought of awakening?

original: ji ltar na byang chub kyi sems yongs su bsngo ba'i sems dang 'grogs pa ma yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na byang chub kyi sems yongs su bsngo ba'i sems dang 'grogs pa ma yin /
translated: How is the thought of awakening not accompanied by the thought of dedication?

original: ji ltar na yongs su bsngo ba'i sems byang chub kyi sems la med cing mi dmigs /
analyzed: ji ltar na yongs su bsngo ba'i sems byang chub kyi sems la med cing mi dmigs /
translated: How is the thought of dedication not present in the thought of awakening and not found there?üîΩHow is the thought of awakening not present in the thought of dedication and not found there?‚Äù

original: ji ltar na byang chub kyi sems yongs su bsngo ba'i sems la med cing mi dmigs zhes bya ba ni yongs su bsngo ba'i sems dang / byang chub kyi sems gnyis don dam par dngos po med cing bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i don zhib tu bshad pa'i skabs dbye ba'i phyir brgya byin gyis rab 'byor la dris pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar na byang chub kyi sems yongs su bsngo ba'i sems la med cing mi dmigs zhes bya ba ni yongs su bsngo ba'i sems dang / byang chub kyi sems gnyis don dam par dngos po med cing bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i don zhib tu bshad pa'i skabs dbye ba'i phyir brgya byin gyis rab 'byor la dris pa'o //
translated: This is ≈öakra‚Äôs question to Subh≈´ti, opening up the opportunity for a detailed explanation of the ultimate unreality and inconceivability of the two thoughts, the thought of dedication and the thought of awakening.

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subh≈´ti replied,

original: koo shi ka yongs su bsngo ba'i sems gang yin pa de ni sems ma yin /
analyzed: koo shi ka yongs su bsngo ba'i sems gang yin pa de ni sems ma yin /
translated: ‚ÄúKau≈õika, the thought of dedication is not a thought.

original: byang chub kyi sems gang yin pa de yang sems ma yin te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems gang yin pa de yang sems ma yin te /
translated: The thought of awakening is also not a thought.

original: de ltar na sems ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na sems ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //
translated: Thus, whatever is not mind is inconceivable.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa gang yin pa de ni sems ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa gang yin pa de ni sems ma yin pa ste /
translated: Whatever is inconceivable is not mind.

original: sems ma yin pa de ni sems ma yin par yongs su bsngo ba med /
analyzed: sems ma yin pa de ni sems ma yin par yongs su bsngo ba med /
translated: That which is not mind is not dedicated to being not mind.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa yang bsam gyis mi khyab par yongs su bsngo ba med de /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa yang bsam gyis mi khyab par yongs su bsngo ba med de /
translated: The inconceivable is not dedicated to being inconceivable.

original: de ltar na sems ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na sems ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //
translated: Thus, whatever is not mind is inconceivable.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa gang yin pa de ni sems ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa gang yin pa de ni sems ma yin pa ste /
translated: Whatever is inconceivable is not mind.üîΩKau≈õika, this is the perfection of wisdom of bodhisattva great beings.‚Äù

original: koo shi ka 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su bsngo ba'i sems dang / byang chub kyi sems gnyi ga yang don dam par yod par ma grub pas sems ma yin te /
analyzed: koo shi ka 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su bsngo ba'i sems dang / byang chub kyi sems gnyi ga yang don dam par yod par ma grub pas sems ma yin te /
translated: Both the mind that is the dedication of the roots of virtue and the mind of awakening are not mind because they are not established as ultimately existent.

original: de ltar sems ma yin pa de ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar sems ma yin pa de ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin no //
translated: Thus, that which is not mind is inconceivable.

original: de ltar bsam gyis mi khyab cing sems ma yin pa de la yongs su bsngo ba med par yongs @278a * //
analyzed: de ltar bsam gyis mi khyab cing sems ma yin pa de la yongs su bsngo ba med par yongs @278a * //
translated: Thus, in that inconceivable, non-mental state, there is no dedication.

original: su rtogs nas rnam par mi rtog par gyur pa de nyid byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: su rtogs nas rnam par mi rtog par gyur pa de nyid byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Having understood that, the non-conceptualization itself is the perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattva.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the venerable Subh≈´ti:

original: rab 'byor khyod de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston cing mos pa bskyed pa legs so legs so //
analyzed: rab 'byor khyod de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston cing mos pa bskyed pa legs so legs so //
translated: Subh≈´ti, it is excellent, excellent that you teach the perfection of wisdom to the bodhisattva-mahƒÅsattvas and generate enthusiasm for it.

original: rab 'byor legs so zhes bya ba ni gong du rab 'byor gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don zab mo bstan pa legs so zhes bstod pa dang / bka' drin dran par bya ba'i tshig 'og nas 'chad pa gleng bslang ba'i phyir gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor legs so zhes bya ba ni gong du rab 'byor gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don zab mo bstan pa legs so zhes bstod pa dang / bka' drin dran par bya ba'i tshig 'og nas 'chad pa gleng bslang ba'i phyir gsungs pa'o //
translated: Excellent is praising Subh≈´ti above for teaching the profound meaning of the perfection of wisdom, and saying Excellent in order to remind him of his kindness and to introduce the explanation below.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subh≈´ti said:

original: bcom ldan 'das bdag gis ni bka' drin dran par bgyi ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bdag gis ni bka' drin dran par bgyi ste /
translated: Blessed One, I will remember your kindness.üîΩI will not forget your kindness.

original: bka' drin mi dran par mi bgyi'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyis rab 'byor la khyod de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston cing mos pa skyed pa legs so zhes
analyzed: bka' drin mi dran par mi bgyi'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyis rab 'byor la khyod de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston cing mos pa skyed pa legs so zhes
translated: The Blessed One praised Subh≈´ti, saying, Subh≈´ti, it is excellent that you teach the perfection of wisdom to the bodhisattva mahƒÅsattvas in this way and generate enthusiasm.

original: bstod pa'i lan du /
analyzed: bstod pa'i lan du /
translated: In response,

original: bdag 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston pa 'di sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams sngon byang chub sems dpa' gyur pa'i tshe yang sngon gyi nyan thos dgra bcom pa rnams kyis pha rol tu phyin pa drug
analyzed: bdag 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston pa 'di sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams sngon byang chub sems dpa' gyur pa'i tshe yang sngon gyi nyan thos dgra bcom pa rnams kyis pha rol tu phyin pa drug
translated: I teach the perfection of wisdom to the bodhisattvas in this way, remembering the kindness of the past thus-gone ones when they were bodhisattvas, and the past ≈õrƒÅvaka arhats who taught the six perfections to the bodhisattvas.

original: la gdams pa dang / rjes su bstan pa bgyis pa las byang chub sems dpa' de dag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par sangs rgyas par gyur te /
analyzed: la gdams pa dang / rjes su bstan pa bgyis pa las byang chub sems dpa' de dag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par sangs rgyas par gyur te /
translated: and through my instructions and follow-up teachings, those bodhisattvas have attained manifest, complete enlightenment in unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood.

original: de bzhin du bdag gis kyang byang chub sems dpa' rnams pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gdams pa dang / rjes su bstan pa la sogs pa bgyis na byang chub sems dpa' de dag kyang de'i rim pas bslabs te /
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag gis kyang byang chub sems dpa' rnams pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gdams pa dang / rjes su bstan pa la sogs pa bgyis na byang chub sems dpa' de dag kyang de'i rim pas bslabs te /
translated: In the same way, if I were to give instructions and follow-up teachings on the six perfections to the bodhisattvas, those bodhisattvas would train in that sequence and

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: attain manifest, complete enlightenment in unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood.

original: de ltar bdag gis bstan na sngon gyi 'phags pa nyan thos dgra bcom pa rnams dang spyod pa mthun par spyad pas sngon gyi 'phags pa rnams kyi rjes su bslab pa nyid bka' drin dran par byas shing /
analyzed: de ltar bdag gis bstan na sngon gyi 'phags pa nyan thos dgra bcom pa rnams dang spyod pa mthun par spyad pas sngon gyi 'phags pa rnams kyi rjes su bslab pa nyid bka' drin dran par byas shing /
translated: If I were to teach in that way, I would be practicing in accordance with the noble listeners of the past who were arhats, and by training in accordance with the noble ones of the past, I would be remembering their kindness

original: drin la lan lon pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: drin la lan lon pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: and repaying their kindness.‚Äù

original: de la gdams pa ni /
analyzed: de la gdams pa ni /
translated: The instruction is:

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i @278b chos la sogs pa byar mi rung ba rnams ma byed cig ces dang po gdams pa'o //
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i @278b chos la sogs pa byar mi rung ba rnams ma byed cig ces dang po gdams pa'o //
translated: Do not do what is not suitable, such as evil and non-virtuous dharmas. This is the initial instruction.

original: rjes su bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rjes su bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching is:

original: dge ba'i chos 'di dag byos shig ces dge ba la gzud pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos 'di dag byos shig ces dge ba la gzud pa'o //
translated: Practice these virtuous dharmas. This is to engage in virtue.üîΩ The delight is:üîΩDo not be ignorant of the object of practice. Practice and meditate.

original: dgyes par byas pa ni nan tan du sgrub pa'i dmigs mi shes pa la sgrub cing sgom pa'i dmigs bstan pas dga' bar byas pa'o//
analyzed: dgyes par byas pa ni nan tan du sgrub pa'i dmigs mi shes pa la sgrub cing sgom pa'i dmigs bstan pas dga' bar byas pa'o//
translated: The encouragement is:

original: yang dag par bskul ba ni sgom zhing sgrub pa la zhugs pa'i tshe lung dang man ngag legs par ma thob pas 'khrul cing log par sgom pa las ma 'khrul cing yang dag par sgom pa la sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: yang dag par bskul ba ni sgom zhing sgrub pa la zhugs pa'i tshe lung dang man ngag legs par ma thob pas 'khrul cing log par sgom pa las ma 'khrul cing yang dag par sgom pa la sbyor ba'o //
translated: When engaged in practice and meditation, do not be confused by not properly receiving the scriptures and instructions. Engage in correct meditation.üîΩ The excellent praise is:

original: legs par gzengs bstod pa ni le lo la sogs pa'i skyon gyis sgrub pa dang / sgom pa la mi brtson pa rnams spro ba bskyed cing brtson 'grus rtsom du 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: legs par gzengs bstod pa ni le lo la sogs pa'i skyon gyis sgrub pa dang / sgom pa la mi brtson pa rnams spro ba bskyed cing brtson 'grus rtsom du 'jug pa'o //
translated: Those who are not diligent in practice and meditation due to faults such as laziness should generate enthusiasm and be made to apply diligence.

original: rab tu dgyes par byas pa na /
analyzed: rab tu dgyes par byas pa na /
translated: The complete delight is:

original: legs par sgrub cing phyin ci ma log par sgom pa la legs so zhes bstod nas sgom pa la spro zhing dga' ba skyed pa'o //
analyzed: legs par sgrub cing phyin ci ma log par sgom pa la legs so zhes bstod nas sgom pa la spro zhing dga' ba skyed pa'o //
translated: Having praised them, saying, Excellent! for their correct practice and their unmistaken meditation, he generates enthusiasm and joy in meditation.

original: bkod pa dang zhes bya ba ni de ltar bsgrubs shing bsgoms pa'i tha mar 'phags pa'i lam la bkod pa'o //
analyzed: bkod pa dang zhes bya ba ni de ltar bsgrubs shing bsgoms pa'i tha mar 'phags pa'i lam la bkod pa'o //
translated: Having established them means that, at the end of their practice and meditation, he establishes them in the noble path.

original: shin tu brtan pa bgyis pas zhes bya ba ni lam bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu thob par byas shing de la brtan par gnas par byas so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shin tu brtan pa bgyis pas zhes bya ba ni lam bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu thob par byas shing de la brtan par gnas par byas so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Having made them very firm means that he causes them to attain the result of the path and to abide firmly in it.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis lha'i dbang po brgya byin la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis lha'i dbang po brgya byin la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the venerable Subhuti said to Sakra, Chief of Gods:üîΩ Subhuti: Kausika, when a Bodhisattva courses in perfect wisdom, he does not review that thought of his which is endowed with the perfection of giving, etc. to : the perfection of wisdom, as coming, or going, or staying.

original: koo shi ka de'i phyir shin tu legs par nyon la yid la zung shig dang / ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par bya ba dang / ji ltar mi gnas par bya ba bdag gis bshad do zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: koo shi ka de'i phyir shin tu legs par nyon la yid la zung shig dang / ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par bya ba dang / ji ltar mi gnas par bya ba bdag gis bshad do zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: Kau≈õika, for that reason listen very well and keep it in mind, and I will explain how a bodhisattva mahƒÅsattva should abide in the perfection of wisdom, and how they should not abide.

original: gong du lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis rab 'byor la ;üîΩbyang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ji ltar gnas par bya zhes dris pa'i lan du /
analyzed: gong du lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis rab 'byor la ; byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ji ltar gnas par bya zhes dris pa'i lan du /
translated: In the above, ≈öakra, Lord of the Gods, asked Subh≈´tiüîΩHow should a bodhisattva mahƒÅsattva abide in the perfection of wisdom?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ji ltar gnas par bya ba'i don rab 'byor gyis zhib tu bshad pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ji ltar gnas par bya ba'i don rab 'byor gyis zhib tu bshad pa ste /
translated: In response, Subh≈´ti explained in detail the meaning of How should a bodhisattva mahƒÅsattva abide in the perfection of wisdom?

original: koo shi ka gzugs ni gzugs kyis stong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzugs la sogs pa phung po lnga nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos ming gis smos pa rnams don dam par de dag gi rang bzhin gyis stong la /üîΩde ltar stong par @279a * //
analyzed: koo shi ka gzugs ni gzugs kyis stong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzugs la sogs pa phung po lnga nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos ming gis smos pa rnams don dam par de dag gi rang bzhin gyis stong la / de ltar stong par @279a * //
translated: The passage beginning Kausika, form is empty of form and so on refers to the mundane and supramundane phenomena from form and so on up to the five aggregates and up to omniscience, which are mentioned by name. They are ultimately empty of their own essence.

original: rtogs par byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang don dam par byang chub sems dpa'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong ste /
analyzed: rtogs par byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang don dam par byang chub sems dpa'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong ste /
translated: The bodhisattva who realizes emptiness in this way is also ultimately empty of the essence of a bodhisattva.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyi stong pa nyid dang / byang chub sems dpa'i stong pa gang yin pa de dag stong pa nyid du ro gcig ste tha mi dad pas de dag la gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med par rtogs shing gnas pa nyid byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyi stong pa nyid dang / byang chub sems dpa'i stong pa gang yin pa de dag stong pa nyid du ro gcig ste tha mi dad pas de dag la gnyis su med cing gnyis su byar med par rtogs shing gnas pa nyid byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha
translated: The emptiness of phenomena such as form and the emptiness of the bodhisattva are of one taste in emptiness. Since they are not different, he realizes and abides in them as nondual and indivisible. This is the bodhisattva great being's perfection of wisdom.

original: rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: One should abide in the perfection of wisdom.

original: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis gnas brtan 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis gnas brtan 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then ≈öatakratu, head of the gods, said to the elder Subh≈´ti,

original: btsun pa rab 'byor ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par bya /
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par bya /
translated: ‚ÄúVenerable monk Subh≈´ti, how should bodhisattva great beings stand in the perfection of wisdom?

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subh≈´ti replied,

original: koo shi ka 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: koo shi ka 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: ‚ÄúKau≈õika, here when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gzugs la gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gnas par mi bya ba yongs su spang ba'i sgo nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par bya ba bstan pa ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gzugs la gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gnas par mi bya ba yongs su spang ba'i sgo nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par bya ba bstan pa ste /
translated: they should not stand in form, etc., with the idea that it is real. This teaches standing in the perfection of wisdom by way of avoiding standing in what is to be abandoned.

original: gnas par mi bya ba yang gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug pa'i bar gyi chos rnams la dmigs pa'i tshul gyis mi gnas pa nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //üîΩdmigs pa'i tshul gyis gzugs zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gnas par mi bya ba yang gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug pa'i bar gyi chos rnams la dmigs pa'i tshul gyis mi gnas pa nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o // dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gzugs zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Not dwelling is not dwelling on the phenomena from form up to the knowledge of all aspects in the manner of an objective support.üîΩDwelling on the perfection of wisdom is not dwelling on form, etc.

original: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid la dmigs pa'i tshul gyis mi gnas pa nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa laüîΩgnas pa yin no zhes bstan pa ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid la dmigs pa'i tshul gyis mi gnas pa nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa yin no zhes bstan pa ste /
translated: Not dwelling on the characteristics of phenomena such as form in the manner of an objective support is dwelling on the perfection of wisdom.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid kyang gzugs kyi mtshan nyid ni gzugs su rung zhing thogs pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid kyang gzugs kyi mtshan nyid ni gzugs su rung zhing thogs pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The characteristic of form is that it is suitable as form and has resistance.

original: tshor ba'i mtshan nyid ni bde ba dang / sdug bsngal myong ba'i rang bzhin can no zhes bya ba la sogs pa chos rnams so so'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa la ji ltar rigs par sbyar ro //
analyzed: tshor ba'i mtshan nyid ni bde ba dang / sdug bsngal myong ba'i rang bzhin can no zhes bya ba la sogs pa chos rnams so so'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa la ji ltar rigs par sbyar ro //
translated: The characteristics of the dharmas are such as the characteristic of feeling is the nature of experiencing pleasure and pain, etc.

original: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gzugs rtag ces bya ba dang mi rtag ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya ba @279b la sogs pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos nyid la dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya ba nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyinüîΩpa la gnas pa yin pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gzugs rtag ces bya ba dang mi rtag ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya ba @279b la sogs pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos nyid la dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya ba nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa yin pa bstan pa ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúdo not abide in the view that form is permanent or impermanent,‚Äù etc., indicates that the perfection of wisdom is the non-abiding in the view of the reality of form, etc.

original: chos nyid la dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya ba yang thams cad shes pa nyid kyi phyogs su gtogs pa dang / lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid kyi phyogs su gtogs pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi phyogs su gtogs pa dang gsum mo //
analyzed: chos nyid la dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya ba yang thams cad shes pa nyid kyi phyogs su gtogs pa dang / lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid kyi phyogs su gtogs pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi phyogs su gtogs pa dang gsum mo //
translated: The non-abiding in the view of reality is threefold: included in the sphere of the knowledge of all modes, included in the sphere of the knowledge of paths, and included in the sphere of the knowledge of all-¬≠aspects.

original: de la dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gzugs rtag ces bya ba dang / mi rtag ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gzugs rtag ces bya ba dang / mi rtag ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya ba nas /
translated: In the phrase One should not abide in the notion that form is permanent or impermanent,üîΩup to the phrase One should not abide in the notion that the Tathagata, the Arhat, the perfectly accomplished Buddha is a field of merit,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sbyin pa'i gnas zhes bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni thams cad shes pa nyid kyi phyogs su gtogs pa'i chos nyid la gnas par mi byaüîΩba bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sbyin pa'i gnas zhes bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni thams cad shes pa nyid kyi phyogs su gtogs pa'i chos nyid la gnas par mi bya ba bstan pa ste /
translated: it is taught that one should not abide in the reality that is included in the aspect of the knowledge of all things.

original: thams cad shes pa nyid kyi phyogs su gtogs pa zhes bya ba yang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams theg pa chung ngu'i tshul gyis thams cad shes pa nyid thob par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: thams cad shes pa nyid kyi phyogs su gtogs pa zhes bya ba yang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams theg pa chung ngu'i tshul gyis thams cad shes pa nyid thob par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: The phrase included in the aspect of the knowledge of all things means that the Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas, by means of the method of the Lesser Vehicle, attain the knowledge of all things.

original: gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyi chos rnams la rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag dang bdag med pa dang / sdug pa dang mi sdug pa dang /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyi chos rnams la rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag dang bdag med pa dang / sdug pa dang mi sdug pa dang /
translated: and so on up to phenomena such as form and so on up to the knowledge of all aspects, as permanent or impermanent, as happiness or suffering, as self or not self, as attractive or unattractive,

analyzed: zhi ba dang ma zhi ba dang / dben pa dang mi dben pa dang / stong pa dang mi stong ba dang / mtshan ma yod pa dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa yod pa dang / smon pa med pa'i chos nyid du dmigs pa'i tshul gyis rtog cing gnas te /
translated: as peaceful or not peaceful, as isolated or not isolated, as empty or not empty, as with signs or signless, as having aspirations or lacking aspirations,

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas de ltar gnas par mi bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //

original: koo shi ka gzhan yang rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu 'dus ma byas pa las gdags zhes bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: koo shi ka gzhan yang rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu 'dus ma byas pa las gdags zhes bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya ba nas /
translated: ‚ÄúMoreover, Kau≈õika, one should not stand in the notion that the fruit of stream enterer is designated from the unconditioned,‚Äù and so on up toüîΩ‚Äúone should not stand in the notion that the knowledge of all aspects is designated from the unconditioned.‚Äù

translated: One should not abide in the way of apprehending that ‚Äòthe result of stream enterer is imputed from the unconditioned,‚Äô up to ‚Äòthe result of a worthy one, the state of a pratyekabuddha, and unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening are imputed from the unconditioned.‚Äô

analyzed: ste / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu @280a * //
translated: The reality of the result of stream enterer, the result of once-returner,

translated: the result of non-returner, the state of a worthy one, a pratyekabuddha‚Äôs awakening, and unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening is nirvana, which is called the unconditioned.

analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa sbyin pa'i gnas zhes bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya ba nas /

analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa dang / rang byang chub dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos nyid ni sbyin pa'i gnas yin no zhes bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o zhes bstan // koo shi ka gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sa dang po la dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya ba nas /
translated: ‚ÄúKau≈õika, bodhisattva great beings should not stand in the idea ‚ÄòI will stand in the perfection of giving, and having stood in it I will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,‚Äô and so on up to ‚ÄòI will stand in the perfection of wisdom, and having stood in it I will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.‚ÄôüîΩ‚ÄúKau≈õika, bodhisattva great beings should not stand in the idea ‚ÄòI will stand in the first level,‚Äô and so on up to

translated: ‚ÄúBodhisattva great beings should accomplish the eighty minor marks of a great being‚Äù is not a way of abiding in terms of reference.üîΩüîΩThis is the conduct that is part of the knowledge of all aspects.

translated: In order to attain that gnosis, they accomplish the five eyes of the tathƒÅgatas, they accomplish the meditative stabilizations, they play with the meditative stabilizations, they accomplish the dhƒÅra·πáƒ´ gateways, they accomplish the ten powers of the tathƒÅgatas,

analyzed: mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang /
translated: Having accomplished the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, great love, great compassion, the eighteen unshared qualities of the Buddha, the thirty-two major marks of a superman,üîΩand the eighty minor marks, I will attain the knowledge of all aspects.üîΩIn this way, the bodhisattva who is skilled in the perfection of wisdom does not stand in form, etc.,üîΩand does not stand in the knowledge of all aspects.

original: * // bstan pa'o //

translated: The one called ‚Äúfollower of faith‚Äù is the ≈õrƒÅvaka of dull faculties who has entered into the path in order to manifest the result of stream enterer.

analyzed: gang zag de dbang po rtul bas bdag nyid kyi blos rtogs pa ni med kyi /

analyzed: lung las thos pa bzhin du dad pas 'phags pa'i lam gyi rjes su 'jug bas na /

original: de dag dbang po rno bas gzhan gyi dring la mi 'jog cing chos kyi tshul dang mthun par rig pa dang / sbyor bas chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba zhes bya'o//

translated: They are called Dharma followers by application because they are not dependent on others due to having sharp faculties, they are aware of the mode of Dharma, and they follow Dharma by application.

original: brgyad pa zhes bya ba ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa'i gang zag dgra bcom ba'i 'bras bu nas yas bgrangs na rim pa brgyad kyi tha ma la 'bab pas brgyad pa zhes bya'o //

translated: The eighth is called the eighth because it is the eighth counting up from the state of an arhat, it is the person who has entered for the purpose of manifesting the result of stream entry.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang po thob pa'i gang zag la bya'o //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang po thob pa'i gang zag la bya'o //
translated: A stream enterer is a person who has obtained the first result of stream entry.

original: de ltar thogs na srid pa lan bdun ba  zhes bya ba ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob pa'i gang zag bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa ma zad pas mi dang lha'i nang du 'khor ba'i srid par re ltar thogs na lan bdun
analyzed: de ltar thogs na srid pa lan bdun ba  zhes bya ba ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob pa'i gang zag bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa ma zad pas mi dang lha'i nang du 'khor ba'i srid par re ltar thogs na lan bdun
translated: One who is obstructed seven times at most is a person who has obtained the result of stream entry but who has not exhausted the afflictions to be abandoned by the path of meditation. They are obstructed seven times at most in the desire realm of gods and humans.

original: skye ba la /
analyzed: skye ba la /
translated: They are born seven times at most.

original: re ltar thogs na srid pa lan bdun pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: re ltar thogs na srid pa lan bdun pa zhes bya'o //
translated: If he is reborn in this way seven times, he is called ‚Äúone who goes to be reborn in this way seven times at most.‚Äù

original: rigs nas rigs su @281b 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni rgyu na du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob pa'i gang zag la la tshe gnyis sam gsum gyi bar du 'khor ba na gnas shing lha dang mi'i rigs bzang por skye ba la bya'o //
analyzed: rigs nas rigs su @281b 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni rgyu na du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob pa'i gang zag la la tshe gnyis sam gsum gyi bar du 'khor ba na gnas shing lha dang mi'i rigs bzang por skye ba la bya'o //
translated: He is called ‚Äúone who goes from family to family‚Äù because he is a person who has attained the fruit of the second or third stage of the path of insight, who remains in cyclic existence for two or three births, and who is born in good families of gods and humans.

original: gcig gis chod pa'o zhes bya ba ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la gnas pa'i gang zag lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu thob par bya ba la skye ba gcig gis bar chos pa la bya'o //üîΩrnam pa gcig tu na mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa la skye ba gcig gis bar chod pa la yang bya ste /
analyzed: gcig gis chod pa'o zhes bya ba ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la gnas pa'i gang zag lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu thob par bya ba la skye ba gcig gis bar chos pa la bya'o // rnam pa gcig tu na mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa la skye ba gcig gis bar chod pa la yang bya ste /
translated: He is called ‚Äúone who is separated by one birth‚Äù because he is a person who has attained the fruit of the third stage of the path of insight, who is separated from the fruit of the fourth stage by one birth, and who is born in good families of gods and humans.üîΩOr, he is called ‚Äúone who is separated by one birth‚Äù because he is separated from the attainment of nirvana by one birth.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa la tshe phyi ma 'ba' zhig gis thogs pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa la tshe phyi ma 'ba' zhig gis thogs pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In other words, he is separated from nirvana by one more birth.

original: gang zag mgo mnyam pa zhes bya ba ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la gnas pa'i gang zag tshe dang las dang nyon mongs pa rnams dus gcig tu mgo mnyam du zad nas /
analyzed: gang zag mgo mnyam pa zhes bya ba ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la gnas pa'i gang zag tshe dang las dang nyon mongs pa rnams dus gcig tu mgo mnyam du zad nas /
translated: The person who is equal in terms of the head refers to the person who is abiding in the result of stream-entry. When life, karma, and afflictions are exhausted simultaneously,

original: thal byung du phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba la bya'o //
analyzed: thal byung du phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba la bya'o //
translated: he passes into parinirvƒÅ·πáa in the realm of nirvƒÅ·πáa without remainder suddenly.

original: tshe zad pa'o zhe'am nyon mongs pa zad pa'o zhes bya ba ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la gnas pa'i gang zag la la tshe dang nyon mongs pa snga phyir zad par 'gyur pa la bya'o //
analyzed: tshe zad pa'o zhe'am nyon mongs pa zad pa'o zhes bya ba ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la gnas pa'i gang zag la la tshe dang nyon mongs pa snga phyir zad par 'gyur pa la bya'o //
translated: When it is said that life is exhausted or afflictions are exhausted, this refers to the person who is abiding in the result of stream-entry. For some, life and afflictions are exhausted sequentially.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la gnas pa'i gang zag lan cig phyir 'ong pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu thob tu nye ba la bya'o //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la gnas pa'i gang zag lan cig phyir 'ong pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu thob tu nye ba la bya'o //
translated: The stream-enterer refers to the person who is abiding in the result of stream-entry. He is approaching the realization of the result of once-returner and is close to attaining the result of once-returner.

original: log par ltung ba med pa'i chos can no zhes bya ba ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la gnas pa'i gang zag ngan song gsum du ltung ba'i las mi byed cing sngon ngan song gsum du ltung ba'i las byas pa yang gnyen po bsgoms pa las de'i
analyzed: log par ltung ba med pa'i chos can no zhes bya ba ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la gnas pa'i gang zag ngan song gsum du ltung ba'i las mi byed cing sngon ngan song gsum du ltung ba'i las byas pa yang gnyen po bsgoms pa las de'i
translated: One who is not subject to falling away is an individual who abides in the result of stream entry who does not commit karma to fall to the three lower rebirths and who has cultivated the antidote to karma previously committed that would cause one to fall to the three lower rebirths.üîΩ

original: 'bras bu rnam par smin par mi 'gyur pa'i chos can la bya'o //üîΩlan cig phyir 'ong ba ste /üîΩ'jig rten 'dir lan cig phyir 'ongs nas sdug bsngal mthar dbyung ngo zhes bya ba ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la gnas pa'i gang zag lha'i 'jig rten nas mi yul gyi 'jig rten 'dir mi'i nang du lan cig skyes nas mya ngan las 'das pa
analyzed: 'bras bu rnam par smin par mi 'gyur pa'i chos can la bya'o // lan cig phyir 'ong ba ste / 'jig rten 'dir lan cig phyir 'ongs nas sdug bsngal mthar dbyung ngo zhes bya ba ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la gnas pa'i gang zag lha'i 'jig rten nas mi yul gyi 'jig rten 'dir mi'i nang du lan cig skyes nas mya ngan las 'das pa
translated: One who is not subject to falling away is one who is not subject to the maturation of karma that would cause him to fall into the three lower realms, or who has cultivated the antidotes to such karma.üîΩOne who is a once-returner is one who returns to this world once and then puts an end to suffering.

original: mngon sum du byed pa la bya'o //
analyzed: mngon sum du byed pa la bya'o //
translated: This refers to a person who is abiding in the result of a once-returner, who will be reborn in the human world once from the world of the gods and then will attain nirvana.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i gang zag de nyid phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu thob tu nye ba la /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i gang zag de nyid phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu thob tu nye ba la /
translated: One who has entered to actualize the fruit of non-return is the person who is a once-returner who is close to attaining the fruit of non-return.üîΩOne who has entered to actualize the fruit of non-return is the person who is a once-returner who is close to attaining the fruit of non-return.üîΩOne who is a non-returner is the person who is a once-returner who has attained the fruit of non-return.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa zhes bya'o //üîΩphyir mi @282a * //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa zhes bya'o // phyir mi @282a * //
translated: One who attains nirvana in the intermediate state is the person who is a non-returner who attains nirvana in the intermediate state.üîΩOne who attains nirvana upon rebirth is the person who is a non-returner who attains nirvana upon rebirth.üîΩOne who attains nirvana with effort is the person who is a non-returner who attains nirvana with effort.üîΩOne who attains nirvana without effort is the person who is a non-returner who attains nirvana without effort.

original: 'ong ba ste /üîΩde nyid du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar bya'o zhes bya ba phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la gnas pa'i gang zag gang du skyes pa'i gnas de nyid du tshe de nyid la yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ba la bya'o //
