original: mi gnas pa yang @285b ma yin pa nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa yin pas /
analyzed: mi gnas pa yang @285b ma yin pa nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa yin pas /
translated: Since abiding in the perfection of wisdom is not abiding in anything,üîΩit is explained that one should abide in that way, without apprehending anything.

original: de ltar mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par bya'o zhes rab 'byor gyis bshad pa'i 'khor gyi nang nas lha'i bu kha cig gis thos nas rab 'byor gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don bshad pa'i tshig zab cing rtogs par bya dka'o snyam du rtogüîΩpar gyur pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par bya'o zhes rab 'byor gyis bshad pa'i 'khor gyi nang nas lha'i bu kha cig gis thos nas rab 'byor gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don bshad pa'i tshig zab cing rtogs par bya dka'o snyam du rtog par gyur pa ste /
translated: When some of the gods in the retinue heard this explanation by Subh≈´ti, they thought, ‚ÄúThe words that Subh≈´ti has explained as the meaning of the perfection of wisdom are profound and difficult to understand.‚Äù

original: gnod sbyin gyi tshig dang / gnod sbyin gyi skad la sogs pa mi'i tshig dang skad ma yin pa rnams kyang bslabs na lobs shing shes par rung gi / ci la yang mi gnas pa nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa yin no zhes bshad pa dang /
analyzed: gnod sbyin gyi tshig dang / gnod sbyin gyi skad la sogs pa mi'i tshig dang skad ma yin pa rnams kyang bslabs na lobs shing shes par rung gi / ci la yang mi gnas pa nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa yin no zhes bshad pa dang /
translated: They thought, ‚ÄúIf one trains in the languages and words of the yak·π£as and so on, which are not the languages and words of humans, one can learn and understand them, but it is explained that abiding in the perfection of wisdom is not abiding in anything.

original: chos thams cad ni gnas pa yang ma yin mi gnas pa yang ma yin no zhes rab 'byor gyis bshad pa'i tshig gi don shes par mi rung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni gnas pa yang ma yin mi gnas pa yang ma yin no zhes rab 'byor gyis bshad pa'i tshig gi don shes par mi rung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: All phenomena are neither abiding nor not abiding.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis /
translated: Then the venerable Subh≈´ti,

original: lha'i bu de dag gi sems kyi rnam par rtog pa sems kyis yongs su shes nas /
analyzed: lha'i bu de dag gi sems kyi rnam par rtog pa sems kyis yongs su shes nas /
translated: having understood in his mind the thought that had arisen in the minds of those gods,

original: lha'i bu de dag la smras pa /
analyzed: lha'i bu de dag la smras pa /
translated: said to those gods,üîΩO gods, is it that what was said is not to be understood?

original: lha'i bu dag gang smras pa de shes par mi rung ngam zhes bya ba ni gong du lha'i bu dag rtogs pa skyes pa de tshig tu ma smras kyang rab 'byor gyi sems kyis rtogs nas ci bdag gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don bshad
analyzed: lha'i bu dag gang smras pa de shes par mi rung ngam zhes bya ba ni gong du lha'i bu dag rtogs pa skyes pa de tshig tu ma smras kyang rab 'byor gyi sems kyis rtogs nas ci bdag gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don bshad
translated: This means that although the gods did not speak the words of the thought that had arisen, Subh≈´ti understood it in his mind and asked, Is it that the meaning of the perfection of wisdom that I explained

original: pa'i tshig de dag shes par mi rung ngam zhes slar brtag cing dris pa'o //
analyzed: pa'i tshig de dag shes par mi rung ngam zhes slar brtag cing dris pa'o //
translated: is not to be understood?

original: lha'i bu rnams kyis smras pa /
analyzed: lha'i bu rnams kyis smras pa /
translated: The gods said,üîΩSubh≈´ti, it is so.

original: 'phags pa rab 'byor shes par mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni brjod du med pa'i don rab 'byor 'chad du gzhug pa'i phyir smras pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa rab 'byor shes par mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni brjod du med pa'i don rab 'byor 'chad du gzhug pa'i phyir smras pa'o //
translated: Noble Subh≈´ti, it is not suitable to know. This is said in order to have Subh≈´ti explain the meaning of inexpressibility.

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subh≈´ti said:

original: lha'i bu de dag ni 'di ltar yi ge gcig kyang ma brjod kyis /
analyzed: lha'i bu de dag ni 'di ltar yi ge gcig kyang ma brjod kyis /
translated: The gods, it is like this: not a single letter has been uttered by them.

original: gang mi brjod pa de ni thos par mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gang mi brjod pa de ni thos par mi rung ngo //
translated: What is not uttered is not suitable to be heard.üîΩWhat is not suitable to be heard is not suitable to be known.

original: gang thos par mi rung ba de ni shes par mi rung po zhes bya ba ni bdag gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyi pa bshad pa ni sems can rnams dkri zhing drang ba'i phyir kun rdzob tu tshig dang yi ge rnams kyis sgro btags te bshadüîΩpar zad kyi /
analyzed: gang thos par mi rung ba de ni shes par mi rung po zhes bya ba ni bdag gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyi pa bshad pa ni sems can rnams dkri zhing drang ba'i phyir kun rdzob tu tshig dang yi ge rnams kyis sgro btags te bshad par zad kyi /
translated: This is the explanation of the perfection of wisdom by me, Subh≈´ti. In order to guide and lead sentient beings, I have explained by superimposing words and letters in the conventional.

original: don dam par ni tshig dang yi ge brjod pas thog tu phebs par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir yi ge gcig kyang ma brjod de /
analyzed: don dam par ni tshig dang yi ge brjod pas thog tu phebs par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir yi ge gcig kyang ma brjod de /
translated: But ultimately, not a single letter has been uttered, because it is not suitable to be confirmed by expressing words and letters.

original: de ltar tshig dang yi ge ma brjod pa de thos pa dang shes par yang mi rung ngo zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar tshig dang yi ge ma brjod pa de thos pa dang shes par yang mi rung ngo zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Thus, it is taught that it is not suitable to hear or understand that which is not expressed in words and letters.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni yi ge ma yin te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni yi ge ma yin te /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is not a letter.üîΩThere is no one there who teaches, hears, or understands it.

original: @286a * // de la su yang ston pa dang / nyan pa dang shes par byed pa med do zhes bya ba ni yi ge gcig kyang ma brjod pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: @286a * // de la su yang ston pa dang / nyan pa dang shes par byed pa med do zhes bya ba ni yi ge gcig kyang ma brjod pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: This is the explanation of the reason why not even a single letter is expressed.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni tshig dang yi ge'i rang bzhin yang ma yin la /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni tshig dang yi ge'i rang bzhin yang ma yin la /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is not the nature of words and letters,

original: tshig dang yi ges bstan par bya ba yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshig dang yi ges bstan par bya ba yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: and it is not something that can be taught with words and letters.üîΩThis is the meaning.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: lha'i bu dag de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi byang chub ni yi ge med pa'o zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi byang chub ni yi ge med pa'o zhes bya bas ni /
translated: O sons of gods, the enlightenment of the Tathagatas, the Arhats, the Perfectly Awakened Ones is without letters.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa tshig dang yi ge'i rang bzhin ma yin pa dang / tshig dang yi ges bstan du mi rung ba'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa tshig dang yi ge'i rang bzhin ma yin pa dang / tshig dang yi ges bstan du mi rung ba'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is not of the nature of words and letters, and it is taught that it is not suitable to be taught by means of words and letters.

original: bla na med pa'i byang chub kyang tshig dang yi ge'i rang bzhin yang ma yin la /
analyzed: bla na med pa'i byang chub kyang tshig dang yi ge'i rang bzhin yang ma yin la /
translated: Also, unsurpassed enlightenment is not of the nature of words and letters,

original: tshig dang yi ges bstan pas thog tu phebs pa yang ma yin gyi /
analyzed: tshig dang yi ges bstan pas thog tu phebs pa yang ma yin gyi /
translated: and it is not suitable to be taught by means of words and letters.

original: 'phags pa rnams kyis so so rang gis rig pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir don dam par yi ge gcig kyang ma brjod do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyis so so rang gis rig pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir don dam par yi ge gcig kyang ma brjod do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Because it is of the nature of the individual knowledge of the ƒÅryas, ultimately not even a single syllable is uttered.

original: lha'i bu dag 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: Sons of gods, it is like this.üîΩFor example, a tathƒÅgata, arhat, perfectly enlightened buddha emanates an emanation.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis sprul pa zhig sprul te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sprul pa dang rmi lam dang sgra brnyan dang sgyu ma'i dpes don dam par chos thams cad tshig dang yi ges bstan cing
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis sprul pa zhig sprul te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sprul pa dang rmi lam dang sgra brnyan dang sgyu ma'i dpes don dam par chos thams cad tshig dang yi ges bstan cing
translated: And so on. The examples of emanations, dreams, echoes, and illusions teach that ultimately all phenomena are not taught by means of words and letters,üîΩand that the ultimate is not an object of words and letters.

original: brjod du med pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: brjod du med pa bstan pa'o //
translated: the teaching of the inexpressible.

original: de nas lha'i bu de dag 'di snyam du sems par gyur te /
analyzed: de nas lha'i bu de dag 'di snyam du sems par gyur te /
translated: Then the thought occurred to those gods:

original: kye ma gnas brtan rab 'byor 'di ni gsal bar byed pa ste zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: kye ma gnas brtan rab 'byor 'di ni gsal bar byed pa ste zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúAh! This elder Subh≈´ti is a clarifier.‚Äù

original: sprul pa la sogs pa'i dpes shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don tshig dang yi ges brjod cing bstan pa dang / thog tu mi phebs pa bshad pas lha'i bu rnams mgu nas gnas brtan rab 'byor 'di shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don gsal bar ston pa'o zhes rab 'byor la bstod pa'o //
analyzed: sprul pa la sogs pa'i dpes shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don tshig dang yi ges brjod cing bstan pa dang / thog tu mi phebs pa bshad pas lha'i bu rnams mgu nas gnas brtan rab 'byor 'di shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don gsal bar ston pa'o zhes rab 'byor la bstod pa'o //
translated: The gods are pleased with the explanation of the inexpressible meaning of the perfection of wisdom by the elder Subh≈´ti through the examples of the magical creation, etc., and they praise Subh≈´ti, saying, ‚ÄúAh! This elder Subh≈´ti is a clarifier of the meaning of the perfection of wisdom.‚Äù

original: kye ma 'phags pa rab 'byor 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gsal bar byed kyang zab pa bas kyang shin tu zab pa ston phra ba bas kyang shin tu phra ba la 'jug go zhes bya ba ni de ltar gsal bar byed du zin
analyzed: kye ma 'phags pa rab 'byor 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gsal bar byed kyang zab pa bas kyang shin tu zab pa ston phra ba bas kyang shin tu phra ba la 'jug go zhes bya ba ni de ltar gsal bar byed du zin
translated: ‚ÄúAh! This noble Subh≈´ti, while clarifying the perfection of wisdom, teaches what is deeper than the deep and enters into what is more subtle than the subtle.‚Äù

original: kyang shes rab rno la blo zab cing phra bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don shin tu @286b zab ston cing shin tu phra ba la 'jug go zhes bstod pa ste zab pa bas kyang shin tu zab pa ston zhes bya ba ni shes rab
analyzed: kyang shes rab rno la blo zab cing phra bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don shin tu @286b zab ston cing shin tu phra ba la 'jug go zhes bstod pa ste zab pa bas kyang shin tu zab pa ston zhes bya ba ni shes rab
translated: And also means sharp and profound and subtle, so it is praised as penetrating into the extremely profound meaning of the perfection of wisdom and engaging in the extremely subtle.

original: kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don zab cing gting dpag dka' ba nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas la sogs pas rtogs par mi nus pa gzhan la ston to zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩphra ba bas kyang shin tu phra ba la 'jug go zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don phra la brtags dka' ba rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul du gyur pa la /
analyzed: kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don zab cing gting dpag dka' ba nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas la sogs pas rtogs par mi nus pa gzhan la ston to zhes bya ba'i don to // phra ba bas kyang shin tu phra ba la 'jug go zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don phra la brtags dka' ba rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul du gyur pa la /
translated: The phrase teaching what is even more profound than the profound means teaching others the profound meaning of the perfection of wisdom, which is difficult to fathom and cannot be realized by ≈õrƒÅvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and so on.üîΩThe phrase engaging in what is even more subtle than the subtle means my mind engages in the object of nonconceptual wisdom, which is the subtle meaning of the perfection of wisdom, difficult to analyze, in the manner of individual self-realization.

original: so so rang gis rig pa'i tshul du bdag gi blo 'jug go zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: so so rang gis rig pa'i tshul du bdag gi blo 'jug go zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis /
translated: Then the venerable Subh≈´ti,

original: lha'i bu de dag gi sems kyi rnam par rtog pa sems kyis yongs su shes te /
analyzed: lha'i bu de dag gi sems kyi rnam par rtog pa sems kyis yongs su shes te /
translated: He knew with his mind the thoughts that had arisen in the minds of those sons of gods,

original: lha'i bu de dag la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: lha'i bu de dag la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: and he said to those sons of gods:

original: lha'i bu dag gzugs ni zab pa ma yin /üîΩphra ba ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gong du lha'i bu rnams 'phags pa rab 'byor 'di ni shin tu zab pa ston cing /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag gzugs ni zab pa ma yin / phra ba ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gong du lha'i bu rnams 'phags pa rab 'byor 'di ni shin tu zab pa ston cing /
translated: ‚ÄúSons of gods, form is not deep,üîΩnot subtle.üîΩThe above, ‚ÄúSons of gods, this noble Subh≈´ti teaches the very deep,

original: shin tu phra ba la 'jug go snyam du sems shing rtog pa tshig tu ma smras kyang /
analyzed: shin tu phra ba la 'jug go snyam du sems shing rtog pa tshig tu ma smras kyang /
translated: and he engages in the very subtle,‚Äù is the thought and speech of the sons of gods who think, ‚ÄúHe is teaching the very deep, and he engages in the very subtle,‚Äù but do not say it.

original: rab 'byor gyi sems kyis shes nas zab cing phra ba nyid kyang don dam par dngos po med cing brjod du med pa yin par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyi sems kyis shes nas zab cing phra ba nyid kyang don dam par dngos po med cing brjod du med pa yin par bstan pa ste /
translated: Having known with his mind, Subh≈´ti taught that even the very deep and subtle are ultimately not things and are inexpressible.

original: zab cing phra ba zhes bya ba zhig yod na ni gzugs la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi chos rnams sam /
analyzed: zab cing phra ba zhes bya ba zhig yod na ni gzugs la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi chos rnams sam /
translated: If there were something called ‚Äúthe very deep and subtle,‚Äù it would be either mundane phenomena such as form and so on,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams shig yin grang na /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams shig yin grang na /
translated: or supramundane phenomena such as the six perfections and so on.

original: gzugs kyi phung po nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyi chos de dag thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong ste /üîΩgang rang bzhin gyis stong pa de ni zab pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyi chos de dag thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong ste / gang rang bzhin gyis stong pa de ni zab pa yang ma yin /
translated: All these phenomena, from the aggregate of form up to omniscience, are empty of intrinsic nature.

original: phra ba yang ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: phra ba yang ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: That which is empty of intrinsic nature is neither profound nor subtle.üîΩThis is the teaching.

original: de nas lha'i bu de dag 'di snyam du sems par gyur te /
analyzed: de nas lha'i bu de dag 'di snyam du sems par gyur te /
translated: Then the thought occurred to those sons of gods:üîΩIn this teaching of the Dharma, there is no designation of form.

original: chos bstan pa 'di la ni gzugs su btags pa med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang du sprul pa la sogs pa'i dpes shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di don dam par sus kyang bstan pa med de /
analyzed: chos bstan pa 'di la ni gzugs su btags pa med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang du sprul pa la sogs pa'i dpes shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di don dam par sus kyang bstan pa med de /
translated: This explains that in this perfection of wisdom, no one has taught it ultimately by means of examples such as emanations,

original: sus kyang thos pa med sus kyang shes pa med do zhes bshad pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad zab pa yang ma yin phra ba yang ma yin par bshad pa 'khor gyi nang na 'khod pa'i lha'i bu de dag gis thos nas /
analyzed: sus kyang thos pa med sus kyang shes pa med do zhes bshad pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad zab pa yang ma yin phra ba yang ma yin par bshad pa 'khor gyi nang na 'khod pa'i lha'i bu de dag gis thos nas /
translated: no one has heard it, and no one has understood it. And all phenomena such as form are neither profound nor subtle. When the sons of gods in the retinue heard this,

original: de ltar chos thams cad smra @287a * //
analyzed: de ltar chos thams cad smra @287a * //
translated: If all phenomena are like this, beyond speech and thought, and inexpressible,

original: bsam las 'das te brjod du med pa yin na ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos bstan pa 'di la /
analyzed: bsam las 'das te brjod du med pa yin na ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos bstan pa 'di la /
translated: then in this Dharma teaching of the perfection of wisdom,

original: gzugs la sogs pa nas sangs rgyas dang / byang chub dang / yi ge rnams su yang btags pa med dam ci snyam du sems pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa nas sangs rgyas dang / byang chub dang / yi ge rnams su yang btags pa med dam ci snyam du sems pa bstan pa'o //
translated: are the designations of form and so on, up to the buddhas, enlightenment, and the letters, not nonexistent?‚Äù

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis lha'i bu de dag la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis lha'i bu de dag la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the venerable Su¬≠bh≈´ti addressed those divine princes as follows:

original: lha'i bu dag de de bzhin no //
analyzed: lha'i bu dag de de bzhin no //
translated: ‚ÄúDivine princes! It is so!

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: It is just as you have said!

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i byang chub ni brjod du med do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i byang chub ni brjod du med do //
translated: The enlightenment of the tathƒÅgatas is inexpressible.

original: sgrar med do //
analyzed: sgrar med do //
translated: It is not a sound.

original: de ni sus kyang bstan pa med do //
analyzed: de ni sus kyang bstan pa med do //
translated: It has not been taught by anyone.

original: sus kyang thos pa med do //
analyzed: sus kyang thos pa med do //
translated: It has not been heard by anyone.

original: sus kyang shes pa med do zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pas bla na med pa'i byang chub thugs su chud pa'i byang chub gang yin pa de don dam par chos gang gi rang bzhin yang ma yin pas tshig dang yi ge la sogs par brjod cingüîΩbstan du yang med la /
analyzed: sus kyang shes pa med do zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pas bla na med pa'i byang chub thugs su chud pa'i byang chub gang yin pa de don dam par chos gang gi rang bzhin yang ma yin pas tshig dang yi ge la sogs par brjod cing bstan du yang med la /
translated: This means that the enlightenment which the Tathagata realized as unexcelled enlightenment is ultimately the nature of no dharma at all, so it cannot be expressed or indicated in words and letters, etc.

original: tshig dang yi ge la sogs pa'i sgo nas sus kyang thos shing shes par byar rung ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: tshig dang yi ge la sogs pa'i sgo nas sus kyang thos shing shes par byar rung ba yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not something that can be heard or known by anyone through words and letters, etc.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad kyang don dam par byang chub kyi rang bzhin dang tha mi dad pas gzugs la sogs par btags pa med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad kyang don dam par byang chub kyi rang bzhin dang tha mi dad pas gzugs la sogs par btags pa med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: It is taught that all dharmas such as form are not designated as form, etc., because ultimately they are not different from the nature of enlightenment.

original: lha'i bu dag de lta bas na la la zhig rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la gnas par 'dod cing rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du bya bar 'dod na yang bzod pa 'di la mi rten du mi rung ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa
analyzed: lha'i bu dag de lta bas na la la zhig rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la gnas par 'dod cing rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du bya bar 'dod na yang bzod pa 'di la mi rten du mi rung ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa
translated: O sons of gods, therefore, if someone wishes to abide in the result of stream enterer and wishes to actualize the result of stream enterer, it is not suitable for them not to rely on this acceptance.

original: ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu bzhi dang / rang byang chub dang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par 'dod pas gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad don dam par skye ba med pas smra bsam las 'das shing tha snyad du gdags pa'i bzod pa 'di la ma brtan par theg
analyzed: ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu bzhi dang / rang byang chub dang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par 'dod pas gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad don dam par skye ba med pas smra bsam las 'das shing tha snyad du gdags pa'i bzod pa 'di la ma brtan par theg
translated: This teaches that those who wish to attain the four results of stream enterer and so on, up to and including the result of pratyekabuddha and unsurpassed perfect complete buddhahood, must rely on this acceptance of the conventional designation of all phenomena such as form and so on, which is beyond speech and thought in terms of ultimate nonarising, and not rely on the three vehicles.

original: pa gsum gyi 'bras bu thob par mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: pa gsum gyi 'bras bu thob par mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: The results of the three vehicles will not be attained.

original: chos zab mo rtogs pa'i bzod pa 'di la brten na gdong theg pa gsum gyi 'bras bu thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: chos zab mo rtogs pa'i bzod pa 'di la brten na gdong theg pa gsum gyi 'bras bu thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: If one relies on this acceptance that realizes the profound dharma, one will attain the results of the three vehicles.

original: lha'i bu dag de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems dang po bskyed pa nas brjod pa dang mnyan du med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems dang po bskyed pa nas brjod pa dang mnyan du med pa'i phyir /
translated: The sons of the gods, in this way, the bodhisattva mahƒÅsattva should abide in the perfection of wisdom, because speech and listening are inexpressible.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par bya'o zhes bya ba ni de ltar gong du smos pa'i tshul gyis @287b chos thams cad smra bsam las 'das shing tshig dang yi ger bral bar rtogs te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par bya'o zhes bya ba ni de ltar gong du smos pa'i tshul gyis @287b chos thams cad smra bsam las 'das shing tshig dang yi ger bral bar rtogs te /
translated: This is saying, In the way that was mentioned above, all phenomena are realized to be beyond speech and thought, and free from words and letters.

original: mtshan ma gang la yang mi gnas pa nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa yin gyis /
analyzed: mtshan ma gang la yang mi gnas pa nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa yin gyis /
translated: Abiding in the perfection of wisdom is precisely not abiding in any sign.

original: sems dang po bskyed nas de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //üîΩshes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'bum pa rgya cher bshad pa las /
analyzed: sems dang po bskyed nas de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o // shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'bum pa rgya cher bshad pa las /
translated: From the first generation of the mind of enlightenment, one should abide in the perfection of wisdom in that way.

original: le'u bco lnga pa'o /
analyzed: le'u bco lnga pa'o /
translated: This is the fifteenth chapter of the Commentary on the Perfection of Wisdom in 100,000 Lines.

original: // / de nas lha'i bu de dag 'di snyam du sems par gyur te /
analyzed: // / de nas lha'i bu de dag 'di snyam du sems par gyur te /
translated: Then the sons of the gods had this thought:

original: gnas brtan rab 'byor la chos nyan pa rnams la ji lta bu dag btsal bar bya snyam pa dang zhes bya ba ni sems dang po bskyed pa nas brjod pa dang mnyan du med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par bya'o zhes
analyzed: gnas brtan rab 'byor la chos nyan pa rnams la ji lta bu dag btsal bar bya snyam pa dang zhes bya ba ni sems dang po bskyed pa nas brjod pa dang mnyan du med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par bya'o zhes
translated: Previously, Subh≈´ti explained, One should abide in the perfection of wisdom, thinking, 'From the first generation of the mind of enlightenment up to the inexpressible, I will listen to the perfection of wisdom.'

original: gong du rab 'byor gyis bshad pa lha'i bu rnams kyis thos nas de ltar chos thams cad brjod du med pa yin no //
analyzed: gong du rab 'byor gyis bshad pa lha'i bu rnams kyis thos nas de ltar chos thams cad brjod du med pa yin no //
translated: The gods heard that and thought, All phenomena are indeed inexpressible.

original: chos 'chad pa dang / chos nyan pa yang med pas chos bshad pa yang med par 'gyur na ;
analyzed: chos 'chad pa dang / chos nyan pa yang med pas chos bshad pa yang med par 'gyur na ;
translated: Since there is no one to explain the Dharma and no one to listen to the Dharma, there will be no explanation of the Dharma.

original: gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis chos bshad pa rnam pa ji lta bu zhig yod par 'gyur snyam du the tshom skyes pa'o //
analyzed: gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis chos bshad pa rnam pa ji lta bu zhig yod par 'gyur snyam du the tshom skyes pa'o //
translated: What kind of explanation of the Dharma will there be when the elder Subh≈´ti explains the Dharma?

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyi sems kyis /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyi sems kyis /
translated: Then the Venerable Subh≈´ti, with his mind,üîΩunderstood the thoughts of those gods and said to them,

original: lha'i bu de dag gi sems kyi rnam par rtog pa yongs su shes nas lha'i bu de dag la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: lha'i bu de dag gi sems kyi rnam par rtog pa yongs su shes nas lha'i bu de dag la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Sons of gods, you should not think like this.

original: lha'i bu dag bdag gi chos bstan pa ni sgyu ma lta bu ste /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag bdag gi chos bstan pa ni sgyu ma lta bu ste /
translated: ‚ÄúDivine princes, my teaching of the Dharma is like an illusion.üîΩDivine princes, you should seek out my listeners to the Dharma as being like an illusion.‚Äù

original: lha'i bu dag bdag la chos nyan pa la yang sgyu ma lta bur btsal bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni chos ston pa dang / chos nyan pa dang / chos bshad par bya ba rnams ni kun rdzob tu brjod par zad kyi /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag bdag la chos nyan pa la yang sgyu ma lta bur btsal bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni chos ston pa dang / chos nyan pa dang / chos bshad par bya ba rnams ni kun rdzob tu brjod par zad kyi /
translated: This teaches that the teacher of the Dharma, the listeners to the Dharma, and the Dharma that is to be explained are all merely said to be conventional.

original: don dam par de dag thams cad kyang dngos po med de /
analyzed: don dam par de dag thams cad kyang dngos po med de /
translated: Ultimately, all of them are non-things.

original: dngos po med pa las yod pa lta bur snang ba ni /üîΩsgyu ma lta bu yin par rig par bya'o zhes bstan pa lha'i bu dag bdag gi chos bstan pa ni sprul pa la bya ste /
analyzed: dngos po med pa las yod pa lta bur snang ba ni / sgyu ma lta bu yin par rig par bya'o zhes bstan pa lha'i bu dag bdag gi chos bstan pa ni sprul pa la bya ste /
translated: That which appears as existent from non-thing is to be known as being like an illusion.üîΩ‚ÄúDivine princes, my teaching of the Dharma is like a magical creation.

original: bdag la chos nyan pa yang sprul pa lta bur btsal bar bya ste /
analyzed: bdag la chos nyan pa yang sprul pa lta bur btsal bar bya ste /
translated: You should seek out my listeners to the Dharma as being like a magical creation.‚Äù

original: de dag ni ci 'ang nyan pa med cing mngon du byed pa med do zhes bya ba ni ston pa dang nyan pa dang / bshad par bya ba gsum char don dam par yod pa ma yin pa'i dpe sprul pa las blangs nas bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de dag ni ci 'ang nyan pa med cing mngon du byed pa med do zhes bya ba ni ston pa dang nyan pa dang / bshad par bya ba gsum char don dam par yod pa ma yin pa'i dpe sprul pa las blangs nas bstan pa ste /
translated: The statement there is no hearing at all and no realization is a teaching that takes as an example an emanation, which is that the three-the teacher, the hearer, and the subject matter-do not ultimately exist.

original: de dag ni ci'ang nyan pa med cing zhes bya ba ni thos pa'i shes rab kyis gang yang mnyan pa med do zhes bstan pa'o //üîΩmngon du byed pa med do zhes bya ba ni bsgoms @288a * //
analyzed: de dag ni ci'ang nyan pa med cing zhes bya ba ni thos pa'i shes rab kyis gang yang mnyan pa med do zhes bstan pa'o // mngon du byed pa med do zhes bya ba ni bsgoms @288a * //
translated: The statement there is no hearing at all teaches that there is no hearing whatsoever by the wisdom of hearing.

original: ba'i shes rab kyis 'bras bu mngon sum du byas pa gang yang med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: ba'i shes rab kyis 'bras bu mngon sum du byas pa gang yang med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: The statement there is no realization teaches that there is no result whatsoever that is realized by the wisdom of meditation.

original: de nas lha'i bu de dag gis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas lha'i bu de dag gis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the sons of the gods said to the venerable Subhuti, Venerable Subhuti!

original: btsun pa rab 'byor ci sems can de dag sgyu ma lta bu ste /
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor ci sems can de dag sgyu ma lta bu ste /
translated: Are those sentient beings like an illusion?
